[She]237-she was [a rather tall , awkward , and strongly - built girl of about fifteen]238-a rather tall , awkward , and strongly - built girl of about fifteen . [I]0-i must confess , when [they]239-they saw [the damsel]244-the damsel , [the ladies]245-the ladies felt a certain twinge of doubt as to whether [they]239-they had not been rash in offering to take [her]244-the damsel ; whether it would not have been wiser to have gone on in [their]239-they old way — now , alas ! grown into a very old way , so as almost to make [them]239-they forget [they]239-they had ever had any other — and done without [a servant]246-a servant still . Many consultations had [the three sisters]247-the three sisters held before such a revolutionary extravagance was determined on . But [Miss Leaf]91-hilary was beginning both to look and to feel " not so young as [she]92-selina had been ; "[91-hilary] [Miss Selina]92-selina ditto ; though , being still under forty , [she]92-selina would not have acknowledged it for [the world]248-the world . And [Miss Hilary]91-hilary young , bright , and active as [she]91-hilary was , could by no possibility do every thing that was to be done in [the little establishment]249-the little establishment : be , for instance , in three places at once — in [the school - room]250-the school - room , teaching [little boys]251-little boys and [girls]252-girls , in [the kitchen]253-the kitchen cooking dinner , and in [the rooms up stairs busy at [house - maid]255-house - maid 's work]254-the rooms up stairs busy at house - maid 's work . Besides , much of [her]91-hilary time was spent in waiting upon [" poor [Selina]92-selina , "[91-hilary] who frequently was , or fancied [her]91-hilary self , too ill to take any part in either the school or house duties]3012-" poor selina , " who frequently was , or fancied her self , too ill to take any part in either the school or house duties . Though , the thing being inevitable , [she]91-hilary said little about it , [Miss Leaf]92-selina 's heart was often sore to see [Hilary]91-hilary 's pretty hands smeared with blacking of grates , and roughened with scouring of [floors]256-floors . To [herself]91-hilary this sort of thing had become natural — but [Hilary]91-hilary ! All the time of [Hilary]91-hilary 's childhood , [the youngest of [the family]258-the family]257-the youngest of the family had of course , been spared all [house]259-house - work ; and afterward [her]91-hilary studies had left no time for it . For [she]91-hilary was [a clever girl , with a genuine love of knowledge Latin , Greek]260-a clever girl , with a genuine love of knowledge latin , greek , and even the higher branches of arithmetic and mathematics , were not beyond [her]91-hilary range ; and this [she]91-hilary found much more interesting than washing dishes or sweeping floors . True , [she]91-hilary always did whatever domestic duty [she]91-hilary was told to do ; but [her]91-hilary bent was not in the household line . [She]91-hilary had only lately learned to " see dust , "[91-hilary] to make a pudding , to iron a shirt ; and , moreover , to reflect , as [she]91-hilary woke up to the knowledge of how these things should be done , and how necessary they were , what must have been [[her]91-hilary eldest sister]261-her eldest sister 's lot during all these twenty years ! What pains , what weariness , what eternal toil must [Johanna]93-johanna have silently endured in order to do all those things which till now had seemed to do [themselves]262-themselves ! Therefore , after much cogitation as to the best and most prudent way to amend matters , and perceiving with [her]91-hilary clear common sense that , willing as [she]91-hilary might be to work in [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , [her]91-hilary own time would be much more valuably spent in teaching [[their]264-their growing school]265-their growing school . It was [Hilary]91-hilary who these Christmas holidays , first started the bold idea , " [We]264-their must have [a servant]246-a servant ; "[91-hilary] and therefore , it being necessary to begin with [a very small servant on very low wages]266-a very small servant on very low wages , ( Ł3 per annum was , [I]0-i fear the maximum ) , did [they]264-their take this [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth Hand . [The ladies]245-the ladies were all there . This was the picture that [[her]93-johanna three mistresses]272-her three mistresses presented to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's eyes : which , though [they]272-her three mistresses seemed to notice nothing , must , in reality , have noticed every thing . "[92-selina] " [We]3023-we will call [her]3019-a good , intelligent girl [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , "[92-selina] said [Miss Leaf]92-selina , with the gentle decision [she]92-selina could use on occasion . There was a little more discussion between [the mother]280-the mother and [the future mistress]285-the future mistress as to holidays , Sundays , and so on , during which time [the new servant]286-the new servant stood silent and impassive in the door - way between [the back kitchen]287-the back kitchen and [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , or , as it is called in [those regions]289-those regions , [the house - place]290-the house - place . As before said , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was by no means , [a personable girl]291-a personable girl , and [her]94-elizabeth clothes did not set [her]94-elizabeth off to advantage . [Her]94-elizabeth cotton frock hung in straight lines down to [her]94-elizabeth ankles , displaying [her]94-elizabeth clumsily shod feet and woolen stockings ; above it was a pinafore — [a regular child]292-a regular child 's pinafore , of the cheap , strong , blue - speckled print which in those days was generally worn . A little shabby shawl , pinned at the throat , and pinned very carelessly and crookedly , with an old black bonnet , much too small for [her]94-elizabeth large head and [her]94-elizabeth quantities of ill kept hair , completed the costume . It did not impress favorably [a lady who , being , or rather having been very handsome [herself]94-elizabeth , was as much alive to appearances as the second [Miss Leaf]92-selina]293-a lady who , being , or rather having been very handsome herself , was as much alive to appearances as the second miss leaf . [She]94-elizabeth made several rather depreciatory observations , and insisted strongly that [the new servant]286-the new servant should only be taken " on trial , "[94-elizabeth] with no obligation to keep [her]94-elizabeth a day longer than [they]295-us wished . [Her]94-elizabeth feeling on the matter communicated itself to [Johanna]93-johanna , who closed the negotiation with [Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand , by saying . " Well , let [us]295-us hope [[your]90-mrs. hand daughter]3024-your daughter will suit [us]295-us . [We]295-us will give [her]3024-your daughter a fair chance at all events . "[93-johanna] " Which is all [I]90-mrs. hand can ax for , [Miss Leaf]92-selina . [Her]3024-your daughter bean't much to look at , but [her]3024-your daughter 's willin ' sharp , and [her]3024-your daughter 's never told [me]90-mrs. hand a lie in [her]3024-your daughter life . Courtesy to [[thy]94-elizabeth missis]3025-thy missis , and say [thee'lt]94-elizabeth do [thy]94-elizabeth best , [Lizabeth]95-lizabeth . "[90-mrs. hand] Pulled forward [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth did courtesy , but [she]94-elizabeth never offered to speak . And [Miss Leaf]92-selina , feeling that for all parties the interview had better be shortened , rose from [her]92-selina chair . [Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand took the hint and departed , saying only , " Good - by , [Lizabeth]95-lizabeth , "[90-mrs. hand] with a nod , half - encouraging , half - admonitory , which [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth silently returned . That was all the parting between [mother]296-mother and [daughter]297-daughter ; [they]298-they neither kissed nor shook hands , which undemonstrative farewell somewhat surprised [Hilary]91-hilary . Now , [Miss Hilary Leaf]91-hilary had all this while gone on toasting . Luckily for [her]91-hilary bread the fire was low and black ; meantime , from behind [her]91-hilary long drooping curls ( which [Johanna]93-johanna would not let [her]91-hilary " turn up , "[91-hilary] though [she]91-hilary was twenty ) , [she]91-hilary was making [her]91-hilary observations on [the new servant]286-the new servant . It might be that , possessing more head than [the one]300-the one and more heart than the other , [Hilary]91-hilary was gifted with deeper perception of character than [either of [[her]91-hilary sisters]302-her sisters]301-either of her sisters , but certainly [her]91-hilary expression , as [she]91-hilary watched [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , was rather amused and kindly that dissatisfied . " Now , [girl]3026-girl , take off [your]3026-girl bonnet , "[92-selina] said [Selina]92-selina , to whom [Johanna]93-johanna had silently appealed in [her]92-selina perplexity as to the next proceeding with regard to [the new member of [the household]277-the household]303-the new member of the household . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth obeyed , and then stood , irresolute , awkward , and wretched to the last degree , at the furthest end of [the house - place]290-the house - place . " Shall [I]91-hilary show [you]3026-girl where to hang up [your]3026-girl things ? "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary , speaking for the first time ; and at the new voice , so quick , cheerful , and pleasant , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth visibly started . [Miss Hilary]91-hilary rose from [her]91-hilary knees , crossed [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , took from [the girl]307-the girl 's unresisting hands the old black bonnet and shawl , and hung them up carefully on a nail behind the great eight - day clock . It was a simple action , done quite without intention , and accepted without acknowledgment , except one quick glance of that keen , yet soft grey eye ; but years and years after [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth reminded [Hilary]91-hilary of it . And now [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth stood forth in [her]94-elizabeth own proper likeness , unconcealed by bonnet or shawl , or maternal protection . The pinafore scarcely covered [her]94-elizabeth gaunt neck and long arms ; that tremendous head of rough , dusky hair was evidently for the first time gathered into a comb . Thence elf locks escaped in all directions , and were forever being pushed behind [her]94-elizabeth ears , or rubbed ( not smoothed ; there was nothing smooth about [her]94-elizabeth ) back from [her]94-elizabeth forehead , which , [Hilary]91-hilary noticed , was low , broad , and full . The rest of [her]94-elizabeth face , except the before - mentioned eyes was absolutely and undeniably plain . [Her]94-elizabeth figure , so far as the pinafore exhibited it , was undeveloped and ungainly , the chest being contracted and the shoulders rounded , as if with carrying [children]308-children or other weights while still [a growing girl]309-a growing girl . In fact , nature and circumstances had apparently united in dealing unkindly with [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth . Still here [she]94-elizabeth was ; and what was to be done with [her]94-elizabeth ? Having sent [her]94-elizabeth with the small burden , which was apparently all [her]94-elizabeth luggage , to [the little room]310-the little room — formerly a box - closet — where [she]94-elizabeth was to sleep , [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf — or as [facetious neighbors]311-facetious neighbors called [them]89-the misses leaf , [the Miss Leaves]96-the miss leaves — took serious counsel together over [their]89-the misses leaf tea . Tea itself suggested the first difficulty . [They]89-the misses leaf were always in the habit of taking that meal , and indeed every other , in [the kitchen]253-the kitchen . It saved time , trouble , and fire , besides leaving [the parlor]313-the parlor always tidy for [callers]314-callers , chiefly [[pupils]315-pupils ' parents]316-pupils ' parents , and preventing [these latter]317-these latter from discovering that [the three orphan daughters of [Henry Leaf]97-ascott]318-the three orphan daughters of henry leaf , [Esq .]319-esq . , [solicitor]320-solicitor , and [sisters of [Henry Leaf]97-ascott]321-sisters of henry leaf , [Junior , Esq .]322-junior , esq . , [also solicitor , but whose sole mission in life]323-also solicitor , but whose sole mission in life seemed to have been to spend every thing , make [every body miserably , marry , and die]324-every body miserably , marry , and die , that [these three ladies]325-these three ladies did always wait upon [themselves]325-these three ladies at meal - time , and did sometimes breakfast without butter , and dine without meat . Now this system would not do any longer . " Besides , there is no need for it , "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary , cheerfully . " [I]91-hilary am sure [we]3027-we can well afford both to keep and to feed [a servant]246-a servant , and to have a fire in [the parlor]313-the parlor every day . Why not take [our]3027-we meals [there]3030-there , and sit there regularly of evenings ? "[91-hilary] " [We]3027-we must , "[92-selina] added [Selina]92-selina , decidedly . " For [my]92-selina part , [I]92-selina could n't eat , or sew , or do any thing with [that great hulking girl]3031-that great hulking girl sitting starting opposite , or standing ; for how could [we]3027-we ask [her]3031-that great hulking girl to sit with [us]3027-we ? Already , what must [she]3031-that great hulking girl have thought of [us]3027-we — [people who take tea in the kitchen]3032-people who take tea in the kitchen ? "[92-selina] " [I]326-the eldest sister do not think that matters , "[326-the eldest sister] said [the eldest sister]326-the eldest sister , gently , after a moment 's silence . " [Every body in [the town]3034-the town]3033-every body in the town knows who and what [we]3027-we are , or might , if [they]3033-every body in the town chose to inquire . [We]3027-we can not conceal [our]3027-we poverty if [we]3027-we tried ; and [I]326-the eldest sister do n't think [any body]3035-any body looks down upon [us]3027-we for it . Not even since [we]3027-we began to keep [school]3036-school , which [you]326-the eldest sister thought was such a terrible thing , [Selina]92-selina . "[326-the eldest sister] " And it was . [I]92-selina have never reconciled [myself]92-selina to teaching [the baker 's two boys]3037-the baker 's two boys and [the grocer 's little girl]3038-the grocer 's little girl . [You]326-the eldest sister were wrong , [Johanna]93-johanna , [you]326-the eldest sister ought to have drawn the line somewhere , and it ought to have excluded [trades - people]3039-trades - people . "[92-selina] " [Beggars]3040-beggars can not be [choosers]3041-choosers , "[91-hilary] began [Hilary]91-hilary . " [Beggars]3040-beggars ! "[92-selina] echoed [Selina]92-selina . " No , [[my]92-selina dear]3016-my dear , [we]3044-we were never that , "[92-selina] said [Miss Leaf]92-selina , interposing against one of the sudden storms that were often breaking out between these two . " [You]326-the eldest sister know well [we]3044-we have never begged or borrowed from any body , and hardly ever been indebted to any body , except for the extra lessons that [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon would insist upon giving to [Ascott]97-ascott at [home]3045-home . "[92-selina] Here [Johanna]93-johanna suddenly stopped , and [Hilary]91-hilary , with a slight color rising in [her]91-hilary face , said — " [I]91-hilary think , [sisters]3046-sisters , [we]3044-we are forgetting that the staircase is quite open , and though [I]91-hilary am sure [she]91-hilary has an honest look and not that of [a listener]3047-a listener , still [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth might hear . Shall [I]91-hilary call [her]91-hilary down [stairs]3048-stairs , and tell [her]91-hilary to light a fire in [the parlor]313-the parlor ? "[91-hilary] While [she]91-hilary is doing it , and in spite of [Selina]92-selina 's forebodings to the contrary , [the small maiden]327-the small maiden did it quickly and well , especially after a hint or two from [Hilary]91-hilary — let [me]0-i take the opportunity of making a little picture of this same [Hilary]91-hilary . Little it should be , for [she]91-hilary was [a decidedly little woman]328-a decidedly little woman : small altogether , hands , feet , and figure being in satisfactory proportion . [Her]91-hilary movements , like those of [most little women]329-most little women , were light and quick rather than elegant ; yet every thing [she]91-hilary did was done with a neatness and delicacy which gave an involuntary sense of grace and harmony . [She]91-hilary was , in brief , one of [those people who are best described by the word " harmonious]3050-those people who are best described by the word " harmonious ; "[3050-those people who are best described by the word " harmonious] [people who never set [your]331-your teeth on edge , or rub [you]331-your up the wrong way , as [very excellent people]332-very excellent people occasionally do]330-people who never set your teeth on edge , or rub you up the wrong way , as very excellent people occasionally do . Yet [she]91-hilary was not over - meek or unpleasantly amiable ; there was a liveliness and even briskness about [her]91-hilary , as if the every day wine of [her]91-hilary life had a spice of Champagniness , not frothiness but natural effervescence of spirit , meant to " cheer but not inebriate "[91-hilary] [a household]333-a household . And in [[her]91-hilary own household]334-her own household this gift was most displayed . No centre of [a brilliant , admiring circle]335-a brilliant , admiring circle could be more charming , more witty , more irresistibly amusing than was [Hilary]91-hilary sitting by the kitchen fire , with the cat on [her]91-hilary knee , between [[her]91-hilary two sisters]336-her two sisters , and [the school - boy [Ascott Leaf]99-ascott , [[their]338-their nephew]339-their nephew — which [four individuals]340-four individuals , the cat being not the least important of [them]340-four individuals]337-the school - boy ascott leaf , their nephew — which four individuals , the cat being not the least important of them , constituted [the family]258-the family . In [the family]258-the family , [Hilary]91-hilary shone supreme . [All]343-all recognized [her]91-hilary as the light of [the house]344-the house , and so [she]91-hilary had been , ever since [she]91-hilary was born , ever since [[her]91-hilary " Dying mother]3051-her " dying mother mild , Said , with accents undefiled , ' [Child]3052-child , be [mother]296-mother to [this child]3054-this child . ' "[3051-her " dying mother] It was said to [Johanna Leaf]93-johanna — who was not [[Mrs. Leaf]99-ascott 's own child]345-mrs. leaf 's own child . "[93-johanna] [She]93-johanna was then just thirty : not too old to look forward to [woman]352-woman 's natural destiny , [a husband]353-a husband and [children of [her]93-johanna own]354-children of her own . But years slipped by , and [she]93-johanna was [Miss Leaf]91-hilary still . What matter ! [Johanna]93-johanna 's pride in [her]91-hilary knew no bounds . Not that [she]93-johanna showed it much ; indeed [she]93-johanna deemed it a sacred duty not to show it ; but to make believe [her]93-johanna " child "[93-johanna] was just like [other children]356-other children . But [she]93-johanna was not . [Nobody]357-nobody ever thought [she]93-johanna was — even in externals.—Fate gave [her]93-johanna all those gifts which are sometimes sent to make up for the lack of worldly prosperity . [Her]93-johanna brown eyes were as soft a doves ' eyes , yet could dance with fun and mischief if they chose ; [her]93-johanna hair , brown also , with a dark - red shade in it , crisped itself in two wavy lines over [her]93-johanna forehead , and then turn bled down in two glorious masses , which [Johanna]93-johanna , ignorant , alas ! of art , called very " untidy , "[93-johanna] and labored in vain to quell under combs , or to arrange in proper , regular curls [Her]93-johanna features — well , they too , were good ; better than [those unartistic people]358-those unartistic people had any idea of — better even than [Selina]92-selina 's , who in [her]92-selina youth had been [the belle of [the town]3034-the town]359-the belle of the town . But whether artistically correct or not , [Johanna]93-johanna , though [she]93-johanna would on no account have acknowledged it , believed solemnly that there was not such a face in [the whole world]361-the whole world as [little Hillary]91-hilary 's . Possibly a similar idea dawned upon the apparently dull mind of [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth , for [she]94-elizabeth watched [[her]94-elizabeth youngest mistress]362-her youngest mistress intently , from [kitchen]363-kitchen to [parlor]364-parlor , and from [parlor]364-parlor back to [kitchen]363-kitchen ; and once when [Miss Hilary]91-hilary stood giving information as to the proper abode of broom , bellows , etc . , [the little maid]367-the little maid gazed at [her]91-hilary with such admiring observation that the scuttle [she]91-hilary carried was titled , and the coals were strewn all over the kitchen floor . At which catastrophe [Miss Leaf]91-hilary looked miserable . [I]0-i shall make no mysteries [here]389-here . Human nature is human nature all [the world]248-the world over . A tale without love in it would be unnatural , unreal — in fact , a simple lie ; for there are no histories and no lives without love in them : if there could be , [Heaven]104-heaven pity and pardon [them]391-them , for they would be mere abortions of humanity . Thank [Heaven]104-heaven , [we]392-we , [most of [us]392-we]393-most of us , do not philosophize : [we]392-we only live . [We]392-we like [one another]394-one another , [we]392-we hardly know why ; [we]392-we love [one another]394-one another , [we]392-we still less know why . If on the day [she]101-hilary first saw — in [church]396-church it was — [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon 's grave , heavy - browed , somewhat severe face — for [he]98-robert lyon was [a Scotsman]397-a scotsman , and [his]98-robert lyon sharp , strong Scotch features did look " hard "[98-robert lyon] beside [the soft , rosy , well conditioned youth of [Stowbury]2-stowbury]398-the soft , rosy , well conditioned youth of stowbury — if on that Sunday [any one]399-any one had told [Hilary Leaf]91-hilary that the face of [this stranger]400-this stranger was to be the one face of [her]101-hilary life , stamped upon brain and heart , and soul with a vividness that no other impressions were strong enough to efface , and retained there with a tenacity that no vicissitudes of time , or place , or fortunes had power to alter , [Hilary]101-hilary would — yes , [I]0-i think [she]101-hilary would — have quietly kept looking on . [She]101-hilary would have accepted [her]101-hilary lot , such as it was , with its shine and shade , its joy and its anguish ; it came to [her]101-hilary without [her]101-hilary seeking , as most of the solemn things in life do ; and whatever it brought with it , it could have come from no other source than that from which all high , and holy , and pure loves ever must come — the will and permission of [GOD]105-god . [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon [himself]98-robert lyon requires no long description . In [his]98-robert lyon first visit [he]98-robert lyon had told [Miss Leaf]91-hilary all about [himself]98-robert lyon that there was to be known ; that [he]98-robert lyon was , as [they]401-they were , [a poor teacher]402-a poor teacher , who had altogether " made [himself]98-robert lyon , "[98-robert lyon] as [so many Scotch students]403-so many scotch students do . [[His]98-robert lyon father]404-his father , whom [he]98-robert lyon scarcely remembered , had been [a small Ayrshire farmer]405-a small ayrshire farmer ; [[his]98-robert lyon mother]406-his mother was dead , and [he]98-robert lyon had never had either [brother]407-brother or [sister]408-sister . Seeing how clever [Miss Hilary]91-hilary was , and how much as [a schoolmistress]409-a schoolmistress [she]91-hilary would need all the education [she]91-hilary could get , [he]98-robert lyon had offered to teach [her]91-hilary along with [[her]91-hilary nephew]369-her nephew ; and [she]91-hilary and [Johanna]93-johanna were only too thankful for the advantage . But during the teaching [he]98-robert lyon had also taught [her]91-hilary another thing , which [neither]411-neither had contemplated at the time — to respect [him]98-robert lyon with [her]91-hilary whole soul , and to love [him]98-robert lyon with [her]91-hilary whole heart . Over this simple fact let no more be now said . [Hilary]101-hilary said nothing . [She]91-hilary recognized it [herself]91-hilary as soon as [he]98-robert lyon was gone ; a plain , sad , solemn truth , which there was no deceiving [herself]91-hilary did not exist , even had [she]91-hilary wished its non - existence . Perhaps [Johanna]93-johanna also found it out , in [[her]93-johanna darling]412-her darling 's extreme paleness and unusual quietness for a while ; but [she]93-johanna too said nothing . [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon wrote regularly to [Ascott]99-ascott , and once or twice to [her]99-ascott , [Miss Leaf]91-hilary ; but though [every one]413-every one knew that [Hilary]101-hilary was [[his]98-robert lyon particular friend in [the whole family]415-the whole family]414-his particular friend in the whole family , [he]98-robert lyon did not write to [Hilary]101-hilary . [He]98-robert lyon had departed rather suddenly , on account of some plan which [he]98-robert lyon said , affected [his]98-robert lyon future very considerably ; but which , though [he]98-robert lyon was in the habit of telling [them]416-them [his]98-robert lyon affairs , [he]98-robert lyon did not further explain . Still [Johanna]93-johanna knew [he]98-robert lyon was [a good man]417-a good man , and though [no man]418-no man could be quite good enough for [[her]93-johanna darling]412-her darling , [she]93-johanna liked [him]98-robert lyon , [she]93-johanna trusted [him]98-robert lyon . What [Hilary]101-hilary felt [none]420-none knew . But [she]101-hilary was very girlish in some things ; and [her]101-hilary life was all before [her]101-hilary , full of infinite hope . By - and - by [her]101-hilary color returned , and [her]101-hilary merry voice and laugh were heard about [the house]344-the house just as usual . This being the position of affairs , it was not surprising that after [Ascott]99-ascott 's last speech [Hilary]101-hilary 's mind wandered from [Dido]102-dido and [Ćneas]103-ćneas to vague listening , as [the lad]422-the lad began talking of [his]422-the lad grand future — the future of [a medical student]423-a medical student , all expenses being paid by [[his]422-the lad godfather]424-his godfather , [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , [the merchant , of [Russell Square]3-russell square]425-the merchant , of russell square , once [a shop boy of [Stowbury]2-stowbury]426-a shop boy of stowbury . Nor was it unnatural that all [Ascott]97-ascott 's anticipations of [London]1-london resolved [themselves]427-themselves , in [[his]422-the lad aunt]428-his aunt 's eyes , into the one fact that [he]97-ascott would " see [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon . "[97-ascott] But in telling thus much about [[her]428-his aunt mistresses]429-her mistresses , [I]0-i have for the time being lost sight of [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth . Left to [herself]428-his aunt , [the girl]307-the girl stood for a minute or two looking around [her]428-his aunt in a confused manner , then , rousing [her]428-his aunt faculties , began mechanically to obey the order with which [[her]428-his aunt mistress]431-her mistress had quitted [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , and to wash up the tea - things . [She]428-his aunt did it in a fashion that , if seen , would have made [Miss Leaf]91-hilary thankful that the ware was only the common set , and not the cherished china belonging to former days : still [she]428-his aunt did it , noisily it is true , but actively , as if [her]428-his aunt heart were in [her]428-his aunt work . Then [she]428-his aunt took a candle and peered about [[her]428-his aunt new domains]433-her new domains . These were small enough ; at least they would have seemed so to other eyes than [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's ; for , until [the school - room]250-the school - room and box - closet above had been kindly added by [the landlord]435-the landlord , who would have done any thing to show [his]435-the landlord respect for [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf , [it]436-it had been merely [a six - roomed cottage]437-a six - roomed cottage — [parlor kitchen]438-parlor kitchen , [back kitchen]439-back kitchen , and [three upper chambers]440-three upper chambers . [It]436-it was [a very cozy house]441-a very cozy house notwithstanding , and [it]436-it seemed to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's eyes a perfect palace . For several minutes more [she]428-his aunt stood and contemplated [[her]428-his aunt kitchen]442-her kitchen , with the fire shining on the round oaken stand in the centre , and the large wooden - bottomed chairs , and the loud - ticking clock , with its tall case , the inside of which , with its pendulum and weights , had been a perpetual mystery and delight , first to [Hilary]91-hilary 's and then to [Ascott]97-ascott 's childhood . Then there was the sofa , large and ugly , but , oh ! so comfortable , with [its]436-it faded , flowered chintz , washed and worn for certainly twenty years . And , overall , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's keen observation was attracted by a queer machine apparently made of thin rope and bits of wood , which hung up to the hooks on the ceiling — [an old - fashioned baby]443-an old - fashioned baby 's swing . Finally , [her]94-elizabeth eye dwelt with content on the blue and red diamond tiled floor , so easily swept and mopped , and ( only [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth did not think of that , for [her]94-elizabeth hard childhood had been all work and no play ) so beautiful to whip tops upon ! [Hilary]91-hilary and [Ascott]97-ascott , condoling together over [the new servant]286-the new servant , congratulated [themselves]445-themselves that [their]445-themselves delight in this occupation had somewhat failed , though it was really not so many years ago since [one of [the former 's pupils]447-the former 's pupils , coming suddenly out of [the school - room]250-the school - room]446-one of the former 's pupils , coming suddenly out of the school - room , had caught [her]428-his aunt in the act of whipping a meditative top round [this same kitchen floor]449-this same kitchen floor . Meantime [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth penetrated farther , investigating [the back kitchen]287-the back kitchen , with [its]287-the back kitchen various conveniences ; especially [the pantry]451-the pantry , every shelf of which was so neatly arranged and beautifully clean . Apparently this neatness impressed [the girl]307-the girl with a sense of novelty and curiosity ; and though [she]94-elizabeth could hardly be said to meditate — [her]94-elizabeth mind was not sufficiently awakened for that — still , as [she]94-elizabeth stood at the [kitchen]363-kitchen fire , a slight thoughtfulness deepened the expression of [her]94-elizabeth face , and made it less dull and heavy than it had at first appeared . " [I]94-elizabeth wonder which on 'em does it all . [They]3068-they must work pretty hard , [I]94-elizabeth reckon ; and two o ' [them]3068-they 's such little uns . "[94-elizabeth] [She]94-elizabeth stood a while longer ; for sitting down appeared to be to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth as new a proceeding as thinking ; then [she]94-elizabeth went up [stairs]3048-stairs , still literally obeying orders , to shut windows and pull down blinds at nightfall . [The bedrooms]455-the bedrooms were small , and insufficiently , nay , shabbily furnished ; but the floors were spotless — ah ! [poor Johanna!—and]106-poor johanna!—and the sheets , though patched and darned to the last extremity , were white and whole . Nothing was dirty , nothing untidy . There was no attempt at picturesque poverty — for whatever [novelists]456-novelists may say , poverty can not be picturesque ; but all things were decent and in order . [The house]344-the house , poor as [it]344-the house was , gave the impression of belonging to [" real ladies]3069-" real ladies ; "[90-mrs. hand] [ladies who thought no manner of work beneath [them]458-ladies who thought no manner of work beneath them , and who , whatever they had to do , took the pains to do it as well as possible , and who , whatever [they]458-ladies who thought no manner of work beneath them , and who , whatever they had to do , took the pains to do it as well as possible had to do , took the pains to do it as well as possible]458-ladies who thought no manner of work beneath them , and who , whatever they had to do , took the pains to do it as well as possible . [[Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand 's roughly - brought - up daughter]459-mrs. hand 's roughly - brought - up daughter had never been in [such a house]460-such a house before , and [her]459-mrs. hand 's roughly - brought - up daughter examination of every new corner of [it]460-such a house seemed quite a revelation . [[Her]459-mrs. hand 's roughly - brought - up daughter own little sleeping nook]461-her own little sleeping nook was fully as tidy and comfortable as the rest , which fact was not lost upon [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . That bright look of mingled softness and intelligence — the only thing which beautified [her]459-mrs. hand 's roughly - brought - up daughter rugged face — came into [the girl]307-the girl 's eyes as [she]94-elizabeth " turned down "[94-elizabeth] the truckle - bed , and felt the warm blankets and sheets , new and rather coarse , but neatly sewed . " [Her]307-the girl 's made 'em hersel ' , [I]94-elizabeth reckon . La ! "[94-elizabeth] Which of [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses the " her "[94-elizabeth] referred to remained unspecified ; but [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , spurred to action by some new idea , went briskly back into [the bedrooms]455-the bedrooms , and looked about to see if there was any thing [she]94-elizabeth could find to do . At last , with a sudden inspiration , [she]94-elizabeth peered into a wash - stand , and found there an empty ewer . Taking it in one hand and the candle in the other , [she]94-elizabeth ran down [stairs]3048-stairs . Fatal activity ! [Hilary]91-hilary 's pet cat , startled from sleep on the [kitchen hearth]466-kitchen hearth , at the same instant ran wildly up [stairs]3048-stairs ; there was a start — a stumble — and then down came the candle , the ewer , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , and all . It was an awful crash . It brought [every member of [the family]258-the family]468-every member of the family to see what was the matter . " What has [the girl]307-the girl broken ? "[92-selina] cried [Selina]92-selina . " Where has [she]307-the girl hurt [herself]307-the girl ? "[93-johanna] anxiously added [Johanna]93-johanna . [Hilary]91-hilary said nothing , but ran for a light , and then picked up first [the servant]276-the servant , then the candle , and then the fragments of crockery . " Why , it 's [my]93-johanna ewer , [my]93-johanna favorite ewer , and it 's all smashed to bits , and [I]93-johanna never can match it again . [You]94-elizabeth careless , [clumsy , good - for - nothing creature]3071-clumsy , good - for - nothing creature ! "[93-johanna] " Please , [Selma]107-selma , "[261-her eldest sister] whispered [[her]93-johanna eldest sister]261-her eldest sister . " Very well , [Johanna]93-johanna . [You]94-elizabeth are [the mistress]3072-the mistress , [I]261-her eldest sister suppose ; why do n't [you]94-elizabeth speak to [[your]94-elizabeth servant]3073-your servant ? "[261-her eldest sister] [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , in an humbled , alarmed way , first satisfied [herself]91-hilary that no bodily injury had been sustained by [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , and then asked [her]91-hilary how this disaster had happened ? For a serious disaster [she]91-hilary felt it was . Not only was the present loss annoying , but [a servant with a talent for crockery breaking]472-a servant with a talent for crockery breaking would be a far too expensive luxury for [them]473-them to think of retaining . And [she]91-hilary had been listening in the solitude of [the parlor]313-the parlor to a long lecture from [[her]91-hilary always dissatisfied younger sister]475-her always dissatisfied younger sister , on the great doubts [Selina]92-selina had about [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's " suiting . "[92-selina] " Come , now , "[91-hilary] seeing [the girl]307-the girl hesitated , " tell [me]91-hilary the plain truth . How was it ? "[91-hilary] " It was the cat , "[94-elizabeth] sobbed [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " What a barefaced falsehood . "[92-selina] exclaimed [Selina]92-selina . " [[You]307-the girl wicked girl]3074-you wicked girl , how could it possibly be the cat ? Do [you]307-the girl know that [you]307-the girl are telling a lie , and that lies are hateful , and that [all liars]3075-all liars go to — "[92-selina] " Nonsense , hush ! "[91-hilary] interrupted [Hilary]91-hilary , rather sharply ; for [Selina]92-selina 's " tongue , "[92-selina] the terror of [her]92-selina childhood , now merely annoyed [her]92-selina . [Selina]92-selina 's temper was a long understood household fact — [they]477-they did not much mind it , knowing that [her]92-selina bark was worse than [her]92-selina bite — but it was provoking that [she]92-selina should exhibit [herself]92-selina so soon before [the new servant]286-the new servant . [The latter]479-the latter first looked up at [the lady]480-the lady with simple surprise ; then , as in spite of [the other two]481-the other two , [Miss Selina]92-selina worked [herself]92-selina up into a downright passion , and unlimited abuse fell upon [the victim]482-the victim 's devoted head , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's manner changed . After one dogged repetition of , " It was the cat ! "[92-selina] not another word could be got out of [her]92-selina . [She]92-selina stood , [her]92-selina eyes fixed on the [kitchen]363-kitchen floor , [her]92-selina brows knitted , and [her]92-selina under lip pushed out — the very picture of sullenness . Young as [she]92-selina was , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth evidently had , like [[her]94-elizabeth unfortunate mistress]484-her unfortunate mistress , " a temper of [her]94-elizabeth own"—a[94-elizabeth] spiritual deformity that [some people]485-some people are born with , as [others with hare - lip or club - foot]486-others with hare - lip or club - foot ; only , unlike these , it may be conquered , though the battle is long and sore , sometimes ending only with life . It had plainly never commenced with poor [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth . [Her]92-selina appearance , as [she]92-selina stood under the flood of sharp words poured out upon [her]92-selina , was absolutely repulsive . Even [Miss Hilary]91-hilary turned away , and began to think it would have been easier to teach all day and do house work half the night , than have the infliction of [a servant]246-a servant — to say nothing of the disgrace of seeing [Selina]92-selina 's " peculiarities "[92-selina] so exposed before [a stranger]488-a stranger . [She]92-selina knew of old that to stop the torrent was impracticable . The only chance was to let [Selina]92-selina expend [her]92-selina wrath and retire , and then to take some quiet opportunity of explaining to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth that sharp language was only " [her]92-selina way , "[92-selina] and must be put up with . Humiliating as this was , and fatal to domestic authority that the first thing to be taught [a new servant]489-a new servant was to " put up "[429-her mistresses] with [one of [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses]490-one of her mistresses , still there was no alternative.—Hilary had already foreboded and made up [her]92-selina mind to such a possibility , but [she]92-selina had hoped it would not occur the very first evening . It did , however , and its climax was worse even than [she]92-selina anticipated . [Whether]108-whether , irritated by the intense sullenness of [the girl]307-the girl . [Selina]92-selina 's temper was worse than usual , or whether , as is always the case with [people like [her]92-selina]493-people like her , something else had vexed [her]92-selina , and [she]92-selina vented it upon the first cause of annoyance that occurred , certain it is that [her]92-selina tongue went on unchecked till it failed from sheer exhaustion . And then , as [she]92-selina flung [herself]92-selina on the sofa — oh , sad mischance!—she caught sight of [[her]92-selina nephew]369-her nephew standing at [the school - room]250-the school - room door , grinning with intense delight , and making faces at [her]92-selina behind [her]92-selina back . It was too much . [The poor lady]496-the poor lady had no more words left to scold with ; but [she]92-selina rushed up to [Ascott]97-ascott , and [big lad]497-big lad as [he]497-big lad was , [she]92-selina soundly boxed [his]497-big lad ears . On this terrible climax let the curtain fall . Common as were the small fends between [Ascott]97-ascott and [[his]97-ascott Aunt]428-his aunt [Selina]92-selina , [they]499-they seldom reached such a catastrophe as that described in [my]0-i last chapter . [Hilary]91-hilary had to fly to the rescue , and literally drag [the furious lad]500-the furious lad back into [the school - room]250-the school - room ; while [Johanna]93-johanna , pale and trembling , persuaded [Selina]92-selina to quit [the field]502-the field and go and lie down . This was not difficult ; for the instant [she]92-selina saw what [she]92-selina had done , how [she]92-selina had disgraced [herself]92-selina and insulted [[her]92-selina nephew]369-her nephew . [Selina]92-selina felt sorry . [Her]92-selina passion ended in a gush of " nervous "[92-selina] tears under the influence of which [she]92-selina was led up stairs and put to bed , almost like [a child]504-a child — the usual termination of these pitiful outbreaks . For the time [nobody]357-nobody thought of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [The hapless cause of all]506-the hapless cause of all stood " [spectatress of the fray]3076-spectatress of the fray "[92-selina] beside [[her]92-selina kitchen fire]507-her kitchen fire . What [she]92-selina thought history saith not . Whether in [[her]92-selina own rough [home]3045-home]508-her own rough home [she]92-selina was used to see [brothers]510-brothers and [sisters]3046-sisters quarrelling , and [mothers]512-mothers boxing [[their]512-mothers childrens]513-their childrens ' ears , can not be known ; whether [she]92-selina was or was not surprised to see the same proceedings among [ladies]514-ladies and [gentlemen]515-gentlemen , [she]92-selina never betrayed , but certain it is that [the little servant]516-the little servant became uncommonly serious ; yes , serious rather than sulky , for [her]516-the little servant " black "[516-the little servant] looks vanished gradually , as soon as [Miss Selina]92-selina left [the kitchen]253-the kitchen . On the reappearance of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary it had quite gone . But [Hilary]91-hilary took no notice of [her]516-the little servant ; [she]91-hilary was in search of [Johanna]93-johanna , who , shaking and cold with agitation , came slowly down [stairs]3048-stairs . " Is [she]93-johanna gone to bed ? "[91-hilary] " Yes , [[my]91-hilary dear]3016-my dear . It was the best thing for [her]93-johanna ; [she]93-johanna is not at all well to - day . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary 's lip curled a little , but [she]91-hilary replied not a word . [She]91-hilary had not the patience with [Selina]92-selina that [Johanna]93-johanna had . [She]91-hilary drew [[her]91-hilary elder sister]519-her elder sister into [the little parlor]520-the little parlor , placed [her]519-her elder sister in the arm - chair , shut the door , came and sat beside [her]519-her elder sister , and took [her]519-her elder sister hand . [Johanna]93-johanna pressed it , shed a quiet tear or two , and wiped them away . Then [the two sisters]521-the two sisters remained silent , with hearts sad and sore . [Every family]522-every family has [its]522-every family skeleton in [the house]344-the house : this was [theirs]522-every family . Whether [they]522-every family acknowledged it or not , [they]522-every family knew quite well that every discomfort [they]522-every family had , every slight jar which disturbed the current of household peace , somehow or other originated with " poor [Selina]92-selina . "[522-every family] [They]522-every family often called [her]92-selina " poor "[522-every family] with a sort of pity — not unneeded . Heaven knows ! for if [the unhappy]524-the unhappy are to be pitied , ten times more so are those who make [others]525-others miserable . This was [Selina]92-selina 's case , and had been all [her]92-selina life . And , sometimes , [she]92-selina [herself]92-selina knew it . Sometimes , after an especially bad outbreak , [her]92-selina compunction and remorse would be almost as terrible as [her]92-selina passion ; forcing [[her]92-selina sisters]302-her sisters to make every excuse for [her]92-selina ; [she]92-selina " did not mean it , "[92-selina] it was only " ill health , "[92-selina] or " nerves , "[92-selina] or [her]92-selina " unfortunate way of taking things . "[92-selina] But [they]522-every family knew in [their]522-every family hearts that not all [their]522-every family poverty and the toils it entailed , not all the hardships and humiliation of [their]522-every family changed estate , were half so bitter to bear as this something — no moral crime , and yet in its results as fatal as crime — which [they]522-every family called [Selina]92-selina 's " way . "[522-every family] [Ascott]97-ascott was the only one who did not attempt to mince matters . When [a little boy]527-a little boy [he]97-ascott had openly declared [he]97-ascott hated [Aunt Salina]109-aunt salina ; when [he]97-ascott grew up [he]97-ascott as openly defied [her]109-aunt salina , and it was a most difficult matter to keep even decent peace between [them]528-them . [Hilary]91-hilary 's wrath had never gone further than wishing [Selina]92-selina was married , that appearing the easiest way of getting rid of [her]92-selina . Latterly [she]92-selina had ceased this earnest aspiration ; it might be , because , learning to think more seriously of marriage , [she]92-selina felt that [a woman who is no blessing in [[her]92-selina own household]334-her own household]529-a woman who is no blessing in her own household , is never likely much to bless [a husband]353-a husband 's ; and that , looking still farther forward , it was , on the whole , a mercy of Providence , which made [Selina]92-selina not [the mother of children]532-the mother of children . Yet [her]92-selina not marrying had been somewhat a surprise ; for [she]92-selina had been attractive in [her]92-selina day , handsome and agreeable in society . But perhaps , for all that , the sharp eye of [the opposite sex]533-the opposite sex had discovered the cloven foot ; since , though [she]92-selina had received various promising attentions , [poor [Selina]92-selina]534-poor selina had never had an offer . Nor , fortunately , had [she]92-selina ever been known to care for any body ; [she]92-selina was one of [those women who would have married as a matter of course , but who never would have been guilty of the weakness of falling in love]535-those women who would have married as a matter of course , but who never would have been guilty of the weakness of falling in love . There seemed small probability of shipping [her]92-selina off , to carry into [a new household]536-a new household the restlessness , the fretfulness , the captious fault - finding with [others]525-others , the readiness to take offence at what was done and said to [herself]92-selina , which made poor [Selina]92-selina Leaf the unacknowledged grief and torment of [her]92-selina own . [[Her]92-selina two sisters]336-her two sisters sat silent . What was the use of talking ? It would be only going ever and over again the old thing ; trying to ease and shift a little the long familiar burden which [they]336-her two sisters knew must be borne . Nearly [every household]539-every household has , near or remote , some such burden , which [Heaven]104-heaven only can lift off or help to bear . And sometimes , looking round [the world outside]540-the world outside , [these two]541-these two congratulated [themselves]541-these two , in a half sort of way , that [theirs]541-these two was as light as it was ; that [Selina]92-selina was after all , [a well - meaning well - principled woman]542-a well - meaning well - principled woman , and , in spite of [her]92-selina little tempers , really fond of [[her]92-selina family]543-her family , as [she]92-selina truly was , at least as fond as a nature which has its centre in self can manage to be . Only when [Hilary]91-hilary looked , as to - night , into [[her]91-hilary eldest sister]261-her eldest sister 's pale face , where year by year the lines were deepening , and saw how every agitation such as the present shook [her]91-hilary more and more — [she]91-hilary who ought to have a quiet life and [a cheerful home]545-a cheerful home , after so many hard years — then [Hilary]91-hilary , fierce in the resistance of [her]91-hilary youth , felt as if what [she]91-hilary could have borne for [herself]91-hilary [she]91-hilary could not bear for [Johanna]93-johanna , and at the moment , sympathized with [Ascott]97-ascott in actually " hating "[110-selina] [Aunt Selina]110-selina . " Where is [that boy]3078-that boy ? [He]3078-that boy ought to be spoken to , "[93-johanna] [Johanna]93-johanna said , at length , rising wearily . " [I]93-johanna have spoken to [him]3078-that boy ; [I]93-johanna gave [him]3078-that boy a good scolding . [He]3078-that boy is sorry , and promises never to be so rude again . "[93-johanna] " Oh no ; not till the next time , "[91-hilary] replied [Miss Leaf]91-hilary . hopelessly . " But [Hilary]91-hilary . "[91-hilary] with a sudden consternation , " what are [we]3079-we to do about [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? "[546-the younger sister] [The younger sister]546-the younger sister had thought of that . [She]546-the younger sister had turned over in [her]546-the younger sister mind all the pros and cons , the inevitable " worries "[546-the younger sister] that would result from the presence of [an additional member of [the family]258-the family]547-an additional member of the family , especially one from whom [the family skeleton could not be hid , to whom it was already only too fatally revealed]549-the family skeleton could not be hid , to whom it was already only too fatally revealed . But [Hilary]91-hilary was [a clear headed girl]550-a clear headed girl , and [she]91-hilary had the rare faculty of seeing things as they really were , undistorted by [her]91-hilary own likings or dislikings — in fact , without reference to [herself]91-hilary at all . [She]91-hilary perceived plainly that [Johanna]93-johanna ought not to do the housework , that [Selina]110-selina would not , and that [she]93-johanna could not : ergo , [they]551-they must keep [a servant]246-a servant . Better , perhaps , [a small servant , over whom [they]551-they could have the same influence as over [a child]504-a child , than one older and more independent , who would irritate [[her]93-johanna mistresses]429-her mistresses at [home]3045-home , and [chatter of [them]429-her mistresses abroad]557-chatter of them abroad]553-a small servant , over whom they could have the same influence as over a child , than one older and more independent , who would irritate her mistresses at home , and chatter of them abroad . Besides , [they]551-they had promised [Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand to give [[her]90-mrs. hand daughter]355-her daughter a fair trial . For a month , then , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was bound to stay ; afterward , time would show . It was best not to meet troubles half way . This explained , in [Hilary]91-hilary 's cheerful voice , seemed greatly to reassure and comfort [[her]91-hilary sister]559-her sister . " Yes , love , [you]91-hilary are right ; [she]94-elizabeth must remain [her]94-elizabeth month out , unless [she]94-elizabeth does something very wrong . Do [you]91-hilary think that really was a lie [she]94-elizabeth told ? "[91-hilary] " About the cat ? [I]560-other people do n't quite know what to think . Let [us]560-other people call [her]94-elizabeth , and put the question once more . Do [you]91-hilary put it , [Johanna]93-johanna . [I]560-other people do n't think [she]94-elizabeth could look at [you]91-hilary and tell [you]91-hilary a story . "[560-other people] [Other people]560-other people , at sight of that sweet , grave face , its bloom faded , and hairs silvered long before [their]560-other people time , yet beautiful , with an almost childlike simplicity and childlike peace — [most other people]561-most other people would have been of [Hilary]91-hilary 's opinion . " Sit down ; [I]91-hilary 'll call [her]94-elizabeth . Dear [me]91-hilary , [Johanna]93-johanna , [we]560-other people shall have to set up a bell as well as [a servant]246-a servant , unless [we]560-other people had managed to combine the two . "[91-hilary] But [Hilary]91-hilary 's harmless little joke failed to make [[her]91-hilary sister]559-her sister smile ; and the entrance of [the girl]307-the girl seemed to excite positive apprehension . How was it possible to make excuse to [a servant]246-a servant for [[her]91-hilary mistress]431-her mistress 's shortcomings ? how scold for ill - doing [this young girl]566-this young girl , to whom , ere [she]566-this young girl had been a night in [the house]344-the house , so bad an example had been set ? [Johanna]93-johanna half expected [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth to take a leaf out of [Selina]110-selina 's book and begin abusing [herself]94-elizabeth and [Hilary]91-hilary . No : [she]94-elizabeth stood very sheepish , very uncomfortable , but not in the least bold or sulky — on the whole , looking rather penitent and humble . [[Her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress took courage . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth [I]431-her mistress want [you]94-elizabeth to tell [me]431-her mistress the truth about that unfortunate breakage . Do n't be afraid . [I]431-her mistress had rather [you]94-elizabeth broke every thing in [the house]344-the house than have told [me]431-her mistress what was not true . "[431-her mistress] " It was true ; it was the cat . "[91-hilary] " How could that be possible ? [You]94-elizabeth were coming down [stairs]3048-stairs with the ewer in [your]94-elizabeth hand . "[431-her mistress] " [Her]307-the girl got under [my]89-the misses leaf feet , and throwed [me]89-the misses leaf down , and so [I]89-the misses leaf tumbled , and smashed the thing agin the floor . "[89-the misses leaf] [The Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf glanced at each other . This version of the momentous event was probable enough , and [the girl]307-the girl 's eager , honest manner gave internal confirmatory evidence pretty strong . " [I]91-hilary am sure [she]307-the girl is telling the truth . "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary . " And remember what [[her]307-the girl mother]241-her mother said about [her]307-the girl word being always reliable . "[91-hilary] This reference was too much for [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [She]94-elizabeth burst out , not into actual crying , but into a smothered choke . " If [you]94-elizabeth donnot believe [me]94-elizabeth , [missus]3084-missus , [I]94-elizabeth 'd rather go [home]3045-home to [mother]296-mother . "[94-elizabeth] " [I]91-hilary do believe [you]94-elizabeth , "[91-hilary] said [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , kindly then waited till the pinafore , used as a pocket handkerchief , had dried up grief and restored composure . " [I]94-elizabeth can quite well understand the accident now ; and [I]94-elizabeth am sure if [you]94-elizabeth had put it as plainly at first , [[my]94-elizabeth sister]3017-my sister would have understood it too . [She]3017-my sister was very much annoyed , and no wonder . [She]3017-my sister will be equally glad to find [she]3017-my sister was mistaken . "[94-elizabeth] Here [Miss Leaf]91-hilary paused , somewhat puzzled how to express what [she]91-hilary felt it [her]91-hilary duty to say , so as to be comprehended by [the servant]276-the servant , and yet not let down the dignity of [the family]258-the family [Hilary]91-hilary came to [her]91-hilary aid . " [Miss Selina]92-selina is sometimes hasty ; but [she]92-selina means kindly always . [You]94-elizabeth must take care not to vex [her]92-selina , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ; and [you]94-elizabeth must never answer [her]92-selina back again , however sharply [she]92-selina speaks . "[94-elizabeth] The subdued clouding of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's face , and [her]94-elizabeth blunt pointing to [Miss Leaf]92-selina as " this ' un . "[94-elizabeth] were too much for [Hilary]91-hilary 's gravity [She]91-hilary was obliged to retreat to the press , and begin an imaginary search for a book . " Yes , [I]93-johanna am [the eldest]3091-the eldest , and [I]93-johanna suppose [you]94-elizabeth may consider [me]93-johanna specially as [[your]94-elizabeth mistress]3089-your mistress , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna , simply . " "[93-johanna] Remember always to come to [me]0-i in any difficulty ; and above all , to tell [me]0-i every thing outright , as soon as it happens . [I]0-i can forgive [you]94-elizabeth almost any fault , if [you]94-elizabeth are truthful and honest ; but there is one thing [I]0-i never could forgive , and that is deception . Now go with [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , and [she]91-hilary will teach [you]94-elizabeth how to make the porridge for supper . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth obeyed silently ; [she]94-elizabeth had apparently a great gift for silence . And [she]94-elizabeth was certainly both obedient and willing ; not stupid , either , though a nervousness of temperament which [Hilary]91-hilary was surprised to find in [so big and coarse - looking a girl]3093-so big and coarse - looking a girl , made [her]94-elizabeth rather awkward at first . However , [she]94-elizabeth succeeded in pouring out and carrying into [the parlor]313-the parlor , without accident , three platefuls of that excellent condiment which formed the frugal supper of [the family]258-the family ; but which [they]258-the family ate , [I]91-hilary grieve to say , in an orthodox southern fashion , with sugar or treacle , until [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon — greatly horrified thereby — had instituted [his]98-robert lyon national custom of "[91-hilary] supping " porridge with milk . It may be a very unsentimental thing to confess , but [Hilary]91-hilary , who even at twenty was rather practical than poetical , never made the porridge without thinking of [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , and the day when [he]98-robert lyon first staid to supper , and ate it , or as [he]98-robert lyon said and was very much laughed at , ate "[572-them] [them]572-them " with such infinite relish Since then , whenever [he]98-robert lyon came , [he]98-robert lyon always asked for [his]98-robert lyon porridge , saying it carried [him]98-robert lyon back to [his]98-robert lyon childish days . And [Hilary]91-hilary , with that curious pleasure that [women]3061-women take in waiting upon [any one unto whom the heart]3097-any one unto whom the heart is ignorantly beginning to own the allegiance , humble yet proud , of [Miranda]111-miranda to [Ferdinand]112-ferdinand : "[573-your] To be [[your]573-your fellow]574-your fellow [You]573-your may deny [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i 'll be [[your]573-your servant]3073-your servant Whether [you]573-your will or no . " [Hilary]91-hilary always contrived to make [his]98-robert lyon supper [herself]91-hilary . Those pleasant days were now over . [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon was gone . As [she]91-hilary stool alone over the kitchen fire , [she]91-hilary thought — as now and then [she]91-hilary let [herself]91-hilary think for a minute or two in [her]91-hilary busy prosaic life — of that August night , standing at the front door , of [his]98-robert lyon last "[0-i] good - by , " and last hand - clasp , tight , warm , and firm ; and somehow [she]91-hilary , like [Johanna]93-johanna , trusted in [him]98-robert lyon . Not exactly in [his]98-robert lyon love ; it seemed almost impossible that [he]98-robert lyon should love [her]91-hilary , at least till [she]91-hilary grew much more worthy of [him]98-robert lyon than now ; but in [himself]98-robert lyon , that [he]98-robert lyon would never be less [himself]98-robert lyon , less thoroughly good and true than now . That , some time , [he]98-robert lyon would be sure to come back again , and take up [his]98-robert lyon old relations with [them]3098-their , brightening [their]3098-their dull life with [his]98-robert lyon cheerfulness ; infusing in [[their]3098-their feminine household]3099-their feminine household the new element of a clear , strong , energetic , manly will , which sometimes made [Johanna]93-johanna say that instead of twenty - five [the young man]3100-the young man might be forty ; and , above all , bringing into [their]3098-their poverty the silent sympathy of [one who had fought [his]98-robert lyon own battle with [the world]248-the world]3101-one who had fought his own battle with the world — a hard one , too , as [his]98-robert lyon face sometimes showed — though [he]98-robert lyon never said much about it . Of the results of this pleasant relation — whether [she]93-johanna being [the only truly marriageable person in [the house]344-the house]3103-the only truly marriageable person in the house . [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon intended to marry [her]93-johanna , or was expected to do so , or that [society]3105-society would think it a very odd thing if [he]98-robert lyon did not do so — this unsophisticated [Hilary]91-hilary never thought at all . If [he]98-robert lyon had said to [her]93-johanna that the present state of things was to go on forever ; [she]93-johanna to remain always [Hilary Leaf]91-hilary , and [he]98-robert lyon [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , [the faithful friend of [the family]258-the family]3106-the faithful friend of the family , [she]93-johanna would have smiled in [his]98-robert lyon face and been perfectly satisfied . True , [she]93-johanna had never had any thing to drive away the smile from that innocent face ; no vague jealousies aroused ; no maddening rumors afloat in the small world that was [his]98-robert lyon and [theirs]3108-theirs . [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon was grave and sedate in all [his]98-robert lyon ways ; [he]98-robert lyon never paid the slightest attention to , or expressed the slightest interest in , [any woman]3109-any woman whatsoever . And so [this hapless girl]3110-this hapless girl loved , [him]98-robert lyon — just [himself]98-robert lyon ; without the slightest reference to [his]98-robert lyon "[0-i] connections , " for [he]98-robert lyon had none ; or [his]98-robert lyon "[0-i] prospects , " which , if [he]98-robert lyon had any , [she]93-johanna did not know of . Alas ! to [practical and prudent people]3111-practical and prudent people [I]0-i can offer no excuse for [her]93-johanna ; except , perhaps what [Shakspeare]113-shakspeare gives in the creation of [the poor Miranda]3112-the poor miranda . When [the small servant]3113-the small servant re - entered [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , [Hilary]91-hilary , with a half sigh , shook off [her]91-hilary dreams , called [Ascott]97-ascott out of [the school - room]250-the school - room , and returned to the work - a - day world and the family supper . This being ended , seasoned with a few quiet words administered to [Ascott]97-ascott , and which on the whole [he]97-ascott took pretty well , it was nearly ten o'clock . "[0-i] Far too late to have kept up [such a child]576-such a child as [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ; [we]577-we must not do it again , " said [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , taking down the large Bible with which [she]91-hilary was accustomed to conclude the day — [Ascott]97-ascott 's early hours at [school]3036-school and [their]577-we own house - work making it difficult of mornings . Very brief the reading was , sometimes not more than half a dozen verses , with no comment thereon ; [she]91-hilary thought the Word of [God]105-god might safely be left to expound itself Being [a very humble - minded woman]3117-a very humble - minded woman , [she]91-hilary did not feel qualified to lead long devotional "[577-we] exercises , " and [she]91-hilary disliked formal written prayers . So [she]91-hilary merely read the Bible to [the family]258-the family , and said after it [the Lord]3119-the lord 's Prayer . But , constitutionally shy as [Miss Leaf]91-hilary was to do even this in presence of [a stranger]488-a stranger cost [her]91-hilary some effort ; and it was only a sense of duty that made [her]91-hilary say "[577-we] yes " to [Hilary]91-hilary 's suggestion , "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose [we]577-we ought to call in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth came . "[94-elizabeth] Sit down , " said [[her]91-hilary mistress]431-her mistress : and [she]431-her mistress sat down , staring uneasily round about [her]94-elizabeth , as if wondering what was going to befall [her]94-elizabeth next . Very silent was [the little parlor]520-the little parlor ; so small , that [it]520-the little parlor was almost filled up by [its]520-the little parlor large square piano , [its]520-the little parlor six cane - bottomed chairs , and one easy chair , in which sat [Miss Leaf]91-hilary with the great Book in [her]91-hilary lap . "[94-elizabeth] Can [you]94-elizabeth read , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? " "[94-elizabeth] Yes , [ma'am]3015-ma'am . " "[94-elizabeth] [Hilary]91-hilary , give [her]94-elizabeth a bible . " And so [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth followed , guided by [her]91-hilary not too clean finger , the words , read in that soft , low voice , somewhere out of the New Testament ; words simple enough for the comprehension of [a child]504-a child or [a heathen]3124-a heathen . The "[91-hilary] South Sea Islander , " as [Ascott]97-ascott persisted in calling [her]94-elizabeth , then , doing as [the family]258-the family did , turned round to kneel down ; but in [her]94-elizabeth confusion [she]94-elizabeth knocked over a chair , causing [Miss Leaf]91-hilary to wait a minute till reverent silence was restored . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth knelt , with [her]94-elizabeth eyes fixed on the wall : it was a green paper , patterned with bunches of nuts . How far [she]94-elizabeth listened , or how much [she]94-elizabeth understood , it was impossible to say ; but [her]94-elizabeth manner was decent and decorous . "[91-hilary] Forgive [us]579-us [our]579-us trespasses as [we]579-us forgive those that trespass against [us]579-us . " Unconsciously [Miss Leaf]91-hilary 's gentle voice rested on these words , so needed in the daily life of [every human being]3126-every human being , and especially of [every family]522-every family . Was [she]91-hilary [the only one who thought of "[91-hilary] poor [Selina]92-selina]3128-the only one who thought of " poor selina ? " [They]258-the family all rose from [their]258-the family knees , and [Hilary]91-hilary out the Bible away . [The little servant]516-the little servant "[92-selina] hung about , " apparently uncertain what was next to be done , or what was expected of [her]91-hilary to do . [Hilary]91-hilary touched [[her]91-hilary sister]559-her sister . "[92-selina] Yes , " said [Miss Leaf]91-hilary . recollecting [herself]91-hilary , and assuming the due authority , "[92-selina] it is quite time for all [the family]258-the family to be in bed . Take care of [your]92-selina candle , and mind and be up at six tomorrow morning . " This was addressed to [the new maiden]3131-the new maiden , who dropped a courtesy , and said , almost cheerfully , "[3015-ma'am] Yes , [ma'am]3015-ma'am . " "[3015-ma'am] Very well , Good night . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " And following [Miss Leaf]91-hilary 's example , [the other two]481-the other two , even [Ascott]97-ascott , said civilly and kindly , "[94-elizabeth] Good night , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " The Christmas holidays ended , and [Ascott]97-ascott left for [London]1-london . It was the greatest household change [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf had known for years , and [they]89-the misses leaf missed [him]97-ascott sorely . [Ascott]97-ascott was not exactly [a lovable boy]3133-a lovable boy , and yet , after the fashion of [womankind]3134-womankind , [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts were both fond and proud of [him]97-ascott ; fond , in [their]3135-his aunts childless old maidenhood , of any sort of [nephew]3136-nephew , and proud , unconsciously , that [the said nephew]3137-the said nephew was [a big fellow , who could look over all [their]89-the misses leaf heads]3138-a big fellow , who could look over all their heads , besides being handsome and pleasant mannered , and though not clever enough to set the Thames on fire , still sufficiently bright to make [them]89-the misses leaf hope that in [his]97-ascott future the family star might again rise . There was something pathetic in [these three women]3139-these three women 's idealization of [him]97-ascott — even [Selina]92-selina 's who though quarrelling with [him]97-ascott to [his]97-ascott face always praised [him]97-ascott behind [his]97-ascott back,—that [great , good - looking , lazy lad ; who , [every body else saw clearly enough]3141-every body else saw clearly enough , thought more of [his]97-ascott own noble self than of all [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts put together . [The only person [he]97-ascott stood in awe of]3143-the only person he stood in awe of was [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon — for whom [he]97-ascott always protested unbounded respect and admiration . How far [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon liked [Ascott]97-ascott even [Hilary]91-hilary could never quite find out ; but [he]98-robert lyon was always very kind to [him]97-ascott]3140-great , good - looking , lazy lad ; who , every body else saw clearly enough , thought more of his own noble self than of all his aunts put together . the only person he stood in awe of was mr. lyon — for whom he always protested unbounded respect and admiration . how far robert lyon liked ascott even hilary could never quite find out ; but he was always very kind to him . There was [one person in [the house]344-the house who , strange to say , did not succumb to [the all - dominating youth]3146-the all - dominating youth]3144-one person in the house who , strange to say , did not succumb to the all - dominating youth . From the very first there was a smouldering feud between [him]97-ascott and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . Whether [she]94-elizabeth overheard , and slowly began to comprehend [his]97-ascott mocking gibes about the "[94-elizabeth] [South Sea Islander]4-south sea islander , " or whether [her]94-elizabeth sullen and dogged spirit resisted the first attempts [the lad]422-the lad made to "[94-elizabeth] put upon [her"—as]3148-her"—as [he]97-ascott did upon [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts , in small daily tyrannies — was never found out ; but certainly [Ascott]97-ascott , [the general favorite]3150-the general favorite , found little favor with [the new servant]286-the new servant . [She]94-elizabeth never answered when [he]97-ascott "[94-elizabeth] hollo'd " for [her]94-elizabeth ; [she]94-elizabeth resisted blacking [his]97-ascott boots more than once a day ; and [she]94-elizabeth obstinately cleared the [kitchen]363-kitchen fire - place of [his]97-ascott "[94-elizabeth] messes , " as [she]94-elizabeth ignominiously termed various pots and pans belonging to what [he]97-ascott called [his]97-ascott "[94-elizabeth] medical studies . " Although the war was passive rather than aggressive , and sometimes a source of private amusement to [the aunts]3153-the aunts , still , on the whole , it was a relief when the exciting cause of it departed ; [his]97-ascott new and most gentlemanly port manteau being carried down [stairs]3048-stairs by [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth [herself]94-elizabeth , of [her]94-elizabeth own accord , with an air of cheerful alacrity , foreign to [[her]94-elizabeth mien]3155-her mien for some weeks past , and which , even in the midst of the dolorous parting , amused [Hilary]91-hilary extremely . "[94-elizabeth] [I]0-i think [that girl]582-that girl is [a character]583-a character , " [she]0-i said afterward to [Johanna]93-johanna . "[583-a character] Any how [she]582-that girl has curiously strong likes and dislikes . " "[582-that girl] [You]0-i may say that , [[my]0-i dear]3016-my dear ; for [she]582-that girl brightens up whenever [she]582-that girl looks at [you]0-i . " "[582-that girl] Does [she]582-that girl ? Oh , that must be because [I]0-i have most to do with [her]582-that girl . It is wonderful how friendly [one]585-one gets over sauce pans and brooms ; and what reverence [one]585-one inspires in the domestic mind when [one]585-one really knows how to make a bed or a pudding . " "[585-one] How [I]0-i wish [you]0-i had to do neither ! " sighed [Johanna]93-johanna , looking fondly at the bright face and light little figure that was flitting about putting [the school - room]250-the school - room to rights before [the pupils]3157-the pupils came in . "[585-one] Nonsense — [I]0-i do n't wish any such thing . Doing it makes [me]0-i not [a whit less charming and lovely]588-a whit less charming and lovely . " [She]93-johanna often applied these adjectives to [herself]93-johanna , with the most perfect conviction that [she]93-johanna was uttering a fiction patent to every body . [I]588-a whit less charming and lovely must be very juvenile also , for [I]588-a whit less charming and lovely 'm certain [the fellow - passenger at [the station]3159-the station to - day]3158-the fellow - passenger at the station to - day took [me]588-a whit less charming and lovely for [[Ascott]97-ascott 's sweetheart]3160-ascott 's sweetheart . " [Miss Leaf]91-hilary laughed , and the shadow vanished from [her]91-hilary face , as [Hilary]91-hilary had meant it should .
