[I]0-i hope [you]590-my pet will have [a real sweetheart]591-a real sweetheart some day . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm in no hurry , thank [you]0-i , [Johanna]93-johanna . " But now was heard the knock after knock of [the little boys]3164-the little boys and [girls]252-girls , and there began that monotonous daily round of school labor , rising from the simplicities of c , a , t , cat , and d , o , g , dog — to the sublime heights of [Pinnock]114-pinnock and [Lennie]115-lennie , [Telemaque]116-telemaque and [Latin Delectus]117-latin delectus . No loftier ; [Stowbury]2-stowbury being well supplied with [first class schools]3166-first class schools , and having a vague impression that [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf , born [ladies]514-ladies and not brought up as [governesses]3168-governesses , were [not [competent educators]3170-competent educators except of [very small children]3171-very small children]3169-not competent educators except of very small children . Which was true enough until lately . So [Miss Leaf]91-hilary kept contentedly to the c , a , t , cat , and d , o , g , dog , of [the little butchers and bakers]3172-the little butchers and bakers , as [Miss Selina]92-selina , who taught only sewing , and came into [the school - room]250-the school - room but little during the day , scornfully termed [them]3172-the little butchers and bakers . [The higher branches such as they were]3174-the higher branches such as they were , [she]91-hilary left gradually to [Hilary]91-hilary , who , of late , possibly out of sympathy with [a friend of hers]3175-a friend of hers , had begun to show an actual gift for teaching [school]3036-school . It is a gift — all will allow ; and [chiefly those who have it not , among which was poor [Johanna Leaf]93-johanna]3177-chiefly those who have it not , among which was poor johanna leaf . The admiring envy with which [she]91-hilary watched [Hilary]91-hilary , moving briskly about from class to class , with a word of praise to [one]585-one and rebuke to another , keeping [every one]413-every one 's attention alive , spurring on the dull , controlling the unruly , and exercising over [every member in this little world that influence , at once the strongest and most intangible and inexplicable — personal influence]3180-every member in this little world that influence , at once the strongest and most intangible and inexplicable — personal influence — was only equaled by the way in which , at pauses in the day 's work , when it grew dull and monotonous or when the stupidity of [the children]3181-the children ruffled [her]91-hilary own quick temper beyond endurance , [Hilary]91-hilary watched [Johanna]93-johanna . The time [I]93-johanna am telling of now is long ago . [The Stowbury children]3182-the stowbury children , who were then [little boys]251-little boys and [girls]252-girls , are now [fathers]3185-fathers and [mothers]512-mothers — doubtless a large proportion being [decent tradesfolk in [Stowbury]2-stowbury]3187-decent tradesfolk in stowbury still ; though , in [this locomotive quarter]3188-this locomotive quarter , [many]3189-many must have drifted elsewhere — where , [Heaven]104-heaven knows . But not [a few of [them]3182-the stowbury children]3190-a few of them may still call to mind [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , who first taught [them]3182-the stowbury children [their]3182-the stowbury children letters — sitting in [her]91-hilary corner between the fire and the window , while the blind was drawn down to keep out , first the light from [her]91-hilary own fading eyes , and , secondly , the distracting view of [green fields]3191-green fields and trees from the youthful eyes by [her]91-hilary side . [They]3182-the stowbury children may remember still [her]91-hilary dark plain dress and [her]91-hilary white apron , on which [the primers]3192-the primers , torn and dirty , looked half ashamed to lie ; and above all , [her]91-hilary sweet face and sweeter voice , never heard in any thing sharper than that grieved tone which signified [their]3182-the stowbury children being "[93-johanna] [naughty children]592-naughty children . " [They]3182-the stowbury children may recall [her]91-hilary unwearied patience with the very dullest and most wayward of [them]3182-the stowbury children ; [her]91-hilary unfailing sympathy with every infantile pleasure and pain . And [I]93-johanna think [they]3182-the stowbury children will acknowledge that whether [she]91-hilary taught [them]3182-the stowbury children much or little — in this advancing age it might be thought little — [Miss Leaf]91-hilary taught [them]3182-the stowbury children one thing — to love [her]91-hilary . Which , as [Ben Johnson]118-ben johnson said of [the Countess of [Pembroke]5-pembroke]3193-the countess of pembroke , was in itself a "[93-johanna] liberal education . " [Hilary]91-hilary , too . Often when [Hilary]91-hilary 's younger and more restless spirit chafed against the monotony of [her]91-hilary life ; when , instead of wasting [her]91-hilary days in teaching [small children]3194-small children , [she]91-hilary would have liked to be learning , learning — every day growing wiser and cleverer , and stretching out into that busy , bright , active world of which [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had told [her]91-hilary — then the sight of [Johanna]93-johanna 's meek face bent over those dirty spelling books would at once rebuke and comfort [her]91-hilary . [She]91-hilary felt , after all , that [she]91-hilary would not mind working on forever , so long as [Johanna]93-johanna still sat there . Nevertheless , that winter seemed to [her]91-hilary very long — especially after [Ascott]97-ascott was gone . For [Johanna]93-johanna , partly for money , and partly for kindness , had added to [her]93-johanna day 's work four evenings a week when [a half educated mother of one of [[her]93-johanna little pupils]3196-her little pupils]3195-a half educated mother of one of her little pupils came to be taught to write a decent hand , and to keep the accounts of [[her]93-johanna shop]3197-her shop . Upon which [Selina]92-selina , highly indignant , had taken to spending [her]92-selina evenings in [the school room]3198-the school room , interrupting [Hilary]91-hilary 's solitary studies [there]3030-there by many a lamentation over the peaceful days when [they]3200-they all sat in [the kitchen]253-the kitchen together and kept [no servant]283-no servant . For [Selina]92-selina was one of [those who never saw the bright side of any thing till it had gone by]3203-those who never saw the bright side of any thing till it had gone by . " [Selina]92-selina was too vexed to reply and for five quiet minutes [Hilary]91-hilary bent over [her]92-selina Homer which [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon had taken such pleasure in teaching [her]92-selina , because [he]98-robert lyon said , [she]92-selina learned it faster than [any of [[his]98-robert lyon grammar school boys]3205-his grammar school boys]3204-any of his grammar school boys . Oh , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , [you]597-you mean — " "[94-elizabeth] [Her]124-amatheia pinafore had three rents in it , which [she]124-amatheia never thinks of mending though [I]0-i gave [her]124-amatheia needles and thread [myself]0-i a week ago . But [she]124-amatheia does not know how to use them any more than [a baby]598-a baby . " "[124-amatheia] Possibly , [nobody]357-nobody ever taught [her]124-amatheia . " "[124-amatheia] Yes ; [she]124-amatheia went for a year to [the National School]600-the national school , [she]124-amatheia says , and learned both marking and sewing . " "[124-amatheia] Perhaps [she]124-amatheia has never practiced them since . [She]124-amatheia could hardly have had time , with all the little Hands to look after , as [[her]124-amatheia mother]241-her mother says [she]124-amatheia did . All the better for [us]602-us . It makes [her]124-amatheia wonderfully patient with [[our]602-us troublesome brats]603-our troublesome brats . It was only to day , when that horrid little [Jacky Smith]125-john smith hurt [himself]125-john smith so , that [I]0-i saw [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth take [him]125-john smith into [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , wash [his]125-john smith face and hands , and cuddle [him]125-john smith up and comfort [him]125-john smith , quite motherly . [Her]124-amatheia forte is certainly [children]308-children . " "[308-children] [You]0-i always find something to say for [her]124-amatheia . " Another pause — and then [Selina]92-selina returned to the charge . "[0-i] Have [you]0-i ever observed , [[my]0-i dear]3016-my dear , the extraordinary way [she]124-amatheia has of fastening , or rather , not fastening [her]124-amatheia gown behind ? [She]124-amatheia just hooks it together at the top and at the waist , while between there is a — " "[124-amatheia] [Hiatus valde deflendus]126-hiatus valde deflendus . Oh dear [me]0-i ! what shall [I]0-i do ? [Selina]92-selina , how can [I]0-i help it if [a girl of fifteen years old]608-a girl of fifteen years old is not a paragon of perfection ? as of course [we]609-we all are , if [we]609-we only could find it out . " And [Hilary]91-hilary , in despair , rose to carry [her]91-hilary candle and books into [the chilly but quiet bedroom]3207-the chilly but quiet bedroom , biting [her]91-hilary lips the while lest [she]91-hilary should be tempted to say something which [Selina]92-selina called "[92-selina] impertinent , " which perhaps it was , from [a younger sister]3208-a younger sister to [an elder]3209-an elder . [I]92-selina do not set [Hilary]91-hilary up as a perfect character . Through sorrow only do [people]3210-people go on to perfection ; and sorrow , in its true meaning , [the cherished girl]3211-the cherished girl had never known . But that night , talking to [Johanna]93-johanna before [they]3212-they went to sleep — [they]3212-they had always slept together since the time when [the elder sister]3213-the elder sister used to walk the room of nights with [that pulling , motherless infant in [her]3213-the elder sister arms]3214-that pulling , motherless infant in her arms — [Hilary]91-hilary anxiously started the question of [the little servant]516-the little servant . "[92-selina] [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i vexed [Selina]92-selina greatly about [her]92-selina to - night , and yet what can [one]585-one do ? [Selina]92-selina is so very unjust — always expecting impossibilities . [She]92-selina would like to have [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth at once [a first rate cook]611-a first rate cook , [a finished house - maid]612-a finished house - maid , and [[an attentive lady]613-an attentive lady 's maid]614-an attentive lady 's maid , and all without being taught ! [She]92-selina gives [her]92-selina things to do , neither waiting to see if they are comprehended by [her]92-selina , nor showing [her]92-selina how to do them . Of course [the girl]307-the girl stands gaping and staring and does not do them , or does them so badly , that [she]307-the girl gets a thorough scolding . " "[307-the girl] Is [she]307-the girl very stupid , do [you]0-i think ? " asked [Johanna]93-johanna , in unconscious appeal to [[her]93-johanna pet]3216-her pet 's stronger judgment . "[0-i] No , [I]0-i do n't . Far from stupid ; only very ignorant , and — [you]0-i would hardly believe it — very nervous . [Selina]92-selina frightens [her]307-the girl . [She]307-the girl gets on extremely well with [me]0-i . " "[307-the girl] [Any one]399-any one would , [[my]0-i dear]3016-my dear . That is , " added [the conscientious elder sister]3217-the conscientious elder sister , still afraid of making [the "[618-any one whom you took pain with] child " vain]3218-the " child " vain , "[0-i] [any one whom [you]0-i took pain with]618-any one whom you took pain with . But do [you]0-i think [you]0-i can ever make any thing out of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? [Her]94-elizabeth month ends to - morrow . Shall [we]619-we let [her]94-elizabeth go ? " "[619-we] And perhaps get in [her]94-elizabeth place [a story - teller]620-a story - teller — [a tale - bearer]621-a tale - bearer — even [a thief]622-a thief . No , no ; let [us]619-we ' Rather bear the ills [we]619-we have , Than fly to others that [we]619-we know not of ; ' and [a thief]622-a thief would be worse than [even a South Sea Islander]624-even a south sea islander . " "[622-a thief] Oh yes , [[my]0-i dear]3016-my dear , " said [Johanna]93-johanna , with a shiver . "[622-a thief] By - the - by , the first step in [the civilization of [the Polynesians]627-the polynesians]626-the civilization of the polynesians was giving [them]627-the polynesians clothes . And [I]0-i have heard say that crime and rags often go together ; that [a man]628-a man unconsciously feels that [he]628-a man owes something to [himself]628-a man and [society]3105-society in the way of virtue when [he]628-a man has a clean face and clean shirt , and a decent coat on . Suppose [we]619-we try the experiment of dressing [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . How many old gowns have [we]619-we ? " The number was few . Nothing in [the Leaf family]3219-the leaf family was ever cast off till its very last extremity of decay ; the talent that "[619-we] Gars auld claes look amaist as gude 's the new " being specially possessed by [Hilary]91-hilary . [She]0-i counted over [her]0-i own wardrobe and [Johanna]93-johanna 's but found nothing that could be spared . "[91-hilary] Yes , [[my]0-i love]630-my love , there is one thing . [You]630-my love certainly shall never put on that old brown merino again ; though [you]630-my love have laid it so carefully by , as if [you]630-my love meant it to come out as fresh as ever next winter . No , [Hilary]91-hilary , [you]630-my love must have a new gown , and [you]630-my love must give [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth [your]630-my love brown merino . " [Hilary]91-hilary laughed , and replied not . Now it might be a pathetic indication of [a girl who had very few clothes]3220-a girl who had very few clothes , but [Hilary]91-hilary had a superstitious weakness concerning hers.—Every dress had its own peculiar chronicle of the scenes where it had been , the enjoyments [she]91-hilary had shared in it . Particular dresses were special memorials of [her]91-hilary loves , [her]91-hilary pleasures , [her]91-hilary little passing pains ; as long as a bit remained of the poor old fabric the sight of it recalled [them]3221-them all . [This brown merino]3222-this brown merino — in which [she]91-hilary had sat two whole winters over [her]91-hilary Greek and Latin by [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon 's side , which [he]98-robert lyon had once stopped to touch and notice , saying what a pretty color it was , and how [he]98-robert lyon liked soft - feeling dresses for [women]3061-women — to cut up this old brown merino seemed to hurt [her]91-hilary so [she]91-hilary could almost have cried . Yet what would [Johanna]93-johanna think if the refused ? And there was [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth absolutely in want of clothes . "[630-my love] [I]0-i must be growing very wicked , " thought poor [Hilary]91-hilary . [She]0-i lay a good while silent in the dark , while [Johanna]93-johanna planned and replanned — calculating how , even with the addition of an old cape of [her]93-johanna own , which was out of the same piece , this hapless gown could be made to fit the gaunt frame of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth Hand.—Her poor kindly brain was in the last extremity of muddle , when [Hilary]91-hilary , with a desperate effort , dashed in to the rescue , and soon made all clear , contriving body , skirt , sleeves and all . "[0-i] [You]0-i have the best head in [the world]248-the world , [[my]0-i love]630-my love . [I]0-i do n't know whatever [I]0-i should do without [you]0-i . " "[0-i] Luckily [you]0-i are never likely to be tried . So give [me]0-i a kiss ; and good night , [Johanna]93-johanna . " [I]93-johanna misdoubt many will say [I]93-johanna am writing about small , ridiculously small , things . Yet is not the whole of life made up of infinitesimally small things ? And in its strange and solemn mosaic , the full pattern of which [we]3224-we never see clearly till looking back on it from far away , dare [we]3224-we say of any thing which the hand of Eternal Wisdom has put together , that it is too common or too small ? While [[her]93-johanna anxious mistresses]3225-her anxious mistresses were thus talking [her]93-johanna over [the servant]276-the servant lay on [her]93-johanna humble bed and slept . [They]3225-her anxious mistresses knew [she]93-johanna did , for [they]3225-her anxious mistresses heard [her]93-johanna heavy breathing through the thin partition wall . Whether , as [Hilary]91-hilary suggested , [she]93-johanna was too ignorant to notice the days of the week , or month , or , as [Selina]92-selina thought , too stupid to care for any thing beyond eating , drinking , and sleeping . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth manifested no anxiety about [herself]94-elizabeth or [her]94-elizabeth destiny . [She]93-johanna went about [her]93-johanna work just as usual ; a little quicker and readier , now [she]93-johanna was becoming familiarized to it ; but [she]93-johanna said nothing . [She]93-johanna was undoubtedly [a girl of silent and undemonstrative nature]3227-a girl of silent and undemonstrative nature . "[93-johanna] Sometimes still waters run deep , " said [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . "[93-johanna] Nevertheless . there are such things as canals , " replied [Johanna]93-johanna . "[633-you] When do [you]633-you mean to have [your]633-you little talk with [her]634-her ? " [Hilary]91-hilary did not know . [She]91-hilary was sitting , rather more tired than usual , by the [school - room fire]3228-school - room fire , [the little people]3229-the little people having just departed for [their]3229-the little people Saturday half - holiday . Before clearing off the debris which [they]3229-the little people always left behind , [she]91-hilary stood a minute at the window , refreshing [her]91-hilary eyes with [the green field opposite]3230-the green field opposite , and [the far - away wood]3231-the far - away wood , crowned by a dim white monument , visible in fair weather , on which those bright brown eyes had a trick of lingering , even in the middle of school hours . For [the wood]3232-the wood and [the hill beyond]3233-the hill beyond belonged to [[a nobleman]3234-a nobleman 's "[633-you] show " estate]3235-a nobleman 's " show " estate , five miles off — the only bit of real landscape beauty that [Hilary]91-hilary had ever beheld . There , during the last holidays but one , [she]91-hilary , [[her]91-hilary sisters]302-her sisters , [[her]91-hilary nephew]369-her nephew , and , by [his]369-her nephew own special request , [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon , had spent a whole long , merry , midsummer day . [She]91-hilary wondered whether such a day would ever come again ! But spring was coming again , any how ; [the field]502-the field looked smiling and green , specked here and there with white dots which , [she]91-hilary opined . might possibly be daisies . [She]91-hilary half wished [she]91-hilary was not too old and dignified to dart across [the road]3239-the road , leap the sunk fence , and run to see . "[93-johanna] [I]0-i think , [Johanna]93-johanna — Hark , what can that be ? " For at this instant [somebody]3240-somebody came tearing down the stairs , opened the front door , and did — exactly what [Hilary]91-hilary had just been wishing to do . "[93-johanna] It 's [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , without [her]94-elizabeth bonnet or shawl , with something white flying behind [her]94-elizabeth . How [she]94-elizabeth is dashing across [the field]502-the field ! What can [she]94-elizabeth be after ? Just look . " But loud screams from [[Selina]92-selina 's room]3241-selina 's room , the front , one , where [she]92-selina had been lying in bed all morning , quite obliterated [the little servant]516-the little servant from [their]636-they minds . [The two sisters]521-the two sisters ran hastily up stairs . [Selina]92-selina was sitting up , in undisguised terror and agitation . "[94-elizabeth] Stop [her]94-elizabeth ! Hold [her]94-elizabeth ! [I]0-i 'm sure [she]94-elizabeth has gone mad . Lock the door , or [she]94-elizabeth 'll come back and murder [us]636-they all . " "[94-elizabeth] Who ? [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ! Was [she]94-elizabeth [here]389-here ? What has been the matter ? " But it was some time before [they]636-they could make out any thing . At last [they]636-they gathered that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had been waiting upon [Miss Selina]92-selina , putting vinegar cloths on [her]94-elizabeth head , and doing various things about [the room]3244-the room . "[94-elizabeth] [She]94-elizabeth is very handy when one is ill . " even [Selina]92-selina allowed . "[94-elizabeth] And [I]0-i assure [you]638-you [I]0-i was talking most kindly to [her]94-elizabeth ; about the duties of [her]94-elizabeth position , and how [she]94-elizabeth ought to dress better , and be more civil behaved , or else [she]94-elizabeth never could except to keep any place . And [she]94-elizabeth stood in [her]94-elizabeth usual sulky way of listening , never answering a word — with [her]94-elizabeth back to [me]0-i , staring right out of window . And [I]0-i had just said , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , [[my]0-i girl'—indeed]639-my girl'—indeed , [Hilary]91-hilary , [I]0-i was talking to [her]94-elizabeth in [my]0-i very kindest way — " "[0-i] [I]0-i 've no doubt of it — but do get on . " "[94-elizabeth] When [she]94-elizabeth suddenly turned round , snatched a clean towel from a chair back , and another from [my]0-i head — actually from [my]0-i very head , [Johanna]93-johanna — and out [she]94-elizabeth ran . [I]0-i called after [her]94-elizabeth , but [she]94-elizabeth took no more notice than if [I]0-i had been a stone . And [she]94-elizabeth left the door wide open — blowing upon [me]0-i . Oh , dear ; [she]94-elizabeth has given [me]0-i [my]0-i death of cold . " And [Selina]92-selina broke out into piteous complainings . [[Her]92-selina elder sister]519-her elder sister soothed [her]92-selina as well as [she]92-selina could , while [Hilary]91-hilary ran down to the front door and looked , and enquired every where for [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [She]307-the girl was not to be seen on [field or road]3246-field or road ; and along [that quiet terrace]3247-that quiet terrace [not a soul]3248-not a soul had even perceived [her]307-the girl quit [the house]344-the house . "[94-elizabeth] It 's a very odd thing . " said [Hilary]91-hilary , returning . "[94-elizabeth] What can have come over [the girl]307-the girl ? [You]641-you are sure , [Selina]92-selina , that [you]641-you said nothing which — " "[641-you] Now [I]0-i know what [you]641-you are going to say , [You]641-you are going to blame [me]0-i . Whatever happens in [this house]642-this house [you]641-you always blame [me]0-i . And perhaps [you]641-you 're right . Perhaps [I]0-i am [a nuisance]643-a nuisance — a burden — would be far better dead and buried . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i were ! " When [Selina]92-selina took this tack , of course [[her]92-selina sisters]302-her sisters were silenced . [They]302-her sisters quited [her]92-selina a little , and then went down and searched [the house]344-the house all over . All was in order ; at least in as much order as was to be expected the hour before dinner . The bowl of half - peeled potatoes stood on the back kitchen "[0-i] sink ; " the roast was down before the fire ; the knives were ready for cleaning . Evidently [Elizabeth flight]94-elizabeth had not been premeditated . "[0-i] It 's all nonsense about [her]644-she going mad . [She]644-she has as sound a head as [I]0-i have , " said [Hilary]91-hilary to [Johanna]93-johanna , who began to look seriously uneasy . "[644-she] [She]644-she might have run away in a fit of passion , certainly ; and yet that is improbable ; [her]644-she temper is more sullen than furious . And having no lack of common sense [she]644-she must know that doing a thing like this is enough to make [her]644-she lose [her]644-she place at once . " "[644-she] Yes , " said [Johanna]93-johanna , mournfully , "[644-she] [I]0-i 'm afraid after this [she]644-she must go . " "[644-she] Wait and see what [she]644-she has to say for [herself]644-she . " pleaded [Hilary]91-hilary . "[644-she] [She]644-she will surely be back in two or three minutes . " But [she]644-she was not , nor even in two or three hours . [[Her]644-she mistresses]429-her mistresses ' annoyance became displeasure , and that again subsided into serious apprehension . Even [Selina]92-selina ceased talking over and over the incident which gave the sole information to be arrived at ; rose , dressed , and came down to [the kitchen]253-the kitchen . There , after long and anxious consultation , [Hilary]91-hilary , observing that "[644-she] [Somebody]3240-somebody had better do something , " began to prepare the dinner as in pre - Elizabethan days ; but [the three ladies]3254-the three ladies ' appetites were small . About three in the afternoon , [Hilary]91-hilary , giving utterance to the hidden alarm of all , said — "[3240-somebody] [I]0-i think , [sisters]3046-sisters , [I]0-i had better go down as quickly as [I]0-i can to [Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand 's . " This agreed , [she]644-she stood consulting with [Johanna]93-johanna as to what could possibly be said to [the mother]280-the mother in case [that unfortunate child]3256-that unfortunate child had not gone [home]3045-home , when the kitchen door opened , and [the culprit]3258-the culprit appeared . Not , however , with the least look of [a culprit]3259-a culprit . Hot [she]280-the mother was , and breathless ; and with [her]280-the mother hair down about [her]280-the mother ears , and [her]280-the mother apron rolled up round [her]280-the mother waist , presented a most forlorn and untidy aspect ; but [her]280-the mother eyes were bright , and [her]280-the mother countenance glowing . [She]280-the mother took a towel from under [her]280-the mother arm.—"There[90-mrs. hand] 's one on 'em — and [you]647-you 'll get back — the other — when it 's washed . " Having blurted out this , [she]280-the mother leaned against the wall , trying to recover [her]280-the mother breath . "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ! Where have [you]94-elizabeth been ? How dared [you]94-elizabeth go ? [Your]94-elizabeth behavior is disgraceful — most disgraceful , [I]0-i say . [Johanna]93-johanna , why do n't [you]94-elizabeth speak to [[your]94-elizabeth servant]3073-your servant ? " ( When , for remissness in reproving [others]525-others , [the elder sister]3213-the elder sister [herself]3213-the elder sister fell under reproof , it was always emphatically "[94-elizabeth] [[your]94-elizabeth sister—"your [nephew"—"your[0-i] servant]3262-nephew"—"your servant]649-your sister—"your nephew"—"your servant . " ) But , for once , [Miss Selina]92-selina 's sharp voice failed to bring the customary sullen look to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's face , and when [Miss Leaf]92-selina , in [her]92-selina milder tones , asked where [she]0-i had been , [she]0-i answered unhesitatingly — "[0-i] [I]0-i 've been down [the town]3034-the town . " "[0-i] Down [the town]3034-the town ! " [the three ladies]3254-the three ladies cried , in one chorus of astonishment . "[0-i] [I]0-i 've been as quick as [I]0-i could , [missis]652-missis . [I]0-i runned all the way there and back ; but it was a good step , and [he]653-he was some'at heavy , though [he]653-he is but a little'un , " "[653-he] [He]653-he ! who on earth is [he]653-he ? " "[653-he] Deary [me]0-i ! [I]0-i never thought of axing ; but [[his]653-he mother]406-his mother lives in [Hall street]6-hall street . [Somebody]3240-somebody saw [me]0-i carrying [him]653-he to [the doctor]656-the doctor , and went and told [her]656-the doctor . Oh ! [he]653-he was welly killed , [Miss Leaf]92-selina — [the doctor]656-the doctor said so ; but [he]653-he 'll do now , and [you]92-selina 'll get [your]92-selina towel clean washed tomorrow . " While [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth spoke so incoherently , and with such unwonted energy and excitement , [Johanna]93-johanna looked as if [she]93-johanna thought [[her]93-johanna sister]559-her sister 's fears were true , and [the girl]307-the girl had really gone mad ; but [Hilary]91-hilary 's quicker perceptions jumped at a different conclusion . "[653-he] Quiet [yourself]92-selina , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , " said [she]91-hilary , taking a firm hold of [her]94-elizabeth shoulder , and making [her]94-elizabeth sit down , when the rolled - up apron dropped , and showed itself all covered with blood spots . [Selina]92-selina screamed outright . Then [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth seemed to become half conscious that [she]94-elizabeth had done something blamable , or was at least a suspected character . [Her]94-elizabeth warmth of manner faded ; the sullen cloud of dogged resistance to authority was rising in [her]94-elizabeth poor dirty face , when [Hilary]91-hilary , beginning with , "[92-selina] Now , [we]658-we are not going to scold [you]94-elizabeth ; but [we]658-we must hear the reason of this , " contrived by adroit questions , and not a few of them , to elicit the whole story . It appeared that , while standing at [Miss Selina]92-selina 's window , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had watched [three little boys]3266-three little boys , apparently engaged in a very favorite amusement of [little boys]251-little boys in [that field]3268-that field , going quickly behind a horse , and pulling out the longest and handsomest hairs in [his]3266-three little boys tail to make fishing lines of . [She]94-elizabeth saw the animal give a kick , and [two of [the boys]3270-the boys]3269-two of the boys ran away ; [the other]3271-the other did not stir . For a minute or so [she]94-elizabeth noticed a black lump lying in the grass ; then , with the quick instinct for which [nobody]357-nobody had ever given [her]94-elizabeth credit , [she]94-elizabeth guessed what had happened , and did immediately the wisest and only thing possible under the circumstances , namely , to snatch up a towel , run across [the field]502-the field , bind up [the child]3274-the child 's head as well as [she]94-elizabeth could , and carry it , bleeding and insensible , to [the nearest doctor , who lived nearly a mile off]3275-the nearest doctor , who lived nearly a mile off . [She]94-elizabeth did not tell — and [they]658-we only found it out afterward — how [she]94-elizabeth had held [the boy]375-the boy while under [the doctor]656-the doctor 's hands , the skull being so badly fractured that [the frightened mother]3278-the frightened mother fainted at the sight ; how [she]94-elizabeth had finally carried [him]375-the boy [home]3045-home , and left [him]375-the boy comfortably settled in bed , [his]375-the boy senses returned , and [his]375-the boy life saved . "[658-we] Ay , [my]0-i arms do ache above a bit , " [she]0-i said , in answer to [Miss Leaf]92-selina 's questions . "[658-we] [He]659-he was n't quite [a baby]598-a baby — nigh upon twelve , [I]0-i reckon ; but then [he]659-he was very small of [his]659-he age . And [he]659-he looked just as if [he]659-he was dead — and [he]659-he bled so . " Here , just for a second or two , the color left [the big girl]3280-the big girl 's lips , and [she]3280-the big girl trembled a little . [Miss Leaf]92-selina went to the kitchen cupboard , and took out [their]661-their only bottle of wine — administered in rare doses , exclusively as medicine . "[659-he] Drink this , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ; and then go and wash [your]94-elizabeth face and eat [your]94-elizabeth dinner . [We]661-their will talk to [you]94-elizabeth by - and - by . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth looked up with a long , wistfull stare of intense surprise , and then added , "[661-their] Have [I]0-i done any thing wrong , [missis]652-missis ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i did not say so . But drink this ; and do n't talk , [child]3052-child . " [She]94-elizabeth was obeyed . By - and - by [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth disappeared into [the back kitchen]287-the back kitchen , emerged thence with a clean face , hands , and apron ; and went about [her]94-elizabeth afternoon business as if nothing had happened . [[Her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses ' threatened "[3052-child] talk " with [her]94-elizabeth never came about . What , indeed , could [they]429-her mistresses say ? No doubt [the little servant]516-the little servant had broken the strict letter of domestic law by running off in that highly eccentric and inconvenient way ; but , as [Hilary]91-hilary tried to explain by a series of most ingenious ratiocinations , [she]516-the little servant had fulfilled , in the spirit of it , the very highest law — that of charity . [She]516-the little servant had also shown prompt courage , decision , practical and prudent forethought , and above all , entire self - forgetfulness . "[3052-child] And [I]0-i should like to know , " said [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , warming with [her]0-i subject , "[3052-child] if those are not the very qualities that go to constitute [a hero]664-a hero . " "[3052-child] But [we]665-we do n't want [a hero]664-a hero ; [we]665-we want [a maid - of - all - work]667-a maid - of - all - work . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll tell [you]668-you what [we]665-we want , [Selina]92-selina . [We]665-we want [a woman]669-a woman ; that is , [a girl with the making of [a good woman]671-a good woman in [her]670-a girl with the making of a good woman in her]670-a girl with the making of a good woman in her . If [we]665-we can find that , all the rest will follow . For [my]0-i part , [I]0-i would rather take [this child]3054-this child , rough as [she]3054-this child is , but with [her]3054-this child truthfulness , conscientiousness , kindliness of heart , and evident capability of both self - control and self - devotedness , than [the most finished servant [we]665-we could find]673-the most finished servant we could find . [My]0-i advice is — keep [her]3054-this child . " This settled the matter , since it was a curious fact that the "[0-i] advice " of [the youngest Miss Leaf]92-selina was , whether [they]665-we knew it or not , almost equivalent to [a family ukase]3284-a family ukase . When [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had brought in the tea - things , which [she]94-elizabeth did with especial care , apparently wishing to blot out the memory of the morning 's escapade by astonishingly good behavior for the rest of the day , [Miss Leaf]92-selina called [her]94-elizabeth , and asked if [she]94-elizabeth knew that [her]94-elizabeth month of trial ended this day ? "[0-i] Yes , [ma'am]3015-ma'am , " with the strict normal courtesy , something between that of [the old - world family domestic]3285-the old - world family domestic — as [[her]94-elizabeth mother]241-her mother might have been to [the Miss Elizabeth Something [she]94-elizabeth was named after]3287-the miss elizabeth something she was named after — and the abrupt "[0-i] dip " of [the modern National school girl]3288-the modern national school girl ; which constituted [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth 's sole experience of manners . "[0-i] If [you]3015-ma'am had not been absent [I]0-i should have gone to speak with [[your]3015-ma'am mother]675-your mother to - day . Indeed [Miss Hilary]91-hilary was going when [you]3015-ma'am came in ; but it would have been with a very different intention from what [we]676-we had in the morning . However , that is not likely to happen again . " "[3017-my sister] Eh ? " said [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , inquiringly . [Miss Leaf]91-hilary hesitated , and looked uneasily at [[her]91-hilary two sisters]336-her two sisters . It was always a trial to [her]91-hilary shy nature to find [herself]91-hilary [the mouth - piece of [the family]258-the family]3290-the mouth - piece of the family ; and this same shyness made it still more difficult to break through the stiff barriers which seemed to rise up between [her]91-hilary , [a gentlewoman well on in years]3292-a gentlewoman well on in years , and [this coarse working girl]3293-this coarse working girl . [She]91-hilary felt , as [she]91-hilary often complained , that with the - kindest intentions , [she]91-hilary did not quite know how to talk to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . "[3017-my sister] [[My]0-i sister]3017-my sister means , " said [Hilary]91-hilary , "[3017-my sister] that as [we]676-we are not likely to have [little boys]251-little boys half killed in [the field]502-the field every day , [she]3017-my sister trusts [you]680-you will not be running away again as [you]680-you did this morning . [She]3017-my sister feels sure that [you]680-you would not do such a thing , putting [us]676-we all to so great annoyance and uneasiness , for any less cause than such as happened to - day . [You]680-you promise that ? " "[680-you] Yes , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . " "[91-hilary] Then [we]676-we quite forgive [you]680-you as regards [ourselves]676-we . Nay"—feeling in spite of [Selina]92-selina 's warning nudge , that [she]3017-my sister had hardly been kind enough—"we[676-we] rather praise than blame [you]680-you , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . And if [you]680-you like to stay with [us]676-we and will do [your]680-you best to improve , [we]676-we are willing to keep [you]680-you as [[our]676-we servant]681-our servant . " "[680-you] Thank [you]680-you [ma'am]3015-ma'am . Thank [you]680-you , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . Yes , [I]0-i 'll stop . " [She]683-her said no more — but sighed a great sigh , as if [her]683-her mind were relieved—("So[0-i] , " thought [Hilary]91-hilary , "[683-her] [she]683-her was not so indifferent to [us]676-we as [we]676-we imagined")—and bustled back into [[her]683-her kitchen]442-her kitchen . "[683-her] Now for the clothing of [her]683-her , " observed [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , also looking much relieved that the decision was over . "[683-her] [You]680-you know what [we]676-we agreed upon ; and there is certainly no time to be lost . [Hilary]91-hilary , [[my]0-i dear]3016-my dear , suppose [you]91-hilary bring down [your]91-hilary brown merino ? " [Hilary]91-hilary went without a word . [People who inhabit [the same house]3296-the same house]3295-people who inhabit the same house , eat , sit , and sleep together — loving [one another]394-one another and sympathizing with [one another]394-one another , ever so deeply and dearly — nevertheless inevitably have momentary seasons when the intense solitude in which [we]676-we all live , and must expect ever to live , at the depth of [our]676-we being , forces itself painfully upon the heart . [Johanna]93-johanna must have had many such seasons when [Hilary]91-hilary was [a child]504-a child ; [Hilary]91-hilary had one now . [She]91-hilary unfolded the old frock , and took out of its pocket , a hiding place at once little likely to be searched , and harmless if discovered , a poor little memento of that happy midsummer day . "[685-dear] [Dear]685-dear [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . To - morrow , then , [I]0-i shall come . [Yours]91-hilary truly , [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . " The only scrap of note [she]91-hilary had ever received ; [he]98-robert lyon always wrote to [Johanna]93-johanna ; as regularly as ever , or more so , now [Ascott]97-ascott was gone ; but only to [Johanna]93-johanna . [She]91-hilary read over the two lines , wondered where [she]91-hilary should keep them now that [Johanna]93-johanna might not notice them ; and then recoiled , as if the secret were a wrong to [that dear sister who loved [her]91-hilary so well]3300-that dear sister who loved her so well . "[98-robert lyon] But nothing makes [me]0-i love [her]91-hilary less ; nothing ever could . [She]91-hilary thinks [me]0-i quite happy , as [I]0-i am ; and yet — oh , if [I]0-i did not miss [him]98-robert lyon so ! " And the aching , aching want which sometimes came over began again . Let [us]3301-us not blame [her]91-hilary . [God]105-god made all [our]3301-us human needs . [God]105-god made love . Not merely affection but actual love — the necessity to seek and find out some other being , not another but the complement of [[one]585-one 's self]3303-one 's self — [the "[91-hilary] other half , " who brings rest and strength for weakness , sympathy in aspiration , and tenderness for tenderness]3304-the " other half , " who brings rest and strength for weakness , sympathy in aspiration , and tenderness for tenderness , as [no other person]3305-no other person ever can . Perhaps , even in marriage , this love is seldom found , and it is possible in all lives to do without it . [Johanna]93-johanna had done so . But then [she]93-johanna had been young , and was now growing old ; and [Hilary]91-hilary was only twenty , with a long life before [her]91-hilary . [Poor child]3306-poor child , let [us]3301-us not blame [her]91-hilary ! [She]91-hilary was not in the least sentimental , [her]91-hilary natural disposition inclining [her]91-hilary to be more than cheerful , actually gay . [She]91-hilary soon recovered [herself]91-hilary , and when , a short time after , [she]91-hilary stood , scissors in hand , demonstrating how very easy it was to make something out of nothing , [[her]91-hilary sisters]302-her sisters never suspected how very near tears had lately been to those bright eyes , which were always the sunshine of [the house]344-the house . "[91-hilary] [You]686-you are giving [yourself]686-you a world of trouble , " said [Selina]92-selina . "[686-you] If [I]0-i were [you]686-you , [I]0-i would just make over the dress to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , and let [her]94-elizabeth do what [she]94-elizabeth could with it . " "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]3016-my dear , [I]0-i always find [I]0-i give [myself]0-i twice the trouble by expecting [people]3210-people to do what [they]3210-people ca n't do . [I]0-i have to do it [myself]0-i afterward . Prove how [a child who ca n't even handle a needle and thread]689-a child who ca n't even handle a needle and thread is competent to make a gown for [herself]689-a child who ca n't even handle a needle and thread , and [I]0-i shall be most happy to secede in [her]689-a child who ca n't even handle a needle and thread favor . " "[0-i] Nay , " put in [the eldest sister]326-the eldest sister , afraid of a collision of words , "[0-i] [Selina]92-selina is right ; if [you]686-you do not teach [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth to make [her]94-elizabeth own gowns how can [she]94-elizabeth learn ? " "[94-elizabeth] [Johanna]93-johanna , [you]93-johanna are [the brilliantest of [women]3061-women]690-the brilliantest of women ! and [you]93-johanna know [you]93-johanna do n't like [the parlor]313-the parlor littered with rags and cuttings . [You]93-johanna wish to get rid of [me]0-i for the evening ? Well , [I]0-i 'll go ! Hand [me]0-i the work basket and the bundle , and [I]0-i 'll give [my]0-i first lesson in dress making to [[our]693-our South Sea Islander]4-south sea islander . " But [Fate]127-fate stood in the way of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's good intentions . [She]91-hilary found [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth not as was [her]91-hilary wo nt , always busy , over the perpetual toil of [those who have not yet learned the mysterious art of arrangement and order]3310-those who have not yet learned the mysterious art of arrangement and order , nor , as sometimes , hanging sleepily over the kitchen fire , waiting for bedtime ; but actually sitting , sitting down at the table . [Her]94-elizabeth candle was flaring on one side of [her]94-elizabeth ; on the other was [the school room inkstand]3311-the school room inkstand , a scrap of waste paper , and a pen But [she]94-elizabeth was not writing ; [she]94-elizabeth sat with [her]94-elizabeth head on [her]94-elizabeth hands , in an attitude of disconsolate idleness , so absorbed that [she]94-elizabeth seemed not to hear [Hilary]91-hilary 's approach . "[0-i] [I]0-i did not know [you]0-i could write , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " "[94-elizabeth] No more [I]0-i can , " was the answer , in the most doleful of voices . "[94-elizabeth] It bean't no good . [I]0-i 've forgotten all about it . T ' letters wonna join . " "[94-elizabeth] Let [me]0-i look at them . " And [Hilary]91-hilary tried to contemplate gravely the scrawled and blotted page , which looked very much as if a large spider had walked into the ink bottle , and then walked out again on a tour of investigation . "[94-elizabeth] What did [you]0-i want to write ? " asked [she]91-hilary , suddenly . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth blushed violently . "[0-i] It was [the woman]694-the woman , [Mrs. Cliffe]128-mrs. cliffe , [[t ' little lad]695-t ' little lad 's mother]696-t ' little lad 's mother , [you]0-i know ; [she]694-the woman wanted [somebody]3240-somebody to write to [[her]694-the woman husband]698-her husband as is at work at [Birmingham]8-birmingham , and [I]0-i said [I]0-i would . [I]0-i 'd learned at the National , but [I]0-i 've forgotten it all . [I]0-i 'm just as [Miss Selina]92-selina says — [I'm]0-i good for nowt . " "[92-selina] Come , come , never fret ; " for there was a sort of choke in [the girl]307-the girl 's voice . "[92-selina] There 's many [a good person who never learned to write]699-a good person who never learned to write . But [I]0-i do n't see why [you]0-i should not learn . Shall [I]0-i teach [you]0-i ? " Utter amazement , beaming gratitude , succeeded one another , plain as light , in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's eyes , but [she]94-elizabeth only said , "[0-i] Thank [you]0-i , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . " "[91-hilary] Very well . [I]0-i have brought [you]0-i an old gown of [mine]0-i , and was going to show [you]0-i how to make it up for [yourself]0-i , but [I]0-i 'll look over [your]0-i writing instead . Sit down and let [me]0-i see what [you]0-i can do . " In a state of nervous trepidation , pitiful to behold , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth took the pen . Terrible scratches resulted ; blots innumerable ; and one fatal deluge of ink , which startled from [their]3313-their seats both [mistress]278-mistress and [maid]3315-maid , and made [Hilary]91-hilary thankful that [she]91-hilary had taken off [her]91-hilary better gown for a common one , as , with sad thriftiness , [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf always did of evenings . When [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth saw the mischief [she]91-hilary had done , [her]94-elizabeth contrition and humility were unbounded . "[91-hilary] No , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , [you]91-hilary ca n't make nothin' of [me]0-i . [I]0-i be too stupid , [I]0-i 'll give it up . " "[0-i] Nonsense ! " And [the bright active little lady]3316-the bright active little lady looked steadily into the heavy face of [this undeveloped girl]3317-this undeveloped girl , [half child]3318-half child , [half woman]3319-half woman , until some of [her]3316-the bright active little lady own spirit seemed to be reflected there . Whether the excitement of the morning had roused [her]3316-the bright active little lady , or [[her]3316-the bright active little lady mistresses]429-her mistresses ' kindness had touched [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's heart , and — as in [most women]3321-most women — the heart was the key to the intellect ; or whether the gradual daily influence of [her]3316-the bright active little lady changed life during the last month had been taking effect , now for the first time to appear — certain it is that [Hilary]91-hilary had never perceived before what [an extremely intelligent face it]3322-an extremely intelligent face it was ; what good sense was indicated in the well shaped head and forehead ; what tenderness and feeling in the deep - set grey eyes . "[0-i] Nonsense , " repeated [she]0-i . "[0-i] Never give up any thing ; [I]0-i never would . [We]700-we 'll try a different plan , and begin from the beginning , as [I]0-i do with [[my]0-i little scholars]701-my little scholars . Wait , while [I]0-i fetch a copy book out of the parlor press . " [She]0-i highly amused [[her]0-i sisters]302-her sisters with a description of what [she]0-i called [her]0-i "[0-i] newly instituted Polynesian Academy ; " returned , and set to work to guide the rough , coarse hand through the mysteries of calligraphy . To say this was an easy task would not be true . [Nature]129-nature 's own laws and limits make the using of faculties which have been unused for generations very difficult at first . To suppose that [a working man]3324-a working man , [the son of [working men]3326-working men , who applies [himself]3324-a working man to study , does it with as little trouble as [[your]3327-your upper - class [children , who have been unconsciously undergoing education ever since the cradle]3329-children , who have been unconsciously undergoing education ever since the cradle]3328-your upper - class children , who have been unconsciously undergoing education ever since the cradle]3325-the son of working men , who applies himself to study , does it with as little trouble as your upper - class children , who have been unconsciously undergoing education ever since the cradle , is a great mistake . All honor , therefore , to [those who do attempt , and to ever so small a degree succeed in , the best and wisest culture of all , self - culture]3330-those who do attempt , and to ever so small a degree succeed in , the best and wisest culture of all , self - culture . Of this honor [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth deserved [her]94-elizabeth share . "[0-i] [She]702-she is stupid enough , " [Hilary]91-hilary confessed , after the lesson was over ; "[702-she] but there is a dogged perseverance about [the girl which [I]0-i actually admire]703-the girl which i actually admire . [She]702-she blots [her]702-she fingers , [her]702-she nose , [her]702-she apron , but [she]702-she never gives in ; and [she]702-she sticks to the grand principle of one thing at a time . [I]0-i think [she]702-she did two whole pages of a 's , and really performed them satisfactorily , before [she]702-she asked to go on to b 's . Yes ! [I]0-i believe [she]702-she will do . " "[0-i] [I]0-i hope [she]702-she will do [her]702-she work , any how , " said [Selina]92-selina , breaking into the conversation rather crossly . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm sure [I]0-i do n't see the good of wasting time over teaching [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth to write , when there 's so much to be done in [the house]344-the house by one and all of [us]705-us , from Monday morning till Saturday night . " "[0-i] Ay , that 's it , " answered [Hilary]91-hilary , meditatively . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't see how [I]0-i ever shall get time to teach [her]94-elizabeth , and [she]94-elizabeth is so tired of nights when the work is all done ; [she]94-elizabeth 'll be dropping asleep with the pen in [her]94-elizabeth hand — [I]0-i have done it [myself]0-i before now . " Ay , in those days when , trying so hard to "[94-elizabeth] improve [her]94-elizabeth mind , " and make [herself]94-elizabeth a little more equal and companionable to another mind [she]94-elizabeth knew , [she]94-elizabeth had , after [her]94-elizabeth daily house cares and [her]94-elizabeth six hours of school teaching , attempted at nine P. M. to begin close study on [her]94-elizabeth own account . And though with [her]94-elizabeth strong will [she]94-elizabeth succeeded tolerably , still , as [she]94-elizabeth told [Johanna]93-johanna , [she]94-elizabeth could well understand how slow was the , "[94-elizabeth] march of intellect " ( a phrase which had just then come up ) among [day laborers and the like]3331-day laborers and the like ; and how difficult it was for [these Mechanics Institutions , which were now talked so much of , to put any new ideas into [the poor tired heads]3333-the poor tired heads]3332-these mechanics institutions , which were now talked so much of , to put any new ideas into the poor tired heads , rendered sluggish and stupid with hard bodily labor , "[94-elizabeth] Suppose [I]0-i were to hold [my]0-i Polynesian Academy on a Sunday ? " and [she]94-elizabeth looked inquiringly at [[her]94-elizabeth sisters]302-her sisters , especially [Johanna]93-johanna . Now [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf were [old fashioned country folk , who lived before the words Sabbatarian and un - Sabbatarian had ever got into the English language]3335-old fashioned country folk , who lived before the words sabbatarian and un - sabbatarian had ever got into the english language . [They]89-the misses leaf simply "[0-i] remembered the Sabbath day to keep it holy ; " [they]89-the misses leaf arranged so as to make it for [all the household]3336-all the household a day of rest : and [they]89-the misses leaf went regularly to [church]396-church once — sometimes [Selina]92-selina and [Hilary]91-hilary went twice . For the intervening hours , [their]89-the misses leaf usual custom was to take an afternoon walk in [the fields]3338-the fields ; begun chiefly for [Ascott]97-ascott 's sake , to keep [the lad]422-the lad out of mischief , and put into [his]422-the lad mind better thoughts than [he]422-the lad was likely to get from [his]422-the lad favorite Sunday recreation of sitting on the wall throwing stones . After [he]422-the lad left for [London]1-london there was [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth to be thought of ; and [they]89-the misses leaf decided that the best Sabbath duty for [the little servant]516-the little servant was to go and see [[her]94-elizabeth mother]241-her mother . So [they]89-the misses leaf gave [her]94-elizabeth every Sunday afternoon free ; only requiring that [she]94-elizabeth should be at [home]3045-home punctually after church time , at eight o'clock . But from thence till bedtime was a blank two hours , which , [Hilary]91-hilary had noticed , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth not infrequently spent in dozing over the fire . "[0-i] And [I]0-i wonder , " said [she]0-i , giving the end of [her]0-i long meditation out loud , "[0-i] whether going to sleep is not as much Sabbath breaking as learning to write ? What do [you]0-i say , [Johanna]93-johanna ? " [Johanna]93-johanna , [simple , God - fearing woman]3343-simple , god - fearing woman as [she]93-johanna was , to whom faith and love came as natural as the breath [she]93-johanna drew , had never perplexed [herself]93-johanna with the question . [She]93-johanna only smiled acquiescence . But [Selina]92-selina was greatly shocked . Teaching to write on a Sunday ! Bringing the week day work into the day of rest ! Doing [one]585-one 's own pleasure on the holy day ! [She]92-selina thought it exceedingly wrong . Such a thing had never been heard of in [[their]3345-their house]3346-their house . Whatever else might be said of [them]3345-their , [the Leafs]3347-the leafs were always [a respectable family]3348-a respectable family as to keeping Sunday . [Nobody]357-nobody could say that even poor [Henry]97-ascott — But here [Selina]92-selina 's torrent of words stopped . When conversation revived , [Hilary]91-hilary , who had been at first half annoyed and half amused , resumed [her]91-hilary point seriously . "[0-i] [I]0-i might say that writing is n't [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's week - day work , and that teaching [her]94-elizabeth is not exactly doing [my]0-i own pleasure ; but [I]0-i wo n't creep out of the argument by a quibble . The question is , What is keeping the Sabbath day ' holy ? ' [I]0-i say — and [I]0-i stick to [my]0-i opinion — that it is by making it a day of worship , a rest day — a cheerful and happy day — and by doing as much good in it as [we]706-we can . And therefore [I]0-i mean to teach [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth on a Sunday . " "[94-elizabeth] [She]94-elizabeth 'll never understand it . [She]94-elizabeth 'll consider it work . " "[94-elizabeth] And if [she]94-elizabeth did , work is a more religious thing than idleness . [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i often feel that , of the two , [I]0-i should be less sinful in digging potatoes in [[my]0-i garden]707-my garden , or sitting mending stockings in [[my]0-i parlor]708-my parlor , than in keeping Sunday as [some people]485-some people do — going to [church]396-church genteelly in [my]0-i best clothes , eating a huge Sunday dinner , and then nodding over a good book , or taking a regular Sunday nap till bedtime . " "[3052-child] Hush , [child]3052-child ! " said [Johanna]93-johanna , reprovingly ; for [Hilary]91-hilary 's cheeks were red , and [her]91-hilary voice angry . [She]0-i was taking the hot , youthful part which in its hatred of forms and shams , sometimes leads — and not seldom led poor [Hilary]91-hilary — a little too far on the other side . "[0-i] [I]0-i think , " [Miss Leaf]91-hilary added , "[0-i] that [our]712-our business is with [ourselves]712-our , and not with [[our]712-our neighbors]713-our neighbors . Let [us]712-our keep the Sabbath according to [our]712-our conscience . Only , [I]0-i would take care never to do any thing which jarred against [[my]0-i neighbor]714-my neighbor 's feelings . [I]0-i would , like [Paul]130-paul , ' eat no meat while [the world]248-the world standeth ' rather than ' make [[my]0-i brother]716-my brother to offend . ' " [Hilary]91-hilary looked in [[her]91-hilary sister]559-her sister 's sweet , calm face , and the anger died out of [her]91-hilary own . "[130-paul] Shall [I]0-i give up [[my]0-i academy]717-my academy ? " [she]0-i said , softly . "[630-my love] No , [[my]0-i love]630-my love . It is lawful to do good on the Sabbath day , and teaching [a poor ignorant girl]719-a poor ignorant girl to write is an absolute good . Make [her]719-a poor ignorant girl understand that , and [you]630-my love need not be afraid of any harm ensuing . " "[630-my love] [You]630-my love never will make [her]719-a poor ignorant girl understand , " said [Selina]92-selina , sullenly . "[630-my love] [She]719-a poor ignorant girl is only [a servant]246-a servant . " "[719-a poor ignorant girl] Nevertheless [I]0-i 'll try . " [Hilary]91-hilary could not tell how far [she]91-hilary succeeded in simplifying to [the young servant]3351-the young servant 's comprehension this great question , involving so many points — such as the following of the spirit and the letter , the law of duty and the compulsion of love , which , as [she]91-hilary spoke , seemed opening out so widely and awfully that [she]91-hilary [herself]91-hilary involuntarily shrank from it , and wondered that poor finite creatures should , ever presume to squabble about it at all . But one thing [the girl]307-the girl did understand — [[her]307-the girl young mistress]3353-her young mistress 's kindness . [She]91-hilary stood watching the delicate little hand that had so patiently guided [hers]91-hilary , and now wrote copy after copy for [her]91-hilary future benefit . At last [she]91-hilary said — "[0-i] [You]630-my love 're taking a deal o ' trouble wi ' [a poor wench]721-a poor wench , and it 's very kind in [a lady like [you]630-my love]722-a lady like you . " [Miss Hilary]91-hilary was puzzled what answer to make . True enough it was "[723-a lady] kind , " and [she]723-a lady was "[723-a lady] [a lady]723-a lady ; " and between [her]91-hilary and [[Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand 's rough daughter]3354-mrs. hand 's rough daughter was an unmistakable difference and distinction . That [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth perceived it was proved by [her]94-elizabeth growing respectfulness of manner — the more respectful , it seemed , the more [she]94-elizabeth [herself]94-elizabeth improved . Yet [Hilary]91-hilary could not bear to make [her]94-elizabeth feel more sharply than was unavoidable the great gulf that lies and ever must lie — not so much between [mistress]278-mistress and [servant]3356-servant , in [their]3357-their abstract relation—(and yet that is right , for the relation and authority are ordained of God)—but between [the educated]3358-the educated and [the ignorant]3359-the ignorant , [the coarse and the refined]3360-the coarse and the refined . "[723-a lady] Well , " [she]0-i said , after a pause of consideration , "[630-my love] [you]630-my love always have it in [your]630-my love power to repay [my]0-i ' kindness , ' as [you]630-my love call it . The cleverer [you]630-my love become the more useful [you]630-my love will be to [me]0-i ; and the more good [you]630-my love grow the better [I]0-i shall like [you]630-my love . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth smiled — that wonderfully bright , sudden smile which seemed to cover over all [her]94-elizabeth plainness of feature . "[0-i] Once upon a time , " [Hilary]91-hilary resumed by - and - by , "[0-i] when [England]9-england was very different from what it is now , [English ladies]724-english ladies used to have what [they]724-english ladies call ' bower - women , ' whom [they]724-english ladies took as [girls]252-girls , and brought up in [their]724-english ladies service ; teaching [them]724-english ladies all sorts of things — cooking , sewing , spinning , singing , and , probably , except that [the ladies of that time]726-the ladies of that time were very ill - educated [themselves]726-the ladies of that time , to read and write also . [They]724-english ladies used to spend part of every day among [[their]724-english ladies bower - women]727-their bower - women ; and as [people]3210-people can only enjoy the company of those with whom [they]3210-people have some sympathies in common , [we]729-we must conclude that — " Here [Hilary]91-hilary stopped , recollecting [she]91-hilary must be discoursing miles above the head of [[her]91-hilary little bower - maiden]3361-her little bower - maiden , and that , perhaps , after all , [her]91-hilary theory would be best kept to [herself]91-hilary , and only demonstrated practically . "[729-we] So , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , if [I]0-i spend a little of [my]0-i time in teaching [you]94-elizabeth , [you]94-elizabeth must grow up [[my]0-i faithful and [attached bower - maiden]731-attached bower - maiden]730-my faithful and attached bower - maiden ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll grow up any thing , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , if it 's to please [you]94-elizabeth , " was the answer , given with a smothered intensity that quite startled [the young mistress]3362-the young mistress . "[91-hilary] [I]0-i do believe [the girl]307-the girl is getting fond of [me]0-i , " said [she]0-i , half touched , half laughing to [Johanna]93-johanna . Now , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's head may be uncommonly tough , but [I]0-i do believe [she]94-elizabeth likes [me]0-i . " [Johanna]93-johanna smiled ; but [she]93-johanna would not for [the world]248-the world have said — never encouraging the smallest vanity in [[her]93-johanna child]3364-her child — that [she]93-johanna did not think this circumstance so very remarkable . [A household exclusively composed of [women]3061-women]3365-a household exclusively composed of women has its advantages and its disadvantages . It is apt to become somewhat narrow in judgment , morbid in feeling , absorbed in petty interests , and bounding its vision of outside things to the small horizon which it sees from [its]3365-a household exclusively composed of women own fireside . But , on the other hand , by this fireside often abides a settled peace and purity , a long - suffering , generous forbearance , and an enduring affectionateness which [the other sex]3367-the other sex can hardly comprehend or credit . [Men]3062-men will not believe , what is nevertheless the truth , that [we]733-we can "[94-elizabeth] stand alone " better than [they]3062-men can ; that [we]733-we can do without [them]3062-men far easier , and with less deterioration of character , than [they]3062-men can do without [us]733-we ; that [we]733-we are better able to provide for [ourselves]733-we interests , duties , and pleasures ; in short , strange as it may appear , that [we]733-we have more real self - sustaining independence than [they]3062-men . Of course , that the true life , the highest life , is that of [man]3369-man and [woman]352-woman united , [no one]3371-no one will be insane enough to deny ; [I]94-elizabeth am speaking of the substitute for it , which poor humanity has so often to fall back upon and make the best of — a better best very frequently than what appears best in the eyes of [the world]248-the world . In truth , [many a troubled , care ridden , wealthy family , torn with dissensions , or frozen up in splendid formalities]3373-many a troubled , care ridden , wealthy family , torn with dissensions , or frozen up in splendid formalities , might have envied [that quiet , humble , maiden household of [the Misses Leaf]3375-the misses leaf , where [their]3375-the misses leaf only trial was poverty , and [their]3375-the misses leaf only grief the one which [they]3375-the misses leaf knew the worst of]3374-that quiet , humble , maiden household of the misses leaf , where their only trial was poverty , and their only grief the one which they knew the worst of , and had met patiently for many a year — poor [Selina]92-selina 's "[94-elizabeth] way . " [I]258-the family doubt not it was good for [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth that [her]94-elizabeth first place — [the home in which [she]94-elizabeth received [her]94-elizabeth first impressions]3376-the home in which she received her first impressions — was [this feminine establishment , simple and regular , in which was neither waste nor disorder allowed]3377-this feminine establishment , simple and regular , in which was neither waste nor disorder allowed . Good , too , that while [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses ' narrow means restricted [her]94-elizabeth in many things enjoyed by [servants in [richer families]3380-richer families]3379-servants in richer families , [their]3379-servants in richer families interests , equally narrow , caused to be concentrated upon [herself]94-elizabeth a double measure of thought and care . [She]94-elizabeth became absolutely "[258-the family] one of [the family]258-the family , " sharing in all its concerns . From its small and few carnal luxuries — such as the cake , fruit , or pot of preserve , votive offerings from [[pupils]315-pupils ' parents]316-pupils ' parents — up to the newspaper and the borrowed book , nothing was either literally or metaphorically "[258-the family] locked " up from [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . This grand question of locking up had been discussed in full conclave the day after [her]94-elizabeth month of preparation ended , [the sisters]3383-the sisters taking opposite sides , as might have been expected . [Selina]92-selina was for the immediate introduction of [a locksmith and a key basket]3384-a locksmith and a key basket . " But [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth did not go . A year passed ; two years ; [her]94-elizabeth wages were raised , and with [them]3386-them [her]94-elizabeth domestic position . From [a "[307-the girl] girl]3387-a " girl " [she]94-elizabeth was converted into [a regular servant]3388-a regular servant ; [her]94-elizabeth pinafores gave place to grown - up gowns and aprons ; and [her]94-elizabeth rough head , at [Miss Selina]92-selina 's incessant instance , was concealed by a cap — caps being considered by [that lady]3389-that lady as the proper and indispensable badge of [servant - hood]3390-servant - hood . To say that during [her]94-elizabeth transition state , or even now that [she]94-elizabeth had reached the cap era , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth gave [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses no trouble , would be stating a self - evident improbability . [I]307-the girl am obliged to confess that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had a few — nay , not a few — most obstinate faults ; that [no child]3396-no child tries [[its]3396-no child parents]3397-its parents , [no pupil]3398-no pupil [[its]3396-no child school teachers]3399-its school teachers , more than [she]94-elizabeth tried [her]94-elizabeth three mistresses at intervals . [She]94-elizabeth was often thoughtless and careless , brusque in [her]94-elizabeth manner , slovenly , in [her]94-elizabeth dress ; sometimes [she]94-elizabeth was down - right "[307-the girl] bad , " filled full — as some of [[her]94-elizabeth elders]3400-her elders and betters are , at all ages — with absolute naughtiness ; when [she]94-elizabeth would sulk for hours and days together , and make [the whole family]415-the whole family uncomfortable , as many [a servant]246-a servant can make [many a family small as that of [the Misses Leaf]3375-the misses leaf]3403-many a family small as that of the misses leaf . [They]415-the whole family took [her]94-elizabeth faults as [we]3405-we must take the surface faults of all connected with [us]3405-we — patiently rather than resentfully , seeking to correct rather than to punish . And though there were difficult elements in [the household]277-the household , such as [their]415-the whole family being [three mistresses]3407-three mistresses to be obeyed [the youngest mistress]3408-the youngest mistress a thought too lax and [the second one]3409-the second one undoubtedly too severe , still [no girl]3410-no girl could live with [these high - principled , much - enduring women]3411-these high - principled , much - enduring women without being impressed with two things which [the serving class]3412-the serving class are slowest to understand — the dignity of poverty , and the beauty of that which is the only effectual law to bring out good and restrain evil — the law of loving - kindness . Two fracas , however , must be chronicled , for after both , [the girl]307-the girl 's dismissal hung on a thread . The first was when [Mrs. Cliffe]128-mrs. cliffe , mother of [Tommy Cliffe]132-tom , who was nearly killed in [the field]502-the field , being discovered to be [an ill sort of woman]3415-an ill sort of woman , and in the habit of borrowing from [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth stray shillings , which were never returned , was forbidden [the house]344-the house , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth resented it so fiercely that [she]94-elizabeth sulked for a whole week afterward . The other and still more dangerous crisis in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's destiny was when a volume of [Scott]133-scott 's novels , having been missing for some days , was found hidden in [her]94-elizabeth bed , and [she]94-elizabeth lying awake reading it was thus ignominiously discovered at eleven P. M. by [Miss Selina]92-selina , in consequence of the gleam of candle light from under [her]94-elizabeth door . It was true neither of these errors were actual moral crimes . [Hilary]91-hilary even roused a volley of sharp words upon [herself]91-hilary by declaring they had their source in actual virtues ; that [a girl who would stint [herself]3417-a girl who would stint herself of shillings , and hold resolutely to any liking she had , even if unworthy , had a creditable amount of both self - denial and fidelity in her disposition of shillings , and hold resolutely to any liking [she]3417-a girl who would stint herself of shillings , and hold resolutely to any liking she had , even if unworthy , had a creditable amount of both self - denial and fidelity in her disposition had , even if unworthy , had a creditable amount of both self - denial and fidelity in [her]3417-a girl who would stint herself of shillings , and hold resolutely to any liking she had , even if unworthy , had a creditable amount of both self - denial and fidelity in her disposition disposition]3417-a girl who would stint herself of shillings , and hold resolutely to any liking she had , even if unworthy , had a creditable amount of both self - denial and fidelity in her disposition . Also that [a tired out maid - of all - work]3418-a tired out maid - of all - work , who was kept awake of nights by [her]3418-a tired out maid - of all - work ardent appreciation of the "[307-the girl] Heart of [Mid - Lothian]10-mid - lothian , " must possess a degree of both intellectual and moral capacity which deserved cultivation rather than blame . And though this surreptitious pursuit of literature under difficulties could not of course be allowed , [I]307-the girl grieve to say that [Miss Hilary]91-hilary took every opportunity of not only giving [the young servant]3351-the young servant books to read , but of talking to [her]91-hilary about them . Did [she]91-hilary do harm ? [I]757-her will not argue the point : [I]757-her am not making [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth a text for a sermon ; [I]757-her am simply writing [her]94-elizabeth story . One thing was certain , that by degrees [the young woman]3425-the young woman 's faults lessened ; even that worst of them , the unmistakable bad temper , not aggressive , but obstinately sullen , which made [her]757-her and [Miss Selina]92-selina sometimes not on speaking terms for a week together . "[757-her] [She]757-her makes [me]0-i feel more sorry for [her]757-her than angry with [her]757-her , " [Miss Leaf]92-selina would sometimes say , coming out of [the kitchen]253-the kitchen with that grieved face , which was the chief sign of displeasure [her]757-her sweet nature ever betrayed . " But gradually [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , too , copying involuntarily [the rest of [the family]258-the family]3427-the rest of the family , learned to put up with [Miss Selina]92-selina ; who , on [her]92-selina part , kept a sort of armed neutrality . After this illness of [[his]757-her Aunt]428-his aunt . [Ascott]97-ascott came [home]3045-home . It was the old story — old as [the hills]3438-the hills ! [I]760-i do not pretend to invent any thing new . [The Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf — ay , even [Selina]92-selina , whose irritation against [the provoking boy]3442-the provoking boy was quite mollified by [the elegant young man]3443-the elegant young man — were no wiser than [[their]89-the misses leaf neighbors]3444-their neighbors . [The young fellow]3447-the young fellow took little notice of [her]760-i except to observe "[760-i] that [she]760-i had n't grown any handsomer ; ' but [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth watched [him]761-him with a keen severity that overlooked nothing , and resisted , with a passive pertinacity that was quite irresistible , all [his]761-him encroachments on the family habits , all the little self - pleasing ways which [Ascott]97-ascott had been so used to of old , that neither [he]97-ascott nor [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts apparently recognized [them]763-them as selfish . " [I]431-her mistress canna bear to see [him]761-him "[431-her mistress] ( " can not , "[431-her mistress] suggested [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress , who not seeing any reason why [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth should not speak [the Queen]765-the queen 's English as well as [herself]94-elizabeth , had instituted h 's , and stopped a few more glaring provincialisms . ) " [I]431-her mistress can not bear to see [him]761-him , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , lolling on the arm - chair , when [Missis]134-missis looks so tired and pale , and sitting up o ' nights , burning double fires , and going up [stairs]3048-stairs at last with [his]761-him boots on , and waking [every body]3430-every body . But [she]91-hilary resolved to seize the first opportunity of giving [Ascott]97-ascott , by way of novelty , the severest lecture that tongue of [aunt]770-aunt could bestow . "[97-ascott] For of late [Ascott]97-ascott had said very little about [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon — not half so much as [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon , in [his]98-robert lyon steadily persistent letters to [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , told [her]91-hilary about [[her]91-hilary nephew]369-her nephew [Ascott]97-ascott . "[98-robert lyon] Something new in [Ascott]97-ascott 's tone — speaking more of the resentful fierceness of [the man]777-the man than the pettishness of [the boy]375-the boy — frightened [[his]97-ascott little aunt]779-his little aunt , and silenced [her]779-his little aunt . By - and - by [she]779-his little aunt took comfort from the reflection that , as [the lad]422-the lad had in [his]422-the lad anger betrayed , [he]422-the lad had beside [him]422-the lad in [London]1-london a monitor whose preaching would be so much wiser and more effectual than [her]779-his little aunt own that [she]779-his little aunt determined to say no more .
