" Do [you]97-ascott go to see [him]98-robert lyon often ? "[779-his little aunt] [she]779-his little aunt said , at last . " Who ? [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon ? "[779-his little aunt] And [Ascott]97-ascott , delighted ' to escape into a fresh subject , became quite cheerful and communicative . " Oh , bless [you]97-ascott ! [He]98-robert lyon would n't care for [my]3447-the young fellow going to [him]98-robert lyon . [He]422-the lad lives in [a two - pair back]3457-a two - pair back , only [one room]3458-one room , ' which serves [him]422-the lad for [kitchen]363-kitchen and [parlor]364-parlor and all : ' dines at [a cook shop]3461-a cook shop for nine - pence a day , and makes [his]422-the lad own porridge night and morning . [He]422-the lad told [me]3447-the young fellow so once , for [he]422-the lad is n't a bit ashamed of it . But [he]422-the lad must be precious hard up sometimes . However , as [he]422-the lad contrives to keep a decent coat on [his]422-the lad back , and pay [his]422-the lad classes at [the University]3462-the university , and carry off the very first honors going [there]3030-there , [nobody]357-nobody asks any questions . That 's the good of [London]1-london life , [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary , "[3447-the young fellow] said [the young fellow]3447-the young fellow , drawing [himself]3447-the young fellow up with great wisdom . " Only look like [a gentleman]3465-a gentleman , behave [yourself]3447-the young fellow as such , and [nobody]357-nobody asks any questions . "[3447-the young fellow] " Yes , "[101-hilary] acquiesced vaguely [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary . And then [her]101-hilary mind wandered yearningly to [the solitary student in the two - pair back]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back . [He]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back might labor and suffer ; [he]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back might be ill ; [he]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back might die , equally solitary , and " [nobody]357-nobody would ask any questions . "[782-the solitary student in the two - pair back] This phase of [London]1-london life let a new light in upon [her]101-hilary mind . The letters to [Johanna]93-johanna had been chiefly filled with whatever [he]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back thought would interest [them]783-them . With [his]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back characteristic Scotch reserve , [he]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back had said very little about [himself]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back , except in the last , wherein [he]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back mentioned that [he]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back had " done pretty well "[782-the solitary student in the two - pair back] at [the college]784-the college this term , and meant to " go in for more work "[782-the solitary student in the two - pair back] immediately . What this work entailed — how much more toil , how much more poverty — [Hilary]101-hilary knew not . Perhaps even [his]782-the solitary student in the two - pair back successes , which [Ascott]97-ascott went on to talk of , had less place in [her]101-hilary thoughts than the picture of the face [she]101-hilary knew , sharpened with illness , wasted with hard work and solitary care . " And [I]101-hilary can not help [him]98-robert lyon — [I]101-hilary can not help [him]98-robert lyon ! "[101-hilary] was [her]101-hilary bitter cry ; until , passing from [the dream - land of fancy]785-the dream - land of fancy , the womanly nature asserted itself . [She]101-hilary thought if it had been , or if it were to be , [her]101-hilary blessed lot to be chosen by [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , how [she]101-hilary would take care of [him]98-robert lyon ! what [an utter slave]786-an utter slave [she]101-hilary would be to [him]98-robert lyon ! How no penury would frighten [her]101-hilary , no household care oppress or humble [her]101-hilary , if done for [him]98-robert lyon and for [his]98-robert lyon comfort . To [her]101-hilary brave heart no battle of life seemed too long or too sore , if only it were fought for [him]98-robert lyon and at [his]98-robert lyon side . And as the early falling leaves were blown in gusts across [her]101-hilary path , and the misty autumn night began to close in , nature [herself]101-hilary seemed to plead in unison with the craving of [her]101-hilary heart , which sighed that youth and summer last not always ; and that , " be it ever so humble , "[101-hilary] as the song says , there is no place so bright and beautiful as the fireside of [a loveful home]787-a loveful home . While [the aunt]788-the aunt and [nephew]3136-nephew were strolling thus , thinking of very different things , [their]790-their own fire newly lit — [Ascott]97-ascott liked a fire — was blazing away in solitary glory , for the benefit of [all passers - by]791-all passers - by . At length one — [a gentleman]3465-a gentleman — stopped at the gate , and looked in , then took a turn to the end of [the terrace]793-the terrace , and stood gazing in once more . The solitude of [the room]3244-the room apparently troubled [him]98-robert lyon ; twice [his]98-robert lyon hand was on the latch before [he]98-robert lyon opened it and knocked at the front door . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth appeared , which seemed to surprise [him]98-robert lyon . " Is [Miss Leaf]91-hilary at [home]3045-home ? "[94-elizabeth] " No , [Sir]3469-sir . "[94-elizabeth] " Is [she]91-hilary well ? Are all [the family]258-the family well ? "[98-robert lyon] and [he]98-robert lyon stepped right into [the passage]795-the passage , with the freedom of a familiar foot . "[98-robert lyon] ) [The stranger]796-the stranger and [she]94-elizabeth mutually examined [one another]394-one another . " [I]98-robert lyon think [I]98-robert lyon have heard of [you]94-elizabeth , "[98-robert lyon] said [he]98-robert lyon , smiling . "[98-robert lyon] " Yes , [Sir]3469-sir , "[98-robert lyon] still grimly , and with a determined grasp of the door handle . " If [[your]94-elizabeth mistresses]3474-your mistresses are likely to be [home]3045-home soon , will [you]94-elizabeth allow [me]98-robert lyon to wait for [them]3474-your mistresses ? [I]98-robert lyon am [an old friend of theirs]3476-an old friend of theirs . [My]98-robert lyon name is [Lyon]98-robert lyon . "[98-robert lyon] Now [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was far too much [one of [the family]258-the family]798-one of the family not to have heard of [such a person]800-such a person . And [his]98-robert lyon knowing [her]94-elizabeth was a tolerable proof of [his]98-robert lyon identity ; besides , unconsciously , [the girl]307-the girl was influenced by that look and mien of true gentlemanhood , as courteous to [the poor maid - of - all - work]802-the poor maid - of - all - work as [he]98-robert lyon would have been to [any duchess born]803-any duchess born ; and by that bright , sudden smile , which came like sunshine over [his]98-robert lyon face , and like sunshine warmed and opened the heart of [every one that met it]804-every one that met it . It opened that of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [She]94-elizabeth relaxed [her]94-elizabeth Cerberus keeping of the door , and even went so far as to inform [him]98-robert lyon that [Miss Leaf]91-hilary and [Miss Selina]92-selina were out to tea , but [Miss Hilary]91-hilary and [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott would be at [home]3045-home shortly . [He]98-robert lyon was welcome to wait in [the parlor]313-the parlor if [he]98-robert lyon liked . Afterward , seized with mingled curiosity and misgiving , [she]94-elizabeth made various errands to go in and look at [him]98-robert lyon ; but [she]94-elizabeth had not courage to address [him]98-robert lyon , and [he]98-robert lyon never spoke to [her]94-elizabeth . [He]98-robert lyon sat by the window , gazing out into the gloaming . Except just turning [his]98-robert lyon head at [her]94-elizabeth entrance ; [she]94-elizabeth did not think [he]98-robert lyon had once stirred the whole time . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth went back to [[her]94-elizabeth kitchen]442-her kitchen , and stood listening for [[her]94-elizabeth young mistress]3353-her young mistress 's familiar knock . [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon seemed to have listened too , for before [she]94-elizabeth could reach it the door was already opened . There was a warm greeting — to [her]94-elizabeth great relief : for [she]94-elizabeth knew [she]94-elizabeth had broken the domestic laws in admitting [a stranger]488-a stranger unawares — and then [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth heard [them]810-them all three go into [the parlor]313-the parlor , where [they]810-them remained talking , without ringing for either tea or candles , a full quarter of an hour . [Miss Hilary]91-hilary at last came out , but much to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's surprise , went straight up into [[her]91-hilary bedroom]812-her bedroom without entering [the kitchen]253-the kitchen at all . It was some minutes more before [she]91-hilary descended ; and then , after giving [her]91-hilary orders for tea , and seeing that all was arranged with special neatness , [she]91-hilary stood absently by the kitchen fire . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth noticed how wonderfully bright [her]91-hilary eyes were , and what a soft , happy smile [she]91-hilary had . [She]94-elizabeth noticed it , because [she]94-elizabeth had never seen [Miss Hilary]91-hilary look exactly like that before ; and [she]94-elizabeth never did again . " Do n't [you]431-her mistress be troubling [yourself]431-her mistress with waiting about here , "[94-elizabeth] [she]94-elizabeth said ; and [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress seemed to start at being spoken to . " [I]91-hilary 'll get the tea all right , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . Please go back into [the parlor]313-the parlor . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary went in . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth got tea ready with unwonted diligence and considerable excitement . [Any visitor]815-any visitor was a rare occurrence in [this very quiet family]816-this very quiet family ; but [a gentleman visitor]817-a gentleman visitor — [a young gentleman]818-a young gentleman too — was a remarkable fact , arousing both interest and curiosity . For in the latter quality [this girl of seventeen]819-this girl of seventeen could scarcely be expected to be deficient ; and as to the former , [she]91-hilary had so completely identified [herself]91-hilary with [the family [she]91-hilary served]820-the family she served , that all [their]820-the family she served concerns were [her]91-hilary concerns also . [Her]91-hilary acute comments on [[their]820-the family she served few guests]821-their few guests , and on [[their]820-the family she served little scholars]822-their little scholars , sometimes amused [Hilary]91-hilary as much as [her]91-hilary criticisms on the books [she]91-hilary read . But as neither were ever put forward intrusively or impertinently , [she]91-hilary let [them]823-them pass , and only laughed over [them]823-them with [Johanna]93-johanna in private . In speaking of these said books , and the questions [they]823-them led to , it was not likely but that [mistress]278-mistress and [maid]3315-maid — [one aged twenty - two]826-one aged twenty - two , and [the other seventeen]827-the other seventeen — should occasionally light upon a subject rather interesting to [women of [their]828-women of their ages ages]828-women of their ages , though not commonly discussed between [mistresses]829-mistresses and [maids]830-maids . Nevertheless , when it did come in the way , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary never shirked it , but talked it out , frankly and freely , as [she]91-hilary would to [any other person]831-any other person . " [The girl]307-the girl has feelings and notions on the matter , like [all other girls]3479-all other girls , [I]91-hilary suppose , "[91-hilary] reasoned [she]91-hilary to [herself]91-hilary ; " so it is important that [her]307-the girl notions should be kept clear , and [her]307-the girl feelings right . It may do [her]307-the girl some good , and save [her]307-the girl from much harm . "[91-hilary] And so it befell [that Elizabeth Hand , whose blunt ways , unlovely person , and temperament so oddly nervous and reserved]832-that elizabeth hand , whose blunt ways , unlovely person , and temperament so oddly nervous and reserved , kept [her]832-that elizabeth hand , whose blunt ways , unlovely person , and temperament so oddly nervous and reserved from attracting [any " sweetheart "[91-hilary] of [[her]832-that elizabeth hand , whose blunt ways , unlovely person , and temperament so oddly nervous and reserved own class]834-her own class]833-any " sweetheart " of her own class , had unconsciously imbibed [[her]832-that elizabeth hand , whose blunt ways , unlovely person , and temperament so oddly nervous and reserved mistress]431-her mistress 's theory of love . Love , pure and simple , the very deepest and highest , sweetest and most solemn thing in life : to be believed in devoutly until it came , and when it did come , to be held to , firmly , faithfully , with a single - minded , settled constancy , till death . A creed , quite impossible , [many]3189-many will say , in [this ordinary world]837-this ordinary world , and most dangerous to be put into the head of [a poor servant]838-a poor servant . Yet [a woman]669-a woman is but [a woman]669-a woman , be [she]669-a woman [maid - servant]841-maid - servant or [queen]842-queen ; and if , from [queens]843-queens to [maid - servants]844-maid - servants , [girls]252-girls were taught thus to think of love , there might be a few more " broken "[669-a woman] hearts perhaps , but there would certainly be fewer wicked hearts ; far fewer corrupted lives of [men]3062-men , and degraded lives of [women]3061-women ; far fewer unholy marriages , and desolated , dreary , [homeless homes]848-homeless homes . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , having cleared away [her]94-elizabeth tea - things , stood listening to the voices in [the parlor]313-the parlor , and pondering . [She]94-elizabeth had sometimes wondered in [her]94-elizabeth own mind that [no knight]850-no knight ever came to carry off [[her]94-elizabeth charming princess]851-her charming princess — [her]94-elizabeth admired and beloved [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , on [her]91-hilary part , seemed totally indifferent to [the youths at [Stowbury]2-stowbury]852-the youths at stowbury ; who indeed were , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth allowed , quite unworthy [her]94-elizabeth regard . [The only suitable lover for [[her]94-elizabeth young mistress]3353-her young mistress]853-the only suitable lover for her young mistress must be [somebody exceedingly grand and noble]855-somebody exceedingly grand and noble — [a compound of [the best heroes of [Shakespeare]135-shakespeare]857-the best heroes of shakespeare]856-a compound of the best heroes of shakespeare , [Scott]133-scott , [Fenimore Cooper]136-fenimore cooper , [Maria Edgeworth]137-maria edgeworth , and [Harriet Martineau]138-harriet martineau . When [this strange gentleman]858-this strange gentleman appeared — in ordinary coat and hat , or rather Glengary bonnet , neither particularly handsome nor particularly tall , yet whose coming had evidently given [Miss Hilary]91-hilary so much pleasure , and who , once or twice while waiting at tea , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth fancied [she]94-elizabeth had seen looking at [Miss Hilary]91-hilary as [nobody]357-nobody ever looked before — when [Mr. Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon appeared on the horizon , [the faithful " bower maiden]3480-the faithful " bower maiden "[3480-the faithful " bower maiden] was a good deal disappointed . [She]94-elizabeth had expected something better ; at all events , something different . [[Her]94-elizabeth first brilliant castle in the air]860-her first brilliant castle in the air fell , [poor lass]861-poor lass ! but [she]94-elizabeth quickly built [it]860-her first brilliant castle in the air up again , and , with the vivid imagination of [her]94-elizabeth age , [she]94-elizabeth mapped out the whole future , ending by a vision of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , all in white , sweeping down [the Terrace]793-the terrace in [a carriage]863-a carriage and pair — to fortune and happiness ; leaving [herself]94-elizabeth , though with a sore want at [her]94-elizabeth heart , and a great longing to follow , to devote the remainder of [her]94-elizabeth natural life to [Miss Johanna]93-johanna . " [Her]94-elizabeth couldna do without [somebody]3240-somebody to see to [her]94-elizabeth — and [Miss Selina]92-selina do worrit [her]94-elizabeth so . "[94-elizabeth] muttered [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , in the excitement of this Almaschar vision , relapsing into [her]94-elizabeth old provincialisms . " So , even if [Miss Hilary]91-hilary axes [me]94-elizabeth to come , [I]94-elizabeth 'll stop , [I]94-elizabeth reckon . Ay , [I]94-elizabeth 'll stop wi ' [Miss Leaf]91-hilary . "[94-elizabeth] This valorous determination taken , [the poor maid servant]864-the poor maid servant 's dream was broken by the opening of the parlor door , and an outcry of [Ascott]97-ascott 's for [his]97-ascott coat and gloves , [he]97-ascott having to fetch [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts [home]3045-home at nine o'clock , [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon accompanying [him]97-ascott . And as [they]867-they all stood together at the front door , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth overheard [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon say something about what a beautiful night it was . " It would do [you]91-hilary no harm , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary ; will [you]91-hilary walk with [us]867-they ? "[98-robert lyon] " If [you]91-hilary like . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary went up [stairs]3048-stairs for [her]91-hilary bonnet and shawl ; but when , a minute or two after , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth followed [her]91-hilary with a candle , [she]94-elizabeth found [her]91-hilary standing in the centre of [the room]3244-the room , all in the dark , [her]91-hilary face white and [her]91-hilary hands trembling . " Thank [you]94-elizabeth , thank [you]94-elizabeth ! " Some'at 's wrong . [I]3351-the young servant 'd like to know who 's been a - vexin ' of [her]91-hilary , "[3351-the young servant] thought fiercely [the young servant]3351-the young servant . No , [nobody]357-nobody had been " a - vexing "[431-her mistress] [[her]3351-the young servant mistress]431-her mistress . There was [nobody]357-nobody to blame ; only there had happened to [Hilary]91-hilary one of those things which strike like a sword through a young and happy heart , taking all the life and youth out of it . [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had , half an hour ago , told [her]94-elizabeth — and [she]94-elizabeth had had to hear it as a piece of simple news , to which [she]94-elizabeth had only to say , " Indeed!"—that[94-elizabeth] to day and to - morrow were [his]98-robert lyon two last days at [Stowbury]2-stowbury — almost [his]98-robert lyon last in [England]9-england . Within a week [he]98-robert lyon was to sail for [India]11-india . There had befallen [him]98-robert lyon what [most people]875-most people would have considered a piece of rare good fortune . At [the London University]876-the london university , [a fellow student , whom [he]98-robert lyon had been gratuitously " coaching "[98-robert lyon] in [Hindostanee]12-hindostanee]877-a fellow student , whom he had been gratuitously " coaching " in hindostanee , fell ill , and was " thrown upon [his]98-robert lyon hands . "[98-robert lyon] as [he]98-robert lyon briefly defined services which must have been great , since they had resulted in this end . [[The young man]3100-the young man 's father]879-the young man 's father — [a Liverpool and Bombay merchant]880-a liverpool and bombay merchant — made [him]98-robert lyon an offer to go out there , to [[their]881-their house]3346-their house , at a rising salary of 300 rupees a month for three years ; after the third year to become [a junior partner]883-a junior partner ; remaining at [Bombay]13-bombay in that capacity for two years more . This [he]98-robert lyon told to [Hilary]91-hilary and [Ascott]97-ascott in almost as few words as [I]0-i have here put it — for brevity seemed a refuge to [him]98-robert lyon . It was also to one of [them]881-their . But [Ascott]97-ascott asked so many questions that [[his]97-ascott aunt]428-his aunt needed to ask none . [She]428-his aunt only listened , and tried to take all in , and understand it , that is , in a consecutive , intelligent , business shape , without feeling it . [She]428-his aunt dared not let [herself]428-his aunt feel it , not for a second , till [they]885-they were out , arm - in - arm , under the quiet winter stars . Then [she]428-his aunt heard [his]97-ascott voice asking [her]428-his aunt , " So [you]428-his aunt think [I]97-ascott was right ? "[97-ascott] " Right ? "[428-his aunt] [she]428-his aunt echoed mechanically . " [I]428-his aunt mean in accepting that sudden chance , and changing [my]428-his aunt whole plan of life . [I]428-his aunt did not do it — believe [me]428-his aunt — without a motive . "[428-his aunt] " What motive ? "[428-his aunt] [she]428-his aunt would once unhesitatingly have asked ; now [she]428-his aunt could not . [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon continued speaking , distinctly and yet in an undertone , that though [Ascott]97-ascott was walking a few yards off , [Hilary]91-hilary felt was meant for [her]428-his aunt alone to hear . " The change is , [you]428-his aunt perceive , from the life of [a student]3482-a student to that of [a man of business]3483-a man of business . [I]98-robert lyon do not deny that [I]98-robert lyon preferred the first . Once upon a time to be [a fellow in [a college]3485-a college]3484-a fellow in a college , or [a professor]3486-a professor , or [the like]3487-the like , was [my]98-robert lyon utmost aim and [I]98-robert lyon would have half killed [myself]98-robert lyon to attain it . Now , [I]98-robert lyon think differently . "[98-robert lyon] [He]98-robert lyon paused , but did not seem to require an answer , and it did not come . " [I]98-robert lyon want , not to be rich but to get a decent competence , and to get it as soon as [I]98-robert lyon can . [I]98-robert lyon want not to ruin [my]98-robert lyon health with incessant study . [I]98-robert lyon have already injured it a good deal . "[98-robert lyon] " Have [you]98-robert lyon been ill ? [You]98-robert lyon never said so . "[91-hilary] " Oh no , it was hardly worth while . And [I]98-robert lyon knew an active life would soon set [me]98-robert lyon right again . No fear ! there 's life in the old dog yet . [He]98-robert lyon does not wish to die . But , "[98-robert lyon] [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon pursued , " [I]98-robert lyon have had a ' sair fecht ' the last year or two . [I]98-robert lyon would not go through it again , nor see [any one dear to [me]98-robert lyon]3488-any one dear to me go through it . It is over , but it has left its scars . Strange ! [I]98-robert lyon have been poor all [my]98-robert lyon life , yet [I]98-robert lyon never till now felt an actual terror of poverty . "[98-robert lyon] [Hilary]91-hilary shrank within [herself]91-hilary ; less even at the words than at something in [their]886-their tone — something hard , nay fierce ; something at once despairing and aggressive . " It is strange , "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary said ; " such a terror is not like [you]98-robert lyon . [I]91-hilary feel none ; [I]91-hilary can not even understand it . "[91-hilary] " No , [I]98-robert lyon knew [you]91-hilary could not , "[98-robert lyon] [he]98-robert lyon muttered ; and was silent . So was [Hilary]91-hilary . A vague trouble came over [her]91-hilary . Could it be that [he]98-robert lyon , [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , had been seized with the auri sacra fames , which [he]98-robert lyon had so often inveighed against and despised ? that [his]98-robert lyon long battle with poverty had caused in [him]98-robert lyon such an overweening desire for riches that , to obtain them , [he]98-robert lyon would sacrifice every thing else , exile [himself]98-robert lyon to [a far country]887-a far country for years , selling [his]98-robert lyon very life and soul for gold ? Such a thought of [him]98-robert lyon was so terrible — that is , would have been were it tenable — that [Hilary]91-hilary for an instant felt [herself]91-hilary shiver all over . The next [she]91-hilary spoke out — in justice to [him]98-robert lyon [she]91-hilary forced [herself]91-hilary to speak out — all [her]91-hilary honest soul . " [I]91-hilary do believe that this going abroad to make a fortune , which [young men]3489-young men so delight in , is often a most fatal mistake . [They]3489-young men give up far more than [they]3489-young men gain — [country]3490-country , [home]3045-home , health . [I]91-hilary think [a man]628-a man has no right to sell [his]628-a man life any more than [his]628-a man soul for so many thousands a year . "[91-hilary] [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon smiled—"No , and [I]91-hilary am not selling [mine]91-hilary . With [my]91-hilary temperate habits [I]91-hilary have as good a chance of health at [Bombay]13-bombay as in [London]1-london — perhaps better . And the years [I]91-hilary must be absent [I]91-hilary would have been absent almost as much from [you]3493-you — [I]91-hilary mean [they]3489-young men would have been spent in work as engrossing and as hard . [They]3489-young men will soon pass , and then [I]91-hilary shall come home rich — rich . Do [you]3493-you think [I]91-hilary am growing mercenary ? "[91-hilary] " No . "[91-hilary] " Tell [me]91-hilary what [you]3493-you do think about [me]91-hilary ? "[91-hilary] " [I]91-hilary — can not quite understand . "[91-hilary] " And [I]91-hilary can not make [you]3493-you understand . Perhaps [I]91-hilary will , some day when [I]91-hilary come back again . Till then , [you]3493-you must trust [me]91-hilary , [Hilary]91-hilary . "[91-hilary] It happens occasionally , in moments of all but tolerable pain , that some small thing , a word , a look , a touch of a hand , lets in such a gleam of peace that nothing ever extinguishes the light of it : it burns on for years and years , sometimes clear , sometimes obscured , but as ineffaceable from life and memory as a star from its place in the heavens . Such , both then , and through the lonely years to come , were those five words , " [You]3493-you must trust [me]888-she . [Hilary]91-hilary . "[888-she] [She]888-she did ; and in the perfection of that trust [her]888-she own separate identity , with all its consciousness of pain , seemed annihilated ; [she]888-she did not think of [herself]888-she at all , only of [him]889-him , and with [him]889-him , and for [him]889-him . So , for the time being , [she]888-she lost all sense of personal suffering , and [their]890-their walk that night was as cheerful and happy as if [they]890-their were to walk together for weeks and months and years , in undivided confidence and content , instead of its being the last — the very last . [Some one]891-some one has said that [all lovers]892-all lovers have , soon or late , to learn to be only [friends]893-friends : happiest and safest are [those in whom the friendship is the foundation — always firm and ready to fall back upon , long after the fascination of passion]894-those in whom the friendship is the foundation — always firm and ready to fall back upon , long after the fascination of passion dies . It may take a little from the romance of these two if [I]0-i own that [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon talked to [Hilary]91-hilary not a word about love , and a good deal about pure business , telling [her]91-hilary all [his]889-him affairs and arrangements , and giving [her]91-hilary as clear an idea of [his]889-him future life as it was possible to do within the limits of one brief half hour . Then casting a glance round , and seeing that [Ascott]97-ascott was quite out of ear - shot , [he]98-robert lyon said , with that tender fall of the voice that felt , as [some poet hath it , " Like a still embrace]3494-some poet hath it , " like a still embrace , "[98-robert lyon] " Now tell [me]98-robert lyon as much as [you]91-hilary can about [yourself]91-hilary . "[98-robert lyon] At first there seemed nothing to tell ; but gradually [he]98-robert lyon drew from [Hilary]91-hilary a good deal . [Johanna]93-johanna 's feeble health , which caused [her]93-johanna continuing to teach to be very unadvisable ; and the gradual diminishing of [the school]895-the school — from what cause [they]896-they could not account — which made it very doubtful whether some change would not soon or late be necessary . What this change should be [she]91-hilary and [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon discussed a little — as far as in the utterly indefinite position of affairs was possible . Also , from some other questions of [his]98-robert lyon , [she]91-hilary spoke to [him]98-robert lyon about another dread which had lurked in [her]91-hilary mind , and yet to which [she]91-hilary could give no tangible shape , about [Ascott]97-ascott . [He]98-robert lyon could not remove it , [he]98-robert lyon did not attempt ; but [he]98-robert lyon soothed it a little , advising with [her]91-hilary as to the best way of managing [the willful lad]897-the willful lad . [His]98-robert lyon strong , clear sense , just judgment , and , above all , a certain unspoken sense of union , as if all that concerned [her]91-hilary and [hers]91-hilary [he]98-robert lyon took naturally upon [himself]98-robert lyon as [his]98-robert lyon own , gave [Hilary]91-hilary such comfort that , even on this night , with a full consciousness of all that was to follow , [she]91-hilary was happy — nay , [she]91-hilary had not been so happy for years . Perhaps ( let the truth be told ) , the glorious truth of true love , that its recognition , spoken or silent , constitutes the only perfect joy of life that of two made perhaps [she]91-hilary had never been so really happy since [she]91-hilary was born . The last thing [he]98-robert lyon did was to make [her]91-hilary give [him]98-robert lyon an assurance that in any and all difficulty [she]91-hilary would apply to [him]98-robert lyon . " To [me]91-hilary , and to [no one else]3495-no one else , remember . [No one]3371-no one but [myself]91-hilary must help [you]91-hilary . And [I]91-hilary will , so , long as [I]91-hilary am alive . Do [you]98-robert lyon believe this ? "[91-hilary] [She]91-hilary looked up at [him]98-robert lyon by the lamp light , and said , " [I]91-hilary do . "[91-hilary] " And [you]98-robert lyon promise ? "[91-hilary] " Yes . "[91-hilary] Then [they]898-they loosed arms , and [Hilary]91-hilary knew that [they]898-they should never walk together again till — when and how ? Returning , of course , [he]98-robert lyon walked with [Miss Leaf]91-hilary ; and throughout the next day , a terribly wet Sunday , spent by [them]898-they entirely in [the little parlor]520-the little parlor , [they]898-they had not a minute of special or private talk together . [He]98-robert lyon did not seem to wish it ; indeed , almost avoided it . Thus slipped away the strange , still day — a Sunday never to be forgotten . At night , after prayers were , over , [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon rose suddenly , saying [he]98-robert lyon must leave [them]898-they now ; [he]98-robert lyon was obliged to start from [Stowbury]2-stowbury at daybreak . " Shall [we]898-they not see [you]98-robert lyon again ? "[93-johanna] asked [Johanna]93-johanna . " No . This will be [my]93-johanna last Sunday in [England]9-england . Good - by ! "[93-johanna] [He]98-robert lyon turned excessively pale , shook hands silently with [them]898-they all — [Hilary]91-hilary last — and almost before [they]898-they recognized the fact , [he]98-robert lyon was gone . With [him]98-robert lyon departed , not all [Hilary]91-hilary 's peace or faith or courage of heart , for to all who love truly , while the best beloved lives , and lives worthily , no parting is hopeless and no grief overwhelming ; but all the brightness of [her]91-hilary youth , all the sense of joy that [young people]900-young people have in loving , and in being beloved again , in fond meetings and fonder partings , in endless walks and talks , in sweet kisses and clinging arms . Such happiness was not for [her]91-hilary : when [she]91-hilary saw it the lot of [others]525-others , [she]91-hilary said to [herself]91-hilary sometimes with a natural sharp sting of pain , but oftener with a solemn acquiescence , " It is the will of [God]105-god ; it is the will of [God]105-god . "[91-hilary] [Johanna]93-johanna , too , who would have given [her]93-johanna life almost to bring some color back to the white face of [[her]93-johanna darling]412-her darling , of whom [she]93-johanna asked no questions , and [who never complained nor confessed any thing , many and many a night]903-who never complained nor confessed any thing , many and many a night when [Hilary]91-hilary either lay awake by [her]93-johanna side , or tossed and moaned in [her]91-hilary sleep , till [the elder sister]3213-the elder sister took [her]91-hilary in [her]3213-the elder sister arms like [a baby]598-a baby — [Johanna]93-johanna , too , said to [herself]93-johanna , " This is the will of [God]105-god . "[93-johanna] [I]0-i have told thus much in detail the brief sad story of [Hilary]91-hilary 's youth , to show how impossible it was that [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth could live in [the house]344-the house with [these two women]907-these two women without being strongly influenced by [them]907-these two women , as [every person]908-every person — especially [every woman]909-every woman — influences for good or for evil [every other person connected with [her]909-every woman]910-every other person connected with her , or dependent upon [her]909-every woman . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was [a girl of close observation and keen perception]911-a girl of close observation and keen perception . Besides , to [most people]875-most people , whether or not [their]875-most people sympathy be universal , so far as [the individual]913-the individual is concerned , any deep affection generally lends eyes , tact , and delicacy . Thus when on the Monday morning at breakfast [Miss Selina]92-selina observed , " What a fine day [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon was having for [his]98-robert lyon journey ; what [a lucky fellow]3497-a lucky fellow [he]98-robert lyon was ; how [he]98-robert lyon would be sure to make a fortune , and if so , [she]92-selina wondered whether [they]3498-they should ever see or hear any thing of [him]98-robert lyon again"—Elizabeth[92-selina] , from the glimpse [she]92-selina caught of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's face , and from the quiet way in which [Miss Leaf]91-hilary merely answered , " Time will show ; "[91-hilary] and began talking to [Selina]92-selina about some other subject — [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth resolved never in any way to make the smallest allusion to [Mr. Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . Something had happened , [she]94-elizabeth did not know what ; and it was not [her]94-elizabeth business to find out ; the family affairs , so far as [she]94-elizabeth was trusted with [them]914-them , were warmly [her]94-elizabeth own , but into the family secrets [she]94-elizabeth had no right to pry . Yet , long after [Miss Selina]92-selina had ceased to " wonder "[98-robert lyon] about [him]98-robert lyon , or even to name [him]98-robert lyon — [his]98-robert lyon presence or absence did not touch [her]92-selina personally , and [she]92-selina was always the centre of [her]92-selina own small world of interest — [the little maidservant]915-the little maidservant kept in [her]92-selina mind , and pondered over at odd times every possible solution of the mystery of [this gentleman]916-this gentleman 's sudden visit ; of the long wet Sunday when [he]98-robert lyon sat all day talking with [[her]92-selina mistresses]429-her mistresses in [the parlor]313-the parlor ; of the evening prayer , when [Miss Leaf]92-selina had twice to stop , [her]92-selina voice faltered so ; and of the night when , long after [all the others]919-all the others had gone to bed , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , coming suddenly into [the parlor]313-the parlor , had found [Miss Hilary]91-hilary sitting alone over the embers of the fire , with the saddest , saddest look ! so that [the girl]307-the girl had softly shut the door again without ever speaking to " [Missis]134-missis . "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth did more ; which , strange as it may appear , [a servant who is supposed to know nothing of any thing that has happened]922-a servant who is supposed to know nothing of any thing that has happened can often do better than [a member of [the family who knows every thing]924-the family who knows every thing]923-a member of the family who knows every thing , and this knowledge is sometimes the most irritating consciousness [a sufferer]925-a sufferer has . [She]94-elizabeth followed [[her]94-elizabeth young mistress]3353-her young mistress with a steady watchfulness , so quiet and silent that [Hilary]91-hilary never found it out ; saved [her]94-elizabeth every little household care , gave [her]94-elizabeth every little household treat . Not much to do , and less to be chronicled ; but the way in which [she]94-elizabeth did it was all . During the long dull winter days , to come in and find [the parlor]313-the parlor fire always bright , the hearth clean swept , and [the room]3244-the room tidy ; never to enter [the kitchen]253-the kitchen without [the servant]276-the servant 's face clearing up into a smile ; when [her]94-elizabeth restless irritability made [her]94-elizabeth forget things and grow quite vexed in the search after them , to see that somehow [her]94-elizabeth shoes were never misplaced , and [her]94-elizabeth gloves always came to hand in some mysterious manner — these trifles ; in [her]94-elizabeth first heavy days of darkness , soothed [Hilary]91-hilary more than words could tell . And the sight of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary going about [the house]344-the house and [school room]932-school room as usual , with that poor white face of [hers]91-hilary ; nay , gradually bringing to the family fireside , as usual , [her]91-hilary harmless little joke , and [her]91-hilary merry laugh at it and [herself]91-hilary — who shall say what lessons may not have been taught by this to [the humble servant]933-the humble servant , dropping deep sown into [her]91-hilary heart , to germinate and fructify , as [her]91-hilary future life 's needs required ? It might have been so — God knows ! [He]934-his alone can know , who , through what ( to [us]935-us ) seem the infinite littleness of [our]935-us mortal existence , is educating [us]935-us into the infinite greatness of [His]934-his and [our]935-us immortality . Autumn soon lapsed into winter : [Christmas]140-christmas came and went , bringing , not [Ascott]97-ascott , as [they]936-they hoped and [he]934-his had promised , but a very serious evil in the shape of sundry bills of [his]934-his , which , [he]934-his confessed in a most piteous letter to [[his]934-his Aunt]428-his aunt [Hilary]91-hilary , were absolutely unpayable out of [[his]934-his godfather]424-his godfather 's allowance . [They]939-they were not large — or would not have seemed so to [rich people]940-rich people — and [they]939-they were for no more blamable luxuries than horse hire , and a dinner or two to [friends]893-friends out in [the country]942-the country ; but [they]939-they looked serious to a household which rarely was more than five pounds beforehand with [the world]248-the world . [He]934-his had begged [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary to keep [his]934-his secret , but that was evidently impossible ; so on the day the school accounts were being written out and sent in , and their amount anxiously reckoned , [she]101-hilary laid before [[her]101-hilary sisters]302-her sisters [the lad]422-the lad 's letter , full of penitence and promises : " [I]101-hilary will be careful — [I]101-hilary will indeed — if [you]101-hilary will help [me]101-hilary out this once , [dear Aunt Hilary]101-hilary ; and do n't think too ill of [me]101-hilary . [I]101-hilary have done nothing wicked . And [you]101-hilary do n't know [London]1-london ; [you]101-hilary do n't know , with a lot of [young fellows about one]3499-young fellows about one , how very hard it is to say no . "[101-hilary] At that unlucky postscript [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf sorrowfully exchanged looks . [Little the lad]946-little the lad thought about it ; but these few words were the very sharpest pang [Ascott]97-ascott had ever given to [[his]422-the lad aunts]3135-his aunts . " What 's bred in the bone will come out in the flesh . "[97-ascott] " Like [father]3500-father like [son]3501-son . "[948-a just god] " The sins of [the parents]3502-the parents shall be visited on [the children]3181-the children . "[97-ascott] So runs many a proverb : so confirms the unerring decree of [a just God]948-a just god , who would not be [a just God]948-a just god did [He]948-a just god allow [Himself]948-a just god to break [His]948-a just god own righteous laws for [the government of [the universe]951-the universe]950-the government of the universe ; did [He]948-a just god falsify the requirements of [His]948-a just god own holy and pure being , by permitting any other wages for sin than death . And though , through [His]948-a just god mercy , sin forsaken escapes sin 's penalty , and [every human being]3126-every human being has it in [his]3126-every human being own power to modify , if not to conquer , any hereditary moral as well as physical disease , thereby avoiding the doom and alleviating the curse , still the original law remains in force , and ought to remain , an example and a warning . As true as that every individual sin that [a man]628-a man commits breeds multitudes more , is it that [every individual sin]954-every individual sin may transmit [his]954-every individual sin own peculiar type of weakness or wickedness to [a whole race]955-a whole race , disappearing in one generation , re - appearing in another , exactly the same as physical peculiarities do , requiring the utmost caution of education to counteract the terrible tendencies of nature — the " something in the blood "[954-every individual sin] which is so difficult to eradicate : which may even make [the third and fourth generation]956-the third and fourth generation execrate the memory of [him]957-him or [her]958-her who was its origin . The long life - curse of [Henry Leaf]97-ascott [the elder]959-the elder , and [Henry Leaf the younger]97-ascott , had been — [the women of [the family]258-the family]960-the women of the family well knew — that [they]962-they were men who " could n't say No . "[97-ascott] So keenly were [the three sisters]247-the three sisters alive to this fault — it could hardly be called a crime , and yet in its consequences it was so — so sickening the terror of it which [their]247-the three sisters own wretched experience had implanted in [their]247-the three sisters minds , that during [Ascott]97-ascott 's childhood and youth [his]97-ascott very fractiousness and roughness , [his]97-ascott little selfishness , and [his]97-ascott persistence in [his]97-ascott own will against [theirs]247-the three sisters , had been hailed by [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts as a good omen that [he]97-ascott would grow up " so unlike [[his]97-ascott poor father]3504-his poor father . "[965-the two unhappy henry leafs] If [the two unhappy Henry Leafs]965-the two unhappy henry leafs — [father]3500-father and [son]3501-son — could have come out of [their]965-the two unhappy henry leafs graves that night and beheld [these three women]3139-these three women , [daughters]969-daughters and [sisters]3046-sisters , sitting with [Ascott]97-ascott 's letter on the table , planning how [the household]277-the household 's small expenses could be contracted , its still smaller luxuries relinquished , in order that [the boy]375-the boy might honorably pay for pleasures [he]375-the boy might so easily have done without ! If [they]965-the two unhappy henry leafs could have seen the weight of apprehension which then sank like a stone on these long - tried hearts , never to be afterward removed : lightened sometimes , but always — however [Ascott]97-ascott might promise and amend — always there ! On such a discovery , surely , [these two " poor ghosts "]3505-these two " poor ghosts "[97-ascott] would have fled away moaning , wishing [they]965-the two unhappy henry leafs had died childless , or that during [their]965-the two unhappy henry leafs mortal lives any amount of self restraint and self compulsion had purged from [their]965-the two unhappy henry leafs natures the accursed thing ; the sin which had worked itself out in sorrow upon [every one belonging to [them]965-the two unhappy henry leafs]973-every one belonging to them , years after [their]965-the two unhappy henry leafs own heads were laid in the quiet dust . " [We]3506-we must do it , "[92-selina] was the conclusion the Misses [Leaf]97-ascott unanimously came to ; even [Selina]92-selina ; who with all [her]92-selina faults , had a fair share of good feeling and of that close clinging to kindred which is found in [fallen households]974-fallen households , or households whom the sacred bond of common poverty , has drawn together in a way that [large , well - to - do home circles]975-large , well - to - do home circles can never quite understand . " [We]3506-we must not let [the boy]375-the boy remain in debt ; it would be such a disgrace to [the family]258-the family . "[93-johanna] " It is not the remaining in debt , but the incurring of it , which is the real disgrace to [Ascott]97-ascott and [the family]258-the family . "[93-johanna] " Hush [Hilary]101-hilary , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna , pointing to the opening door ; but it was too late .
