[Her]94-elizabeth conscious face showed it ; more especially the bright scarlet which covered both [her]94-elizabeth cheeks when [Miss Leaf]92-selina said " Hush ! "[92-selina] [She]94-elizabeth stood , apparently irresolute as to whether [she]94-elizabeth should run away again ; and then [her]94-elizabeth native honesty got the upper hand , and [she]94-elizabeth advanced into [the room]3244-the room . " If [you]101-hilary please , [missis]652-missis , [I]94-elizabeth did n't mean to — but [I]94-elizabeth 've heard — "[94-elizabeth] " What have [you]94-elizabeth heard ; that is , how much ? "[94-elizabeth] " Just what [Miss Hilary]91-hilary said . Do n't be afeared . [I]94-elizabeth sha n't tell . [I]94-elizabeth never chatter about [the family]258-the family . [Mother]141-mother told [me]94-elizabeth not . "[94-elizabeth] " [You]94-elizabeth owe a great deal , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , to [[your]94-elizabeth good mother]3512-your good mother . Now go away . "[94-elizabeth] " And another time . "[92-selina] said [Miss Selina]92-selina , " knock at the door . "[92-selina] This was [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's first initiation into what [many a servant]978-many a servant has to share — the secret burden of [the family]258-the family . After that day , though [they]978-many a servant did not actually confide in [her]94-elizabeth , [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses used no effort to conceal that [they]429-her mistresses had cares ; that the domestic economies must , this winter , be especially studied ; there must be no extra fires , no candles left burning to waste ; and once a week or so , a few butterless breakfasts or meatless dinners must be partaken of cheerfully , in both [parlor]364-parlor and [kitchen]363-kitchen . [The Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf never stinted [[their]89-the misses leaf servant]983-their servant in any thing in which [they]89-the misses leaf did not stint [themselves]89-the misses leaf . Strange to say , in spite of [Miss Selina]92-selina 's prophecies , [the girl]307-the girl 's respectful conduct did not abate : on the contrary , it seemed to increase . The nearer [she]94-elizabeth was lifted to [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's level , the more [her]94-elizabeth mind grew , so that [she]94-elizabeth could better understand [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses cares , and the deeper [her]94-elizabeth consciousness of the only thing which gives [one human being]987-one human being any real authority over another — personal character . Therefore , though the family means were narrowed , and [the family]258-the family luxuries few , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth cheerfully put up with all ; [she]94-elizabeth even felt a sort of pride in wasting nothing and in making the best of every thing , as [the others]989-the others did . Perhaps , it may be said [she]94-elizabeth was [an exceptional servant]990-an exceptional servant ; and yet [I]0-i would not do [her]94-elizabeth class the wrong to believe so - [I]0-i would rather believe that there are [many such among it]991-many such among it ; [many good , honest , faithful girls , who only need [good mistresses unto whom to be honest and faithful]993-good mistresses unto whom to be honest and faithful , and [they]992-many good , honest , faithful girls , who only need good mistresses unto whom to be honest and faithful , and they would be no less so than elizabeth hand would be no less so than [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth]992-many good , honest , faithful girls , who only need good mistresses unto whom to be honest and faithful , and they would be no less so than elizabeth hand . The months went by — heavy and anxious months ; for [the school]895-the school gradually dwindled away , and [Ascott]97-ascott 's letter — now almost the only connection [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts had with [the outer world]996-the outer world , for poverty necessarily diminished even [[their]3135-his aunts small Stowbury society]997-their small stowbury society — became more and more unsatisfactory ; and the want of information in [them]3135-his aunts was not supplied by those other letters which had once kept [Johanna]93-johanna 's heart easy concerning [the boy]375-the boy . [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon had written once before sailing , nay , after sailing , for [he]98-robert lyon had sent it [home]3045-home by [the pilot from [the English Channel]14-the english channel]1000-the pilot from the english channel ; then there was , of course , silence . October , November , December , January , February , March — how often did [Hilary]101-hilary count the months , and wonder how soon a letter would come , whether a letter ever would come again . And sometimes — the sharp present stinging [her]101-hilary with its small daily pains , the future looking dark before [her]101-hilary and [them]1001-them all — [she]101-hilary felt so forlorn , so forsaken , that but for a certain tiny well - spring of hope , which rarely dries up till long after three - and twenty , [she]101-hilary could have sat down and sighed , " [My]101-hilary good days are done . "[101-hilary] [Rich people]940-rich people break [their]940-rich people hearts much sooner than [poor people]1003-poor people ; that is , [they]940-rich people more easily get into that morbid state which is glorified by the term , " a broken heart . "[1003-poor people] [Poor people]1003-poor people can not afford it . [Their]1003-poor people constant labor " physics pain . "[101-hilary] [Their]1003-poor people few and narrow pleasures seldom pall . Holy poverty ! black as its dark side is , it has its bright side too , that is , when it is honest , fearless , free from selfishness . wastefulness , and bickerings ; above all , free from the terror of debt . " [We]3513-we 'll starve , [we]3513-we 'll go into [the work house]3514-the work house rather than [we]3513-we 'll go into debt ! "[101-hilary] cried [Hilary]101-hilary once , in a passion of tears , when [she]101-hilary was in sore want of a shawl , and [Selina]92-selina urged [her]101-hilary to get it , and wait till [she]101-hilary could pay for it . " Yes ; [the work house]3514-the work house ! It would be less shame to be honorably indebted to the laws of [the land]3516-the land than to be meanly indebted , under false pretences , to [any individual in]3517-any individual in [it]3514-the work house "[92-selina] . And when , in payment for some accidental lessons , [she]101-hilary got next month enough money to buy a shawl , and a bonnet , too — nay , by great ingenuity , another bonnet for [Johanna]93-johanna — [Hilary]101-hilary could have danced and sang — sang , in the gladness and relief of [her]93-johanna heart , the glorious euthanasia of poverty . But these things happened only occasionally ; the daily life was hard still ; ay , very hard , even though at last came the letter from " foreign parts ; "[98-robert lyon] and following it , at regular intervals , other letters . They were full of facts rather than feelings — simple , straightforward ; worth little as literary compositions ; [school - master and [learned man]1006-learned man as [he]1005-school - master and learned man as he was was]1005-school - master and learned man as he was , there was nothing literary or poetical about [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon ; but what [he]1005-school - master and learned man as he was wrote was like what [he]1005-school - master and learned man as he was spoke , the accurate reflection of [his]1005-school - master and learned man as he was own clear , original mind and honest , tender heart . [His]1005-school - master and learned man as he was letters gave none the less comfort because , nominally , they were addressed to [Johanna]93-johanna . This might have been from some crotchet of over - reserve , delicacy , or honor — the same which made [him]1005-school - master and learned man as he was part from [her]93-johanna for years with no other word than ' [You]1007-you must trust [me]0-i , [Hilary]101-hilary ; ' but whatever it was [she]93-johanna respected it , and [she]93-johanna did trust [him]1005-school - master and learned man as he was . And whether [Johanna]93-johanna answered [his]1005-school - master and learned man as he was letters or not , month by month they unfailingly came , keeping [her]93-johanna completely informed of all [his]1005-school - master and learned man as he was proceedings , and letting out , as epistles written from over [the seas]1008-the seas often do , much more of [himself]1005-school - master and learned man as he was and [his]1005-school - master and learned man as he was character than [he]1005-school - master and learned man as he was was probably aware that [he]1005-school - master and learned man as he was betrayed . And [Hilary]101-hilary , whose sole experience of mankind had been [the scarcely remembered father]1009-the scarcely remembered father , [the too well remembered brother]1010-the too well remembered brother , and [the anxiously watched nephew]1011-the anxiously watched nephew , thanked [God]105-god that there seemed to be [one man in [the world]248-the world whom [a woman]669-a woman could lean [her]669-a woman heart upon , and not feel the support break like a reed beneath [her]669-a woman]1012-one man in the world whom a woman could lean her heart upon , and not feel the support break like a reed beneath her — [one man whom [she]669-a woman could entirely believe in , and safely and sacredly trust]1015-one man whom she could entirely believe in , and safely and sacredly trust . Time slipped by . [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had been away more than three years . But in the monotonous life of [the three sisters]247-the three sisters at [Stowbury]2-stowbury , nothing was changed . Except , perhaps , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , who had grown quite [a woman]669-a woman ; might have passed almost for thirty ; so solidly old fashioned were [her]94-elizabeth figure and [her]94-elizabeth manners . [Ascott Leaf]99-ascott had finished [his]98-robert lyon walking [the hospitals]1018-the hospitals and [his]98-robert lyon examinations , and was now fitted to commence practice for [himself]98-robert lyon . [[His]98-robert lyon godfather]424-his godfather had still continued [his]98-robert lyon allowance , though once or twice , when [he]98-robert lyon came down to [Stowbury]2-stowbury , [he]98-robert lyon had asked [[his]98-robert lyon aunts]3135-his aunts to help [him]98-robert lyon in small debts the last time in one a little more serious ; when , after some sad and sore consultation , it had been resolved to tell [him]98-robert lyon [he]98-robert lyon must contrive to live within [his]98-robert lyon own allowance . For [they]1021-they were poorer than [they]1021-they used to be ; many more schools had arisen in [the town]3034-the town , and theirs had dwindled away . It was becoming a source of serious anxiety whether [they]1021-they could possibly make ends meet ; and when , the next Christmas , [Ascott]99-ascott sent [them]1021-they a five pound note — an actual five pound note , together with a fond , grateful letter that was worth it all — [the aunts]3153-the aunts were deeply thankful , and very happy . But still [the school]895-the school declined . One night [they]1021-they were speculating upon the causes of this , and [Hilary]101-hilary was declaring , in a half jocular , half earnest way , that it must be because [a prophet]1025-a prophet is never [a prophet in [[his]1025-a prophet own country]1027-his own country]1026-a prophet in his own country . " [The Stowbury people]3518-the stowbury people will never believe how clever [I]101-hilary am . Only , it is a useless sort of cleverness , [I]101-hilary fear . Greek , Latin , and mathematics are no good to [infants under seven]3519-infants under seven , such as [Stowbury]2-stowbury persists in sending to [us]1021-they . "[101-hilary] " [They]3518-the stowbury people think [I]92-selina am only fit to teach [little children]3520-little children — and perhaps it is true , "[92-selina] said [Miss Leaf]92-selina . " [I]92-selina wish [you]3521-you had not to teach at all . [I]92-selina wish [I]92-selina was [a daily governess]3522-a daily governess — [I]92-selina might be , and earn enough to keep [the whole family]415-the whole family ; only , not [here]389-here . "[92-selina] " [I]93-johanna wonder , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna , thoughtfully , " if [we]1021-they shall have to make a change . "[93-johanna] " A change ! "[92-selina] It almost pained [the elder sister]3213-the elder sister to see how [the younger]1029-the younger brightened up at the word . " Where to — [London]1-london ? Oh , [I]1029-the younger have so longed to go and live in [London]1-london ! But [I]1029-the younger thought [you]93-johanna would not like it , [Johanna]93-johanna . "[1029-the younger] That was true . [Miss Leaf]92-selina , whom feeble health had made [prematurely]1030-prematurely old , would willingly have ended [her]92-selina days in [the familiar town]1031-the familiar town ; but [Hilary]101-hilary was young and strong . [Johanna]93-johanna called to mind the days when [she]93-johanna too had felt that rest was only another name for dullness ; and when the most difficult thing possible to [her]93-johanna was what seemed now so easy — to sit down and endure . Besides , unlike [herself]93-johanna , [Hilary]101-hilary had [her]101-hilary life all before [her]101-hilary . It might be a happy life , safe in [a good man]417-a good man 's tender keeping ; those unfailing letters from [India]11-india seemed to prophecy that it would . But [no one]3371-no one could say . [Miss Leaf]92-selina 's own experience had not led [her]92-selina to place much faith in either [men]3062-men or happiness . Still , whatever [Hilary]101-hilary 's future might be , it would likely be a very different one from that quiet , colorless life of [hers]92-selina . And as [she]93-johanna looked at [[her]93-johanna younger sister]1035-her younger sister , with the twilight glow on [her]1035-her younger sister face — [they]1036-they were taking an evening stroll up and down [the terrace]793-the terrace — [Johanna]93-johanna hoped and prayed it might be so . [[Her]93-johanna own lot]1038-her own lot seemed easy enough for [herself]93-johanna ; but for [Hilary]101-hilary — [she]93-johanna would like to see [Hilary]101-hilary something better than [a poor schoolmistress at [Stowbury]2-stowbury]1039-a poor schoolmistress at stowbury . No more was said at that time , but [Johanna]93-johanna had the deep , still , [Mary]143-mary - like nature , which " kept "[143-mary] things , and " pondered them in [her]93-johanna heart . "[143-mary] So that when the subject came up again [she]93-johanna was able to meet it with that sweet calmness which was [her]93-johanna especial characteristic — the unruffled peace of a soul which no worldly storms could disturb overmuch , for it had long since cast anchor in [the world]248-the world unseen . The chance which revived the question of [the Great Metropolitan Hegira]144-the great metropolitan hegira , as [Hilary]101-hilary called it , was a letter from [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , as follows : " [MISS LEAF]92-selina . [MADAM,—I]3525-madam,—i shall be obliged by [your]97-ascott informing [me]97-ascott if it is [your]97-ascott wish , as it seems to be [[your]97-ascott nephew]3526-your nephew 's , that instead of returning to [Stowbury]2-stowbury , [he]3526-your nephew should settle in [London]1-london as [a surgeon and general practitioner]3527-a surgeon and general practitioner ? [His]3526-your nephew education complete , [I]97-ascott consider that [I]97-ascott have done [my]97-ascott duty by [him]3526-your nephew ; but [I]97-ascott may assist [him]3526-your nephew occasionally still , unless [he]3526-your nephew turns out — as [[his]3526-your nephew father]404-his father did before [him]3526-your nephew — [a young man who prefers being helped to helping [himself]3526-your nephew , in which case [I]97-ascott shall have nothing more to do with [him]3526-your nephew]3529-a young man who prefers being helped to helping himself , in which case i shall have nothing more to do with him . [I]97-ascott remain , [Madam]3530-madam , [[your]3530-madam obedient servant]3531-your obedient servant , [PETER ASCOTT]145-ascott . "[97-ascott] [The sisters]3383-the sisters read this letter , passing it round the table , [none of [them]3383-the sisters]1042-none of them apparently liking to be the first to comment upon it . At length [Hilary]101-hilary said : " [I]101-hilary think that reference to poor [Henry]97-ascott is perfectly brutal . "[101-hilary] " And yet [he]145-ascott was very kind to [Henry]97-ascott . And if it had not been for [his]145-ascott common sense in sending [poor little Ascott]97-ascott and [the nurse]3532-the nurse down to [Stowbury]2-stowbury [the baby]3533-the baby might have died . But [you]3530-madam do n't remember any thing of that time , [[my]93-johanna dear]3016-my dear , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna , sighing . " [He]145-ascott has been kind enough , though [he]145-ascott has done it in such a patronizing way , "[92-selina] observed [Selina]92-selina . " [I]92-selina suppose that 's the real reason of [his]145-ascott doing it . [He]145-ascott thinks it fine to patronize [us]3535-us , and show kindness to [[our]3535-us family]3536-our family ; [he]145-ascott , [the stout , bullet - headed grocer 's boy , who used to sit and stare at [us]3535-us all church time]3537-the stout , bullet - headed grocer 's boy , who used to sit and stare at us all church time . "[92-selina] " At [you]92-selina — [you]92-selina mean . Was n't [he]145-ascott called [[your]92-selina beau]3538-your beau ? "[101-hilary] said [Hilary]101-hilary mischievously , upon which [Selina]92-selina drew [herself]92-selina up in great indignation . And then [they]1043-they fell to talking of that anxious question — [Ascott]97-ascott 's future . A little [they]1043-they reproached [themselves]1043-they that [they]1043-they had left [the lad]422-the lad so long in [London]1-london — so long out of the influence that might have counteracted the evil , sharply hinted in [[his]422-the lad godfather]424-his godfather 's letter . But once away — to lure [him]422-the lad back to [[their]1043-they poor home]1046-their poor home was impossible . " Suppose [we]1043-they were to go to [him]422-the lad , "[101-hilary] suggested [Hilary]101-hilary . [The poor and friendless]1047-the poor and friendless possess one great advantage — [they]1047-the poor and friendless have [nobody]357-nobody to ask advice of ; [nobody to whom it]1049-nobody to whom it matters much what [they]1047-the poor and friendless do or where [they]1047-the poor and friendless go . [The family]258-the family mind has but to make itself up , and act accordingly . Thus within an hour or two of the receipt of [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott 's letter [Hilary]101-hilary went into [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , and told [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth that as soon as [her]94-elizabeth work was done [Miss Leaf]92-selina wished to have a little talk with [her]94-elizabeth . " Eh ! what 's wrong ? Has [Miss Selina]92-selina been a - grumbling at [me]94-elizabeth ? "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was in one of [her]94-elizabeth bad humors , which , though of course [they]1047-the poor and friendless never ought to have , [servants]1052-servants do have as well as [[their]1047-the poor and friendless superiors]1053-their superiors . [Hilary]101-hilary perceived this by the way [she]101-hilary threw the coals on and tossed the chairs about . But to - day [her]101-hilary heart was full of far more serious cares than [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's ill temper . [She]101-hilary replied , composedly — " [I]101-hilary have not heard that [either of [[my]101-hilary sisters]3540-my sisters]3539-either of my sisters is displeased with [you]94-elizabeth . What [they]3540-my sisters want to talk to [you]94-elizabeth about is for [your]94-elizabeth own good . [We]3541-we are thinking of making a great change . [We]3541-we intend to leave [Stowbury]2-stowbury and going to live in [London]1-london . "[101-hilary] " Going to live in [London]1-london ! "[101-hilary] Now , quick as [her]101-hilary tact and observation were — [her]101-hilary heart taught [her]101-hilary these things — [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's head was a thorough Saxon one , slow to receive impressions . It was [a family]1054-a family saying , that nothing was so hard as to put a new idea into [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth except to get it out again . For this reason [Hilary]101-hilary preferred paving the way quietly , before startling [her]94-elizabeth with the sudden intelligence of [their]1055-their contemplated change . " Well , what do [you]101-hilary say to the plan ? "[101-hilary] asked [she]101-hilary , good - humoredly . " [I]94-elizabeth dunnot like it at all , "[94-elizabeth] was the brief gruff answer of [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth . Now it was one of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's doctrines that [no human being]1056-no human being is good for much unless [he]1057-he or [she]1058-she has what is called " a will of one 's own . "[101-hilary] Perhaps this , like many another creed , was with [her]101-hilary the result of circumstances . But [she]101-hilary held it firmly , and with that exaggerated one - sidedness of feeling which [any bitter family]1059-any bitter family or personal experience is sure to leave behind — a strong will was [her]101-hilary first attraction to every body . It had been so in the case of [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , and not less in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's . But this quality has [its]1060-its inconveniences . When [the maid]1061-the maid began sweeping up [her]1061-the maid hearth with a noisy , angry gesture , [the mistress]3072-the mistress did the wisest and most dignified thing [a mistress]1063-a mistress could do under the circumstances and which [she]3072-the mistress knew was the sharpest rebuke [she]3072-the mistress could administer to [the sensitive Elizabeth]94-elizabeth — [she]3072-the mistress immediately quitted [the kitchen]253-the kitchen . For an hour after the parlor bell did not ring ; and though it was washing day , [no Miss Hilary]91-hilary appeared to help in folding up the clothes . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , subdued and wretched , waited till [she]94-elizabeth could wait no longer ; then knocked at the door , and asked humbly if [she]101-hilary should bring in supper ? The extreme kindness of the answer , to the effect that [she]94-elizabeth must come in , as [they]1065-we wanted to speak to [her]94-elizabeth , crushed the lingering fragments of ill humor out of [the girl]307-the girl . " [Miss Hilary]91-hilary has told [you]94-elizabeth [our]1065-we future plans , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ; now [we]1065-we wish to have a little talk with [you]94-elizabeth about [yours]94-elizabeth . "[1065-we] " Eh ? "[91-hilary] " [We]1065-we conclude [you]94-elizabeth will not wish to go with [us]1065-we to [London]1-london ; and it would be hardly advisable [you]94-elizabeth should . [You]94-elizabeth can get higher wages now than any [we]1065-we can afford to give [you]94-elizabeth ; indeed , [we]1065-we have more than once thought of telling [you]94-elizabeth so , and offering [you]94-elizabeth [your]94-elizabeth choice of trying for a better place . "[1065-we] " [You]94-elizabeth 're very kind , "[1065-we] was the answer , stolid rather than grateful . " No ; [I]91-hilary think [we]1065-we are merely honest . [We]1065-we should never think of keeping [a girl]3542-a girl upon lower wages than [she]3542-a girl was worth . Hitherto , however , the arrangement has been quite fair [you]94-elizabeth know , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , [you]94-elizabeth have given [us]1065-we a deal of trouble in the teaching of [you]94-elizabeth . "[91-hilary] And [Miss Leaf]91-hilary smiled , half sadly , as if this , the first of the coming changes , hurt [her]91-hilary more than [she]91-hilary liked to express . " Come , [[my]91-hilary girl]3543-my girl , "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary added , " [you]94-elizabeth need n't look so serious . [We]1065-we are not in the least vexed with [you]94-elizabeth ; [we]1065-we shall be very sorry to lose [you]94-elizabeth , and [we]1065-we will give [you]94-elizabeth the best of characters when [you]94-elizabeth leave . "[91-hilary] " [I]94-elizabeth dunnot — mean — to leave . "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth threw out the words like pellets , in a choked fashion , and disappeared suddenly from [the parlor]313-the parlor . " Who would have thought it ! "[92-selina] exclaimed [Selina]92-selina ; " [I]92-selina declare [the girl]307-the girl was crying . "[92-selina] No mistake about that ; though when , a few minutes after , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary entered [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth tried in a hurried , shamefaced way to hide [her]94-elizabeth tears by being very busy over something . [[Her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress took no notice , but began , as usual on washing days , to assist in various domestic matters , in the midst of which [she]431-her mistress said , quietly , " And so , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , [you]94-elizabeth would really like to go to [London]1-london ? "[431-her mistress] " No ! [I]431-her mistress should n't like it at all ; never said [I]431-her mistress should . But if [you]94-elizabeth go , [I]431-her mistress shall go too ; though [Missis]134-missis is so ready to get shut o ' [me]431-her mistress . "[431-her mistress] " It was for [your]94-elizabeth own good , [you]94-elizabeth know . "[431-her mistress] " [You]94-elizabeth always said it was for [a girl]3542-a girl 's good to stop in one place ; and if [you]94-elizabeth think [I]431-her mistress 'm going to another . [I]431-her mistress are n't that 's all . "[431-her mistress] Rude as the form of the speech was — almost the first rude speech that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had ever made to [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , and which , under other circumstances [she]94-elizabeth would have felt bound severely to reprove — [the mistress]3072-the mistress passed it over . That which lay beneath it , the sharpness of wounded love , touched [her]94-elizabeth heart . [She]94-elizabeth felt that , for all [the girl]307-the girl 's rough manner , it would have been hard to go into [[her]94-elizabeth [London]1-london kitchen]1072-her london kitchen and meet a strange [London]1-london face , instead of that fond homely one of [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth 's . Still , [she]94-elizabeth thought it right to explain to [her]94-elizabeth that [London]1-london life might have many difficulties , that ; for the present at least , [her]94-elizabeth wages could not be raised , and [the family]258-the family might at first be in even more straitened circumstances than [they]258-the family were at [Stowbury]2-stowbury . " Only at first , though , for [I]94-elizabeth hope to find [plenty of pupils]3546-plenty of pupils , and by - and - by [[our]1075-us nephew]3547-our nephew will get into practice . "[94-elizabeth] " Is it on account of [him]3547-our nephew [you]94-elizabeth 're going , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary ? "[94-elizabeth] " [Chiefly]146-chiefly . "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth gave a grunt which said as plainly as words could say , " [I]94-elizabeth thought so ; "[94-elizabeth] and relapsed into what [she]94-elizabeth , no doubt , believed to be virtuous indignation , but which , as it was testified against [the wrong parties]1074-the wrong parties , was open to the less favorable interpretation of ill humor — a small injustice not uncommon with [us]1075-us all . [I]0-i do not pretend to paint [this young woman]1076-this young woman as [a perfect character]1077-a perfect character . [She]94-elizabeth had [her]94-elizabeth fierce dislikes as well as [her]94-elizabeth strong fidelities ; [her]94-elizabeth faults within and without , which had to be struggled with , as all of [us]1075-us have to struggle to the very end of [our]1075-us days . Oftentimes not till the battle is high over — sometimes not till it is quite over — does [God]105-god give [us]1075-us the victory . Without more discussion on either side , it was agreed that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth should accompany [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses . Even [Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand seemed to be pleased thereat , [her]90-mrs. hand only doubt being lest [[her]90-mrs. hand daughter]355-her daughter should meet and be led astray by [that bad woman]1080-that bad woman , [Mrs. Cliffe]128-mrs. cliffe , [[Tommy Cliffe]132-tom 's mother]1081-tommy cliffe 's mother , who was reported to have gone to [London]1-london . But [Miss Hilary]91-hilary explained that this meeting was about as probable as the rencontre of two needles in a hay - rick ; and besides , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was not [the sort of girl to be easily " led astray "[280-the mother] by any body]1082-the sort of girl to be easily " led astray " by any body . " No , no ; [her]94-elizabeth 's [a good wench]3548-a good wench , though [I]280-the mother says it , "[280-the mother] replied [the mother]280-the mother , who was too hard worked to have much sentiment to spare . " [I]91-hilary wish [the little ' uns]3549-the little ' uns may take pattern by [[our]3550-our [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth]3551-our elizabeth . [You]91-hilary 'll send [her]94-elizabeth [home]3045-home , may be , in two or three years ' time , to let [us]3550-our have a look at [her]94-elizabeth ? "[91-hilary] [Miss Hilary]91-hilary promised , and then took [her]91-hilary way back through [the familiar old town — so soon to be familiar]1084-the familiar old town — so soon to be familiar no more — thinking anxiously , in spite of [herself]91-hilary , upon those two or three years , and what [they]1085-they might bring . It happened to be a notable day — that sunshiny 28th of June — when [the little , round - cheeked damsel]1086-the little , round - cheeked damsel , who is [a grandmother]1087-a grandmother now , had the crown of three kingdoms first set upon [her]1086-the little , round - cheeked damsel youthful head ; and [Stowbury]2-stowbury , like [[every other town]1088-every other town in [the land]3516-the land]1089-every other town in the land , was a perfect bower of green arches , garlands , banners ; white covered tables were spread in the open air down almost [every street]1091-every street , where [poor men]1092-poor men dined , or [poor women]1093-poor women drank tea ; and [every body]3430-every body was out and abroad , looking at or sharing in the holiday ' making , wild with merriment , and brimming over with passionate loyalty to [the Maiden Queen]1095-the maiden queen . That day is now twenty - four years ago ; but [all those who remember it]1096-all those who remember it must own there never has been a day like it , when , all over [the country]942-the country , [every man]1098-every man 's heart throbbed with chivalrous devotion , [every woman]909-every woman 's with womanly tenderness , toward [this one royal girl , who , [God]105-god bless [her]1100-this one royal girl , who , god bless her]1100-this one royal girl , who , god bless her ! has lived to retain and deserve it all . [Hilary]91-hilary called for , and protected through [the crowd]1101-the crowd , [the little , timid , widow lady who had taken off the Misses Leaf 's hands [[their]1103-their house]3346-their house and furniture , and whom [they]1103-their had made very happy — as [the poor]1105-the poor often can make [those still poorer than [themselves]1105-the poor]1106-those still poorer than themselves]1102-the little , timid , widow lady who had taken off the misses leaf 's hands their house and furniture , and whom they had made very happy — as the poor often can make those still poorer than themselves — by refusing to accept any thing for the " good will "[94-elizabeth] of [the school]895-the school . Then [she]1100-this one royal girl , who , god bless her was fetched by [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , who had been given a whole afternoon 's holiday ; and [mistress]278-mistress and [maid]3315-maid went together [home]3045-home , watching the last of the festivities , the chattering groups that still lingered in [the twilight streets]1111-the twilight streets , and listening to the merry notes of the " Triumph "[91-hilary] which came down through the lighted windows of [the Town Hall]1112-the town hall , where [the open - air tea drinkers]1113-the open - air tea drinkers had adjourned to dance country dances , by civic permission , and in perfectly respectable jollity . " [I]91-hilary wonder , "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary — while , despite some natural regret , [her]91-hilary spirit stretched itself out eagerly from the narrowness of the place where [she]91-hilary was born into [the great wide world]1114-the great wide world ; the world where so many grand things were thought and written and done ; [the world [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had so long fought with]1115-the world robert lyon had so long fought with , and was fighting bravely still—"I wonder , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , what sort of place [London]1-london is , and what [our]1118-they life will be in [it]1-london ? "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth said nothing . For the moment [her]91-hilary face seemed to catch the reflected glow of [[her]91-hilary mistress]431-her mistress 's , and then it settled down into that look of mingled resistance and resolution which was habitual to [her]91-hilary . For the life that was to be , which [neither]411-neither knew — oh , if [they]1118-they had known!—she also was prepared . The day of [the Grand Hegira]147-the grand hegira came . " [I]91-hilary remember , "[91-hilary] said [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , as [they]1118-they rumbled for the last time through [the empty morning streets of poor old [Stowbury]2-stowbury]1119-the empty morning streets of poor old stowbury : " [I]91-hilary remember [[my]91-hilary grandmother]3553-my grandmother telling [me]91-hilary that when [[my]91-hilary grandfather]3554-my grandfather was courting [her]3553-my grandmother , and [she]3553-my grandmother out of coquetry refused [him]3554-my grandfather , [he]3554-my grandfather set off on horseback to [London]1-london , and [she]3553-my grandmother was so wretched to think of all the dangers [he]3554-my grandfather ran on the journey , and in [London]1-london itself , that [she]3553-my grandmother never rested till [she]3553-my grandmother got [him]3554-my grandfather back , and then immediately married [him]3554-my grandfather . "[91-hilary] " No such catastrophe is likely to happen to any of [us]1120-us , except , perhaps , to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , "[91-hilary] said [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , trying to get up , a little feeble mirth , any thing to pass away the time and lessen the pain of parting , which was almost too much for [Johanna]93-johanna . " What do [you]94-elizabeth say ? Do [you]94-elizabeth mean to get married in [London]1-london , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? "[91-hilary] But [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth could make no answer , even to [kind Miss Hilary]91-hilary . [They]1120-us had not imagined [she]94-elizabeth felt the leaving [[her]94-elizabeth native place]1121-her native place so much . [She]94-elizabeth had watched intently the last glimpse of [Stowbury church tower]2-stowbury , and now sat with reddened eyes , staring blankly out of the carriage window , " Silent as a stone . "[94-elizabeth] Once or twice a large slow tear gathered on each of [her]94-elizabeth eyes , but it was shaken off angrily from the high check bones , and never settled into absolute crying . [They]1120-us thought it best to take no notice of [her]94-elizabeth . Only , when reaching [the new small station]1122-the new small station , where the " resonant steam eagles "[91-hilary] were , for the first time , beheld by [the innocent Stowbury ladies]1123-the innocent stowbury ladies , there arose a discussion as to the manner of traveling . [Miss Leaf]91-hilary said , decidedly " [Second class]3555-second class ; and then [we]1120-us can keep [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth with [us]1120-us . "[91-hilary] Upon which [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's mouth melted into something between a quiver and a smile . Soon it was all over , and [the little house - hold]1124-the little house - hold was compressed into [the humble second class carriage]1125-the humble second class carriage , cheerless and cushionless , whirling through indefinite [England]9-england in a way that confounded all [their]1120-us geography and topography . Gradually as the day darkened into heavy , chilly July rain , the scarcely kept up spirits of [the four passengers]1126-the four passengers began to sink . [Johanna]93-johanna grew very white and worn , [Selina]92-selina became , to use [Ascott]97-ascott 's phrase , " as cross as two sticks , "[92-selina] and even [Hilary]91-hilary , turning [her]91-hilary eyes from the gray sodden looking landscape without , could find no spot of comfort to rest on within [the carriage]1127-the carriage , except that round rosy face of [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth 's . Whether it was from the spirit of contradiction existing in most such natures , which , especially in youth , are more strong than sweet , or from a better feeling , the fact was noticeable , that when [every one else]1128-every one else 's spirits went down [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's went up . Nothing could bring [her]94-elizabeth out of a " grumpy "[91-hilary] fit so satisfactorily as [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses falling into one . When [Miss Selina]92-selina now began to fidget hither and thither , each tone of [her]92-selina fretful voice seeming to go through [[her]92-selina eldest sister]261-her eldest sister 's every nerve , till even [Hilary]91-hilary said , impatiently , " Oh , [Selina]92-selina , ca n't [you]92-selina be quiet ? "[91-hilary] then [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth rose from the depth of [her]94-elizabeth gloomy discontent up to the surface immediately . [She]94-elizabeth was only [a servant]246-a servant ; but Nature bestows that strange vague thing that [we]1132-we term " force of character "[91-hilary] independently of position . [Hilary]91-hilary often remembered afterward , how much more comfortable the end of the journey was than [she]91-hilary had expected — how [Johanna]93-johanna lay at ease , with [her]93-johanna feet in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's lap , wrapped in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's best woolen shawl ; and how , when [Selina]92-selina 's whole attention was turned to an ingenious contrivance with a towel and fork and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's basket , for stopping the rain out of the carriage roof — [she]92-selina became far less disagreeable , and even a little proud of [her]92-selina own cleverness . And so there was a temporary lull in [Hilary]91-hilary 's cares , and [she]91-hilary could sit quiet , with [her]91-hilary eyes fixed on the rainy landscape , which [she]91-hilary did not see , and [her]91-hilary thoughts wandering toward that unknown place and unknown life into which [they]1133-they were sweeping , as [we]1132-we all sweep , ignorantly , unresistingly , almost unconsciously , into new destinies . [Hilary]91-hilary , for the first time , began to doubt of [theirs]1133-they . Anxious as [she]91-hilary had been to go to [London]1-london , and wise as [the proceeding]1134-the proceeding appeared , now that the die was cast and the cable cut , the old simple , peaceful life at [Stowbury]2-stowbury grew strangely dear . " [I]91-hilary wonder if [we]1132-we shall ever go back again , or what is to happen to [us]1132-we before [we]1132-we do go back , "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary thought , and turned , with a half defined fear , toward [[her]91-hilary eldest sister]261-her eldest sister , who looked so old and fragile beside [that sturdy , healthful servant girl]1136-that sturdy , healthful servant girl . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ! "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , rubbing [Miss Leaf]91-hilary 's feet , started at the unwonted sharpness of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's tone . " There ; [I]94-elizabeth 'll do that for [[my]94-elizabeth sister]3017-my sister . Go and look out of the window at [London]1-london . "[94-elizabeth] For the great smoky cloud which began to rise in the rainy horizon was indeed [London]1-london . Soon through the thickening nebula of [houses]1137-houses [they]1138-they converged to what was then the nucleus of all railway traveling , [the Euston Terminus]1139-the euston terminus , and were hustled on to [the platform]1140-the platform , and jostled helplessly to and fro [these poor country ladies]1141-these poor country ladies ! Anxiously [they]1138-they scanned the crowd of strange faces for [the one only face [they]1138-they knew in [the great metropolis]1143-the great metropolis]1142-the one only face they knew in the great metropolis — which did not appear . " It is very strange ; very wrong of [Ascott]97-ascott . [Hilary]91-hilary , [you]91-hilary surely told [him]97-ascott the hour correctly . For once , at least , [he]97-ascott might have been in time "[1142-the one only face they knew in the great metropolis] So chafed [Miss Selina]92-selina , while [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , who by some miraculous effort of intuitive genius , had succeeded in collecting the luggage , was now engaged in defending it from [all comers]1144-all comers , especially [porters]1145-porters , and making of it a comfort able seat for [Miss Leaf]92-selina . " Nay , have patience , [Selina]92-selina . [We]1138-they will give [him]97-ascott just five minutes more , [Hilary]91-hilary . "[93-johanna] And [Johanna]93-johanna sat down , with [her]93-johanna sweet , calm , long suffering face turned upward to that younger one , which was , as [youth]1146-youth is apt to be , hot , and worried , and angry . And so [they]1138-they waited till [the terminus]1147-the terminus was almost deserted , and [the last cab]1148-the last cab had driven off , when , suddenly , dashing up [the station yard]1149-the station yard out of another , came [Ascott]97-ascott . [He]97-ascott was so sorry , so very sorry , downright grieved , at having kept [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts waiting . But [his]97-ascott watch was wrong — [some fellows at dinner]1151-some fellows at dinner detained [him]97-ascott — [the train]1152-the train was before its time surely . In fact , [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts never quite made out what the excuse was ; but [they]3135-his aunts looked into [his]97-ascott bright handsome face , and [their]3135-his aunts wrath melted like clouds before the sun . [He]97-ascott was so gentlemanly , so well dressed — much better dressed than even at [Stowbury]2-stowbury — and [he]97-ascott seemed so unfeignedly glad to see [them]3135-his aunts . [He]97-ascott handed [them]3135-his aunts all into [the cab]1154-the cab — even [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . though whispering meanwhile to [[his]97-ascott Aunt]428-his aunt [Hilary]91-hilary , " What on earth did [you]97-ascott bring [her]94-elizabeth for ? "[1156-their] and [their]1156-their was just going to leap on to the box [himself]97-ascott , when [he]97-ascott stopped to ask " Where [he]97-ascott should tell [cabby]3557-cabby to drive to ? "[97-ascott] " Where to ? "[3135-his aunts] repeated [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts in undisguised astonishment . [They]3135-his aunts had never thought of any thing but of being taken [home]3045-home at once by [[their]3135-his aunts boy]1159-their boy . " [You]3135-his aunts see , "[97-ascott] [Ascott]97-ascott said , in a little confusion , " [you]3135-his aunts would n't be comfortable with [me]97-ascott . [A young fellow]3558-a young fellow 's lodgings are not like [a house of [one]585-one 's own]3559-a house of one 's own , and , besides — "[97-ascott] " Besides , when [a young fellow]3558-a young fellow is ashamed of [[his]3558-a young fellow old aunts]3562-his old aunts , [he]3558-a young fellow can easily find reasons . "[97-ascott] " Hush , [Selina]92-selina ! "[92-selina] interposed [Miss Leaf]92-selina . " [[My]97-ascott dear boy]3563-my dear boy , [[your]3563-my dear boy old aunts]3564-your old aunts would never let [you]3563-my dear boy inconvenience [yourself]3563-my dear boy for [them]3564-your old aunts . " And [you]93-johanna are not vexed with [me]97-ascott , [Aunt Johanna]93-johanna ? "[97-ascott] said [he]97-ascott , with something of [his]97-ascott old childish tone of compunction , as [he]97-ascott saw — [he]97-ascott could not help seeing — the utter weariness which [Johanna]93-johanna tried so hard to hide . " No , [[my]97-ascott dear]3016-my dear , not vexed . Only [I]97-ascott wish [we]1161-we had known this a little sooner that [we]1161-we might have made arrangements . Now , where shall [we]1161-we go ? "[97-ascott] [Ascott]97-ascott mentioned [a dozen hotels]1160-a dozen hotels , but [they]1161-we found [he]97-ascott only knew [them]1160-a dozen hotels by name . At last [Miss Leaf]92-selina remembered one , which [[her]92-selina father]1162-her father used to go to , on [his]1162-her father frequent journeys to [London]1-london , and whence , indeed , [he]1162-her father had been brought [home]3045-home to die . And though all the recollections about it were sad enough , still it felt less strange than the rest , in this dreariness of [London]1-london . So [she]92-selina proposed going to [the " Old Bell]3568-the " old bell , "[92-selina] [Holborn]16-holborn . " [A capital place]3569-a capital place ! "[97-ascott] exclaimed [Ascott]97-ascott , eagerly . " And [I]97-ascott 'll take and settle [you]92-selina there : and [we]3570-we 'll order supper , and make a jolly night of it . All right . Drive on , [cabby]3557-cabby . "[97-ascott] [He]97-ascott jumped on the box , and then looked in mischievously , flourishing [his]97-ascott lit cigar and shaking [his]97-ascott long hair — [his]97-ascott Aunt [Selina]92-selina 's two great abominations — right in [her]92-selina indignant face : but [withal]148-withal looking so merry and good tempered that [she]92-selina shortly softened into a smile . " How handsome [the boy]375-the boy is growing ! "[92-selina] " Yes , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna , with a slight sigh ; " and did [you]97-ascott notice ? how exceedingly like [his]375-the boy — "[93-johanna] The sentence was left unfinished . Alas ! if [every young man]1164-every young man , who believes [his]1164-every young man faults and follies injure [himself]1164-every young man alone , could feel what it must be , years afterward , to have [[his]1164-every young man nearest kindred]1165-his nearest kindred shrink from saying as the saddest , most ominous thing [they]1165-his nearest kindred could say of [[his]1164-every young man son]1166-his son , that [the lad]422-the lad is growing " so like [[his]422-the lad father]404-his father ! "[1165-his nearest kindred] It might have been — [they]1165-his nearest kindred assured [each other]1168-each other that it was — only the incessant roll , roll of the street sounds below [their]1165-his nearest kindred windows , which kept [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf awake half the night of this [their]1165-his nearest kindred first night in [London]1-london . And when [they]1165-his nearest kindred sat down to breakfast — having waited an hour vainly for [[their]1165-his nearest kindred nephew]339-their nephew — it might have been only the gloom of [the little parlor]520-the little parlor which cast a slight shadow over [them]1165-his nearest kindred all . Still the shadow was there . It deepened despite the sunshiny morning into which the last night 's rain had brightened till [Holborn Bars]17-holborn bars looked cheerful , and [Holborn]16-holborn pavement actually clean , so that , as [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth said , " [you]94-elizabeth might eat [your]94-elizabeth dinner off it ; "[94-elizabeth] which was the one only thing [she]94-elizabeth condescended to approve in [London]1-london . [She]94-elizabeth had sat all evening mute in [[her]94-elizabeth corner]1171-her corner , for [Miss Leaf]92-selina would not send [her]94-elizabeth away into [the terra incognita of [a London hotel]1173-a london hotel]1172-the terra incognita of a london hotel . [Ascott]97-ascott , at first considerably annoyed at the presence of what [he]97-ascott called a " skeleton at the feast , "[97-ascott] had afterward got over it ; and run on with a mixture of childish glee and mannish pomposity about [his]97-ascott plans and intentions — how [he]97-ascott meant to take [a house]1174-a house , [he]97-ascott thought , in [one of [the squares]1176-the squares]1175-one of the squares , or [a street]1177-a street leading out of [them]1176-the squares : how [he]97-ascott would put up the biggest of brass plates , with " [Mr. Leaf]97-ascott , [surgeon]3574-surgeon . "[97-ascott] and soon get an extensive practice , and have all [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts to live with [him]97-ascott . And [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts had smiled and listened , forgetting all about [the silent figure in the corner , who perhaps had gone to sleep]1180-the silent figure in the corner , who perhaps had gone to sleep , or had also listened . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , come and look out at [London]1-london . "[1181-she] So [she]1181-she and [Miss Hilary]91-hilary whiled away another heavy three quarters of an hour in watching and commenting on the incessantly shifting crowd which swept past [Holborn Bars]17-holborn bars . [Miss Selina]92-selina sometimes looked out too , but more often sat fidgeting and wondering why [Ascott]97-ascott did not come ; while [Miss Leaf]92-selina , who never fidgeted , became gradually more and more silent . [Her]92-selina eyes were fixed on the door , with an expression which , if [Hilary]91-hilary could have remembered so far back , would have been to [her]92-selina something not painfully new , but still more painfully old — a look branded into [her]92-selina face by [many an anxious hour 's listening for the footstep that never came , or only came to bring distress]1182-many an anxious hour 's listening for the footstep that never came , or only came to bring distress . It was the ineffaceable token of that long , long struggle between affection and conscience , pity and scarcely repressible contempt , which , for more than one generation , had been the appointed burden of [this family]1183-this family — at least [the women of it]1184-the women of it — till sometimes it seemed to hang over [them]1185-them almost like a fate . About noon [Miss Leaf]91-hilary proposed calling for the hotel bill . Its length so alarmed [the country ladies]1186-the country ladies that [Hilary]91-hilary suggested not staying to dine , but going immediately in search of [lodgings]1187-lodgings . " What , without [a gentleman]3465-a gentleman ! Impossible ! [I]91-hilary always understood [ladies]514-ladies could go nowhere in [London]1-london without [a gentleman]3465-a gentleman ! "[91-hilary] " [We]3578-we shall come very ill off then , [Selina]92-selina . But any how [I]91-hilary mean to try . [You]92-selina know [the region where , [we]3578-we have heard]3579-the region where , we have heard , [lodgings]1187-lodgings are cheapest and best — that is , best for [us]3578-we . It can not be far from here . Suppose [I]91-hilary start at once ? "[91-hilary] " What , alone ? "[93-johanna] cried [Johanna]93-johanna , anxiously . " No , [dear]685-dear , [I]93-johanna 'll take the map with [me]93-johanna , and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [She]94-elizabeth is not afraid . "[93-johanna] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth smiled , and rose , with that air of dogged devotedness with which [she]94-elizabeth would have prepared to follow [Miss Hilary]91-hilary to [the North Pole]1188-the north pole , if necessary . So , after a few minutes of arguing with [Selina]92-selina , who did not press [her]92-selina point overmuch , since [she]92-selina [herself]92-selina had not to commit the impropriety of the expedition . After a few minutes more of hopeless lingering about — till even [Miss Leaf]92-selina said [they]1189-they had better wait no longer — [mistress]278-mistress and [maid]3315-maid took a farewell nearly as pathetic as if [they]1189-they had been really [Arctic voyagers]1192-arctic voyagers , and plunged right into the dusty glare and hurrying crowd of [the " sunny side "[278-mistress] of [Holborn]16-holborn]1193-the " sunny side " of holborn in July . A strange sensation , and yet there was something exhilarating in it . The intense solitude that there is in [a [London]1-london crowd [these country girls]1195-these country girls]1194-a london crowd these country girls — for [Miss Hilary]91-hilary [herself]91-hilary was no more than [a girl]3542-a girl — could not as yet realize . [They]1195-these country girls only felt the life of it ; stirring , active , incessantly moving life ; even though it was of a kind that [they]1195-these country girls knew as little of it as [the crowd]1101-the crowd did of [them]1195-these country girls . Nothing struck [Hilary]91-hilary more than the self - absorbed look of [passers - by]1198-passers - by : each so busy on [his]1199-his own affairs , that , in spite of [Selina]92-selina 's alarm , for all notice taken of [them]1195-these country girls , [they]1195-these country girls might as well be walking among the cows and horses in [Stowbury field]2-stowbury . Poor old [Stowbury]2-stowbury ! [They]1195-these country girls felt how far away [they]1195-these country girls were from [it]1200-it when [a ragged , dirty , vicious looking girl]1201-a ragged , dirty , vicious looking girl offered [them]1195-these country girls a moss rose bud for " one penny , only one penny ; "[1201-a ragged , dirty , vicious looking girl] which [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , lagging behind , bought , and found it only a broken off bud stuck on to a bit of wire . " That 's [London]1-london ways , [I]94-elizabeth suppose , "[94-elizabeth] said [she]94-elizabeth , severely , and became so misanthropic that [she]94-elizabeth would hardly vouchsafe a glance to the hand [some square [they]1195-these country girls turned into]1202-some square they turned into , and merely observed of [the tall houses]1203-the tall houses , taller than any [Hilary]91-hilary had ever seen , that [she]94-elizabeth " would n't fancy running up and down [them]1203-the tall houses stairs . "[94-elizabeth] But [Hilary]91-hilary was cheerful in spite of all . [She]91-hilary was glad to be in [this region]1204-this region , which , theoretically , [she]91-hilary knew by heart — glad to find [herself]91-hilary in the body , where in the spirit [she]91-hilary had come so many a time . The mere consciousness of this seemed to refresh [her]91-hilary . [She]91-hilary thought [she]91-hilary would be much happier in [London]1-london ; that in the long years to come that must be borne , it would be good for [her]91-hilary to have something to do as well as to hope for ; something to fight with as well as to endure . Now more than ever came pulsing in and out of [her]91-hilary memory a line once repeated in [her]91-hilary hearing , with an observation of how " true "[628-a man] it was . And though originally it was applied by [a man]628-a man to [a woman]669-a woman , and [she]91-hilary smiled sometimes to think how " unfeminine "[485-some people] [some people]485-some people — [Selina]92-selina for instance — would consider [her]91-hilary turning it the other way , still [she]91-hilary did so . [She]91-hilary believed that , for [woman]352-woman as for [man]3369-man , that is the purest and noblest love which is the most self - existent , most independent of love returned ; and which can say , each to the other equally on both sides , that the whole solemn purpose of life is , under [God]105-god 's service , " If not to win , to feel more worthy [thee]3582-thee . "[105-god] Such thoughts made [her]91-hilary step firmer and [her]91-hilary heart lighter ; so that [she]91-hilary hardly noticed the distance [they]1210-they must have walked till the close [London]1-london air began to oppress [her]91-hilary , and the smooth glaring [London]1-london pavements made [her]91-hilary Stowbury feet ache sorely . " Are [you]91-hilary tired , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? Well , [we]1210-they 'll rest soon . There must be lodgings near [here]389-here . Only [I]91-hilary ca n't quite make out — "[91-hilary] As [Miss Hilary]91-hilary looked up to the name of [the street]1211-the street [the maid]1061-the maid noticed what a glow came into [[her]1061-the maid mistress]431-her mistress 's face , pale and tired as it was . Just then a church clock struck the quarter hour . " That must be [St. Pancras]19-st. pancras . And this — yes , this is [Burton Street]20-burton street , [Burton Crescent]21-burton crescent . "[94-elizabeth] " [I]94-elizabeth 'm sure [Missis]134-missis would n't like to live [there]3030-there ; "[94-elizabeth] observed [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , eyeing uneasily [the gloomy rez de - chaussee]1214-the gloomy rez de - chaussee , familiar to [many a generation of struggling respectability]1215-many a generation of struggling respectability , where , in the decadence of the season , [every second house]1216-every second house bore the announcement " [apartments furnished]3585-apartments furnished . "[94-elizabeth] " No , "[91-hilary] [Miss Hilary]91-hilary replied , absently . Yet [she]91-hilary continued to walk up and down the whole length of [the street]1211-the street ; then passed out into [the dreary , deserted looking Crescent]1218-the dreary , deserted looking crescent , where the trees were already beginning to fade ; not , however , into the bright autumn tint of [country woods]1219-country woods , but into a premature withering , ugly and sad to behold . " [I]91-hilary am glad [he]98-robert lyon is not [here]389-here — glad , glad ! "[91-hilary] thought [Hilary]91-hilary , as [she]91-hilary realized the unutterable dreariness of those years when [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon lived and studied in [[his]98-robert lyon garret]1220-his garret from month 's end to month 's end — these few dusty trees being the sole memento of the green country life in which [he]98-robert lyon had been brought up , and which [she]91-hilary knew [he]98-robert lyon so passionately loved . Now [she]91-hilary could understand , that " calenture "[98-robert lyon] which [he]98-robert lyon had sometimes jestingly alluded to , as coming upon [him]98-robert lyon at times , when [he]98-robert lyon felt literally sick for the sight of [a green field]1221-a green field or a hedge full of birds . [She]91-hilary wondered whether the same feeling would ever come upon [her]91-hilary in [this strange desert of [London]1-london]1222-this strange desert of london , the vastness of which grew upon [her]91-hilary every hour . [She]91-hilary was glad [he]98-robert lyon was away ; yes , heart glad ! And yet , if this minute [she]91-hilary could only have seen [him]98-robert lyon coming round [the Crescent]1223-the crescent , have met [his]98-robert lyon smile , and the firm , warm clasp of [his]98-robert lyon hand — For an instant there rose up in [her]91-hilary one of those wild , rebellious outcries against fate , when to have to waste years of this brief life of [ours]1224-we , in the sort of semi - existence that living is , apart from the treasure of the heart and delight of the eyes , seems so cruelly , cruelly hard ! " [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . "[91-hilary] [She]91-hilary started , and " put [herself]91-hilary under lock and key "[91-hilary] immediately . " [Miss Hilary]91-hilary ; [you]91-hilary do look so tired ! "[91-hilary] " Do [I]91-hilary ? Then [we]1224-we will go and sit down in [[this baker]3587-this baker 's shop]3588-this baker 's shop , and get rested and fed . [We]1224-we can not afford to wear [ourselves]1224-we out , [you]91-hilary know . [We]1224-we have a great deal to do to - day . "[91-hilary] More indeed , than [she]91-hilary calculated , for [they]1224-we walked up [one street]1225-one street and down another , investigating [at least twenty lodgings before any appeared which seemed fit for [them]1224-we]1226-at least twenty lodgings before any appeared which seemed fit for them . Yet some place must be found where [Johanna]93-johanna 's poor , tired head could rest that night . At last , completely exhausted , with that oppressive exhaustion which seems to crush mind as well as body after a day 's wandering in [London]1-london . [Hilary]91-hilary 's courage began to ebb . Oh for an arm to lean on , [a voice to listen for]1227-a voice to listen for , a brave heart to come to [her]91-hilary side , saying , " Do not be afraid , there are two of [us]1224-we ! "[1227-a voice to listen for] And [she]91-hilary yearned , with an absolutely sick yearning such as only [a woman who now and then feels the utter helplessness of [her]1228-a woman who now and then feels the utter helplessness of her womanhood womanhood]1228-a woman who now and then feels the utter helplessness of her womanhood can know , for the only arm [she]91-hilary cared to lean on , the only voice dear enough to bring [her]91-hilary comfort , the only heart that [she]91-hilary felt [she]91-hilary could trust . [Poor Hilary]149-hilary ! And yet why pity [her]91-hilary ? To [her]91-hilary three alternatives could but happen : were [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon true to [her]91-hilary [she]91-hilary would be [his]98-robert lyon entirely and devotedly , to the end of [her]91-hilary days ; did [he]98-robert lyon forsake [her]91-hilary , [she]91-hilary would forgive [him]98-robert lyon should [he]98-robert lyon die , [she]91-hilary would be faithful to [him]98-robert lyon eternally . [Love of this kind]1229-love of this kind may know anguish , but not the sort of anguish that [lesser and weaker loves]1230-lesser and weaker loves do . If it is certain of nothing else , it can always be certain of itself . " [Its]1229-love of this kind will is strong ; ' [It]1229-love of this kind suffers ; but it can not suffer long . "[1229-love of this kind] And even in its utmost pangs is an underlying peace which often approaches to absolute joy . Not a word did [she]91-hilary say to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , or [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth to [her]91-hilary , till [they]1260-they got into [the dull , dingy parlor]1261-the dull , dingy parlor — henceforth , to be [their]1260-they sole apology for " [home]3045-home : "[91-hilary] and then [she]91-hilary only talked about domestic arrangements — talked fast and eagerly , and tried to escape the affectionate eyes which [she]91-hilary knew were so sharp and keen . "[91-hilary] [She]91-hilary felt convinced [the girl]307-the girl had heard every syllable that passed at [[Ascott]97-ascott 's lodgings]1263-ascott 's lodgings : that [she]91-hilary knew all that was to be known , and guessed what was to be feared as well as [Hilary]91-hilary [herself]91-hilary . " [Elizabeth"—she]152-elizabeth"—she[91-hilary] hesitated long , and doubted whether [she]91-hilary should say the thing before [she]91-hilary did say it—"remember [we]3617-we are [all strangers in [London]1-london]3618-all strangers in london , and family matters are best kept within [the family]258-the family . Do not mention either in writing [home]3045-home , or to any body here , about — about — "[91-hilary] [She]91-hilary could not name [Ascott]97-ascott ; [she]91-hilary felt so horribly ashamed . Living in [lodgings]1187-lodgings , not temporarily , but permanently , sitting down to make [[one]585-one 's only " home "[585-one] in [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones 's parlor]1266-one 's only " home " in mrs. jones 's parlor or [[Mrs. Smith]154-mrs. smith 's first floor]1267-mrs. smith 's first floor , of which not a stick or a stone that [one]585-one looks at is [one]585-one 's own , and whence [one]585-one may be evicted or evade , with a week 's notice or a week 's rent , any day — this sort of life is natural and even delightful to [some people]485-some people . There are [those who , like strawberry plants , are of such an errant disposition]1272-those who , like strawberry plants , are of such an errant disposition , that grow them where [you]1273-you will , [they]1272-those who , like strawberry plants , are of such an errant disposition will soon absorb all the pleasantness of [their]1272-those who , like strawberry plants , are of such an errant disposition habitat , and begin casting out runners elsewhere ; may , if not frequently transplanted , would actually wither and die . Of such are [the pioneers of society]1274-the pioneers of society — [the emigrants]1275-the emigrants , [the tourists]1276-the tourists , [the travelers]1277-the travelers round [the world]248-the world ; and great is the advantage [the world]248-the world derives from [them]1274-the pioneers of society , active , energetic , and impulsive as [they]1274-the pioneers of society are . Unless , indeed , [their]1274-the pioneers of society talent for incessant locomotion degenerates into rootless restlessness , and [they]1274-the pioneers of society remain forever rolling stones , gathering no moss , and acquiring gradually a smooth , hard surface , which adheres to nothing , and to which [nobody]357-nobody dare venture to adhere . But there are [others possessing in a painful degree this said quality of adhesiveness , to whom the smallest change]1281-others possessing in a painful degree this said quality of adhesiveness , to whom the smallest change is obnoxious ; [who like drinking out of a particular cup , and sitting in a particular chair ; to whom even a variation in the position of furniture]1282-who like drinking out of a particular cup , and sitting in a particular chair ; to whom even a variation in the position of furniture is unpleasant . Of course , this peculiarity has its bad side , and yet it is not in itself mean or ignoble . For is not adhesiveness , faithfulness , constancy — call it what [you]1273-you will — at the root of all citizenship , clanship , and family love ? Is it not the same feeling which , granting [they]1283-they remain at all , makes old friendships dearer than any new ? Nay , to go to the very sacredest and closest bond , is it not that which makes [an old man]1284-an old man see to the last in [[his]1284-an old man old wife]1285-his old wife 's faded face the beauty which perhaps [nobody]357-nobody ever saw except [himself]1284-an old man , but which [he]1284-an old man sees and delights in still , simply because it is familiar and [his]1284-an old man own . To [people who possess a large share of this rare]1287-people who possess a large share of this rare — shall [I]0-i say fatal?—characteristic of adhesiveness , living in [lodgings]1187-lodgings is about the saddest life under the sun . Whether some dim foreboding of this fact crossed [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's mind as [she]94-elizabeth stood at the window watching for [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses ' first arrival at " [home]3045-home , "[97-ascott] it is impossible to say . [She]94-elizabeth could feel , though [she]94-elizabeth was not accustomed to analyze [her]94-elizabeth feelings . But [she]94-elizabeth looked dull and sad . Not cross , even [Ascott]97-ascott could not have accused [her]94-elizabeth of " savageness . "[97-ascott] And yet [she]94-elizabeth had been somewhat tried . First , in going out what [she]94-elizabeth termed " marketing , "[94-elizabeth] [she]94-elizabeth had traversed [a waste of streets]1290-a waste of streets , got lost several times , and returned with light weight in [her]94-elizabeth butter , and sand in [her]94-elizabeth moist sugar ; also with the conviction that [[London]1-london [tradesmen]1292-tradesmen]1291-london tradesmen were [the greatest rogues alive]1293-the greatest rogues alive . Secondly , a pottle of strawberries , which [she]94-elizabeth had bought with [her]94-elizabeth own money to grace the tea - table with the only fruit [Miss Leaf]91-hilary cared for , had turned out a large delusion , big and beautiful at top , and all below small , crushed , and stale . [She]94-elizabeth had thrown it indignantly , pottle and all , into the kitchen fire . Thirdly , [she]94-elizabeth had a war with [the landlady]1243-the landlady , partly on the subject of [their]1295-their fire — which , with [her]94-elizabeth Stowbury notions on the subject of coals , seemed wretchedly mean and small — and partly on the question of table cloths at tea , which [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones had " never heard of , "[94-elizabeth] especially when the use of plate and lines was included in the rent . And the dinginess of the article produced at last out of an omnium - gatherum sort of kitchen cupboard , made an ominous impression upon [the country girl]1296-the country girl , accustomed to clean , tidy , country ways — where [the kitchen]253-the kitchen was kept as neat as [the parlor]313-the parlor , and [the bedrooms]455-the bedrooms were not a whit behind [the sitting rooms]1300-the sitting rooms in comfort and orderliness . Here it seemed as if , supposing [people]3210-people could show a few [respectable living rooms]1302-respectable living rooms , [they]3210-people were content to sleep any where , and cook any how , out of anything , in the midst of any quantity of confusion and dirt . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth set all this down as " [London]1-london , "[94-elizabeth] and hated it accordingly . [She]94-elizabeth had tried to ease [her]94-elizabeth mind by arranging and rearranging the furniture — regular lodging house furniture — table , six chairs , horse - hair sofa , a what not , and the chiffonnier , with a tea - caddy upon it , of which the respective keys had been solemnly presented to [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . But still [the parlor]313-the parlor looked homeless and bare ; and the yellowish paper on the walls , the large patterned , many colored Kidderminster on the floor , gave an involuntary sense of discomfort and dreariness . Besides , [No . 15]1304-no . 15 was on the shady side of [the street]1211-the street — [cheap lodgings]1306-cheap lodgings always are ; and [no one who has not lived in the like lodgings]1307-no one who has not lived in the like lodgings — not [a house]1174-a house — can imagine what it is to inhabit perpetually [one room where the sunshine just peeps in for an hour a day]1309-one room where the sunshine just peeps in for an hour a day , and vanishes by eleven A. M. ; leaving behind in winter a chill dampness , and in summer a heavy , dusty atmosphere , that weighs like lead on the spirits in spite of one 's self . No wonder that , as is statistically known and proved , cholera stalks , fever rages , and [the registrar]1310-the registrar 's list is always swelled along the shady side of [a London street]1311-a london street . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth felt this , though [she]94-elizabeth had not the dimmest idea why . [She]94-elizabeth stood watching the sunset light fade out of the topmost windows of [the opposite house]1312-the opposite house — ghostly reflection of some sunset over [fields]1313-fields and trees far away ; and [she]94-elizabeth listened to the long monotonous cry melting away round the crescent , and beginning again at the other end of the street—"Straw - berries — straw - ber - ries ! "[94-elizabeth] Also , with an eye to tomorrow 's Sunday dinner , [she]94-elizabeth investigated the cart of the tired costermonger , who crawled along beside [his]1314-his equally tired donkey , reiterating at times , in tones hoarse with a day 's bawling , [his]1314-his dreary " Cauli - flower ! Cauli - flower!—Fine new pease , sixpence peck ! "[1314-his] But , alas ! the pease were neither fine nor new ; and the cauliflowers were regular Saturday night 's cauliflowers . Besides , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth suddenly doubted whether [she]94-elizabeth had any right , unordered , to buy these things which , from being common garden necessaries , had become luxuries . This thought , with some others that it occasioned , [her]94-elizabeth unwonted state of Idleness and the dullness of every thing about [her]94-elizabeth — what is so dull as [a " quiet "[97-ascott] [London]1-london street]1315-a " quiet " london street on a summer evening?—actually made [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth stand , motionless and meditative , for a quarter of an hour . Then [she]94-elizabeth started to hear [two cabs]1316-two cabs drive up to the door ; [the " family "]3622-the " family "[3622-the " family "] had at length arrived . [Ascott]97-ascott was there too . Two new portmanteaus and a splendid hat - box east either ignominy or glory upon the poor [Stowbury]2-stowbury luggage ; and — [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's sharp eye noticed — there was also [his]97-ascott trunk which [she]94-elizabeth had seen lying detained for rent in [[his]97-ascott Gower Street lodgings]1317-his gower street lodgings . But [he]97-ascott looked quite easy and comfortable : handed out [his]97-ascott Aunt [Johanna]93-johanna , commanded the luggage about , and paid [the cabmen]1318-the cabmen with such a magnificent air , that [they]1318-the cabmen touched [their]1318-the cabmen bats to [him]97-ascott , and winked at [one another]394-one another as much as to say . " That 's [a real gentleman]3471-a real gentleman ! "[1318-the cabmen] In which statement [the landlady]1243-the landlady evidently coincided , and courtesied low when [Miss Leaf]91-hilary introducing [him]97-ascott as " [[my]91-hilary nephew]3624-my nephew , "[91-hilary] hoped that a room could be found for [him]97-ascott . Which at last there was , by [his]97-ascott appropriating [Miss Leaf]91-hilary 's , while [she]91-hilary and [Hilary]91-hilary took that at [the top of [the house]344-the house]1321-the top of the house . But [they]1318-the cabmen agreed , [Ascott]97-ascott must have [a good airy room to study in]1323-a good airy room to study in . " [You]97-ascott know , [[my]93-johanna dear boy]3563-my dear boy , "[93-johanna] said [[his]97-ascott Aunt]428-his aunt [Johanna]93-johanna to [him]97-ascott — and at [her]93-johanna tender tone [he]97-ascott looked a little downcast , as when [he]97-ascott was [a small fellow]1325-a small fellow and had been forgiven something — " [You]97-ascott know [you]97-ascott will have to work very hard . "[93-johanna] " All right , [aunt]770-aunt ! [I]93-johanna 'm [[your]770-aunt man]3627-your man for that ! This will be [a jolly room]3628-a jolly room ; and [I]93-johanna can smoke up the chimney capitally ! "[93-johanna] So [they]1326-they came down [stairs]3048-stairs quite cheerfully , and [Ascott]97-ascott applied [himself]97-ascott with the best of appetites to what [he]97-ascott called a " hungry "[97-ascott] tea . True , the ham , which [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had to fetch from [an eating house some streets]1328-an eating house some streets off , cost two shillings a pound , and the eggs , which caused [her]94-elizabeth another war below over the relighting of a fire to boil them , were dismissed by [the young gentleman]3610-the young gentleman as " horrid stale . "[352-woman] Still , [woman]352-woman - like , when there is [a man in the question]1331-a man in the question , [[his]1331-a man in the question aunts]3135-his aunts let [him]1331-a man in the question , have [his]1331-a man in the question why . It seemed as if [they]1326-they had resolved to try [their]1326-they utmost to make [the new home to which [he]1331-a man in the question came]1333-the new home to which he came , or rather was driven , [a pleasant home]1334-a pleasant home , and to bind [him]1331-a man in the question to [it]1333-the new home to which he came with cords of love , the only cords worth any thing , though sometimes — [Heaved]155-heaved knows why — even [they]1335-they fail , and are snapped and thrown aside like straws . Whenever [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth went in and out of [the parlor]313-the parlor [she]94-elizabeth always heard lively talk going on among [the family]258-the family ; [Ascott]97-ascott making [his]97-ascott jokes , telling about [his]97-ascott college life , and planning [his]97-ascott life to come as [a surgeon in full practice , on the most extensive scale]1338-a surgeon in full practice , on the most extensive scale . And when [she]94-elizabeth brought in the chamber candles , [she]94-elizabeth saw [him]97-ascott kiss [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts affectionately , and even help [his]97-ascott Aunt [Johanna]93-johanna — who looked frightfully pale and tired , but smiling still — to [her]93-johanna bed - room door . " [You]97-ascott 'll not sit up long , [[my]94-elizabeth dear]3016-my dear ? No reading to night ? "[94-elizabeth] said [she]94-elizabeth , anxiously . " Not a bit of it . And [I]94-elizabeth 'll be up with the lark to - morrow morning . [I]94-elizabeth really will [auntie]3630-auntie . [I]94-elizabeth 'm going to turn over a new leaf , [you]3630-auntie know . "[94-elizabeth] [She]94-elizabeth smiled again at the immemorial joke , kissed and blessed [him]97-ascott , and the door shut up on [her]94-elizabeth and [Hilary]91-hilary . [He]97-ascott did not perceive [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , who , hidden behind , was kneeling to arrange something in the chiffonnier , till [she]94-elizabeth rose up and proceeded to fasten the parlor shutters . " [Hollo]156-hollo ! are [you]156-hollo there ? Come , [I]94-elizabeth 'll do that when [I]94-elizabeth go to bed . [You]156-hollo may ' slope ' if [you]156-hollo like . "[94-elizabeth] " Eh , [Sir]3469-sir . "[94-elizabeth] " [Slope]157-slope , [mizzle]3633-mizzle , cut [your]156-hollo stick ; do n't [you]156-hollo understand . "[94-elizabeth] " [I]94-elizabeth do n't mean to , "[94-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ; gravely , rather than gruffly , as if [she]94-elizabeth had made up [her]94-elizabeth mind to things as they were , and was determined to be [a belligerent party]1341-a belligerent party no longer . Besides , [she]94-elizabeth was older now ; too old to have things forgiven to [her]94-elizabeth that might be overlooked in [a child]504-a child ; and [she]94-elizabeth had received a long lecture from [Miss Hilary]91-hilary on the necessity of showing respect to [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , or [Mr. Leaf]97-ascott , as it was now decided [he]97-ascott was to be called , in [his]97-ascott dignity and responsibility as [the only masculine head of [the family]258-the family]1343-the only masculine head of the family .
