"[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth went , but shortly reappeared with the information that [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones had gone to bed : in [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , [she]94-elizabeth supposed , as [she]94-elizabeth could not get in . But [she]94-elizabeth laid on the table the large street door key . " Perhaps that 's what [you]97-ascott wanted , [Mr. Leaf]97-ascott . Though [I]94-elizabeth think [you]97-ascott need n't be the least afraid of [robbers]3639-robbers , for there 's three bolts , and a chain besides . "[94-elizabeth] " All right ! "[97-ascott] cried [Ascott]97-ascott , smothering down a laugh . " Thank [you]94-elizabeth ! That 's for [you]94-elizabeth , "[97-ascott] throwing a half - crown across the table . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth took it up demurely , and put it down again . Perhaps [she]94-elizabeth did not like [him]97-ascott enough to receive presents from [him]97-ascott ; perhaps [she]94-elizabeth thought , being [an honest minded girl]1348-an honest minded girl , that [a young man who could not pay]1349-a young man who could not pay [his]1349-a young man who could not pay rent had no business to be giving away half - crowns ; or else [she]94-elizabeth [herself]94-elizabeth had not been so much as many [servants]1052-servants are , in the habit of taking them . For [Miss Hilary]91-hilary had put into [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth some of [her]94-elizabeth own feeling as to this habit of paying [an inferior]1351-an inferior with money for any little civility or kindness which , from [an equal]1352-an equal , would be accepted simply as kindness , and only requited with thanks . Any how , the coin remained on the table , and the door was just shutting upon [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , when [the young gentleman]3610-the young gentleman turned round again . " [I]3610-the young gentleman say , since [[my]3610-the young gentleman aunts]3640-my aunts are so horridly timid of [robbers]3639-robbers and such like , [you]94-elizabeth 'd better not tell [them]3640-my aunts any thing about the latch - key . "[3610-the young gentleman] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth stood a minute perplexed , and then replied briefly : " [Miss Hilary]91-hilary is n't a bit timid ; and [I]94-elizabeth always tells [Miss Hilary]91-hilary every thing . "[94-elizabeth] Nevertheless , though [she]94-elizabeth was so ignorant as never to have heard of a latch - key , [she]94-elizabeth had the wit to see that all was not right . [She]94-elizabeth even lay awake , in [[her]94-elizabeth closet off [[Miss Leaf]91-hilary 's room]1355-miss leaf 's room]1354-her closet off miss leaf 's room , whence [she]94-elizabeth could hear the murmur of [[her]94-elizabeth two mistresses]1356-her two mistresses talking together , long after [they]1356-her two mistresses retired — lay broad awake for an hour or more , trying to put things together — the sad things that [she]94-elizabeth felt certain must have happened that day , and wondering what [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott could possibly want with the key . Also , why [he]97-ascott had asked [her]94-elizabeth about it , instead of telling [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts at once ; and why [he]97-ascott had treated [her]94-elizabeth in the matter with such astonishing civility . It may be said [a servant]246-a servant had no business to think about these things , to criticize [[her]246-a servant young master]1359-her young master 's proceedings , or wonder why [[her]246-a servant mistresses]429-her mistresses were sad : that [she]246-a servant had only to go about [her]246-a servant work like [an automaton]1361-an automaton , and take no interest in any thing . [I]0-i can only answer to [those who like such service]1362-those who like such service , let [them]1362-those who like such service have it : and as [they]1362-those who like such service sow [they]1362-those who like such service will assuredly reap . But long after [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , young and hearty , was soundly snoring on [her]94-elizabeth hard , cramped bed , [Johanna]93-johanna and [Hilary Leaf]91-hilary , after a brief mutual pretence of sleep , soon discovered by both , lay consulting together over ways and means . How could the family expenses , beginning with twenty - five shillings per week as rent , possibly be met by the only actual certain family income , [their]3135-his aunts Ł50 per annum from a mortgage ? For [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf were or that old - fashioned stamp which believed that to reckon an income by mere probabilities is either insanity or dishonesty . Common arithmetic soon proved that this Ł50 a year could not maintain [them]3135-his aunts ; in fact [they]3135-his aunts must soon draw on the little sum — already dipped into to - day , for Ascott — which had been produced by the sale of the Stowbury furniture . That sale , [they]3135-his aunts now found had been a mistake ; and [they]3135-his aunts half feared whether the whole change from [Stowbury]2-stowbury to [London]1-london had not been a mistake — one of those sad errors in judgment which [we]1363-our all commit sometimes , and have to abide by , and make the best of , and learn from if [we]1363-our can . Happy those who " Dinna greet ower spilt milk"—a[91-hilary] proverb wise as cheerful , which [Hilary]91-hilary , knowing well who it came from , repeated to [Johanna]93-johanna to comfort [her]93-johanna — teaches a second brave lesson , how to avoid spilling the milk a second time . And then [they]3135-his aunts consulted anxiously about what was to be done to earn money . Teaching presented [itself]1364-itself as the only resource . In those days women 's work and [women]3061-women 's rights had not been discussed so freely as at present . There was a strong feeling that the principal thing required was [our]1363-our duties — owed to [ourselves]1363-our , [[our]1363-our home]1366-our home , [[our]1363-our family]3536-our family and [friends]893-friends . There was a deep conviction — now , alas ! slowly disappearing — that [a woman]669-a woman , single or married , should never throw [herself]669-a woman out of the safe circle of domestic life till the last extremity of necessity ; that it is wiser to keep or help to keep [a home]1370-a home , by learning how to expend [its]1370-a home income , cook [its]1370-a home dinners , make and mend [its]1370-a home clothes , and , by the law that " prevention is better than cure , "[3061-women] studying all those preservative means of holding [a family]1054-a family together — as [women]3061-women , and [women]3061-women alone , can — than to dash into [men]3062-men 's sphere of trades and professions , thereby , in most instances , fighting an unequal battle , and coming out of it maimed , broken , unsexed ; turned into beings that are neither [men]3062-men nor [women]3061-women , with the faults and corresponding sufferings of both , and the compensations of neither . " [I]91-hilary do n't see , "[91-hilary] said [poor Hilary]91-hilary , " what [I]91-hilary can do but teach . And oh , if [I]91-hilary could only get daily pupils , so that [I]91-hilary might come [home]3045-home or nights , and creep into the fireside ; and have time to mend the stockings and look after [Ascott]97-ascott 's linen , that [he]422-the lad need not be so awfully extravagant . "[91-hilary] [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary fixed [her]101-hilary honest eyes on [the lad]422-the lad 's face — [the lad]422-the lad , so little younger than [herself]101-hilary , and yet who at tunes , when [he]422-the lad let out sayings such as this , seemed so awfully , so pitifully old ; and [she]101-hilary felt thankful that , at all risks and costs , [they]1379-they had come to [London]1-london to be beside [him]422-the lad , to help [him]422-the lad , to save [him]422-the lad , if [he]422-the lad needed saving , as [women]3061-women only can . For , after all , [he]422-the lad was but [a boy]384-a boy . And though as [he]422-the lad walked by [her]101-hilary side , stalwart and manly , the thought smote [her]101-hilary painfully that [many a young fellow of [his]422-the lad age]1382-many a young fellow of his age was [the stay and bread winner of [some widowed mother]1384-some widowed mother or [sister]408-sister]1383-the stay and bread winner of some widowed mother or sister , nay even of [wife]1386-wife and [child]3052-child , still [she]101-hilary repeated cheerfully . " What can [one]585-one expect from [him]422-the lad ? [He]422-the lad is only [a boy]384-a boy . "[101-hilary] [God]105-god help [the women who , for those belonging to [them]1388-the women who , for those belonging to them]1388-the women who , for those belonging to them — [husbands]1389-husbands , [fathers]3185-fathers , [brothers]510-brothers , [lovers]1392-lovers , [sons]1393-sons — have ever so tenderly to apologize . [You]101-hilary are [the very prettiest auntie]3650-the very prettiest auntie . Be sure [you]101-hilary get [home]3045-home safe . [Hollo]156-hollo , there ! That 's [[my]97-ascott omnibus]3652-my omnibus . "[97-ascott] [He]1395-he jumped on the top of it , and was off . [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary stood quite confounded , and with one of those strange sinkings of the heart which had come over [her]101-hilary several times this day . It was not that [Ascott]97-ascott showed any unkindness — that there was any actual badness in [his]97-ascott bright and handsome young face . Still there was a want there — want of earnestness , steadfastness , truthfulness , a something more discoverable as the lack of something else than as aught in itself tangibly and perceptibly wrong . It made [her]101-hilary sad ; it caused [her]101-hilary to look forward to [his]97-ascott future with an anxious heart . It was so different from the kind of anxiety , and yet settled repose , with which [she]101-hilary thought of [the only other man in whose future [she]101-hilary felt the smallest interest]1396-the only other man in whose future she felt the smallest interest . Of [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , [she]101-hilary was certain that whatever misfortune visited [him]98-robert lyon [he]98-robert lyon would bear it in the best way it could be borne ; whatever temptation assailed [him]98-robert lyon [he]98-robert lyon would fight against it as [a brave and good Christian]1397-a brave and good christian should fight . But [Ascott]97-ascott ? [Ascott]97-ascott 's life was as yet an unanswered query . [She]101-hilary could but leave it in Omnipotent hands . So [she]101-hilary found [her]101-hilary way [home]3045-home , asking it once or twice of [civil policemen]1399-civil policemen , and going a little distance round — dare [I]0-i make this romantic confession about [so sensible and practical a little woman?—that]1400-so sensible and practical a little woman?—that [she]101-hilary might walk once up [Burton Street]20-burton street and down again . But [nobody]357-nobody knew the fact , and it did [nobody]357-nobody any harm . Meantime at No 15 the afternoon had passed heavily enough . [Miss Selina]92-selina had gone to lie down ; [she]92-selina always did of Sundays , and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , after making [her]94-elizabeth comfortable , by the little attentions [the lady]480-the lady always required , had descended to [the dreary wash house]1404-the dreary wash house , which had been appropriated to [herself]94-elizabeth , under the name of [a " private kitchen]3653-a " private kitchen , "[92-selina] in the which , after all the cleanings and improvements [she]94-elizabeth could achieve , sat like [Marius]158-marius among the rains of [Carthage]29-carthage , and sighed for [the tidy bright house place at [Stowbury]2-stowbury]1405-the tidy bright house place at stowbury . Already , from [her]94-elizabeth brief experience , [she]94-elizabeth had decided that [[London]1-london [people]3210-people]1406-london people were horrid shams , because [they]3210-people did not in the least care to have [[their]3210-people kitchens]1408-their kitchens comfortable . [She]94-elizabeth wondered how [she]94-elizabeth should ever exist in [this one]1409-this one , and might have carried [her]94-elizabeth sad and sullen face up [stairs]3048-stairs , if [Miss Leaf]92-selina had not come down stairs , and glancing about with that ever gentle smile of [hers]92-selina , said kindly , " Well , it is not very pleasant , but [you]94-elizabeth have made the best of it , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [We]3654-we must all put up with something , [you]94-elizabeth know . Now , as [my]92-selina eyes are not very good to - day , suppose [you]94-elizabeth come up and read [me]92-selina a chapter . "[92-selina] So , in [the quiet parlor]1411-the quiet parlor , [the maid]1061-the maid sat down opposite [[her]1061-the maid mistress]431-her mistress , and read aloud out of that Book which says distinctly : " [Servants]1052-servants , be obedient to [them]1052-servants that are [[your]1052-servants masters]3656-your masters according to the flesh , with fear and trembling , in singleness of heart , as unto [Christ]159-christ : knowing , that whatsoever good thing [a man]628-a man doeth , the same shall [he]628-a man receive of [the Lord]3119-the lord , whether [he]628-a man be bond or free . "[1061-the maid] And yet says immediately after : " [[Ye]1052-servants masters]3659-ye masters , to the same things unto [them]1052-servants , forbearing threatening : knowing that [[your]1052-servants Master]3660-your master also is in [heaven]3661-heaven ; neither is there respect of [persons]3662-persons with [him]3660-your master . "[1061-the maid] And [I]0-i think that Master whom [Paul]130-paul served , not in preaching only , but also in practice , when [he]130-paul sent back [the slave Onesimus]1414-the slave onesimus to [Philemon]160-philemon , praying that [he]130-paul might be received , " no ' now as [a servant]246-a servant , but above [a servant]246-a servant , [a brother beloved]3665-a brother beloved , "[130-paul] that [Divine Master]161-divine master must have looked tenderly upon [these two women]907-these two women — [both women , though of such different age and position]1416-both women , though of such different age and position , and taught [them]907-these two women through [His]130-paul Spirit in [His]130-paul word , as only [He]130-paul can teach . The reading was disturbed by [a carriage driving up]1417-a carriage driving up to the door , and a knock , [a tremendously grand and forcible footman]1418-a tremendously grand and forcible footman 's knock , which made [Miss Leaf]92-selina start in [her]92-selina easy chair . " But it ca n't be [visitors to [us]907-these two women]3666-visitors to us . [We]907-these two women know [nobody]357-nobody . Sit still , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . "[92-selina] It was [a visitor]1419-a visitor , however , though by what ingenuity [he]130-paul found [them]907-these two women out remained , when [they]907-these two women came to think of it , a great puzzle . A card was sent in by [the dirty servant of [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones]1420-the dirty servant of mrs. jones , speedily followed by [a stout , bald headed , round faced man]1421-a stout , bald headed , round faced man — [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ought to write " gentleman"—in[1421-a stout , bald headed , round faced man] whom , though [she]92-selina had not seen [him]1421-a stout , bald headed , round faced man for years , [Miss Leaf]92-selina found no difficulty in recognizing [[the grocer]1422-the grocer 's prentice boy]1423-the grocer 's prentice boy , now [Mr. Peter Ascott]145-ascott , of [Russell Square]3-russell square . [She]92-selina rose to receive [him]1421-a stout , bald headed , round faced man : there was always a stateliness in [Miss Leaf]92-selina 's reception of [strangers]273-strangers ; a slight formality belonging to [[her]92-selina own past generation]1425-her own past generation , and to the time when [the Leafs]162-the leafs were a " county family . "[92-selina] Perhaps this extra dignity , graceful as it was , overpowered [the little man]1426-the little man ; or else , being [a bachelor]1427-a bachelor , [he]1426-the little man was unaccustomed to [ladies]514-ladies ' society : but [he]1426-the little man grew red in the face , twiddled [his]1426-the little man hat , and then cast a sharp inquisitive glance toward [her]92-selina . " [Miss Leaf]92-selina , [I]1426-the little man presume , [ma'am]3015-ma'am . [The eldest]3091-the eldest ? [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , give [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott a chair . "[1426-the little man] While doing so , and before [her]92-selina disappearance , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth took a rapid observation of [the visitor]1429-the visitor , whose name and history were perfectly familiar to [her]94-elizabeth . [Most small towns]1430-most small towns have [[their]1430-most small towns hero]1431-their hero , and [Stowbury]2-stowbury 's was [Peter Ascott]145-ascott , [[the grocer]1422-the grocer 's boy]1433-the grocer 's boy , [the little fellow who had gone up to [London]1-london to seek [his]145-ascott fortune]1434-the little fellow who had gone up to london to seek his fortune , and had , strange to say , found it . Whether by industry or luck — except that industry is luck , and luck is only another word for industry — [he]145-ascott had gradually risen to be [a large city merchant]1435-a large city merchant , a dry - salter [I]0-i conclude [it]1436-it would be called , with [a handsome house]1437-a handsome house , [carriage]1438-carriage , etc . [He]145-ascott had never revisited [[his]145-ascott native place]1439-his native place , which indeed could not be expected of [him]145-ascott , as [he]145-ascott had [no relations]1440-no relations , but , when asked , as was not seldom of course , [he]145-ascott subscribed liberally to [its]1439-his native place charities . Altogether [he]145-ascott was [a decided hero]1441-a decided hero in [the place]1442-the place , and though [people]3210-people really knew very little about [him]145-ascott , the less [they]3210-people knew the more [they]3210-people gossiped , holding [him]145-ascott up to [the rising generation]1444-the rising generation as a modern [Dick Whittington]163-dick whittington , and reverencing [him]145-ascott extremely as [one who had shed glory on [[his]145-ascott native town]1446-his native town]1445-one who had shed glory on his native town . Even [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had conceived a great idea of [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott . When [she]94-elizabeth saw [this little fat man]1447-this little fat man , coarse and common looking in spite of [his]1447-this little fat man good clothes and diamond ring , and in manner a curious mixture of pomposity and awkwardness , [she]94-elizabeth laughed to [herself]94-elizabeth , thinking what [a very uninteresting individual]1448-a very uninteresting individual it was about whom [Stowbury]2-stowbury had told so many interesting stories . However , [she]94-elizabeth went up to inform [Miss Selina]92-selina , and prevent [her]92-selina making [her]92-selina appearance before [him]145-ascott in the usual Sunday dishabille in which [she]92-selina indulged when [no visitors]1449-no visitors were expected . After [his]145-ascott first awkwardness , [Mr. Peter Ascott]145-ascott became quite at [his]145-ascott ease with [Miss Leaf]92-selina . [He]145-ascott began to talk — not of [Stowbury]2-stowbury , that was tacitly ignored by both — but of [London]1-london , and then of " [[my]145-ascott house in [Russell Square]3-russell square]3672-my house in russell square , "[145-ascott] " [[my]145-ascott carriage]3673-my carriage , "[145-ascott] " [my]145-ascott servants"—the[145-ascott] inconvenience of keeping [coachmen who would drink]1450-coachmen who would drink , and [footmen who would not clean the plate]1451-footmen who would not clean the plate properly ; ending by what was a favorite moral axiom of [his]145-ascott , that " wealth and position are heavy responsibilities . "[145-ascott] [He]145-ascott [himself]145-ascott seemed , however , not to have been quite overwhelmed by [them]1452-them ; [he]145-ascott was fat and flourishing — with an acuteness and power in the upper half of [his]145-ascott face which accounted for [his]145-ascott having attained [his]145-ascott present position . The lower half , somehow [Miss Leaf]92-selina did not like it , [she]92-selina hardly knew why , though [a physiognomist]1453-a physiognomist might have known . For [Peter Ascott]145-ascott had the underhanging , obstinate , sensual lip , the large throat — bull - necked , as it has been called — indications of that essentially animal nature which may be born with [the nobleman as with the clown]1454-the nobleman as with the clown ; which no education can refine , and no talent , though it may co - exist with it , can ever entirely remove . [He]145-ascott reminded one , perforce , of the rough old proverb ; " [You]3674-you ca n't make a silk purse out of a sow 's ear . "[145-ascott] Still , [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott was not [a bad man]1455-a bad man , though something deeper than [his]145-ascott glorious indifference to grammar , and [his]145-ascott dropped h's — which , to steal [some one]891-some one 's joke , might have been swept up in bushels from [[Miss Leaf]92-selina 's parlor]1457-miss leaf 's parlor — made it impossible for [him]145-ascott ever to be , by any culture whatever , [a gentleman]3465-a gentleman . [They]1459-they talked of [Ascott]145-ascott , as being the most convenient mutual subject ; and [Miss Leaf]92-selina expressed the gratitude which [[her]92-selina nephew]369-her nephew felt , and [she]92-selina earnestly hoped would ever show , toward [[his]369-her nephew kind godfather]1461-his kind godfather . [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott looked pleased . " Um — yes , [Ascott]145-ascott 's not [a bad fellow]3675-a bad fellow — believe [he]145-ascott means well : but weak , [ma'am]3015-ma'am , [I]145-ascott 'm afraid [he]145-ascott 's weak . Knows nothing of business — has no business habits whatever . However , [we]1459-they must make the best of [him]145-ascott ; [I]145-ascott do n't repent any thing [I]145-ascott 've done for [him]145-ascott . "[145-ascott] " [I]92-selina hope not , "[92-selina] said [Miss Leaf]92-selina , gravely . And then there ensued an uncomfortable pause , which was happily broken by the opening of the door , and the sweeping in of [a large , goodly figure]1462-a large , goodly figure . " [[My]1462-a large , goodly figure sister]3017-my sister , [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott ; [[my]1462-a large , goodly figure sister]3017-my sister [Selina]92-selina . "[1462-a large , goodly figure] [The little stout man]1463-the little stout man actually started , and , as [he]1463-the little stout man bowed , blushed up to the eyes . [Miss Selina]92-selina was , as [I]0-i have stated , the beauty of [the family]258-the family , and had once been [an acknowledged Stowbury belle]1465-an acknowledged stowbury belle . Even now , though nigh upon forty , when carefully and becomingly dressed , [her]92-selina tall figure , and [her]92-selina well featured , fair complexioned , unwrinkled face , made [her]92-selina still appear [a very personable woman]1466-a very personable woman . At any rate , [she]92-selina was not faded enough , nor [the city magnate]1467-the city magnate 's heart cold enough to prevent a sudden revival of the vision which — in what now seemed an almost antediluvian stage of existence — had dazzled , Sunday after Sunday , the eyes of [[the grocer]1422-the grocer 's lad]1469-the grocer 's lad . If there is one pure spot in [a man]628-a man 's heart — oven the very worldliest of [men]3062-men — it is usually [his]628-a man boyish first love . [So Peter Ascott]145-ascott looked hard at [Miss Selina]92-selina , then into [his]1463-the little stout man hat , then , as good luck would have it , out of the window , where [he]1463-the little stout man caught sight of [[his]1463-the little stout man carriage]1472-his carriage and horses . These revived [his]1463-the little stout man spirits , and made [him]1463-the little stout man recognize what [he]1463-the little stout man was — [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott , of [Russell Square]3-russell square , addressing [himself]145-ascott in the character of [a benevolent patron to [the Leaf family]3219-the leaf family]1473-a benevolent patron to the leaf family . " Glad to see [you]92-selina , [Miss.]164-miss. Long time since [we]3679-we met — neither of [us]3679-we so young as [we]3679-we have been — but [you]92-selina do wear well , [I]92-selina must say . "[92-selina] [Miss Selina]92-selina drew back ; [she]92-selina was within an inch of being highly offended , when [she]92-selina too happened to catch a glimpse of [the carriage]1127-the carriage and horses . So [she]92-selina sat down and entered into conversation with [him]145-ascott ; and when [she]92-selina liked , [nobody]357-nobody could be more polite and agreeable than [Miss Selina]92-selina . So it happened that [the handsome equipage]1477-the handsome equipage crawled round and round [the Crescent]30-the crescent , or stood pawing [the silent Sunday street]1478-the silent sunday street before [No . 15]1304-no . 15 , for very nearly an hour , even till [Hilary]101-hilary came [home]3045-home . It was vexatious to have to make excuses for [Ascott]145-ascott : particularly as [[his]145-ascott godfather]424-his godfather said with a laugh , that " [young fellows]3680-young fellows would be [young fellows]3680-young fellows , "[424-his godfather] [they]424-his godfather need n't expect to see [the lad]422-the lad till midnight , or till to - morrow morning . But though in this , and other things , [he]145-ascott somewhat annoyed [the ladies from [Stowbury]2-stowbury]1483-the ladies from stowbury , [no one]3371-no one could say [he]145-ascott was not civil to [them]1483-the ladies from stowbury — exceedingly civil . [He]145-ascott offered [them]1483-the ladies from stowbury [Botanical Garden]31-botanical garden tickets — Zoological Garden tickets ; [he]145-ascott even , after some meditation and knitting of [his]145-ascott shaggy grey eyebrows , bolted out with an invitation for [the whole family]415-the whole family to dinner at [Russell Square]3-russell square the following Sunday . " [I]145-ascott always give [my]145-ascott dinners on Sunday . [I]145-ascott 've no time any other day , "[145-ascott] said [he]145-ascott , when [Miss Leaf]92-selina gently hesitated . " Come or not , just as [you]92-selina like . "[145-ascott] [Miss Selina]92-selina , to whom the remark was chiefly addressed , bowed the most gracious acceptance . [The visitor]1429-the visitor took very little notice of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . " For [you]91-hilary must be aware , [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , that though [[your]91-hilary nephew]3526-your nephew 's allowance is nothing — a mere drop in the bucket out of [my]145-ascott large income — still , when it comes year after year , and no chance of [his]145-ascott shifting for [himself]145-ascott , [the most benevolent man in [the world]248-the world]3683-the most benevolent man in the world feels inclined to stop the supplies . " And [I]91-hilary trust , [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott , [[my]91-hilary nephew]3624-my nephew will soon cease to be an expense to [you]91-hilary . "[1493-i] The instant [he]1493-i was gone [Hilary]91-hilary burst forth — " If [I]91-hilary were [Ascott]145-ascott , [I]91-hilary 'd rather starve in [a garret]3696-a garret , break stones in [the high road]3697-the high road , or buy a broom and sweep a crossing , than [I]91-hilary 'd be dependent on [this man]3698-this man , [this pompous , purse - proud , illiterate fool]3699-this pompous , purse - proud , illiterate fool ! " Well , [Selina]92-selina ; and what is [your]92-selina opinion of [[our]3703-we stout friend]3705-our stout friend ? "[91-hilary] [Miss Selina]92-selina , bridling a little , declared that [she]92-selina did not see so much to complain of in [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott . And [his]145-ascott calling upon [them]1495-they so soon was most civil and attentive . " For [my]145-ascott part , [I]145-ascott shall go , though it is Sunday . [I]145-ascott consider it quite a religious duty — [my]145-ascott duty towards [[my]145-ascott neighbor]714-my neighbor . "[145-ascott] " Which is to love [him]145-ascott as [yourself]145-ascott . [I]91-hilary am sure , [Selina]92-selina , [I]91-hilary have no objection . "[91-hilary] Here [Hilary]91-hilary , breaking out into one of [her]91-hilary childish fits of irrepressible laughter , was startled to see [Selina]92-selina 's face in one blaze of indignation . " Hold [your]145-ascott tongue , [you]145-ascott silly chit , and do n't chatter about things [you]145-ascott do n't understand . "[91-hilary] But [Miss Selina]92-selina 's fits of annoyance were so common that [the sisters]3383-the sisters rarely troubled [themselves]3383-the sisters long on the matter . And when at tea - time [she]92-selina came down in the best of spirits , [they]3383-the sisters met [her]92-selina half - way , as [they]3383-the sisters always did , thankful for these brief calms in the family atmosphere , which never lasted too long . It was a somewhat heavy evening . [They]3383-the sisters waited supper till after ten ; and yet [Ascott]145-ascott did not appear . [Miss Leaf]92-selina read the chapter as usual ; and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was sent to bed , but still no sign of [the absentee]1499-the absentee . " [I]91-hilary will sit up for [him]145-ascott . [He]145-ascott can not be many minutes new , "[91-hilary] said [[his]145-ascott Aunt]428-his aunt [Hilary]91-hilary , and settled [herself]91-hilary in [the solitary parlor]1501-the solitary parlor , which one candle and no fire made as cheerless as could possibly be . There [she]91-hilary waited till midnight before [the young man]3100-the young man came in . "[3100-the young man] Months slipped by ; the trees in [Burton Crescent]21-burton crescent had long been all bare ; the summer cries of [itinerant vegetable dealers]1503-itinerant vegetable dealers and [flower sellers]1504-flower sellers had vanished out of the quiet street.—The [three sisters]1505-three sisters almost missed [them]1505-three sisters , sitting in [that one dull parlor]1506-that one dull parlor from morning till night , in the intense solitude of [people who , having neither heart nor money to spend in gayeties]1507-people who , having neither heart nor money to spend in gayeties , live forlorn in [[London]1-london lodgings]1508-london lodgings , and knowing [nobody]357-nobody , have [nobody to visit]1510-nobody to visit , [nobody]357-nobody to visit [them]1505-three sisters . Except [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott , who still called , and occasionally stayed to tea . The hospitalities , however , were all on [their]1505-three sisters side . The first entertainment — to which [Selina]92-selina insisted upon going , and [Johanna]93-johanna thought [Hilary]101-hilary and [Ascott]145-ascott had better go too — was splendid enough , but [they]1505-three sisters were [the only ladies present]1512-the only ladies present ; and though [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott did the honors with great magnificence , putting [Miss Selina]92-selina at the head of [his]145-ascott table , where [she]92-selina looked exceedingly well , still [the sisters]3383-the sisters agreed it was better that all further invitations to [Russell Square]3-russell square should be declined . [Miss Selina]92-selina [herself]92-selina said it would be more dignified and decorous . [Other visitors]1514-other visitors [they]1514-other visitors had none . [Ascott]145-ascott never offered to bring [any of [[his]145-ascott friends]1252-his friends]1515-any of his friends ; and gradually [they]1514-other visitors saw very little of [him]145-ascott . [He]145-ascott was frequently out , especially at meal times , so that [[his]145-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts gave up the struggle to make the humble dinners better and more to [his]145-ascott liking , and would even have hesitated to take the money which [he]145-ascott was understood to pay for [his]145-ascott board , had [he]145-ascott ever offered it , which [he]145-ascott did not . Yet still whenever [he]145-ascott did happen to remain with [them]1514-other visitors a day , or an evening , [he]145-ascott was good and affectionate , and always entertained [them]1514-other visitors with descriptions of all [he]145-ascott would do as soon as [he]145-ascott got into practice . Meantime [they]1514-other visitors kept [house]259-house as economically as possible upon the little ready money [they]1514-other visitors had , hoping that more would come in — that [Hilary]101-hilary would get pupils . But [Hilary]101-hilary never did . To any body who knows [London]1-london this will not be surprising.—The wonder was in [the Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf being so simple as to imagine that [a young country lady]1519-a young country lady , settling [herself]1519-a young country lady in lodgings in [an obscure metropolitan street]1520-an obscure metropolitan street , without [friends]893-friends or [introduction]1522-introduction , could ever expect such a thing . No thing but [her]1519-a young country lady own daring , and the irrepressible well - spring of hope that was in [her]1519-a young country lady healthy youth , could have sustained [her]1519-a young country lady in what , ten years after , would have appeared to [her]1519-a young country lady , as it certainty was , downright insanity . But Heaven takes care of [the mad]1523-the mad , [the righteously and unselfishly mad]1524-the righteously and unselfishly mad , and [Heaven]104-heaven took care of poor [Hilary]101-hilary . The hundred labors [she]101-hilary went through — weariness of body and travail of soul , the risks [she]101-hilary ran , the pitfalls [she]101-hilary escaped — what need to record here ? Many have recorded the like , many more have known [them]1525-them , and acknowledged that when such histories are reproduced in books how utterly imagination fades before reality . [Hilary]101-hilary never looked back - upon that time [herself]101-hilary without a shuddering wonder how [she]101-hilary could have dared all and gone through all . Possibly [she]101-hilary never could , but for the sweet old face , growing older yet sweeter every day , which smiled upon [her]101-hilary the minute [she]101-hilary opened the door of [that dull parlor]1526-that dull parlor , and made even No . 15 look like [home]3045-home . When [she]101-hilary told , sometimes gayly , sometimes with burning , bursting tears , the tale of [her]101-hilary day 's efforts and day 's failures , it was always comfort to feel [Johanna]93-johanna 's hand on [her]101-hilary hair [Johanna]93-johanna 's voice whispering over [her]101-hilary , " Never mind , [[my]93-johanna child]3717-my child , all will come right in time All happens for good . "[93-johanna] And the face , withered and worn , yet calm as [a summer sea]1528-a summer sea , full of the " peace which passeth all understanding , "[93-johanna] was a living comment on the truth of these words . Another comfort [Hilary]101-hilary had — Elizabeth.—During [her]101-hilary long days of absence , wandering from [one end of [London]1-london]1529-one end of london to the other , after advertisements that [she]101-hilary had answered , or [governess]1530-governess institutions that [she]101-hilary had applied to the domestic affairs fell almost entirely into the hands of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . It was [she]94-elizabeth who bought in , and kept a jealous eye , not unneeded , over provisions ; [she]94-elizabeth who cooked and waited , and sometimes even put a helping hand , coarse , but willing , into [the family]258-the family sewing and mending . This had now become so vital a necessity that it was fortunate [Miss Leaf]92-selina had no other occupation , and [Miss Selina]92-selina no other entertainment , than stitch , stitch , stitch , at the ever - beginning , never - ending wardrobe wants which assail decent poverty every where , especially in [London]1-london . " Clothes seem to wear out frightfully fast , "[101-hilary] said [Hilary]101-hilary one day , when [she]101-hilary was putting on [her]101-hilary oldest gown , to suit a damp , foggy day , when [the streets]1532-the streets were slippery with the mud of settled rain . " [I]101-hilary saw such beautiful merino dresses in [a shop in [Southampton Row]33-southampton row]3718-a shop in southampton row , "[101-hilary] insinuated [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ; but [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress shook [her]431-her mistress head . " No , no ; [my]431-her mistress old black silk will do capitally , and [I]431-her mistress can easily put on two shawls . [Nobody]357-nobody knows [me]431-her mistress ; and [people]3210-people may wear what [they]3210-people like in [London]1-london . Do n't look so grave , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . What does it signify if [I]431-her mistress can but keep [myself]431-her mistress warm ? Now , run away . "[431-her mistress] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth obeyed , but shortly reappeared with a bundle — a large , old fashioned thick shawl . " [Mother]296-mother gave [it]3722-it [me]1534-me ; [[her]296-mother mistress]431-her mistress gave it [her]296-mother ; but [we]3724-we 've never worn it , and never shall . If only [you]94-elizabeth did n't mind putting it on , just this once — this terrible soaking day ! "[1534-me] The scarlet face , the entreating tones — there was no resisting [them]1534-me . One natural pang [Hilary]101-hilary felt — that in [her]101-hilary sharp poverty [she]101-hilary had fallen so low as to be indebted to [[her]101-hilary servant]1535-her servant , and then [she]101-hilary too blushed , less for shame at accepting the kindness than for [her]101-hilary own pride that could not at once receive it as such . " Thank [you]94-elizabeth , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , "[101-hilary] [she]101-hilary said , gravely and gently , and let [herself]101-hilary be wrapped in the thick shawl . [Its]1536-its gorgeous reds and yellows would , [she]101-hilary knew , make [her]101-hilary noticeable , even though " [people]3210-people might wear any thing in [London]1-london . "[101-hilary] Still , [she]101-hilary put it on with a good grace , and all through [her]101-hilary peregrinations that day it warmed not only [her]101-hilary shoulders , but [her]101-hilary heart . Coming [home]3045-home , [she]101-hilary paused wistfully before [a glittering shoe shop]1538-a glittering shoe shop ; [her]101-hilary poor little feet were so soaked and cold . Could [she]101-hilary possibly afford a new pair of boots ? It was not a matter of vanity — [she]101-hilary had passed that . [She]101-hilary did not care now how ugly and shabby looked the " wee feet "[101-hilary] that had once been praised ; but [she]101-hilary felt it might be a matter of health and prudence . Suppose [she]101-hilary caught cold — fell ill — died : died , leaving [Johanna]93-johanna to struggle alone ; died before [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon came [home]3045-home . Both thoughts struck sharp . [She]101-hilary was too young still , or had not suffered enough , calmly to think of death and dying . " It will do no harm to inquire the price . [I]101-hilary might stop it out in omnibuses . "[101-hilary] For this was the way that every new article of dress had to be procured—"stopping it cut "[1540-the shopman] of something else . After trying several pairs - with a fierce , bitter blush at a small hole which the day 's walking had worn in [her]101-hilary well darned stockings , and which [she]101-hilary was sure [the shopman]1540-the shopman saw , as well as [an old lady who sat opposite — [Hilary]101-hilary bought the plainest and stoutest of boots]1541-an old lady who sat opposite — hilary bought the plainest and stoutest of boots . The bill overstepped [her]101-hilary purse by six pence , but [she]101-hilary promised that sum on delivery , and paid the rest . [She]101-hilary had got into a nervous horror of letting any account stand over for a single day . Look tenderly , [reader]1542-reader , on this picture of struggles so small , of sufferings so uninteresting and mean . [I]0-i paint it not because it is original , but because it is so awfully true . [Thousands of women , well born , well reared]1543-thousands of women , well born , well reared , know it to be true — burned into [them]1543-thousands of women , well born , well reared by the cruel conflict of [their]1543-thousands of women , well born , well reared youth ; happy [they]1543-thousands of women , well born , well reared if it ended in [their]1543-thousands of women , well born , well reared youth , while mind and body had still enough vitality and elasticity to endure ! [I]0-i paint it , because it accounts for the accusation sometimes made — especially by [men]3062-men — that [women]3061-women are naturally stingy . Possibly so : but in many instances may it not have been this petty struggle with petty wants this pitiful calculating of penny against penny , how best to save here and spend there , which narrows [a woman]669-a woman 's nature in spite of [herself]669-a woman ? It sometimes takes years of comparative ease and freedom from pecuniary cares to counteract the grinding , lowering effects of [a youth of poverty]1547-a youth of poverty . And [I]0-i paint this picture , too , literally , and not on its picturesque side — it , indeed , poverty has a picturesque side — in order to show another side which it really has — high , heroic , made up of dauntless endurance , self sacrifice , and self control Also , to indicate that blessing which narrow circumstances alone bestow , the habit of looking more to the realities than to the shows of things , and of finding pleasure in enjoyments mental rather than sensuous , inward rather than external . When [people]3210-people can truly recognize this [they]3210-people cease either to be afraid or ashamed of poverty . [Hilary]101-hilary was not ashamed:—not even now , when [hers]101-hilary smote sharper and harder than it had ever done at [Stowbury]2-stowbury . [She]101-hilary felt it a sore thing enough ; but it never humiliated nor angered [her]101-hilary . Either [she]101-hilary was too proud or not proud enough ; but [her]101-hilary low estate always seemed to [her]101-hilary too simply external a thing to affect [her]101-hilary relations with [the world outside]540-the world outside . [She]101-hilary never thought of being annoyed with [the shopkeeper]1550-the shopkeeper , who , though [he]1550-the shopkeeper trusted [her]101-hilary with the sixpence , carefully took down [her]101-hilary name and address : still less to suspecting [the old lady]1551-the old lady opposite , who sat and listened to the transaction — apparently [a well - to - do customer]1552-a well - to - do customer , clad in a rich black silk and handsome sable furs — of looking down upon [her]101-hilary and despising [her]101-hilary . [She]101-hilary [herself]101-hilary never despised any body , except for wickedness . So [she]101-hilary waited contentedly , neither thinking of [herself]101-hilary , nor of what [others]525-others thought of [her]101-hilary ; but with [her]101-hilary mind quietly occupied by the two thoughts , which in any brief space of rest always recurred , calming down all annoyances , and raising [her]101-hilary above the level of petty pains — [Johanna]93-johanna and [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . Under the influence of these [her]101-hilary tired face grew composed , and there was a wishful , far away , fond look in [her]101-hilary eyes , which made it not wonderful that [the said old lady]1554-the said old lady — apparently [an acute old soul in [her]101-hilary way]1555-an acute old soul in her way — should watch [her]101-hilary , as [we]1556-we do occasionally watch [strangers]273-strangers in whom [we]1556-we have become suddenly interested . There is no accounting for these interests , or to the events to which they give rise . Sometimes [they]1558-they are pooh - pooh - ed as " romantic , "[101-hilary] " unnatural , "[101-hilary] " like a bit in a novel ; "[101-hilary] and yet they are facts continually occurring , especially to [people of quick intuition , observation , and sympathy]1559-people of quick intuition , observation , and sympathy . Nay , [even the most ordinary people]1560-even the most ordinary people have known or heard of such , resulting in mysterious , life - long loves ; firm friendships ; strange yet often wonderful happy marriages ; sudden revolutions of fortune and destiny : things utterly unaccountable for , except by the belief in the inscrutable Providence which " Shapes [our]1556-we ends , [Rough]167-rough - how them as [we]1556-we will . "[1551-the old lady] When [Hilary]101-hilary left [the shop]1561-the shop [she]101-hilary was startled by a voice at [her]101-hilary elbow . " [I]101-hilary beg [your]101-hilary pardon , but if [your]101-hilary way lies up [Southampton Row]33-southampton row , would [you]101-hilary object to give [an old woman]3726-an old woman a share of that capital umbrella of [yours]101-hilary ? "[101-hilary] " With pleasure , "[101-hilary] [Hilary]101-hilary answered , though the oddness of the request amused [her]101-hilary . And it was granted really with pleasure ; for [the old lady]1551-the old lady spoke with those " accents of the mountain tongue "[1551-the old lady] which [this foolish Hilary]101-hilary never recognized without a thrill at the heart . " May be [you]101-hilary think [an old woman]3726-an old woman ought to take [a cab]3728-a cab , and not be intruding upon [strangers]273-strangers ; but [I]1551-the old lady am hale and hearty , and being only a streets length from [my]1551-the old lady own door , [I]1551-the old lady dislike to waste unnecessary shillings . "[1551-the old lady] " Certainly , "[101-hilary] acquiesced [Hilary]101-hilary , with a half sigh : shillings were only too precious to [her]101-hilary . " [I]101-hilary saw [you]101-hilary in [the boot shop]3730-the boot shop , and [you]101-hilary seemed [the sort of young lady who would do a kindness to an old body like [me]101-hilary]3731-the sort of young lady who would do a kindness to an old body like me ; so [I]101-hilary said to [myself]101-hilary , ' Ill ask [her]101-hilary . ' "[101-hilary] " [I]101-hilary am glad [you]101-hilary did . "[101-hilary] [Poor girl]1563-poor girl ! [she]101-hilary felt unconsciously pleased at finding [herself]101-hilary still able to show a kindness to any body . [They]1564-they walked on and on — it was certainly [a long street]1565-a long street 's length — to [the stranger]796-the stranger 's door , and it took [Hilary]101-hilary a good way round from [hers]796-the stranger ; but [she]101-hilary said nothing of this , concluding , of course , that [[her]101-hilary companion]1567-her companion was unaware of where [she]101-hilary lived ; in which [she]101-hilary was mistaken . [They]1564-they stopped at last before [a respectable house near [Brunswick Square]34-brunswick square]1568-a respectable house near brunswick square , bearing a brass plate , with the words " [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder . "[101-hilary] " That is [my]101-hilary name , and very much obliged to [you]1563-poor girl , [[my]101-hilary dear]3016-my dear . How it rains ! [Ye're]1563-poor girl just drenched . "[101-hilary] [Hilary]101-hilary smiled and shook [her]101-hilary damp shawl . " [I]101-hilary shall take no harm . [I]101-hilary am used to go out in all weathers . "[101-hilary] " Are [you]101-hilary [a governess]1488-a governess ? "[101-hilary] The question was so direct and kindly , that it hardly seemed an impertinence . " Yes ; but [I]101-hilary have [no pupils]3734-no pupils , and [I]101-hilary fear [I]101-hilary shall never get any . "[101-hilary] " Why not ? "[101-hilary] " [I]101-hilary suppose , because [I]101-hilary know [nobody]357-nobody [here]389-here . It seems so very hard to get teaching in [London]1-london . But [I]101-hilary beg [your]101-hilary pardon . "[101-hilary] " [I]168-miss balquidder beg [yours]101-hilary , "[168-miss balquidder] said [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder — not without a certain dignity—"for asking questions of [a stranger]488-a stranger . But [I]101-hilary was once [a stranger]488-a stranger [here]389-here [myself]101-hilary , and had a ' sair fecht , ' as [we]3740-we say in [Scotland]35-scotland , before [I]101-hilary could earn even [my]101-hilary daily bread . Though [I]101-hilary was n't [a governess]1488-a governess , still [I]101-hilary know pretty well what the sort of life is , and if [I]101-hilary had [[daughters]969-daughters who must work for [their]969-daughters bread]3743-daughters who must work for their bread , the one thing [I]101-hilary would urge upon [them]969-daughters should be—'Never become [a governess]1488-a governess . ' "[101-hilary] " Indeed . For what reason ? "[101-hilary] " Thank [you]101-hilary ! "[101-hilary] said [Hilary]101-hilary , not sufficiently initiated in [London]1-london caution to dread making a new acquaintance . Besides , [she]101-hilary liked the rough hewn , good natured face ; and the Scotch accent was sweet to [her]101-hilary ear . Yet when [she]101-hilary reached [home]3045-home [she]101-hilary was half shy of telling [[her]101-hilary sisters]302-her sisters the engagement [she]101-hilary had made . [Selina]92-selina was extremely shocked , and considered it quite necessary that the [London]1-london Directory , [the nearest clergyman]1571-the nearest clergyman , or , perhaps , [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott , who living in [the parish]1572-the parish , must know — should be consulted as to [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's respectability . " [She]168-miss balquidder has much more reason to question [ours]3746-ours , "[101-hilary] recollected [Hilary]101-hilary , with some amusement ; for [I]0-i never told [her]168-miss balquidder [my]0-i name or address . [She]168-miss balquidder does not know a single thing about [me]0-i . Which fact , arguing the matter energetic ally two days after , [the young lady]1573-the young lady might not have been so sure of , could [she]1573-the young lady have penetrated the ceiling overhead . In truth , [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder , [a prudent person , who never did things by halves , and , like [most truly generous people]1575-most truly generous people]1574-a prudent person , who never did things by halves , and , like most truly generous people , was cautious even in [her]168-miss balquidder extremist fits of generosity , at that very moment was sitting in [[Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones 's first floor]1576-mrs. jones 's first floor , deliberately discovering every single thing possible to be learned about [the Leaf family]3219-the leaf family . Nevertheless , owing to [Selina]92-selina 's indignant pertinacity , [Hilary]101-hilary 's own hesitation , and a dim hope of a pupil which rose up and faded like the rest , the possible acquaintance lay dormant for two or three weeks ; till , alas ! the fabulous wolf actually came to the door ; and [the sisters]3383-the sisters , after paying [their]3383-the sisters week 's rent , looked aghast at [one another]394-one another , not knowing where in [the wide world]1580-the wide world the next week 's rent was to come from . " Thank [God]105-god , [we]3383-the sisters do n't owe any thing : not a penny ! "[101-hilary] gasped [Hilary]101-hilary . " No ; there is comfort in that , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna . And the expression of [her]93-johanna folded hands and upward face was not despairing , even though that of [the poor widow]1581-the poor widow , when [her]93-johanna barrel of meal was gone , and [her]93-johanna cruse of oil spent , would hardly have been sadder . " [I]1581-the poor widow am sure [we]3383-the sisters have wasted nothing , and cheated nobody;—surely [God]105-god will help [us]3383-the sisters . "[1583-elder and younger] And [the two sisters]521-the two sisters , [elder and younger]1583-elder and younger , kissed [one another]394-one another , cried a little , and then sat down to consider what was to be done . [Ascott]145-ascott must be told how things were with [them]521-the two sisters . Hitherto [they]521-the two sisters had not troubled [him]145-ascott much with [their]521-the two sisters affairs : indeed , [he]145-ascott was so little at [home]3045-home . And after some private consultation , both [Johanna]93-johanna and [Hilary]101-hilary decided that it was wisest to let [the lad]422-the lad come and go as [he]145-ascott liked ; not attempting — as [he]145-ascott once indignantly expressed it—"to tie [him]145-ascott to [their]521-the two sisters apron strings . "[145-ascott] For instinctively [these maiden ladies]1587-these maiden ladies felt that with [men]3062-men , and , above all , [young men]3489-young men , the only way to bind the wandering heart was to leave it free , except by trying [their]521-the two sisters utmost that [home]3045-home should be always [a pleasant home]1334-a pleasant home . It was touching to see [their]521-the two sisters efforts , when [Ascott]145-ascott came in of evenings , to enliven for [his]145-ascott sake [the dull parlor at [No . 15]1304-no . 15]1592-the dull parlor at no . 15 . How [Johanna]93-johanna put away [her]93-johanna mending , and [Selina]92-selina ceased to grumble , and [Hilary]101-hilary began [her]101-hilary lively chat , that never failed to brighten and amuse [the household]277-the household . [[Her]101-hilary nephew]369-her nephew even sometimes acknowledged that wherever [he]369-her nephew went , [he]369-her nephew met [nobody]357-nobody so " clever "[101-hilary] as [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary . So , presuming upon [her]101-hilary influence with [him]369-her nephew , on this night , after [the rest]1597-the rest were gone to bed , [she]101-hilary , being always the boldest to do any unpleasant thing , said to [him]369-her nephew . " [Ascott]145-ascott , how are [your]369-her nephew business affairs progressing ? When do [you]369-her nephew think [you]369-her nephew will be able to get into practice ? "[101-hilary] " Oh , presently . There 's no hurry . "[101-hilary] " [I]101-hilary am not so sure of that . Do [you]369-her nephew know , [[my]101-hilary dear]3016-my dear boy"—and[101-hilary] [she]101-hilary opened [her]101-hilary purse , which contained a few shillings—"this is all the money [we]3749-we have in [the world]248-the world . "[101-hilary] " Nonsense , "[145-ascott] said [Ascott]145-ascott , laughing . " [I]369-her nephew beg [your]101-hilary pardon , "[369-her nephew] [he]369-her nephew added , seeing it was with [her]101-hilary no laughing matter ; " but [I]369-her nephew am so accustomed to be hard up that [I]369-her nephew do n't seem to care . It always comes right somehow — at least with [me]369-her nephew . "[369-her nephew] " How ? "[369-her nephew] " Oh , [I]101-hilary do n't exactly know ; but it does . Do n't fret , [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary . [I]101-hilary 'll lend [you]101-hilary a pound or two . "[101-hilary] [She]101-hilary drew back . [These poor , proud , fond women , who , if [[their]1598-these poor , proud , fond women , who , if their boy , instead of a fine gentleman , had been a helpless invalid boy]1159-their boy , instead of [a fine gentleman]1600-a fine gentleman , had been [a helpless invalid]1601-a helpless invalid]1598-these poor , proud , fond women , who , if their boy , instead of a fine gentleman , had been a helpless invalid , would have tended [him]1159-their boy , worked for [him]1159-their boy , nay , begged for [him]1159-their boy — cheerfully , oh , how cheerfully ! wanting nothing in [the whole world]361-the whole world but [his]1159-their boy love — [they]1598-these poor , proud , fond women , who , if their boy , instead of a fine gentleman , had been a helpless invalid could not ask [him]1159-their boy for [his]1159-their boy money . Even now , offered thus , [Hilary]101-hilary felt as if to take it would be intolerable . Still the thing must be done . " [I]101-hilary wish , [Ascott"—and]169-ascott"—and[101-hilary] [she]101-hilary nerved [herself]101-hilary to say what [somebody]3240-somebody ought to say to him—"I would [you]169-ascott"—and would not lend but pay [us]3751-us the pound a week [you]169-ascott"—and said [you]169-ascott"—and could so easily spare . "[3240-somebody] " To be sure [I]101-hilary will . What [a thoughtless fellow]3752-a thoughtless fellow [I]101-hilary have been ! But — but — [I]101-hilary fancied [you]169-ascott"—and would have asked [me]101-hilary if [you]169-ascott"—and wanted it . Never mind , [you]169-ascott"—and 'll get it all in a lump . Let [me]101-hilary see — how much will it come to ? [You]169-ascott"—and are the best head going for arithmetic , [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary . Do reckon it all up ? "[101-hilary] [She]101-hilary did so ; and the sum total made [Ascott]145-ascott open [his]145-ascott eyes wide . " Upon [my]145-ascott soul [I]145-ascott had no idea it was so much . [I]145-ascott 'm very sorry , but [I]145-ascott seem fairly cleaned out this quarter — only a few sovereigns left to keep [the mill]3753-the mill going . [You]169-ascott"—and shall have them , or half of them , and [I]145-ascott 'll owe [you]169-ascott"—and the rest . Here ! "[145-ascott] [He]145-ascott emptied on the table , without counting , four or five pounds . [Hilary]101-hilary took two , asking [him]145-ascott gravely " If [he]145-ascott was sure [he]145-ascott could spare so much ? [She]101-hilary did not wish to inconvenience [him]145-ascott . "[101-hilary] " Oh , not at all ; and [I]145-ascott would n't mind if it did ; [you]169-ascott"—and have been [good aunts]3754-good aunts to [me]145-ascott . "[145-ascott] [He]145-ascott kissed [her]101-hilary , with a sudden fit of compunction , and bade [her]101-hilary good - night , looking as if [he]145-ascott did not care to be " bothered "[145-ascott] any more . [Hilary]101-hilary retired , more sad , more hopeless about [him]145-ascott than if [he]145-ascott had slammed the door in [her]101-hilary face , or scolded [her]101-hilary like [a trooper]1604-a trooper . Had [he]145-ascott met [her]101-hilary seriousness in the same spirit , even though it had been a sullen or angry spirit — and little as [she]101-hilary said [he]145-ascott must have felt [she]101-hilary wished [him]145-ascott to feel — that [[his]145-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts were displeased with [him]145-ascott ; but that utterly unrepressible light - heartedness of [his]145-ascott — there was no doing any thing with it . There was so to speak , " no catching hold "[145-ascott] of [Ascott]145-ascott . [He]145-ascott meant no harm . [She]101-hilary repeated over and over again that [the lad]422-the lad meant no harm . [He]145-ascott had no evil ways ; was always pleasant , good - natured , and affectionate , in [his]145-ascott own careless fashion ; but was no more to be relied on than a straw that every wind blows hither and thither ; or , to use a common simile , a butterfly that never sees any thing farther than the nearest flower . [His]145-ascott was , in short , the pleasure - loving temperament , not positively sinful or sensual , but still holding pleasure as the greatest good ; and regarding what deeper natures call " duty , "[145-ascott] and find therein [their]1607-their strong - hold and consolation , as a mere bugbear or a sentimental theory , or an impossible folly . [Poor lad]1608-poor lad ! and [he]145-ascott had [the world]248-the world to fight with ; how would it use [him]145-ascott ? Even if no heavy sorrows for [himself]145-ascott or [others]525-others smote [him]145-ascott , [his]145-ascott handsome face would have to grow old , [his]145-ascott strong frame to meet sickness — death.—How would [he]145-ascott do it ? That is the thought which always recurs . What is the end of [such men as these]1611-such men as these ? Alas ! the answer would come from [hospital wards]1612-hospital wards , [alms - houses]1613-alms - houses and [work - houses]1614-work - houses , [[debtors]1615-debtors ' prisons and [lunatic asylums]1617-lunatic asylums]1616-debtors ' prisons and lunatic asylums . To apprehensions like this — except the last , happily it was as yet too far off — [Hilary]101-hilary had been slowly and sadly arriving about [Ascott]145-ascott for weeks past ; and [her]101-hilary conversation with [him]145-ascott to - night seemed to make [them]1618-them darken down upon [her]101-hilary with added gloom . As [she]101-hilary went up [stairs]3048-stairs [she]101-hilary set [her]101-hilary lips together hard . " [I]101-hilary see there is [nobody]357-nobody to do any thing except [me]101-hilary . But [I]101-hilary must not tell [Johanna]93-johanna . "[101-hilary] [She]101-hilary lay long awake , planning every conceivable scheme for saving money ; till at length , [her]101-hilary wits sharpened by the desperation of the circumstances , there flashed upon [her]101-hilary an idea that came out of a talk [she]101-hilary had had with [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth that morning . True , it was a perfectly new and untried chance — and a mere chance ; still it was right to overlook nothing . [She]101-hilary would not have ventured to tell [Selina]92-selina of it for [the world]248-the world , and even to [Johanna]93-johanna , [she]101-hilary only said — finding [her]93-johanna as wakeful as [herself]101-hilary — said it in a careless manner , as if it had relation to nothing , and [she]101-hilary expected nothing from it — " [I]101-hilary think , as [I]101-hilary have nothing else to do , [I]101-hilary will go and see [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder to - morrow morning . "[101-hilary] [[Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's house]1621-miss balquidder 's house was [a handsome one , handsomely furnished]1622-a handsome one , handsomely furnished , and [a neat little to aid - servant]1623-a neat little to aid - servant showed [Hilary]101-hilary at once into [the dining - parlor]1624-the dining - parlor , where [the mistress]3072-the mistress sat before a business - like writing - table , covered with letters , papers , etc . , all arranged with that careful order in disorder which indicates , even in the smallest things , the possession of an accurate , methodical mind , than which there are few greater possessions , either to [its owner]1626-its owner or to [the world at large]1627-the world at large . [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder was not [a personable woman]1628-a personable woman ; [she]168-miss balquidder had never been so even in youth ; and age had told [its]1629-its tale upon those large , strong features—"thoroughly Scotch features , "[1630-they] [they]1630-they would have been called by those who think [all Scotchwomen]1631-all scotchwomen are necessarily big , raw - boned , and ugly ; and have never seen that wonderfully noble beauty — not prettiness , but actual beauty in its highest physical as well as spiritual development — which is not seldom found across [the Tweed]36-the tweed . But while there was nothing lovely , there was nothing unpleasant or uncomely in [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder . [Her]168-miss balquidder large figure , in its plain black silk dress ; [her]168-miss balquidder neat white cap , from under which peeped the little round curls of flaxen hair , neither gray nor snowy , but real " lint - white locks "[168-miss balquidder] still ; and [her]168-miss balquidder good - humored , motherly look — motherly rather than old - maidish — gave an impression which may be best described by the word " comfortable . "—She[168-miss balquidder] was [a " comfortable "[1632-a " comfortable " woman] woman]1632-a " comfortable " woman . [She]168-miss balquidder had that quality — too rarely , alas ! in [all people]1633-all people , and rarest in [women going solitary down the hill of life]1634-women going solitary down the hill of life — of being able , out of the deep content of [her]168-miss balquidder own nature , to make [other people]560-other people the same . [Hilary]101-hilary was cheered in spite of [herself]101-hilary : it always conveys hope to [the young]1636-the young , when in sore trouble , if [they]1636-the young see [the old looking happy]1637-the old looking happy . " Welcome , [[my]669-a woman dear]3016-my dear ! [I]669-a woman was afraid [you]3016-my dear had forgotten [your]3016-my dear promise . "[669-a woman] " Oh no , "[101-hilary] said [Hilary]101-hilary , responding heartily to the hearty clasp of a hand large as [a man]628-a man 's , but soft as [a woman]669-a woman 's . " Why did [you]3016-my dear not come sooner ? "[669-a woman] More than one possible excuse flashed thro ' [Hilary]101-hilary 's mind , but [she]101-hilary was too honest to give it . "[168-miss balquidder] " There 's reason in it , too , "[101-hilary] said [Hilary]101-hilary , amused and drawn out of [herself]101-hilary by the frank manner and the cordial voice — [I]0-i use the adjective advisedly ; none the less sweet because its good terse English had a decided Scotch accent , with here and there a Scotch word . Also there was about [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder a certain dry humor essentially Scotch — neither Irish " wit "[168-miss balquidder] nor English " fun , "[168-miss balquidder] but Scotch humor ; a little ponderous perhaps , yet sparkling : like the sparkles from a large lump of coal , red - warm at the heart , and capable of warming [a whole household]1641-a whole household . As many a time it had warmed [the little household at [Stowbury]2-stowbury]1642-the little household at stowbury — for [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had it in perfection . Like a waft as from old times , it made [Hilary]101-hilary at once feel at [home]3045-home with [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder . Equally , [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder might have seen something in [this girl]1644-this girl 's patient , heroic , forlorn youth which reminded [her]168-miss balquidder of [her]168-miss balquidder own . Unreasoning as these sudden attractions appear , there is often a hidden something beneath which in reality makes them both natural and probable , as was the case here . In half an hour [these two women]907-these two women were sitting talking like [old friends]1646-old friends ; and [Hilary]101-hilary had explained [her]101-hilary present position , needs and desires . [They]907-these two women ended in the one cry — familiar to how many thousands more of [helpless young women!—"I]3774-helpless young women!—"i want work ! "[907-these two women] [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder listened thoughtfully . Not that it was a new story — alas ! [she]168-miss balquidder heard it every day ; but there was something new in the telling of it ; such extreme directness and simplicity , such utter want of either false pride or false shame , No asking of favors , and yet no shrinking from well - means kindness ; [the poor woman]1647-the poor woman speaking freely to [the rich one , recognizing the common womanhood of both]1648-the rich one , recognizing the common womanhood of both , and never supposing for an instant that mere money or position could make any difference between [them]907-these two women . The story ended , both turned , as was the character of both , to the practical application of it — what it was exactly that [Hilary]101-hilary needed , and what [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder could supply . "[168-miss balquidder] [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder then went on to explain , that finding , from [her]168-miss balquidder own experience , how great was the number , and how sore the trial of [young women who nowadays are obliged to work — obliged to forget that there is such a thing as the blessed privilege of being worked for]1673-young women who nowadays are obliged to work — obliged to forget that there is such a thing as the blessed privilege of being worked for — [she]168-miss balquidder had set [herself]168-miss balquidder , in [her]168-miss balquidder small way , to try and help [them]1674-them . [Her]168-miss balquidder pet project was to induce [educated women]1675-educated women to quit the genteel starvation of [governesships]1676-governesships for some good trade thereby bringing higher intelligence into [a class which needed , not the elevation of the work itself]1677-a class which needed , not the elevation of the work itself , which was comparatively easy and refined , but of [the workers]1678-the workers . [She]168-miss balquidder had therefore invested sum after sum of [her]168-miss balquidder capital in setting up [various small shops in [the environs of [London]1-london]1680-the environs of london]1679-various small shops in the environs of london , in [[her]168-miss balquidder own former line]1681-her own former line , and [others]525-others — [stationers]1683-stationers , [lace - shops]1684-lace - shops , etc.—trades which could be well carried on by women.—Into the management of these [she]168-miss balquidder put as many young girls as [she]168-miss balquidder could find really fitted for it , or willing to learn , paying [them]1674-them regular salaries , large or small , according to [their]1674-them deserts . " Fair work , fair pay ; not one penny more or less ; [I]168-miss balquidder never do it ; it would not be honest . [I]168-miss balquidder overlook each business [myself]168-miss balquidder , and it is carried on in [my]168-miss balquidder name . Sometimes it brings [me]168-miss balquidder in a little profit ; sometimes not . Of course , "[168-miss balquidder] [she]168-miss balquidder added , smiling . " [I]168-miss balquidder would rather have profits than losses ; still , [I]168-miss balquidder balance one against the other , and it leaves [me]168-miss balquidder generally a small interest for [my]168-miss balquidder money — two or three per cent . , which is all [I]168-miss balquidder care about . Thus , [you]3816-you see . [I]168-miss balquidder and [[my]168-miss balquidder young people]3817-my young people make a fair bargain on both sides ; it 's no charity . " [I]101-hilary think [I]101-hilary could do it , "[101-hilary] [she]101-hilary added . " [I]101-hilary think , with a little practice , [I]101-hilary really could keep [a shop]3782-a shop . "[1690-the good old lady] [They]1691-they parted quite like [friends]893-friends ; and [Hilary]101-hilary went out , walking quickly , feeling neither the wind nor the rain . Yet when [she]101-hilary reached [No . 15]1304-no . 15 [she]101-hilary could not bring [herself]101-hilary to enter , but took another turn or two round [the Crescent]30-the crescent , trying to be quite sure of [her]101-hilary own mind before [she]101-hilary opened the matter to [[her]101-hilary sisters]302-her sisters . — And there was one little battle to be fought which [the sisters]3383-the sisters did know . It was perhaps foolish , seeing [she]101-hilary did not belong to [him]1696-he in any open way , and [he]1696-he had no external right over [her]101-hilary life or [her]101-hilary actions , that [she]101-hilary should go back and back to the question , " What would [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon say ? "[1696-he] [He]1696-he knew [she]101-hilary earned [her]101-hilary daily bread ; sometimes this had seemed to vex and annoy [him]1696-he , but it must be done ; and when a thing was inevitable , it was not [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon 's way to say much about it . But being [a governess]1488-a governess was an accredited and customary mode of [a young lady]3593-a young lady 's earning [her]101-hilary livelihood . This was different . If [he]1696-he should think it too public , too unfeminine : [he]1696-he had such a horror of [a woman]669-a woman 's being any thing but [a woman]669-a woman , as strong and brave as [she]101-hilary could , but in a womanly way ; doing any thing , however painful , that [she]101-hilary was obliged to do , but never out of choice or bravado , or the excitement of stepping out of [her]101-hilary own sphere into [man]3369-man 's . Would [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon think less of [her]101-hilary , [Hilary]101-hilary , because [she]101-hilary had to earn to take care of [herself]101-hilary , to protect [herself]101-hilary , and to act in so many ways for [herself]101-hilary , contrary to the natural and right order of things ? That old order — God forbid it should ever [change!—which]170-change!—which ordained that [the women]3631-the women should be " [keepers]3833-keepers at [home]3045-home ; "[170-change!—which] [happy rulers of [that happy little world , which seemed as far off as [the next world]1705-the next world from [this poor Hilary]1706-this poor hilary]1704-that happy little world , which seemed as far off as the next world from this poor hilary]1703-happy rulers of that happy little world , which seemed as far off as the next world from this poor hilary . " What if [he]98-robert lyon should look down upon [me]101-hilary ? What if [he]98-robert lyon should return and find [me]101-hilary different from what [he]98-robert lyon expected ? "[101-hilary] And bitter tears burned in [her]101-hilary eyes , as [she]101-hilary walked rapidly and passionately along [the deserted street]1707-the deserted street . Then a revulsion came . " No ; love is worth nothing that is not worth every thing , and to be trusted through every thing . If [he]98-robert lyon could forget [me]101-hilary — could love any one better than [me]101-hilary — [me]101-hilary [myself]101-hilary , no matter what [I]101-hilary was — ugly or pretty , old or young , rich or poor — [I]101-hilary would not care for [his]98-robert lyon love . It would not be worth [my]101-hilary having ; [I]101-hilary 'd let it go . [Robert]98-robert lyon , though it broke [my]101-hilary heart , [I]101-hilary 'd let [you]98-robert lyon go . "[101-hilary] [Her]101-hilary eyes flashed ; [her]101-hilary poor little hand clenched itself under [her]101-hilary shawl ; and then , as a half reproach , [she]101-hilary heard in fancy the steady loving voice — which could have calmed [her]101-hilary wildest paroxysm of passion and pain—"You must trust [me]1709-a man to be trusted , [Hilary]101-hilary . "[1709-a man to be trusted] Yes , [he]1708-he was [a man to be trusted]1709-a man to be trusted . No doubt very much like [other men]1710-other men , and by no means such [a hero to [the world]248-the world at large as [this fond girl]1713-this fond girl made [him]1708-he out to be]1711-a hero to the world at large as this fond girl made him out to be ; but [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had , with [all people]1633-all people , and under all circumstances , the character of reliableness . [He]1708-he had also — [you]1715-you might read it in [his]1708-he face — a quality equally rare , faithfulness . Not merely sincerity , but faithfulness ; the power of conceiving one clear purpose , or one strong love — in unity of strength — and of not only keeping true to it at the time , but of holding fast to it with a single - minded persistency that never even takes in the idea of voluntary change , as long as persistency is right or possible . " [Robert]98-robert lyon , [Robert]98-robert lyon ! "[1716-this forlorn girl] sobbed [this forlorn girl]1716-this forlorn girl , as if slowly waking up to a sense of [her]1716-this forlorn girl forlorness , and of the almost universal fickleness , not actual falseness , but fickleness , which prevails in [the world]248-the world and among [mankind]1718-mankind . " O [Robert]98-robert lyon , be faithful ! faithful to [yourself]98-robert lyon — faithful to [me]91-hilary ! "[91-hilary] When [Miss Hilary]91-hilary reached [home]3045-home [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth opened the door to [her]94-elizabeth ; [the parlor]313-the parlor was deserted . " With [Mr. Peter Ascott]145-ascott ! "[101-hilary] [Hilary]101-hilary was a little surprised ; but on second thoughts [she]101-hilary found it natural ; [Selina]92-selina was glad of any amusement — to [her]92-selina , not only the narrowness but the dullness of [their]1722-their poverty was inexpressibly galling . " [She]307-the girl will be back to dinner , [I]101-hilary suppose ? "[101-hilary] " [I]94-elizabeth do n't know , "[94-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth briefly . Had [Miss Hilary]91-hilary been less preoccupied , [she]101-hilary would have noticed something not quite right about [the girl]307-the girl — something that at any other time would have aroused the direct question , " What is the matter , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? "[101-hilary] For [Miss Hilary]91-hilary did not consider it beneath [her]91-hilary dignity to observe that things might occasionally go wrong with [this solitary young woman]1724-this solitary young woman , away from [[her]1724-this solitary young woman friends]1725-her friends , and exposed to all the annoyances of [[London]1-london lodgings]1508-london lodgings ; that many trifles might happen to worry and perplex [her]1724-this solitary young woman . If [the mistress]3072-the mistress could not set them right , [she]3072-the mistress could at least give the word of kindly sympathy , as precious to " [a poor servant]838-a poor servant "[3072-the mistress] as to [the Queen on [her]1728-the queen on her throne throne]1728-the queen on her throne . This time , however , it came not , and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth disappeared below stairs immediately . [The girl]307-the girl was revolving in [her]307-the girl own mind a difficult ethical question . To - day , for the first time in [her]94-elizabeth life , [she]94-elizabeth had not " told [Miss Hilary]91-hilary every thing . "[307-the girl] Two things had happened , and [she]94-elizabeth could not make up [her]94-elizabeth mind as to whether [she]94-elizabeth ought to communicate them . Now [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had a conscience , by nature a very tender one , and which , from circumstances , had been cultivated into a much higher sensitiveness than , alas ! is common among [[her]94-elizabeth class]1730-her class , or , indeed , in any class . This , if an error , was [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's doing ; it probably caused [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth a few more miseries , and vexations , and painful shocks in [the world]248-the world than [she]94-elizabeth would have had had [she]94-elizabeth imbibed only the ordinary tone of morality , especially the morality of [ordinary domestic servants]1732-ordinary domestic servants ; but it was an error upon which , in summing up [her]94-elizabeth life , [the Recording Angel]1733-the recording angel would gravely smile . The first trial had happened at breakfast time . [Ascott]145-ascott , descending earlier than [his]145-ascott wo nt , had asked [her]94-elizabeth . Did [any gentleman , short and dirty , with a hooked nose]1734-any gentleman , short and dirty , with a hooked nose , inquire for [him]145-ascott yesterday ? [Ascott]97-ascott laughed . " So [he]1735-some person answering the above not too flattering description is — [a very particular friend]3836-a very particular friend ; but [[my]97-ascott aunts]3640-my aunts would not fancy [him]1735-some person answering the above not too flattering description , and [I]97-ascott do n't want [him]1735-some person answering the above not too flattering description to come here . Shall [you]3469-sir start before dinner ?
