"[97-ascott] And [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's anxious face , white with long wakefulness , had put out of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's head the answer that was coming ; indeed the matter slipped from [her]94-elizabeth mind altogether , in consequence of another circumstance which gave [her]94-elizabeth much more perplexity . During [[her]94-elizabeth young mistress]3353-her young mistress 's absence , supposing [Miss Selina]92-selina out too , and [Miss Leaf]92-selina up [stairs]3048-stairs , [she]94-elizabeth had come suddenly into [the parlor]313-the parlor without knocking . There , to [her]94-elizabeth amazement , [she]94-elizabeth saw [Miss Selina]92-selina and [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott standing , in close conversation , over the fire . [They]1742-they were so engrossed that [they]1742-they did not notice [her]94-elizabeth , and [she]94-elizabeth shut door again immediately . But what confounded [her]94-elizabeth was , that [she]94-elizabeth was certain , absolutely certain , [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott had [his]97-ascott arm round [Miss Selina]92-selina 's waist ! Now that was no business of [hers]94-elizabeth , and yet [the faithful domestic]1743-the faithful domestic was a good deal troubled ; still more so , when , by [Miss Leaf]92-selina 's excessive surprise at hearing of [the visitor who had come and gone , carrying [Miss Selina]92-selina away to [the city]1745-the city]1744-the visitor who had come and gone , carrying miss selina away to the city , [she]94-elizabeth was certain [the elder sister]3213-the elder sister was completely in the dark as to any thing going to happen in [the family]258-the family . Could it be a wedding ? Could [Miss Selina]92-selina really love , and be intending to marry , [that horrid little man]1748-that horrid little man ? For strange to say , [this young servant]1749-this young servant had , what many [a young beauty of rank and fashion]1750-a young beauty of rank and fashion has not , or has lost forever — the true , pure , womanly creed , that loving and marrying are synonymous terms ; that to let [a man]628-a man put [his]628-a man arm round [your]1752-you waist when [you]1752-you do not intend to marry [him]628-a man , or to intend to marry [him]628-a man for money or any thing else when [you]1752-you do not really love [him]628-a man , are things quite impossible and incredible to [any womanly mind]1753-any womanly mind . A creed somewhat out of date , and perhaps existing only in [stray nooks of [the world]248-the world]1754-stray nooks of the world ; but thank [God]105-god ! it does exist . [Hilary]101-hilary had it , and [she]101-hilary had taught it to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " [I]101-hilary wonder whether [Miss Hilary]91-hilary knows of this ? [I]101-hilary wonder what [she]91-hilary would say to it ? "[101-hilary] And now arose the perplexing ethical question aforesaid , as to whether [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ought to tell [her]94-elizabeth . It was one of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's doctrines — the same for [the kitchen]253-the kitchen as for [the parlor]313-the parlor , nay , preached strongest in [the kitchen]253-the kitchen , where the mysteries of [the parlor]313-the parlor are often so cruelly exposed — that a secret accidentally found out should be kept as sacred as if actually confided ; also , that the secret of [an enemy]1760-an enemy should no more be betrayed than that of [a beloved and trusting friend]1761-a beloved and trusting friend . " [Miss Selina]92-selina is n't [[my]94-elizabeth enemy]3841-my enemy , "[94-elizabeth] smiled [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth : " but [I]94-elizabeth 'm not overfond of [her]92-selina , and so [I]94-elizabeth 'd rather not tell of [her]92-selina , or vex [her]92-selina if [I]94-elizabeth can help it . Any how , [I]94-elizabeth 'll keep it to [myself]94-elizabeth for a bit . "[94-elizabeth] But the secret weighed heavily upon [her]94-elizabeth , and besides , [her]94-elizabeth honest heart felt a certain diminution of respect for [Miss Selina]92-selina . "[97-ascott] [He]97-ascott started up , and gave the fire a fierce poke , which consumed in five minutes a large lump of coal that [Hilary]101-hilary had hoped — oh , cruel , sordid economy — would have lasted half the evening . "[93-johanna] " To be sure , [we]258-the family must [Auntie]171-auntie . "[92-selina] " [I]92-selina mean , [[my]92-selina boy]3860-my boy , [we]258-the family must live honestly ; [we]258-the family must not run into debt : "[92-selina] and [her]92-selina voice sharpened as with the reflected horror of [her]92-selina young days — if , alas ! there ever had been any youth for [[Henry Leaf]97-ascott 's eldest daughter]1777-henry leaf 's eldest daughter . " No , [Ascott]97-ascott , out of debt out of danger . "[92-selina] [Ascott]97-ascott sprang up , coloring violently . " [You]101-hilary use strong language , [Aunt Johanna]93-johanna . Never mind . [I]97-ascott dare say [you]101-hilary are right . "[97-ascott] [He]97-ascott went away whistling , with that air of untroubled , good - natured liveliness peculiar to [Ascott Leaf]99-ascott , which made [them]1781-us say continually that [he]97-ascott was " only [a boy]384-a boy , "[1781-us] living [a boy]384-a boy 's life , as thoughtless and as free . When [his]97-ascott handsome face disappeared [the three women]1783-the three women sat down again round the fire . [They]1783-the three women made no comments on [him]97-ascott whatever ; [they]1783-the three women were [women]3061-women , and [he]97-ascott was [their]1783-the three women own . But — passing [him]97-ascott over as if [he]97-ascott had never existed — [Hilary]101-hilary began to explain to [[her]101-hilary sisters]302-her sisters all particulars of [her]101-hilary new scheme for maintaining [the family]258-the family . [She]101-hilary told these details in a matter of - fact way , as already arranged ; and finally hoped [Selina]110-selina would make no more objections . " It is a thing quite impossible , "[110-selina] said [Selina]110-selina , with dignity . " Why impossible ? [I]110-selina can certainly do the work ; and it can not make [me]110-selina less of [a lady]723-a lady . Besides , [we]3874-we had better not be [ladies]514-ladies if [we]3874-we can not be [honest ones]3876-honest ones . And , [Selina]110-selina , where is the money to come from ? [We]3874-we have none in [the house]344-the house ; [we]3874-we can not get any till Christmas . "[110-selina] " Opportunities might occur . [We]3874-we have [friends]893-friends . "[101-hilary] " Not one in [London]1-london ; except , perhaps , [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , and [I]101-hilary would not ask [him]97-ascott for a farthing . [You]110-selina do n't see , [Selina]110-selina , how horrible it would be to be helped , unless by [some one dearly loved]3879-some one dearly loved . [I]101-hilary could n't bear it ! [I]101-hilary 'd rather beg , starve : almost steal ! "[101-hilary] " Do n't be violent , [child]3052-child . "[110-selina] " Oh , but it 's hard ! "[101-hilary] and the cry of long - smothered pain burst out . " Hard enough to have to earn [one]585-one 's bread in a way [one]585-one does n't like ; harder still to have to be parted from [Johanna]93-johanna from Monday morning till Saturday night . But it must be , [I]101-hilary 'll go . It 's a case between hunger , debt , and work : the first is unpleasant , the second impossible , the third is [my]101-hilary only alternative . [You]110-selina must consent , [Selina]110-selina , for [I]101-hilary will do it . "[101-hilary] " Do n't ! "[110-selina] [Selina]110-selina spoke more gently , and not without some natural emotion . " Do n't disgrace [me]110-selina , [child]3052-child ; for [I]110-selina may as well tell [you]3052-child — [I]110-selina meant to do so to - night — [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott has made [me]110-selina an offer of marriage , and [I]110-selina — [I]110-selina have accepted it . "[110-selina] Had a thunder - bolt fallen in the middle of [the parlor]313-the parlor at [No . 15]39-no . 15 , [its inmates]1788-its inmates — that is , [two of [them]1788-its inmates]1789-two of them — could not have been more astounded . No doubt this surprise was a great instance of simplicity on [their]1788-its inmates part . [Many women]1790-many women would have prognosticated , planned the thing from the first ; thought it a most excellent match ; seen glorious visions of [the house in [Russell Square]3-russell square]1791-the house in russell square , of the wealth and luxury that would be the portion of " dear [Selina]110-selina , "[1790-many women] and the general benefit that the marriage would be to [the whole Leaf family]1792-the whole leaf family . But [these two]541-these two were different from [others]525-others . [They]1788-its inmates only saw [[their]1788-its inmates sister]1795-their sister [Selina]110-selina , [a woman no longer young]1796-a woman no longer young , and not without [her]110-selina peculiarities , going to be married to [a man [she]110-selina knew little or nothing about]1797-a man she knew little or nothing about — [a man whom [they]1788-its inmates [themselves]1788-its inmates had endured rather than liked , and for the sake of gratitude]1798-a man whom they themselves had endured rather than liked , and for the sake of gratitude . [He]1797-a man she knew little or nothing about was trying enough merely as [a chance visitor]1799-a chance visitor ; but to look upon [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott as [a brother - in - law]1800-a brother - in - law , as [a husband]353-a husband — " Oh , [Selina]110-selina ! [you]110-selina can not be in earnest ? "[110-selina] " Why not ? Why should [I]110-selina not be married as well as [[my]110-selina neighbors]3884-my neighbors ? "[110-selina] said [she]110-selina , sharply . [Nobody]357-nobody arguing that point , [both]1803-both being indeed too bewildered to argue at all , [she]110-selina continued , majestically , " [I]110-selina assure [you]110-selina , [sisters]3046-sisters , there could not be a more unexceptionable offer . It is true , [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott 's origin was rather humble ; but [I]110-selina can overlook that . In [his]97-ascott present wealth , and with [his]97-ascott position and character , [he]97-ascott will make the best of [husbands]1389-husbands . "[110-selina] Not a word was answered ; what could be answered ? [Selina]110-selina was free to marry if [she]110-selina liked , and whom [she]110-selina liked . Perhaps , from [her]110-selina nature , it was idle to expect [her]110-selina to marry in any other way than this ; one of the thousand and one unions where [the man]777-the man desires [a handsome , lady - like wife for the head of [[his]777-the man establishment]1806-his establishment]1805-a handsome , lady - like wife for the head of his establishment , and [the woman]694-the woman wishes [an elegant establishment]1808-an elegant establishment to be [mistress of]1809-mistress of ; so [they]1810-they strike a bargain — possibly as good as most other bargains . Still , with one faint lingering of hope , [Hilary]101-hilary asked if [she]110-selina had quite decided . " Quite . [He]145-ascott wrote to [me]110-selina last night , and [I]110-selina gave [him]145-ascott [his]145-ascott answer this morning . "[110-selina] [Selina]110-selina certainly had not troubled any body with [her]110-selina " love affairs . "[110-selina] It was entirely a matter of business . [The sisters]3383-the sisters saw at once that [she]110-selina had made up [her]110-selina mind . Henceforward there could be no criticism of [Mr. Peter Ascott]145-ascott . Now all was told , [she]110-selina talked freely of [her]110-selina excellent prospects . " [He]145-ascott had behaved handsomely — very much so . [He]145-ascott makes a good settlement on [me]110-selina , and says how happy [he]145-ascott will be to help [[my]110-selina family]3887-my family , so as to enable [you]3383-the sisters always to make a respectable appearance . "[110-selina] " [We]3888-we are exceedingly obliged to [him]145-ascott . "[110-selina] " Do n't be sharp , [Hilary]101-hilary . [He]145-ascott means well . And [he]145-ascott must feel that this marriage is a sort of — ahem ! condescension on [my]110-selina part , which [I]110-selina never should have dreamed of twenty years ago . "[110-selina] [Selina]110-selina sighed ; could it be at the thought of that twenty years ago ? Perhaps , shallow as [she]110-selina seemed , [this woman]1812-this woman might once have had some fancy , [some ideal man whom [she]110-selina expected to meet and marry]1813-some ideal man whom she expected to meet and marry ; possibly [a very different sort of man from [Mr. Peter Ascott]145-ascott]1814-a very different sort of man from mr. peter ascott . However , the sigh was but momentary ; [she]110-selina plunged back again into all the arrangements of [her]110-selina wedding , every one of which , down to the wedding - dress , [she]110-selina had evidently decided . " And therefore [you]101-hilary see , "[110-selina] [she]110-selina added , as it the unimportant , almost forgotten item of discussion had suddenly occurred to [her]110-selina , " it 's quite impossible that [[my]110-selina sister]3017-my sister should keep [a shop]3782-a shop . "[110-selina] But when [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott appeared next day in solemn state as [an accepted lover]1815-an accepted lover [he]145-ascott seemed to care very little about the matter . [He]145-ascott thought it was a good thing for every body to be independent ; did not see why [young women]3826-young women — [he]145-ascott begged pardon , [young ladies]3824-young ladies — should not earn [their]3826-young women own bread if [they]3826-young women liked . [He]145-ascott only wished that [the shop]1561-the shop were a little further off than [Kensington]40-kensington , and hoped the name of [Leaf]97-ascott would not be put over the door . "[145-ascott] " [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott is quite right ; [we]3893-we will end the subject , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna , with grave dignity while [Hilary]101-hilary sat with burning cheeks , thinking that , miserable as [the family]258-the family had been , it had never till now known real degradation . But [her]101-hilary heart was very sore that day . It the morning had come the letter from [India]11-india never omitted , never delayed ; [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon was punctual as clock - work in every thing [he]98-robert lyon did . It came , but this month it was a short and somewhat sad letter — hinting of failing health , uncertain prospects ; full of a bitter longing to come [home]3045-home , and a dread that it would be years before that longing was realized . " [My]98-robert lyon only consolation is , "[98-robert lyon] [he]98-robert lyon wrote , for once betraying [himself]98-robert lyon a little , " that however hard [my]98-robert lyon life out here may be , [I]98-robert lyon bear it alone . "[98-robert lyon] But that consolation was not so easy to [Hilary]101-hilary . That [they]1824-them two should be wasting [their]1824-them youth apart , when just a little heap of yellow coins — of which [men like [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott]1825-men like mr. ascott had such profusion — would bring [them]1824-them together ; and , let [trials]1826-trials be many or poverty hard , give [them]1824-them the unutterable joy of being once more face to face and heart to heart — oh , it was sore , sore ! Yet when [she]101-hilary went up from [the parlor]313-the parlor , where [the newly - affianced couple]1828-the newly - affianced couple sat together , " making - believe "[101-hilary] a [passion that did not exist , and acting out the sham courtship]1829-passion that did not exist , and acting out the sham courtship , proper for [the gentleman]3612-the gentleman to pay and [the lady]480-the lady to receive — when [she]101-hilary shut [her]101-hilary bedroom door , and there , sitting in the cold , read again and again [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon 's letter to [Johanna]93-johanna , so good , so honest ; so sad , yet so bravely enduring — [Hilary]101-hilary was comforted . [She]101-hilary felt that true love , in its most unsatisfied longings , its most cruel delays , nay , even its sharpest agonies of hopeless separation , is sweeter ten thousand times than the most " respectable "[101-hilary] of loveless marriages such as this . So , at the week 's end , [Hilary]101-hilary went patiently to [her]101-hilary work at [Kensington]40-kensington , and [Selina]110-selina began the preparations for [her]110-selina wedding . In relating so much about [[her]101-hilary mistresses]429-her mistresses , [I]0-i have lately seemed to overlook [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth . [She]94-elizabeth was [a person easy enough to be overlooked]1833-a person easy enough to be overlooked . [She]94-elizabeth never put [herself]94-elizabeth forward , not even now , when [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's absence caused the weight of housekeeping and domestic management to fall chiefly upon [her]94-elizabeth . [She]94-elizabeth went about [her]94-elizabeth duties as soberly and silently as [she]94-elizabeth had done in [her]94-elizabeth girlhood ; even [Miss Leaf]91-hilary could not draw [her]94-elizabeth into much demonstrativeness : [she]94-elizabeth was one of [those people who never " come out "[94-elizabeth] till they are strongly needed , and then — But it remained to be]1834-those people who never " come out " till they are strongly needed , and then — but it remained to be proved what [this girl]1644-this girl would be . Years afterward [Hilary]101-hilary remembered with what a curious reticence [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth used to go about in those days : how [she]94-elizabeth remained as old - fashioned as ever ; acquired no [London]1-london ways , no fripperies of dress or flippancies of manner . Also , that [she]94-elizabeth never complained of anything ; though the discomforts of [her]94-elizabeth lodging - house life must have been great — greater than [[her]94-elizabeth mistresses]429-her mistresses had any idea of at the time . Slowly , out of [her]94-elizabeth rough , unpliant girlhood , was forming that character of self - reliance and self - control , which , in all ranks , makes of [some women]1837-some women [the helpers]1838-the helpers rather than [the helped]1839-the helped , [the laborers]1840-the laborers rather than [the pleasure - seekers]1841-the pleasure - seekers ; [women whose constant lot it seems to be to walk on the shadowed side of life , to endure rather than to enjoy]1842-women whose constant lot it seems to be to walk on the shadowed side of life , to endure rather than to enjoy . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had very little actual enjoyment . [She]94-elizabeth made [no acquaintances]1843-no acquaintances , and never asked for holidays . Indeed [she]94-elizabeth did not seem to care for any . [Her]94-elizabeth great treat was when , on a Sunday afternoon , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary sometimes took [her]94-elizabeth to [Westminster Abbey]41-westminster abbey or [St. Paul 's]42-st. paul 's ; when [her]94-elizabeth pleasure and gratitude always struck [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress — may , even soothed [her]431-her mistress , and won [her]431-her mistress from [her]431-her mistress own many anxieties . It is such a blessing to be able to make [any other human being]1845-any other human being , even for an hour or two , entirely happy . Except these bright Sundays , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's whole time was spent in waiting upon [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , who had seemed to grow suddenly frail and old . It might be that living without [[her]91-hilary child]3364-her child six days out of the seven was a greater trial than had at first appeared to [the elder sister]3213-the elder sister , who until now had never parted with [her]94-elizabeth since [she]94-elizabeth was born ; or it was perhaps a more commonplace and yet natural cause , the living in [[London]1-london lodgings]1508-london lodgings , without even a change of air from room to [room]1849-room ; and the want of little comforts and luxuries , which , with all [Hilary]91-hilary 's care , were as impossible as ever to [their]1850-their limited means . For [Selina]110-selina 's engagement , which , as a matter of decorum , [she]110-selina had insisted should last six months , did not lessen expenses . Old gowns were shabby , and omnibuses impossible to the future [Mrs. Ascott]99-ascott of [Russell Square]3-russell square ; and though , to do [her]99-ascott justice , [she]99-ascott spent as little as to [her]99-ascott self - pleasing nature was possible , still [she]99-ascott spent something . " It 's the last ; [I]99-ascott shall never cost [you]3894-you any more , "[99-ascott] [she]99-ascott would say , complacently ; and revert to that question of absorbing interest , [her]99-ascott trousseau , an extremely handsome one , provided liberally by [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott . Sorely had this arrangement jarred upon the pride of [the Leaf family]3219-the leaf family ; yet it was inevitable . But no personal favors would [the other two sisters]1852-the other two sisters have accepted from [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , even had [he]97-ascott offered [them]1852-the other two sisters — which [he]97-ascott did not — save a dress each for the marriage , and a card for the marriage breakfast , which , [he]97-ascott also arranged , was to take place at [a hotel]1853-a hotel . So , in spite of the expected wedding , there was little change in the dull life that went on at [No . 15]1304-no . 15 . Its only brightness was when [Miss Hilary]91-hilary came [home]3045-home from Saturday to Monday . And in those brief glimpses , when , as was natural , [she]91-hilary on [her]91-hilary side , and [they]1856-they on [theirs]1856-they , put on [their]1856-they best face , so to speak , each trying to hide from [the other]3271-the other any special care , it so fell out that [Miss Hilary]91-hilary never discovered a thing which , week by week , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth resolved to speak to [her]91-hilary about , and yet never could . For it was not [her]94-elizabeth own affair ; it seemed like presumptuously middling in the affairs of [the family]258-the family . Above all , it involved the necessity of something which looked like tale - bearing and backbiting of [a person [she]94-elizabeth disliked]1859-a person she disliked , and there was in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth — [servant]3356-servant as [she]94-elizabeth was — an instinctive chivalrous honor which made [her]94-elizabeth especially anxious to be just to [[her]94-elizabeth enemies]1861-her enemies . [Enemy]1862-enemy , however , is a large word to use ; and yet day by day [her]94-elizabeth feelings grew more bitter toward [the person concerned]1863-the person concerned — namely . [Mr. Ascott Leaf]1864-mr. ascott leaf . It was not from any badness in [him]1864-mr. ascott leaf : [he]1864-mr. ascott leaf was [the sort of young man always likely to be a favorite with what would be termed [his]1864-mr. ascott leaf " inferiors]3895-the sort of young man always likely to be a favorite with what would be termed his " inferiors ; "[1864-mr. ascott leaf] easy , good - tempered , and gentlemanly , giving a good deal of trouble certainly , but giving it so agreeably that [few servants]1865-few servants would have grumbled , and paying for it — as [he]1864-mr. ascott leaf apparently thought every thing could be paid for — with a pleasant word and a handful of silver . But [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's distaste for [him]1864-mr. ascott leaf had deeper roots . [The principal one]1866-the principal one was [his]1864-mr. ascott leaf exceeding indifference to [[his]1864-mr. ascott leaf aunts]3135-his aunts ' affairs , great and small , from the marriage , which [he]1864-mr. ascott leaf briefly designated as a " jolly lark , "[1866-the principal one] to the sharp economies which , even with the addition of [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's salary , were still requisite.—None of these latter did [he]1864-mr. ascott leaf ever seem to notice , except when [they]1868-they pressed upon [himself]1864-mr. ascott leaf ; when [he]1864-mr. ascott leaf neither scolded nor argued , but simply went out and avoided [them]1868-they . [He]1864-mr. ascott leaf was now absent from [home]3045-home more than ever , and apparently tried as much as possible to keep [the household]277-the household in the dark as to [his]1864-mr. ascott leaf movements — leaving at uncertain times , never saying what hour [he]1864-mr. ascott leaf would be back , or if [he]1864-mr. ascott leaf said so , never keeping to [his]1864-mr. ascott leaf word . This was the more annoying as there were a number of people continually inquiring for [him]1864-mr. ascott leaf , hanging about [the house]344-the house , and waiting to see [him]1864-mr. ascott leaf " on business ; "[153-mrs. jones] and some of these occasionally commented on [the young gentleman]3610-the young gentleman in such unflattering terms that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was afraid [they]1868-they would reach the ear of [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones , and henceforward tried always to attend to the door [herself]94-elizabeth . But [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones was [a wide awake woman]1873-a wide awake woman . [She]153-mrs. jones had not let [lodgings]1187-lodgings for thirty years for nothing . Ere long [she]153-mrs. jones discovered , and took good care to inform [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth of [her]153-mrs. jones discovery , that [Mr. Ascott Leaf]1875-mr. ascott leaf was what is euphuistically termed " in difficulties . "[1875-mr. ascott leaf] And here one word , lest in telling [this poor lad]1876-this poor lad 's story [I]0-i may be supposed to tell it harshly or uncharitably , as if there was no crime greater than that which [a large portion of society]1877-a large portion of society seems to count as none ; as if , at the merest mention of the ugly word debt , [this rabid author]1878-this rabid author flew out , and made [all the ultra virtuous persons whose history is here told]1879-all the ultra virtuous persons whose history is here told fly out , like turkeys , after a bit of red cloth which is a very harmless scrap of red cloth after all . Most true , some kind of debt deserves only compassion . S. D. to the end of [their]1885-children in practice days]1882-the individuals , men or women , who , without any laxity of principle , are such utter children in practice , that they have to learn the value and use of money by hard experience , much as a child does , and are little better than children in all that concerns l. s. d. to the end of their days . But these are [debtors]1615-debtors by accident , not error . [The deliberate debtor]1889-the deliberate debtor , who orders what [he]1889-the deliberate debtor knows [he]1889-the deliberate debtor has no means of paying for ; [the pleasure loving debtor]1890-the pleasure loving debtor , who can not renounce one single luxury for conscience ' sake ; [the well - meaning , lazy debtor , who might make " ends meet , "]3896-the well - meaning , lazy debtor , who might make " ends meet , "[1889-the deliberate debtor] but does not , simply because [he]1889-the deliberate debtor will not take the trouble ; upon such as these it is right to have no mercy — [they]1885-children in practice deserve none . To which of these classes young Ascott Leaf belonged [his]1889-the deliberate debtor story will show . [I]0-i tell it , or rather let it tell itself , and point its own moral ; it is the story of [hundreds and thousands]1891-hundreds and thousands . That [a young fellow]3558-a young fellow should not enjoy [his]3558-a young fellow youth would be hard ; that it should not be pleasant to [him]3558-a young fellow to dress well , live well , and spend with open hand upon [himself]3558-a young fellow as well as [others]525-others , [no one]3371-no one will question . [No one]3371-no one would ever wish it otherwise . [Many a kindly spendthrift of twenty - one]1896-many a kindly spendthrift of twenty - one makes a prudent paterfamilias at forty , while [a man who in [his]1897-a man who in his twenties showed a purposeless niggardliness , would at sixty grow into the most contemptible miser alive twenties showed a purposeless niggardliness , would at sixty grow into [the most contemptible miser alive]1898-the most contemptible miser alive]1897-a man who in his twenties showed a purposeless niggardliness , would at sixty grow into the most contemptible miser alive . There is something even in the thoughtless liberality of youth to which one 's heart warms , even while [one]585-one 's wisdom reproves.—But what struck [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was that [Ascott]97-ascott 's liberalities were always toward [himself]97-ascott , and [himself]97-ascott only . Sometimes when [she]94-elizabeth took in a parcel of new clothes , while [others yet unpaid for]1900-others yet unpaid for were tossing in wasteful disorder about [[his]97-ascott room]1901-his room , or when [she]94-elizabeth cleaned indefinite pairs of handsome boots , and washed dozens of the finest cambric pocket - handkerchiefs , [her]94-elizabeth spirit grew hot within [her]94-elizabeth to remember [Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's countless wants and contrivances in the matter of dress , and all the little domestic comforts which [Miss Leaf]91-hilary 's frail health required — things which never once seemed to cross [the nephew]1902-the nephew 's imagination . Of course not , it will be said ; how could [a young man]1903-a young man be expected to trouble [himself]1903-a young man about these things ? But they do though . [Answer]174-answer , [[many a widow]1904-many a widow 's son]1905-many a widow 's son ; [many a heedful brother of [orphan sisters]1907-orphan sisters]1906-many a heedful brother of orphan sisters ; [many a solitary clerk]1908-many a solitary clerk living and paying [his]97-ascott way upon the merest pittance ; is it not better to think of [others]525-others than [one]585-one 's self ? Can [a man]628-a man , even [a young man]1903-a young man , find [his]628-a man highest happiness in mere personal enjoyment ? However , let [me]0-i cease throwing these pebbles of preaching under the wheels of [my]0-i story ; as it moves on it will preach enough for itself . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's annoyances , suspicions , and conscience - pricks as to whether [she]94-elizabeth ought or ought not to communicate both , came to an end at last . Gradually [she]94-elizabeth made up [her]94-elizabeth mind that , even if it did look like tale bearing , on the following Saturday night [Miss Hilary]91-hilary must know all . It was an anxious week ; for [Miss Leaf]91-hilary had fallen ill . Not seriously ; and [she]94-elizabeth never complained until [[her]94-elizabeth sister]559-her sister had left , when [she]94-elizabeth returned to [her]94-elizabeth bed and did not again rise . [She]94-elizabeth would not have [Miss Hilary]91-hilary sent for , nor [Miss Selina]92-selina , who was away paying a ceremonious prenuptial visit to [[Mr. Ascott]97-ascott 's partner 's wife]1914-mr. ascott 's partner 's wife at [Dulwich]43-dulwich . " [I]94-elizabeth do n't want any thing that [you]307-the girl can not do for [me]94-elizabeth . [You]307-the girl are becoming [a first rate nurse]3897-a first rate nurse . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , "[94-elizabeth] [she]94-elizabeth said , with that passive , peaceful smile which almost frightened [the girl]307-the girl ; it seemed as if [she]94-elizabeth were slipping away from [this world]1916-this world and all its cares into another existence . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth felt that to tell [her]94-elizabeth any thing about [[her]94-elizabeth nephew]369-her nephew 's affairs was perfectly impossible . How thankful [she]94-elizabeth was that in the quiet of [the sick - room]1918-the sick - room [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress was kept in ignorance of the knocks and inquiries at the door , and especially of a certain ominous paper which had fallen into [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones 's hands , and informed [her]153-mrs. jones , as [she]153-mrs. jones took good care to inform [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , that any day " [the bailiffs]3898-the bailiffs "[153-mrs. jones] might be after [[her]153-mrs. jones young master]1359-her young master . " And the sooner the whole set of [you]94-elizabeth clear out of [[my]153-mrs. jones house]3899-my house the better ; [I]153-mrs. jones am [a decent respectable woman]3900-a decent respectable woman , "[153-mrs. jones] said [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones , that very morning ; and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had had to beg [her]153-mrs. jones as a favor not to disturb [[her]94-elizabeth sick mistress]1921-her sick mistress , but to wait one day , till [Miss Hilary]91-hilary came [home]3045-home . Also , when [Ascott]97-ascott , ending with a cheerful and careless countenance [his]97-ascott ten minutes ' after breakfast chat in [[[his]97-ascott aunt]428-his aunt 's room]1924-his aunt 's room , had met [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth on the staircase , [he]97-ascott had stopped to bid [her]94-elizabeth say if any body wanted [him]97-ascott [he]97-ascott was gone to [Birmingham]8-birmingham , and would not be [home]3045-home till Monday . And on [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's hesitating , [she]94-elizabeth having determined to tell no more of these involuntary lies , [he]97-ascott had been very angry , and then stooped to entreaties , begging [her]94-elizabeth to do as [he]97-ascott asked , or it would be the ruin of [him]97-ascott . Which [she]94-elizabeth understood well enough when , all the day , [she]94-elizabeth — grown painfully wise , poor girl!—watched [a Jewish - looking man hanging about [the house]344-the house , and noticing every body that went in or out of [it]344-the house]1926-a jewish - looking man hanging about the house , and noticing every body that went in or out of it . Now , sitting at [Miss Leaf]91-hilary 's window , [she]94-elizabeth fancied [she]94-elizabeth saw [this man]3698-this man disappear into [the gin - palace opposite]1929-the gin - palace opposite , and at the same moment a figure darted hurriedly round [the street corner]1930-the street corner , and into the door of [No . 15]1304-no . 15 . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth looked to see if [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress were asleep , and then crept quietly out of [the room]3244-the room , shutting the door after [her]94-elizabeth . Listening , [she]94-elizabeth heard the sound of the latch - key , and of [some one coming stealthily up stairs]1934-some one coming stealthily up stairs . " Hollo!—Oh , it 's only [you]94-elizabeth , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . "[1934-some one coming stealthily up stairs] " Shall [I]94-elizabeth light [your]3698-this man candle , [sir]3469-sir ? "[94-elizabeth] But when [she]94-elizabeth did the sight was not pleasant . Drenched with rain , [his]3698-this man collar pulled up , and [his]3698-this man hat slouched , so as in some measure to act as a disguise , breathless and trembling — [hardly any body]1935-hardly any body would have recognized in this discreditable object [that gentlemanly young man]1936-that gentlemanly young man , [Mr. Ascott Leaf]1937-mr. ascott leaf . [He]3698-this man staggered into [[his]3698-this man room]1901-his room and threw [himself]3698-this man across the bed . " Do [you]3469-sir want anything , [Sir]3469-sir ? "[94-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , from the door . " No — yes — stay a minute . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , are [you]94-elizabeth to be trusted ? "[94-elizabeth] " [I]3698-this man hope [I]3698-this man am , [Sir]3469-sir . "[3698-this man] " [The bailiffs]3898-the bailiffs are after [me]94-elizabeth . [I]94-elizabeth 've just dodged [them]3898-the bailiffs . If [they]3898-the bailiffs know [I]94-elizabeth 'm here the game 's all up — and it will kill [[my]94-elizabeth aunt]589-my aunt . "[94-elizabeth] Shocked as [she]94-elizabeth was , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was glad to hear [him]3698-this man say that — glad to see the burst of real emotion with which [he]3698-this man flung [himself]3698-this man down on the pillow , muttering all sorts of hopeless self - accusations . " Come , [Sir]3469-sir , ' tis no use taking on so , "[94-elizabeth] said [she]94-elizabeth , much as [she]94-elizabeth would have spoken to [a child]504-a child , for there was something childish rather than [man]3369-man like in [Ascott]97-ascott 's distress . Nevertheless , [she]94-elizabeth pitied [him]3698-this man , with the unreasoning pity a kind heart gives to any creature , who , blameworthy or not , has fallen into trouble . " What do [you]3698-this man mean to do ? "[94-elizabeth] " Nothing . [I]3698-this man 'm cleaned out . And [I]3698-this man have n't [a friend]3907-a friend in [the world]248-the world . "[3698-this man] [He]3698-this man turned [his]3698-this man face to the wall in perfect despair . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth tried hard not to sit in judgment upon what the catechism would call [her]94-elizabeth " betters ; "[94-elizabeth] and yet [her]94-elizabeth own strong instinct of almost indefinite endurance turned with something approaching contempt from this weak , lightsome nature , broken by the first touch of calamity . " Come , it 's no use making things worse than they are . If [no body]3909-no body knows that [you]94-elizabeth are [here]389-here , lock [your]94-elizabeth door and keep quiet . [I]3698-this man 'll bring [you]94-elizabeth some dinner when [I]3698-this man bring up [Missis]134-missis ' tea , and not even [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones will be any the wiser . "[3698-this man] " [You]94-elizabeth 're a brick , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth — a regular brick ! "[3447-the young fellow] cried [the young fellow]3447-the young fellow , brightening up at the least relief . " That will be capital.—Get [me]3447-the young fellow a good slice of beef , or ham , or something . And mind [you]94-elizabeth , do n't forget!—a regular stunning bottle of pale ale . "[3447-the young fellow] " Very well , [Sir]3469-sir . "[3698-this man] The acquiescence was somewhat sullen , and had [he]3698-this man watched [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's face [he]3698-this man might have seen there an expression not too flattering . But [she]94-elizabeth faithfully brought [him]3698-this man [his]3698-this man dinner , and kept [his]3698-this man secret , even though , hearing from over the staircase [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones resolutely deny that [Mr. Leaf]97-ascott had been at [home]3045-home since morning , [she]94-elizabeth felt very much as if [she]94-elizabeth were conniving at a lie . With a painful , half - guilty consciousness [she]94-elizabeth waited for [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's usual question . " Is [[my]431-her mistress nephew]3624-my nephew come [home]3045-home ? "[431-her mistress] but fortunately it was not asked . — [Miss Leaf]91-hilary lay quiet and passive , and [[her]91-hilary faithful nurse]1944-her faithful nurse settled [her]91-hilary for the night with a strangely solemn feeling , as if [she]1944-her faithful nurse were leaving [her]91-hilary to [her]91-hilary last rest , safe and at peace before the overhanging storm broke upon [the family]258-the family . But all shadow of this storm seemed to have passed away from [him]3698-this man who was [its cause]1946-its cause . As soon as [the house]344-the house was still [Ascott]97-ascott crept down and fell to [his]97-ascott supper with as good an appetite as possible . [He]97-ascott even became free and conversational . " Do n't look so glum , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [I]97-ascott shall soon weather through . [Old Ascott]175-ascott will fork out ; [he]175-ascott could n't help it . [I]97-ascott 'm to be [[his]175-ascott nephew]3914-his nephew [you]94-elizabeth know . Oh , that was a clever catch of [Aunt Selina]110-selina 's . If only [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary would try another like it . "[97-ascott] " If [you]97-ascott please , [Sir]3469-sir , [I]97-ascott 'm going to bed . "[97-ascott] " Off with [you]94-elizabeth , then , and [I]97-ascott 'll not forget the gown at Christmas . [You]94-elizabeth 're [a sharp young woman]3916-a sharp young woman , and [I]97-ascott 'm much obliged to [you]94-elizabeth . "[97-ascott] And for a moment [he]97-ascott looked as if [he]97-ascott were about to make the usual unmannerly acknowledgment of civility from [a young gentleman]818-a young gentleman to [a servant maid]1949-a servant maid , viz . , kissing [her]1949-a servant maid , but [he]97-ascott pulled a face and drew back . [He]97-ascott really could n't ; [she]1949-a servant maid was so very plain . At this moment there came a violent ring , and " Fire ! "[1951-the sheriff] was shouted through the key - hole of the door . Terrified , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth opened it , when , with a burst of laughter , [a man]628-a man rushed in and laid hands upon [Ascott]175-ascott . It was [[the sheriff]1951-the sheriff 's officer]1952-the sheriff 's officer . When [his]97-ascott trouble came upon [him]97-ascott [Ascott]175-ascott 's manliness returned . [He]175-ascott turned very white , but [he]175-ascott made no opposition ; had even enough of [his]175-ascott wits about [him]175-ascott — or something better than wits — to stop [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones from rushing up in alarm and indignation to arouse [Miss Leaf]91-hilary . " No ; [she]91-hilary 'll know it quite soon enough.—Let [her]91-hilary sleep till morning . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , look here . "[97-ascott] [He]97-ascott wrote upon a card the address of [the place [he]97-ascott was to be taken to]1953-the place he was to be taken to . " Give [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary this . "[97-ascott] [He]97-ascott pulled [his]97-ascott hat over [his]97-ascott eyes , jumped into [the cab]1154-the cab , and was gone . The whole thing had not occupied five minutes . Stupefied , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth stood and considered what was best to be done . [Miss Hilary]91-hilary must be told ; but how to get at [her]91-hilary in the middle of the night , thereby leaving [[her]91-hilary mistress]431-her mistress to the mercy of [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones . It would never do . Suddenly [she]94-elizabeth thought of [Miss Balquidder.—She]1956-miss balquidder.—she might send a message . No , not a message — for [the family]258-the family misery and disgrace must not be betrayed to [a stranger]488-a stranger — but a letter to [Kensington]40-kensington . With an effort [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth composed [herself]94-elizabeth sufficiently to write one — [her]94-elizabeth first — to [[her]94-elizabeth dear]1959-her dear [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . " HONORED MADAM,—Mr . [Leaf]91-hilary has got [himself]91-hilary into trouble , and is taken away [somewhere]3919-somewhere ; and [I]91-hilary dare not tell [missis]652-missis ; and [I]91-hilary wish [you]94-elizabeth was at [home]3045-home , as [she]652-missis is not well , but better than [she]652-missis has been , and [she]652-missis shall know nothing about it till [you]94-elizabeth come.—Your obedient and affectionate servant , [ELIZABETH HAND]94-elizabeth . "[91-hilary] Taking [Ascott]175-ascott 's latch - key [she]94-elizabeth quitted [the house]344-the house and slipped out into the dark night , almost losing [her]94-elizabeth way among [the gloomy squares]1961-the gloomy squares , where [she]94-elizabeth met not a creature except [the solitary policeman]1962-the solitary policeman , plashing steadily along [the wet pavement]1963-the wet pavement . When [he]1962-the solitary policeman turned the glimmer of [his]1962-the solitary policeman bull 's eye upon [her]94-elizabeth [she]94-elizabeth started like [a guilty creature]1964-a guilty creature , till [she]94-elizabeth remembered that [she]94-elizabeth really was doing nothing wrong , and so need not be afraid of any thing . This was [her]94-elizabeth simple creed , which [Miss Hilary]91-hilary had taught [her]94-elizabeth , and it upheld [her]94-elizabeth , even till [she]94-elizabeth knocked at [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's door . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth answered , what [she]94-elizabeth had before determined to say , as sufficiently explaining [her]94-elizabeth errand , and yet betraying nothing that [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress might wish concealed . "[94-elizabeth] Now [the honest Scotswoman]1969-the honest scotswoman , as [she]1969-the honest scotswoman said , hated any thing underhand , but [she]1969-the honest scotswoman respected the right of [every human being]3126-every human being to maintain silence if necessary . [She]1969-the honest scotswoman looked sharply in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's face , which apparently re - assured [her]1969-the honest scotswoman , for [she]1969-the honest scotswoman said , not unkindly , " Very well , [child]3052-child , keep [[your]94-elizabeth mistress]3089-your mistress 's secrets by all means . " [You]94-elizabeth are [a good , mindful girl]3937-a good , mindful girl , "[168-miss balquidder] said [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder . " How did [you]94-elizabeth learn to be so sensible ? "[168-miss balquidder] At the kindly word and manner , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , bewildered and exhausted with the excitement [she]94-elizabeth had gone through , and agitated by the feeling of having , for the first time in [her]94-elizabeth life , to act on [her]94-elizabeth own responsibility , gave way a little . [She]94-elizabeth did not exactly cry , but [she]94-elizabeth was very near it .
