"[168-miss balquidder] " Yes , [ma'am]3015-ma'am . "[168-miss balquidder] And following [David]177-david 's gray head , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , for the first time since [she]94-elizabeth came to [London]1-london , took a comfortable meal in [a comfortable kitchen]1972-a comfortable kitchen , seasoned with such stories of [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's goodness and generosity , that when , an hour after , [she]94-elizabeth went [home]3045-home and to sleep , it was with a quieter and more hopeful than [she]94-elizabeth could have believed possible under the circumstances . Next morning , while with that cheerful , unanxious countenance which [those about an invalid]1974-those about an invalid must learn continually to wear , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was trying to persuade [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress not to rise , [she]94-elizabeth heard a knock , and made some excuse for escaping . [She]94-elizabeth well knew what it was and who had come . There , in [the parlor]313-the parlor , sat [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones talking at [her]91-hilary rather than to [her]91-hilary , for [she]91-hilary hardly seemed to hear . But that [she]91-hilary had heard every thing was clear enough . [Her]91-hilary drawn white face , the tight clasp of [her]91-hilary hands , showed that the ill tidings had struck [her]91-hilary hard . " Go away , [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones , "[94-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , fiercely . " [Miss Hilary]91-hilary will call when [she]91-hilary wants [you]694-the woman . "[94-elizabeth] And with an ingenious movement that just fell short of a push , somehow [the woman]694-the woman was got on the other side of the parlor door , which [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth immediately shut . Then [Miss Hilary]91-hilary stretched [her]91-hilary hands across the table and looked up piteously in [[her]91-hilary servant]1535-her servant 's face . Only [a servant]246-a servant ; only [that poor servant to whom [she]94-elizabeth could look for any comfort in this sore trouble]1980-that poor servant to whom she could look for any comfort in this sore trouble , this bitter humiliation . There was no attempt at disguise or concealment between [mistress]278-mistress and [maid]3315-maid . " [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones has told [me]246-a servant every thing , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . How is [[my]246-a servant sister]3017-my sister ? [She]3017-my sister does not know ? "[246-a servant] " No ; and [I]246-a servant think [she]3017-my sister is a good deal better this morning . [She]3017-my sister has been very bad all week ; only [she]153-mrs. jones would not let [me]246-a servant send for [you]94-elizabeth . [She]3017-my sister is really getting well now ; [I]246-a servant 'm sure of that ! "[246-a servant] " Thank [God]105-god ! "[246-a servant] And then [Miss Hilary]91-hilary began to weep . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth also was thankful , even for those tears , for [she]94-elizabeth had been perplexed by the hard , dry - eyed look of misery , deeper than anything [she]94-elizabeth could comprehend , or than the circumstances seemed to warrant . It was deeper . The misery was not only [Ascott]175-ascott 's arrest ; [many a lad]1983-many a lad has got into debt and got out again — the first taste of the law proving a warning to [him]1983-many a lad for life ; but it was this ominous " beginning of the end . "[175-ascott] The fatal end — which seemed to overhang like a hereditary cloud , to taint as with hereditary disease , [the Leaf family]3219-the leaf family . Another bitterness ( and who shall blame it , for when love is really love , have not [the lovers]1985-the lovers a right to be [one another]394-one another 's first thought?)—what would [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon say ? To [his]98-robert lyon honest Scotch nature poverty was nothing ; honor every thing . [She]94-elizabeth knew [his]98-robert lyon horror of debt was even equal to [her]94-elizabeth own . This , and [her]94-elizabeth belief in [his]98-robert lyon freedom from all false pride , had sustained [her]94-elizabeth against many doubts lest [he]98-robert lyon might think the less of [her]94-elizabeth because of [her]94-elizabeth present position — might feel ashamed could [he]98-robert lyon see [her]94-elizabeth sitting at [her]94-elizabeth ledger in that high desk , or even occasionally serving in [the shop]1561-the shop . Many a time things [she]94-elizabeth would have passed over lightly on [her]94-elizabeth own account [she]94-elizabeth had felt on [his]98-robert lyon ; felt how [they]1988-they would annoy and vex [him]98-robert lyon . The exquisitely natural thought which [Tennyson]178-tennyson has put into poetry — " If [I]178-tennyson am dear to [some one else]3946-some one else , Then [I]178-tennyson should be to [myself]178-tennyson more dear "[178-tennyson] — had often come , prosaically enough perhaps , into [her]94-elizabeth head , and prevented [her]94-elizabeth from spoiling [her]94-elizabeth little hands with unnecessarily rough work , or carelessly passing down [ill streets]1989-ill streets and by - ways , where [she]94-elizabeth knew [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , had [he]98-robert lyon been in [London]1-london , would never have allowed [her]94-elizabeth to go . Now what did such things signify ? What need of taking care of [herself]94-elizabeth ? These were all superficial , external disgraces , the real disgrace was within . The plague - spot had burst out anew ; it seemed as if this day were the recommencement of that bitter life of penury , misery , and humiliation , familiar through three generations to [the women of [the Leaf family]3219-the leaf family]1990-the women of the leaf family . It appeared like a fate . No use to try and struggle out of it , stretching [her]94-elizabeth arms up to [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon 's tender , honest , steadfast heart , there to be sheltered , taken care of , and made happy . No happiness for [her]94-elizabeth ! Nothing but to go on enduring and enduring to the end . Such was [Hilary]91-hilary 's first emotion ; morbid perhaps , yet excusable . It might have lasted longer — though in [her]94-elizabeth healthy nature it could not have lasted very long — had not the reaction come , suddenly and completely , by the opening of the parlor door , and the appearance of [Miss Leaf]91-hilary . [Miss Leaf]91-hilary — pale , indeed ; but neither alarmed nor agitated , who hearing somehow that [[her]91-hilary child]3364-her child had arrived , had hastily dressed [herself]91-hilary , and come down [stairs]3048-stairs , in order not to frighten [Hilary]91-hilary . And as [she]91-hilary took [her]3364-her child in [her]91-hilary arms , and kissed [her]3364-her child with those mother - like kisses , which were the sweetest [Hilary]91-hilary had as yet ever known — the sharp anguish went out of [the poor girl]1994-the poor girl 's heart . " Oh , [Johanna]93-johanna ! [I]1994-the poor girl can bear any thing as long as [I]1994-the poor girl have [you]93-johanna "[1994-the poor girl] And so in this simple and natural way the miserable secret about [Ascott]175-ascott came out . Being once out , it did not seem half so dreadful ; nor was its effect nearly so serious as [Miss Hilary]91-hilary and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had feared.—Miss [Leaf]91-hilary bore it wonderfully ; [she]91-hilary might almost have known it beforehand ; [they]1995-they would have thought [she]91-hilary had , but that [she]91-hilary said decidedly [she]91-hilary had not . " Still [you]94-elizabeth need not have minded telling [me]94-elizabeth ; though it was very good and thoughtful of [you]94-elizabeth [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [You]94-elizabeth have gone through a great deal for [our]1995-they sakes , [[my]94-elizabeth poor girl]3947-my poor girl . "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth burst into [one smothered sob the first and the last]1996-one smothered sob the first and the last . " Nay , "[91-hilary] said [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , very kindly ; for this unwonted emotion in [[their]1995-they servant]983-their servant moved [them]1995-they both . " [You]94-elizabeth shall tell [me]91-hilary the rest another time . Go down now , and get [Miss Hilary]91-hilary some breakfast . "[91-hilary] When [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had departed [the sisters]3383-the sisters turned to [one another]394-one another . [They]3383-the sisters did not talk much ; where was the use of it ? [They]3383-the sisters both knew the worst , both as to facts and fears . " What must be done . [Johanna]93-johanna ? "[93-johanna] [Johanna]93-johanna , after a long pause , said , " [I]93-johanna see but one thing — to get [him]3947-my poor girl [home]3045-home . "[93-johanna] [Hilary]91-hilary started up , and walked to and fro along [the room]3244-the room . " No , not that . [I]91-hilary will never agree to it.—We can not help [him]3947-my poor girl . [He]3947-my poor girl does not deserve helping . If the debts were for food now , or any necessaries ; but for mere luxuries , mere fine clothes ; it is [[his]3947-my poor girl tailor]3949-his tailor who has arrested [him]3947-my poor girl , [you]93-johanna know . [I]91-hilary would rather have gone in rags ! [I]91-hilary would rather see [us]3383-the sisters all in rags!—It 's mean , selfish , cowardly , and [I]91-hilary despise [him]3947-my poor girl for it . Though [he]3947-my poor girl is [my]91-hilary own flesh and blood , [I]91-hilary despise [him]3947-my poor girl . "[91-hilary] " [Hilary]91-hilary ! "[93-johanna] " No . "[91-hilary] and the tears burst from [her]91-hilary angry eyes , " [I]93-johanna do n't mean that [I]93-johanna despise [him]3947-my poor girl . [I]93-johanna 'm sorry for [him]3947-my poor girl : there is good in [him]3947-my poor girl , [poor dear lad]3950-poor dear lad ; but [I]93-johanna despise [his]3947-my poor girl weakness ; [I]93-johanna feel fierce to think how much it will cost [us]3383-the sisters all , and especially [you]91-hilary , [Johanna]93-johanna . Only think what comforts of all sorts that thirty pounds would have brought to [you]91-hilary ! "[93-johanna] " [God]105-god will provide , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna , earnestly . " But [I]93-johanna know , [[my]93-johanna dear]3016-my dear , this is sharper to [you]91-hilary than to [me]93-johanna . Besides , [I]93-johanna have been more used to it . "[93-johanna] [She]93-johanna closed [her]93-johanna eyes , with a half shudder , as if living over again the old days — when [[Henry Leaf]97-ascott 's wife]2001-henry leaf 's wife and [eldest daughter]2002-eldest daughter used to have to give dinner parties upon food that stuck in [their]2003-they throats , as if every morsel had been stolen ; which in truth it was , and yet [they]2003-they were helpless , [innocent thieves]2004-innocent thieves ; when [they]2003-they and [the children]3181-the children had to wear clothes that seemed to poison [them]2003-they like the shirt of [Dejanira]179-dejanira ; when [they]2003-they durst not walk along [special streets]2006-special streets , nor pass [particular shops]2007-particular shops , for the feeling that [the shop people]2008-the shop people must be staring , and pointing , and jibing at [them]2008-the shop people , " Pay [me]91-hilary what [thou]3952-thou owest ! "[91-hilary] " But things can not again be so bad as those days , [Hilary]91-hilary . [Ascott]97-ascott is young ; [he]97-ascott may mend . [People]3210-people can mend , [[my]91-hilary child]3717-my child ; and [he]97-ascott had such a different bringing up from what [[his]97-ascott father]404-his father had , and [[his]97-ascott grandfather]1660-his grandfather , too . [We]3957-we must not be hopeless yet . [You]91-hilary see , "[91-hilary] and making [Hilary]91-hilary kneel down before [her]91-hilary , [she]91-hilary took [her]91-hilary by both hands , as if to impart something of [her]91-hilary own quietness to this poor heart , struggling as [young , honest , upright hearts]2009-young , honest , upright hearts do struggle with something which [their]2009-young , honest , upright hearts whole nature revolts against , and loathes , and scorns—"you see , [the boy]375-the boy is [[our]3957-we boy]3959-our boy ; [our]3957-we own flesh and blood . [We]3957-we were very foolish to let [him]375-the boy away from [us]3957-we for so long . [We]3957-we might have made [him]375-the boy better if [we]3957-we had kept [him]375-the boy at [Stowbury]2-stowbury . But [he]375-the boy is young ; that is [my]91-hilary hope of [him]375-the boy ; and [he]375-the boy was always fond of [[his]375-the boy aunts]3135-his aunts , and is still , [I]91-hilary think . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary smiled sadly . " [Deeds]180-deeds , not words [I]91-hilary do n't believe in words . "[91-hilary] " Well , let [us]3957-we put aside believing , and only act . Let [us]3957-we give [him]375-the boy another chance . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary shook [her]91-hilary head . " Another , and another , and another — it will be always the same . [I]91-hilary know it will . [I]91-hilary ca n't tell how it is , [Johanna]93-johanna ; but whenever [I]91-hilary look at [you]93-johanna , [I]91-hilary feel so stern and hard to [Ascott]97-ascott . It seems as if there were circumstances when pity to [some]3961-some , to one , was wicked injustice to [others]525-others : as if there were times when it is right and needful to lop off , at once and forever , a rotten branch rather than let the whole tree go to rack and ruin . [I]91-hilary would do it ! [I]91-hilary should think [myself]91-hilary justified in doing it . "[91-hilary] " But not just yet . [He]375-the boy is only [a boy]384-a boy — [[our]2010-the two women own boy]3964-our own boy . "[91-hilary] And [the two women]2010-the two women , in both of whom the maternal passion existed strong and deep , yet in the one never had found , and in the other never might find , its natural channel , wept together over [this lad]2011-this lad , almost as [mothers]512-mothers weep . " But what can [we]2010-the two women do ? "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary at last . " Thirty pounds , and not a halfpenny to pay it with ; must [we]2010-the two women borrow ? "[91-hilary] " Oh no — no , "[91-hilary] was the answer , with a shrinking gesture ; " no borrowing . There is the diamond ring . "[91-hilary] This was a sort of heir - loom from [eldest daughter]2002-eldest daughter to [eldest daughter of [the Leaf family]3219-the leaf family]2014-eldest daughter of the leaf family which had been kept even as a sort of superstition , through all temptations of poverty.—The last time [Miss Leaf]91-hilary looked at it [she]91-hilary had remarked , jestingly , it should be given some day to [that important personage talked of]2016-that important personage talked of for many a year among [the three aunts]2017-the three aunts — [Mrs. Ascott Leaf]99-ascott . " Who must do without it now , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna , looking regretfully at the ring ; " that is , if [he]2011-this lad ever takes to [himself]2011-this lad [a wife]3811-a wife , [poor boy]3966-poor boy . "[93-johanna] [Hilary]91-hilary answered , beneath [her]91-hilary breath , " Unless [he]2011-this lad alters , [I]91-hilary earnestly hope [he]2011-this lad never may . "[91-hilary] And there came over [her]91-hilary involuntarily a wild , despairing thought , Would it not be better that neither [Ascott]99-ascott nor [herself]91-hilary should ever be married , that [the family]258-the family might die out , and trouble [the world]248-the world no more ? Nevertheless [she]91-hilary rose up to do what [she]91-hilary knew had to be done , and what there was [nobody]357-nobody to do but [herself]91-hilary . " Do n't mind it , [Johanna]93-johanna ; for indeed [I]2021-i do not . [I]2021-i shall go to [a first rate , respectable jeweler]3967-a first rate , respectable jeweler , and [he]2011-this lad will not cheat [me]2021-i ; and then [I]2021-i shall find [my]2021-i way to [the sponging - house]3968-the sponging - house — isn't that what [they]3969-they call it ? [I]2021-i dare say many [a poor woman]3970-a poor woman has been there before [me]2021-i . [I]2021-i am not the first , and shall not be the last , and [no body]3909-no body will harm [me]2021-i . [I]2021-i think [I]2021-i look honest , though [my]2021-i name is [Leaf]99-ascott . "[2021-i] [She]2021-i laughed — a bitter laugh ; but [Johanna]93-johanna silenced it in a close embrace ; and when [Hilary]91-hilary rose up again [she]91-hilary was quite [her]91-hilary natural self . [She]91-hilary summoned [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , and began giving [her]94-elizabeth all domestic directions , just as usual ; finally , bade [[her]91-hilary sister]559-her sister good by in a tone as like [her]91-hilary usual tone as possible , and left [her]559-her sister settled on the sofa in content and peace . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth followed to the door . [Miss Hilary]91-hilary had asked [her]94-elizabeth for the card on which [Ascott]99-ascott had written the address of [the place where [he]2024-he had been taken to]2023-the place where he had been taken to ; and though [the girl]307-the girl said not a word , [her]307-the girl anxious eyes made piteous inquiry . [[Her]91-hilary mistress]431-her mistress patted [her]94-elizabeth on the shoulder . " Never mind about [me]431-her mistress ; [I]431-her mistress shall come to no harm , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . "[431-her mistress] " It 's a bad place ; such a dreadful place , [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones says . "[431-her mistress] " Is it ? "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth guessed part , not the whole of the feelings that made [Hilary]91-hilary hesitate , shrink even , from the duty before [her]91-hilary , turning first so hot , and then so pale . Only as a duty could [she]91-hilary have done it at all . " No matter , [I]91-hilary must go . Take care of [[my]91-hilary sister]3017-my sister . "[91-hilary] [She]91-hilary ran down the door steps , and walked quickly through [the Crescent]1223-the crescent . It was a clear , sunshiny , frosty day — such a day as always both cheered and calmed [her]91-hilary . [She]91-hilary had , despite all [her]91-hilary cares , youth , health , energy ; and a holy and constant love lay like a sleeping angel in [her]91-hilary heart . Must [I]0-i tell the truth , and own that before [she]91-hilary had gone [two streets]2028-two streets ' length [Hilary]91-hilary ceased to feel so very , very miserable ? Love — this kind of love of which [I]0-i speak — is a wonderful thing , the most wonderful thing in all [the world]248-the world . The strength it gives , the brightness , the actual happiness , even in hardest times , is often quite miraculous . When [Hilary]91-hilary sat waiting in [[the jeweler]2030-the jeweler 's shop]2031-the jeweler 's shop , [she]91-hilary watched a little episode of high life — [two wealthy people]2032-two wealthy people choosing [their]2032-two wealthy people marriage plate ; [the bride]2033-the bride , so careless and haughty ; [the bridegroom]2034-the bridegroom , so unutterably mean to look at , stamped with that innate smallness and coarseness of soul which [his]2034-the bridegroom fine clothes only made more apparent . And [she]91-hilary thought — oh , how fondly [she]91-hilary thought!—of that honest , manly mein ; of that true , untainted heart , which [she]91-hilary felt sure , had never loved [any woman]3109-any woman but [herself]91-hilary ; of the warm , firm hand , carving its way thro ' [the world]248-the world for [her]91-hilary sake , and waiting patiently till it could openly clasp [hers]91-hilary , and give [her]91-hilary every thing it had won . [She]91-hilary would not have exchanged [him]2034-the bridegroom . [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , with [his]98-robert lyon penniless love , [his]98-robert lyon half - hopeless fortunes , or maybe [his]98-robert lyon lot of never ending care , for the " brawest bridegroom "[98-robert lyon] under the sun . Under this sun — the common , everyday winter sun of [Regent]44-regent and [Oxford]45-oxford streets — [she]91-hilary walked now as brightly and bravely as if there were no trouble before [her]91-hilary , no painful meeting with [Ascott]99-ascott , no horrid humiliation from which every womanly feeling in [her]91-hilary nature shrunk with acute pain . " [Robert]98-robert lyon , [[my]91-hilary [Robert]98-robert lyon]3973-my robert ! "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary whispered in [her]91-hilary heart , and felt [him]2034-the bridegroom so near to [her]91-hilary that [she]91-hilary was at rest , [she]91-hilary hardly knew why . Possibly grand , or clever , or [happy people who condescend to read this story]2037-happy people who condescend to read this story may despise it , think it unideal , uninteresting ; treating of small things and [common people—"poor persons]3974-common people—"poor persons , "[1105-the poor] in short . [I]0-i can not help it . [I]0-i write for [the poor]1105-the poor ; not to excite the compassion of [the rich]2039-the rich toward [them]1105-the poor , but to show [them]1105-the poor [their]1105-the poor own dignity and the bright side of [their]1105-the poor poverty . For it has its bright side ; and its very darkest , when no sin is mixed up therewith , is brighter than many an outwardly prosperous life . " Better is a dinner of herbs , where love is , than a stalled ox and hatred therewith . Better is a dry morsel , and quietness therewith , than [a house full of sacrifices]3975-a house full of sacrifices and strife . "[0-i] With these two sage proverbs — which all acknowledge and scarcely any really believe , or surely [they]2040-they would act a little more as if [they]2040-they did — [I]0-i leave [Johanna Leaf]93-johanna sitting silently in [[her]93-johanna solitary parlor]2041-her solitary parlor , knitting stockings for [[her]93-johanna child]3364-her child ; weaving many a mingled web of thought withal , yet never letting a stitch go down ; and [Hilary Leaf]91-hilary walking cheerily and fearlessly up [one strange street]2043-one strange street and down another to find out [the " bad "[91-hilary] place]2044-the " bad " place , where [she]93-johanna once had no idea it would ever have been [her]93-johanna lot to go.—One thing [she]93-johanna knew , and gloried in the knowledge , that if [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had known [she]93-johanna was going , or known half the cares [she]93-johanna had to meet , [he]98-robert lyon would have recrossed [the Indian seas]2045-the indian seas — have risked fortune , competence , hope of the future , which was the only cheer of [his]98-robert lyon hard present — in order to save [her]93-johanna from [them]2046-them all . The minute history of this painful day [I]0-i do not mean to tell . [Hilary]91-hilary never told it till , years after , [she]91-hilary wept it out upon a bosom that could understand the whole , and would take good care that while the life beat in [his]98-robert lyon [she]91-hilary never should go through the like again . [Ascott]99-ascott came [home]3045-home — that is , was brought [home]3045-home — very humbled , contrite , and grateful . There was [no one]3371-no one to meet [him]98-robert lyon but [[his]98-robert lyon Aunt [Johanna]93-johanna]2050-his aunt johanna , and [she]93-johanna just kissed [him]98-robert lyon quietly , and bade [him]98-robert lyon come over to the fire ; [he]98-robert lyon was shivering , and somewhat pale . [He]98-robert lyon had even two tears in [his]98-robert lyon handsome eyes , the first [Ascott]99-ascott had been known to shed since [he]98-robert lyon was [a boy]384-a boy . That [he]98-robert lyon felt a good deal , perhaps as much as was in [his]98-robert lyon nature to feel , there could be no doubt . So [[his]98-robert lyon two aunts]2052-his two aunts were glad and comforted ; gave [him]98-robert lyon [his]98-robert lyon tea and the warmest seat at the hearth ; said not a harsh word to [him]98-robert lyon , but talked to [him]98-robert lyon about indifferent things.—Tea being over , [Hilary]91-hilary was anxious to get every thing painful ended before [Selina]110-selina came [home]3045-home — [Selina]110-selina , who , [they]2052-his two aunts felt by instinct , had now a separate interest from [themselves]2052-his two aunts , and had better not be told this sad story if possible ; so [she]91-hilary asked [[her]91-hilary nephew]369-her nephew " if [he]98-robert lyon remembered what [they]2052-his two aunts had to do this evening ? "[91-hilary] " Had to do ? Oh , [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary , [I]91-hilary 'm so tired ! ca n't [you]101-hilary let [me]91-hilary be quiet ? Only this one night . [I]91-hilary promise to bring [you]101-hilary everything on Monday . "[91-hilary] " Monday will be too late . [I]91-hilary shall be away . And [you]101-hilary know [you]101-hilary ca n't do without [my]91-hilary excellent arithmetic , "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary added with a faint smile . " Now , [Ascott]99-ascott , be [a good boy]3976-a good boy — fetch down all those bills and let [us]3977-us go over them together . "[91-hilary] " [His]369-her nephew debts came to more than the thirty pounds then ? "[93-johanna] said [[his]369-her nephew Aunt]428-his aunt [Johanna]93-johanna , when [he]369-her nephew was gone . " Yes . But the ring sold for fifty . "[93-johanna] And [Hilary]101-hilary drew to the table , got writing materials , and sat waiting , with a dull , silent patience in [her]101-hilary look , at which [Johanna]93-johanna sighed and said no more . [The aunt]788-the aunt and [nephew]3136-nephew spent some time in going over that handful of papers , and approximating to the sum total , in that kind of awful arithmetic when figures cease to be mere figures , but grow into avenging monsters , bearing with [them]2058-them life or death . " Is that all ! [You]99-ascott are quite sure it is all ? "[101-hilary] said [Hilary]101-hilary at last , pointing to the whole amount , and looking steadily into [Ascott]99-ascott 's eyes . [He]369-her nephew flushed up , and asked what [she]91-hilary meant by doubting [his]369-her nephew word ? " Not that , but [you]99-ascott might easily have made a mistake ; [you]99-ascott are so careless about money matters . "[369-her nephew] " Ah , that 's it . [I]369-her nephew 'm just careless , and so [I]369-her nephew come to grief . But [I]369-her nephew never mean to be careless any more . [I]369-her nephew 'll be as precise as [you]99-ascott . [I]369-her nephew 'll balance [my]369-her nephew books every week — every day if [you]99-ascott like — exactly as [you]99-ascott do at [that horrid shop]3978-that horrid shop , [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary . "[369-her nephew] So [he]369-her nephew was rattling on , but [Hilary]101-hilary stopped [him]369-her nephew by pointing to the figures . " [You]99-ascott see , this sum is more than [we]3979-we expected . How is it to be met ? Think for [yourself]99-ascott . [You]99-ascott are [a man]628-a man now . "[101-hilary] " [I]99-ascott know that , "[99-ascott] said [Ascott]99-ascott , sullenly ; " but what 's the use of it?—money only makes [the man]777-the man , and [I]99-ascott have none . If [the ancient Peter]3982-the ancient peter would but die now and leave [me]99-ascott [[his]3982-the ancient peter heir]3983-his heir , though to be sure [Aunt Selina]110-selina might be putting [her]110-selina oar in . Perhaps — considering [I]99-ascott 'm [[Aunt Selina]110-selina 's nephew]3984-aunt selina 's nephew — if [I]99-ascott were to walk into [the old chap]3985-the old chap now [he]3985-the old chap might be induced to fork out ! Hurrah ! that 's a splendid idea . "[99-ascott] " What idea ? "[101-hilary] " [I]101-hilary 'll borrow the money from [old Ascott]99-ascott . "[101-hilary] " That means , because [he]3985-the old chap has already given , [you]101-hilary would have [him]3985-the old chap keep on giving — and [you]101-hilary would take and take and take — [Ascott]99-ascott , [I]99-ascott 'm ashamed of [you]99-ascott . "[99-ascott] But [Ascott]99-ascott only burst out laughing . " Nonsence!—he has money and [I]99-ascott have none ; why should n't [he]3985-the old chap give it [me]99-ascott ? "[99-ascott] " [Why?"—she]181-why?"—she[99-ascott] repeated , [her]99-ascott eyes flashing and [her]99-ascott little feminine figure seeming to grow taller as [she]99-ascott spoke—"I'll tell [you]101-hilary , since [you]101-hilary do n't seem [yourself]101-hilary to understand it . Because [a young man]1903-a young man , with health and strength in [him]1903-a young man , should blush to eat any bread but what [he]1903-a young man [himself]1903-a young man earns . Because [he]1903-a young man should work at any thing and every thing , stint [himself]1903-a young man of every luxury and pleasure , rather than ask or borrow , or , except under rare circumstances , rather than be indebted to [any living soul]3987-any living soul for a single half - penny . [I]99-ascott would not , if [I]99-ascott were [a young man]1903-a young man . "[99-ascott] " What [a nice young man]3989-a nice young man [you]99-ascott would make , [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary ! "[99-ascott] There was something in [the lad]422-the lad 's imperturbable good humor at once irritating and disarming . Whatever [his]422-the lad faults , they were more negative than positive ; there was no malice prepense about [him]422-the lad , no absolute personal wickedness . And [he]422-the lad had the strange charm of manner and speech which keeps up one 's outer surface of habitual affection toward [a person]2060-a person long after all its foundations of trust and respect have hopelessly crumbled away . " Come now , [[my]2061-she pretty aunt]3990-my pretty aunt must go with [me]2061-she . [She]3990-my pretty aunt will manage [the old ogre]3991-the old ogre much better than [I.]2061-she And [he]3991-the old ogre must be managed somehow . It 's all very fine talking of independence , but is n't it hard that [a poor fellow]3992-a poor fellow should be living in constant dread of being carried off to that horrid , uncleanly , beastly den — bah ! [I]2061-she do n't like thinking of it — and all for the want of twenty pounds ? [You]2062-they must go to [him]3991-the old ogre , [Aunt Hilary]101-hilary . "[2061-she] [She]2061-she saw [they]2062-they must — there was no help for it . Even [Johanna]93-johanna said so . It was after all only asking for [Ascott]99-ascott 's quarterly allowance three days in advance , for it was due on Tuesday . But what jarred against [her]2061-she proud , honest spirit was the implication that such a request gave of taking as a right that which had been so long bestowed as a favor . Nothing but the great strait [they]2062-they were in could ever have driven [her]2061-she to consent that [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott should be applied to at all ; but since it must be done , [she]2061-she felt that [she]2061-she had better do it [herself]2061-she . Was it from some lurking doubt or dread that [Ascott]97-ascott might not speak the entire truth , as [she]2061-she had insisted upon its being spoken , before [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott was asked for any thing ? since whatever [he]97-ascott gave must be given with a full knowledge on [his]97-ascott part of the whole pitiable state of affairs . It was with a strange , sad feeling — the sadder because [he]97-ascott never seemed to suspect it , but talked and laughed with [her]2061-she as usual — that [she]2061-she took [[her]2061-she nephew]369-her nephew 's arm and walked silently through [the dark squares]2064-the dark squares , perfectly well aware that [he]97-ascott only asked [her]2061-she to go with [him]97-ascott in order to do an unpleasant thing which [he]97-ascott did not like to do [himself]97-ascott , and that [she]2061-she only went with [him]97-ascott in the character of watch , or [supervisor]2065-supervisor , to try and save [him]97-ascott from doing something which [she]2061-she [herself]2061-she would be ashamed should be done . Yet [he]97-ascott was ostensibly [the head , hope , and stay of [the family]258-the family]2066-the head , hope , and stay of the family . Alas ! [many a family]2068-many a family has to submit to , and smile under an equally melancholy and fatal sham . [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott was sitting half asleep in [[his]97-ascott solitary dining room]2069-his solitary dining room , [his]97-ascott face rosy with wine , [his]97-ascott heart warmed also , probably from the same cause . Not that [he]97-ascott was in the least " tipsy"—that[97-ascott] low - word applicable only to [low people]2070-low people , and not [men of property , who have a right to enjoy all the good things of this life]2071-men of property , who have a right to enjoy all the good things of this life . [He]97-ascott was scarcely even " merry , "[97-ascott] merely " comfortable , "[97-ascott] in that cozy , benevolent state which [middle aged or elderly gentlemen]2072-middle aged or elderly gentlemen are apt to fall into after a good dinner and good wine , when [they]2072-middle aged or elderly gentlemen have no mental resources , and the said good dinner and good wine constitutes [their]2072-middle aged or elderly gentlemen best notion of felicity . Yet wealth and comfort are not things to be despised . [Hilary]101-hilary [herself]101-hilary was not insensible to the pleasantness of [this warm , well - lit , crimson - atmosphered apartment]2073-this warm , well - lit , crimson - atmosphered apartment . [She]101-hilary as well as [[her]101-hilary neighbors]2074-her neighbors liked pretty things about [her]101-hilary , soft , harmonious colors to look at and wear , well - cooked food to eat , [cheerful rooms to live in]2075-cheerful rooms to live in . If [she]101-hilary could have had all these luxuries with those [she]101-hilary loved to share [them]2076-them , no doubt [she]101-hilary would have been much happier . But yet [she]101-hilary felt to the full that solemn truth that " [a man]628-a man 's life consisteth not in the abundance of things that [he]628-a man possesses ; "[101-hilary] and though [hers]101-hilary was outwardly so dark , so full of poverty , anxiety , and pain , still [she]101-hilary knew that inwardly it owned many things , one thing especially , which no money could buy , and without which [fine houses]2077-fine houses , fine furniture , and fine clothes — indeed , all the comforts and splendors of existence , would be worse that valueless , actual torment . So as [she]101-hilary looked around [her]101-hilary [she]101-hilary felt not the slightest envy of [[her]101-hilary sister]559-her sister [Selina]110-selina . Nor of [honest Peter]145-ascott , who rose up from [his]145-ascott arm - chair , pulling the yellow silk handkerchief from [his]145-ascott sleepy face , and , it must be confessed , receiving [his]145-ascott future connections very willingly , and even kindly . Now how was [he]145-ascott to be told ? How when [she]101-hilary and [Ascott]145-ascott sat over the wine and desert [he]145-ascott had ordered for [them]2079-they , listening to [the rich man]2080-the rich man 's complaisant pomposities , were [they]2079-they to explain that [they]2079-they had come a begging , asking [him]145-ascott , as the climax to [his]145-ascott liberalities , to advance a few pounds in order to keep [the young man whom [he]145-ascott had for years generously and sufficiently maintained out of prison]2081-the young man whom he had for years generously and sufficiently maintained out of prison ? This , smooth it over as one might , was , [Hilary]101-hilary felt , [the plain English of the matter]2082-the plain english of the matter , and as minute after minute lengthened , and nothing was said of [their]2079-they errand , [she]101-hilary sat upon thorns . But [Ascott]145-ascott drank [his]145-ascott wine and ate [his]145-ascott walnuts quite composedly . At last [Hilary]101-hilary said , in a sort of desperation , " [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott , [I]101-hilary want to speak to [you]145-ascott . "[101-hilary] " With pleasure , [[my]101-hilary dear young lady]3994-my dear young lady . Will [you]3994-my dear young lady come to [[my]101-hilary study?—I]3995-my study?—i have [a most elegantly furnished study]3996-a most elegantly furnished study , [I]101-hilary assure [you]3994-my dear young lady . "[101-hilary] And then [she]101-hilary braced up all [her]101-hilary courage , and while [Ascott]145-ascott busied [himself]145-ascott over [his]145-ascott walnuts — [he]145-ascott had the grace to look excessively uncomfortable — [she]101-hilary told , as briefly as possible , the bitter truth . [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott listened , apparently without surprise , and any how , without comment . [His]145-ascott self - important loquacity ceased , and [his]145-ascott condescending smile passed into a sharp , reticent , business look . [He]145-ascott knitted [his]145-ascott shaggy brows , contracted that coarsely - hung , but resolute mouth , in which lay the secret of [his]145-ascott success in life , buttoned up [his]145-ascott coat , and stuck [his]145-ascott hands behind [him]145-ascott over [his]145-ascott coat - tails . As [he]145-ascott stood there on [[his]145-ascott own hearth]2083-his own hearth , with all [his]145-ascott comfortable splendors about [him]145-ascott — [a man who had made [his]145-ascott own money , hardly and honestly , who from the days when [he]145-ascott was [a poor errand - lad]2085-a poor errand - lad had had [no one]3371-no one to trust to but [himself]145-ascott]2084-a man who had made his own money , hardly and honestly , who from the days when he was a poor errand - lad had had no one to trust to but himself , yet had managed always to help [himself]145-ascott , ay , and [others]525-others too — [Hilary]101-hilary 's stern sense of justice contrasted [him]145-ascott with [the graceful young man who sat opposite to [him]145-ascott , so much [[his]145-ascott inferior]2089-his inferior , and so much [[his]145-ascott debtor]2090-his debtor]2088-the graceful young man who sat opposite to him , so much his inferior , and so much his debtor . [She]101-hilary owned that [Peter Ascott]145-ascott had a right to look both contemptuously and displeased . " A very pretty story , but [I]145-ascott almost expected it , "[145-ascott] said [he]145-ascott . And there [he]145-ascott stopped . In [his]145-ascott business capacity [he]145-ascott was too acute [a man]628-a man to be [a man of many words]2092-a man of many words , and [his]145-ascott feelings , if they existed , were kept to [himself]145-ascott . " It all comes to this , [young man]3998-young man , "[145-ascott] [he]145-ascott continued , after an uncomfortable pause , in which [Hilary]101-hilary could have counted every beat of [her]101-hilary heart , and even [Ascott]145-ascott played with [his]145-ascott wine glass in a nervous kind of way—"you want money , and [you]3998-young man think [I]145-ascott 'm sure to give it , because it would n't be pleasant just now to have discreditable stories going about concerning the future [[Mrs. Ascott]99-ascott 's relatives]3999-mrs. ascott 's relatives . [You]3998-young man 're quite right , it would n't . But [I]145-ascott 'm too old a bird to be caught with chaff for all that . [You]3998-young man must rise very early in the morning to take [me]145-ascott in . "[145-ascott] [Hilary]101-hilary started up in an agony of shame . " That 's not fair , [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott . [We]4000-we do not take [you]145-ascott in . Have [we]4000-we not told [you]145-ascott the whole truth ? [I]101-hilary was determined [you]145-ascott should know it before [we]4000-we asked [you]145-ascott for one farthing of [your]145-ascott money . "[101-hilary] It might be that [Peter Ascott]145-ascott had a soft place in [his]145-ascott heart , or that this time , just before [his]145-ascott marriage , was the one crisis which sometimes occurs in [a hard man]2093-a hard man 's life , when , if the right touch comes , [he]145-ascott becomes malleable ever after ; but [he]145-ascott looked kindly at [the poor girl]1994-the poor girl , and said , in quite a gentle way , " Do n't vex [yourself]1994-the poor girl , [[my]145-ascott dear]3016-my dear . "[145-ascott] [He]145-ascott wrote the memorandum of the check inside the page , then tore off the check itself , and proceeded to write the words " Twenty pounds , "[145-ascott] date it , and sign it , lingering over the signature , as if [he]145-ascott had a certain pride in the honest name " [Peter Ascott]145-ascott , "[145-ascott] and was well aware of its monetary value on Change and elsewhere . [One]585-one can not be too careful over — What 's that ? a letter , [John]125-john smith ? "[145-ascott] By [his]145-ascott extreme eagerness , almost snatching it from [[his]145-ascott footman]2095-his footman 's hands , it was one of importance . [He]145-ascott made some sort of rough apology , drew the writing materials to [him]145-ascott , wrote one or two business - looking letters , and made out one or two more checks . " Here 's [yours]4005-yours [Ascott]145-ascott ; take it , and let [me]145-ascott have done with it , "[145-ascott] said [he]145-ascott , throwing it across the table folded up . " Ca n't waste time on such small transactions . [Ma'am]3015-ma'am , excuse [me]145-ascott , but five thousand pounds depends on [my]145-ascott getting these letters written and sent off within a quarter of an hour . "[145-ascott] [Hilary]101-hilary bent [her]101-hilary head , and sat watching the pen scratch , and the clock tick on the mantle - piece ; thinking if this really was to be the last of [[his]145-ascott godfather]424-his godfather 's allowance , what on earth would become of [Ascott]145-ascott ? For [Ascott]145-ascott [himself]145-ascott , [he]145-ascott said not a word . Not even when , the letters dispatched , [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott rose , and administering a short , sharp homily , tacitly dismissed [[his]145-ascott visitors]2097-his visitors : Whether this silence was sullenness , cowardice , or shame , [Hilary]101-hilary could not guess . [She]101-hilary quitted [the house]344-the house with a sense of grinding humiliation almost intolerable . But still the worst was over ; the money had been begged and given — there was no fear of [a prison]2099-a prison . And spite of every thing , [Hilary]101-hilary felt a certain relief that this was the last time [Ascott]145-ascott would be indebted to [[his]145-ascott godfather]424-his godfather . Perhaps this total cessation of extraneous help might force [the young man]3100-the young man upon [his]3100-the young man own resources , compel [his]3100-the young man easy temperament into active energy , and bring out in [him]3100-the young man those dormant qualities that [[his]3100-the young man aunts]3135-his aunts still fondly hoped existed in [him]3100-the young man . [You]145-ascott will , [I]101-hilary know . "[101-hilary] [He]3100-the young man answered nothing . " [I]101-hilary wo n't let [you]145-ascott give in , [[my]101-hilary boy]3860-my boy , "[101-hilary] [she]101-hilary went on , kindly . " Who would ever dream of giving in at [your]145-ascott age , with health and strength , a good education , and no encumbrances whatever — not even [aunts]4009-aunts ! for [we]4007-we will not stand in [your]145-ascott way , be sure of that . Why not try ? Any thing ; [we]4007-we will consent to any thing , if only [we]4007-we can see [your]145-ascott life busy and useful and happy . "[101-hilary] Thus [she]101-hilary talked , feeling far more tenderly to [him]2103-him in [his]2103-him forlorn despondency than when [they]2104-they had quitted [the house]344-the house two hours before . But [Ascott]145-ascott took not the slightest notice . A strange fit of sullenness or depression seemed to have come over [him]2103-him , which , when [they]2104-they reached [home]3045-home and met [Aunt Johanna]93-johanna 's silently - questioning face , changed into devil - may - care indifference . " Oh yes , [aunt]770-aunt , [we]4007-we 've done it ; [we]4007-we 've got the money , and now [I]93-johanna may go to the dogs as soon as [I]93-johanna like . "[101-hilary] But [Ascott]145-ascott shook [his]145-ascott head with a fierce denial . " Why should [that old fellow]4017-that old fellow be as rich as [Croesus]183-croesus and [I]145-ascott as poor as a rat ? Why should [I]145-ascott be put into [the world]248-the world to enjoy [myself]145-ascott , and ca n't ? Why was [I]145-ascott made like what [I]145-ascott am , and then punished for it ? Whose fault is it ? "[145-ascott] [Ay]184-ay , whose ? The eternal , unsolvable problem rose up before [Hilary]101-hilary 's imagination . The ghastly spectre of that everlasting doubt , which haunts even the firmest faith sometimes — and which all the nonsense written about that mystery which , " Binding nature fate to fate , Leaves free the human will , "[184-ay] only makes darker than before — oppressed [her]101-hilary for the time being with an inexpressible dread . [Ay]184-ay , why was it that [the boy]375-the boy was what [he]375-the boy was ? From [his]375-the boy inherited nature , [his]375-the boy temperament , or [his]375-the boy circumstances ? What , or more awful question still , who was to blame ? But as [Hilary]101-hilary 's thoughts went deeper down the question answered itself — at least as far as it ever can be answered in this narrow , finite stage of being . Whose will — [we]2108-we dare not say whose blame — is it that evil must inevitably generate evil ? that the smallest wrong - doing in [any human being]2109-any human being rouses a chain of results which may fatally involve [other human beings]2110-other human beings in an almost incalculable circle of misery ? The wages of sin is death . Were it not so sin would cease to be sin , and holiness , holiness . If [He]375-the boy , [the All - holy , who for some inscrutable purpose saw fit to allow the existence of evil]2111-the all - holy , who for some inscrutable purpose saw fit to allow the existence of evil , allowed any other law than this , in either [the spiritual or material world]2112-the spiritual or material world , would [He]375-the boy not be denying [Himself]375-the boy , counteracting the necessities of [His]375-the boy own righteous essence , to which evil is so antagonistic , that [we]2108-we can not doubt it must be in the end cast into total annihilation — into the allegorical lake of fire and brimstone , which is the " second death ? "[2113-they] Nay , do [they]2113-they not in reality deny [Him]375-the boy and [His]375-the boy holiness almost as much as [Atheists]2114-atheists do , who preach that the one great salvation which [He]375-the boy has sent into [the world]248-the world is a salvation from punishment — a keeping out of hell and getting into heaven — instead of a salvation from sin , from the power and love of sin , through the love of [God]105-god in [Christ]159-christ ? [I]0-i tell these thoughts , because like lighting [they]2113-they passed through [Hilary]101-hilary 's mind , as sometimes a whole chain of thoughts do , link after link , and because they helped [her]101-hilary to answer [[her]101-hilary nephew]369-her nephew quietly and briefly , for [she]101-hilary saw [he]369-her nephew was in no state of mind to be argued with . " [I]145-ascott can not explain , [Ascott]145-ascott , why it is that any of [us]2108-we are what [we]2108-we are , and why things happen to [us]2108-we as they do ; it is a question [we]2108-we none of [us]2108-we understand , and in [this world]1916-this world never shall . But if [we]2108-we know what [we]2108-we ought to be , and how [we]2108-we may make the best of every thing , good or bad , that happens to [us]2108-we , surely that is enough without perplexing [ourselves]2108-we about any thing more . " What are [you]101-hilary meddling with [my]101-hilary things for ? Do [you]101-hilary want to get at the check , and be peering at it to see if it 's all right ? "[2134-a young man of his age] [He]2134-a young man of his age caught hold of [her]93-johanna hand , which [she]93-johanna had laid upon [his]2134-a young man of his age head , looked up a minute into [her]93-johanna kind , fond face , and burst into a flood of boyish tears . Evidently [his]2134-a young man of his age troubles had been too much for [him]2134-a young man of his age ; [he]2134-a young man of his age was in a state of great excitement . For some minutes [his]2134-a young man of his age sobs were almost hysterical : then by a struggle [he]2134-a young man of his age recovered [him]2134-a young man of his age - self , seemed exceedingly annoyed and ashamed , took up [his]2134-a young man of his age candle , bade [them]2135-they a hurried goodnight , and went to bed . That is , [he]2134-a young man of his age went to [[his]2134-a young man of his age room]1901-his room ; but [they]2135-they heard [him]2134-a young man of his age moving about overhead for a long while after : nor were [they]2135-they surprised that [he]2134-a young man of his age refused to rise next morning , but lay most of the time with [his]2134-a young man of his age door locked , until late in the afternoon , when [he]2134-a young man of his age went out for a long walk , and did not return till supper , which [he]2134-a young man of his age ate almost in silence . Then , after going up to [[his]2134-a young man of his age room]1901-his room , and coming down again , complaining bitterly how very cold it was , [he]2134-a young man of his age crept in to the fireside with a book in [his]2134-a young man of his age hand , of which [Hilary]101-hilary noticed [he]2134-a young man of his age scarcely read a line . [[His]2134-a young man of his age aunts]3135-his aunts said nothing to [him]2134-a young man of his age ; [they]3135-his aunts had determined not : [they]3135-his aunts felt that further interference would be not only useless but dangerous . " [He]2134-a young man of his age will come to [himself]2134-a young man of his age by - and by ; [his]2134-a young man of his age moods , good or bad , never last long , [you]3135-his aunts know , "[101-hilary] said [Hilary]101-hilary , somewhat bitterly . " But , in the mean time , [I]101-hilary think [we]3135-his aunts had better just do as [he]2134-a young man of his age says — let [him]2134-a young man of his age alone . "[101-hilary] And in that sad , hopeless state [they]3135-his aunts passed the last hours of that dreary Sunday — afraid either to comfort [him]2134-a young man of his age or reason with [him]2134-a young man of his age ; afraid , above all , to blame [him]2134-a young man of his age lest it might drive [him]2134-a young man of his age altogether astray . That [he]2134-a young man of his age was in a state of great misery , halt sullen , half defiant , [they]3135-his aunts saw , and were scarcely surprised at it ; it was very hard not to be able to open [their]3135-his aunts loving hearts to [him]2134-a young man of his age , as those of [one family]2139-one family should always do , making every trouble a common care , and every joy a universal blessing . But in [his]2134-a young man of his age present state of mind — the sudden obstinacy of a weak nature conscious of its weakness , and dreading control — it seemed impossible either to break upon [his]2134-a young man of his age silence or to force [his]2134-a young man of his age confidence . [They]3135-his aunts might have been right in this , or wrong ; afterward [Hilary]101-hilary thought the latter . Many a time [she]101-hilary wished and wished , with a bitter regret , that instead of the quiet " Good night , [Ascott]145-ascott ! "[101-hilary] and the one rather cold kiss on [his]2134-a young man of his age forehead , [she]101-hilary had flung [her]101-hilary arms round [his]2134-a young man of his age neck , and insisted on [his]2134-a young man of his age telling out [his]2134-a young man of his age whole mind to [her]101-hilary , [[his]2134-a young man of his age nearest kinswoman , who had been [half aunt]2141-half aunt and half sister to [him]2134-a young man of his age all [his]2134-a young man of his age life]2140-his nearest kinswoman , who had been half aunt and half sister to him all his life . But it was not done : [she]101-hilary parted from [him]2134-a young man of his age , as [she]101-hilary did Sunday after Sunday , with a sore sick feeling of how much [he]2134-a young man of his age might be to [her]101-hilary , to [them]2142-them all , and how little [he]2134-a young man of his age really was . If this silence of [hers]101-hilary was a mistake — one of those mistakes which [sensitive people]2143-sensitive people sometimes make — it was , like all similar errors , only too sorrowfully remembered and atoned for . The week passed by , and [Hilary]101-hilary received no ill tidings from [home]3045-home . Incessant occupation kept [her]101-hilary from dwelling too much on anxious subjects : besides , [she]101-hilary would not have thought it exactly right , while [her]101-hilary time and [her]101-hilary mental powers were for so many hours per diem legally [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's , to waste the one and weaken the other by what is commonly called " fretting . "[101-hilary] Nor , carrying this conscientious duty to a higher degree , and toward [a higher Master]2145-a higher master , would [she]101-hilary have dared to sit grieving overmuch over [their]2146-their dark future . And yet it was very dark . [She]101-hilary pondered over what was to be done with [Ascott]145-ascott , or whether [he]145-ascott was still to be left to the hopeless hope of doing something for [himself]145-ascott : how long [the little establishment at No . 15]2147-the little establishment at no . 15 could be kept together , or if , after [Selina]110-selina 's marriage , it would not be advisable to make some change that should contract expenses , and prevent this hard separation , from Monday to Saturday , between [Johanna]93-johanna and [herself]101-hilary . These , with equally anxious thoughts , attacked [her]101-hilary in crowds every day and every hour ; but [she]101-hilary had generally sufficient will to put them aside : at least till after work was done , and [they]2148-they could neither stupefy nor paralyze [her]101-hilary . Trouble had to [her]101-hilary been long enough familiar to have taught [her]101-hilary its own best lesson — that the mind can , in degree , rule itself , even as it rules the body . Thus , in [her]101-hilary business duties , which were principally keeping accounts ; in [her]101-hilary management of [the two young people under [her]101-hilary]2149-the two young people under her , and of [the small domestic establishment connected with [the shop]1561-the shop]2150-the small domestic establishment connected with the shop , [Hilary]101-hilary went steadily on , day after day ; made no blunders in [her]101-hilary arithmetic , no mistakes in [her]101-hilary housekeeping . Being new to all [her]101-hilary responsibilities , [she]101-hilary had to give [her]101-hilary whole mind to [them]2148-they ; and [she]101-hilary did it : and it was a blessing to [her]101-hilary — the sanctified blessing which rests upon labor , almost seeming to neutralize its primeval curse . But night after night , when work was over , [she]101-hilary sat alone at [her]101-hilary sewing — the only time [she]101-hilary had for it — and [her]101-hilary thoughts went faster than [her]101-hilary needle . [She]101-hilary turned over plan after plan , and went back upon hope after hope , that had risen and broken like waves of [the sea]2152-the sea — nothing happening that [she]101-hilary had expected ; the only thing which had happened , or which seemed to have any permanence or reality , being two things which [she]101-hilary had never expected at all — [Selina]110-selina 's marriage , and [her]101-hilary own engagement with [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder . It often happens so , in [most people]875-most people 's lives , until at last [they]875-most people learn to live on from day to day , doing each day 's duty within the day , and believing that it is a righteous as well as a tender hand which keeps the next day 's page safely folded down . So [Hilary]101-hilary sat , glad to have a quiet hour , not to grieve in , but to lay out the details of a plan which had been maturing in [her]101-hilary mind all week , and which [she]101-hilary meant definitely to propose to [Johanna]93-johanna when [she]101-hilary went [home]3045-home next day . It would cost [her]101-hilary something to do so , and [she]101-hilary had had some hesitations as to the scheme itself , until at last [she]101-hilary threw [them]2155-them all to the winds , as [an honest - hearted , faithful and faithfully - trusting woman]2156-an honest - hearted , faithful and faithfully - trusting woman would . [Her]101-hilary plan was , that [they]2157-their should write to [the only real friend [the family]258-the family]2158-the only real friend the family had — [the only good man [she]101-hilary believed in]2160-the only good man she believed in — stating plainly [their]2157-their troubles and difficulties about [[their]2157-their nephew]339-their nephew ; asking [his]2160-the only good man she believed in advice , & possibly [his]2160-the only good man she believed in help . [He]2160-the only good man she believed in might know of something — some opening for [a young surgeon]2162-a young surgeon in [India]11-india , or some temporary appointment for the voyage out and [home]3045-home , which might catch [Ascott]145-ascott 's erratic and easily attracted fancy : give [him]2160-the only good man she believed in occupation for the time being , and at least detach [him]2160-the only good man she believed in from [his]2160-the only good man she believed in present life , with all its temptations and dangers . Also , it might result in bringing [the boy]375-the boy again under that influence which had been so beneficial to [him]2160-the only good man she believed in while it lasted , and which [Hilary]101-hilary devoutly believed was the best influence in [the world]248-the world . Was it unnatural , if , mingled with an earnest desire for [Ascott]145-ascott 's good , was an under - lying delight that that good should be done to [him]2160-the only good man she believed in by [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon ? So when [her]101-hilary plan was made , even to the very words in which [she]101-hilary meant to unfold it to [Johanna]93-johanna , and the very form in which [Johanna]93-johanna should write the letter , [she]101-hilary allowed [herself]101-hilary a few brief minutes to think of [him]98-robert lyon — [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon — to call up [his]98-robert lyon eyes , [his]98-robert lyon voice , [his]98-robert lyon smile ; to count , for the hundreth time , how many months — one less than twenty - four , so [she]101-hilary could not say years now — it would be before [he]98-robert lyon returned to [England]9-england . Also , to speculate when and where [they]2166-they would first meet , and how [he]98-robert lyon would speak the one word — all that was needful to change " liking "[101-hilary] into " love , "[101-hilary] and " [friend]4035-friend "[101-hilary] into " [wife]1386-wife . "[101-hilary] [They]2166-they had so grown together during so many years not the less so during these years of absence , that it seemed as if such a change would hardly make any difference . And yet — and yet — as [she]101-hilary sat and sewed , wearied with [her]101-hilary day 's labors , sad and perplexed , [she]101-hilary thought — if only , by some strange magic , [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon were standing opposite , holding open [his]98-robert lyon arms , ready and glad to take [her]101-hilary and all [her]101-hilary cares to [his]98-robert lyon heart , how [she]101-hilary would cling there ! how closely [she]101-hilary would creep to [him]98-robert lyon , weeping with joy and content , neither afraid nor ashamed to let [him]98-robert lyon see how dearly [she]101-hilary loved [him]98-robert lyon ! Only a dream ! ah , only a dream ! and [she]101-hilary started from it at the sharp sound of the doorbell — started , blushing and trembling , as if it had been [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon [himself]98-robert lyon , when [she]101-hilary knew it was only [[her]101-hilary two young assistants whom [she]101-hilary had allowed to go out to tea in [the neighborhood]2168-the neighborhood]2167-her two young assistants whom she had allowed to go out to tea in the neighborhood . So [she]101-hilary settled [herself]101-hilary to [her]101-hilary work again ; put all [her]101-hilary own thoughts by in [their]2167-her two young assistants whom she had allowed to go out to tea in the neighborhood little private corners , and waited for the entrance and the harmless gossip of [these two orphan girls]2169-these two orphan girls , who were already beginning to love [her]101-hilary , and make [a friend of [her]101-hilary]2170-a friend of her , and toward whom [she]101-hilary felt [herself]101-hilary quite [an elderly and responsible person]2171-an elderly and responsible person . [Poor little Hilary]101-hilary ! It seemed to be [her]101-hilary lot always to take care of [somebody or other]2172-somebody or other . Would it ever be that any body should take care of [her]101-hilary ? So [she]101-hilary cleared away some of [her]101-hilary needlework , stirred the fire , which was dropping hollow and dull , and looked up pleasantly to the opening door . But it was not [the girls]2173-the girls : it was [a man]628-a man 's foot and [a man]628-a man 's voice . " [Any person of the name of Leaf]4037-any person of the name of leaf living [here]389-here ? [I]628-a man wish to see [her]4037-any person of the name of leaf , on business . " [Peter Ascott]145-ascott . "[145-ascott] Only instead of being a check for twenty pounds it was for seventy . Instantly the whole truth flashed upon [Hilary]91-hilary : [Ascott]145-ascott 's remark about how easily the T could be made into an S , and what a " good joke "[145-ascott] it would be ; [his]145-ascott long absence that night ; [his]145-ascott strange manner : [his]145-ascott refusal to let [her]91-hilary see the check again ; all was clear as daylight . [Unfortunate boy]2182-unfortunate boy ! the temptation had been too strong for [him]145-ascott . Under what sudden , insane impulse [he]145-ascott had acted — under what delusion of being able to repay in time ; or of [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott 's not detecting the fraud ; or if discovered , of its being discovered after the marriage , when to prosecute [[his]145-ascott wife 's nephew]2183-his wife 's nephew would be a disgrace to [himself]145-ascott , could never be known . " Well , is n't this a nice return for all [my]145-ascott kindness ? So cleverly done , too . But for the merest chance [I]145-ascott might not have found it out for three months . [Hilary]91-hilary uttered a bitter groan . Yes , it was quite true . [[Their]2185-their Ascott]2186-their ascott , [[their]2185-their own boy]2187-their own boy , was no longer merely idle , extravagant , thoughtless — faults bad enough , but capable of being mended as [he]2186-their ascott grew older : [he]2186-their ascott had done that which to the end of [his]2186-their ascott days [he]2186-their ascott could never blot out . At last [she]91-hilary put [her]91-hilary question into words . " What do [you]145-ascott mean to do ? Shall [you]145-ascott prosecute [him]2186-their ascott ? "[91-hilary] [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott crossed [his]145-ascott legs , and settled [his]145-ascott neckcloth with a self - satisfied air . [He]145-ascott evidently rather enjoyed the importance of [his]145-ascott position . To be dictator , almost of life and death , to [this unfortunate family]2191-this unfortunate family was worth certainly fifty pounds . " Well , [I]145-ascott have n't exactly determined . The money , [you]145-ascott see , is of no moment to [me]145-ascott , and [I]145-ascott could n't get it back any how . [He]2186-their ascott 'll never be worth a half - penny , [that rascal]4061-that rascal . But — "[145-ascott] Perhaps , [hard man]2192-hard man as [he]145-ascott was , [he]145-ascott was touched by the agony of suspense in [Hilary]91-hilary 's face , for [he]145-ascott added . "[145-ascott] " Never hear of [Ascott]97-ascott any more ? "[145-ascott] [Mr. Peter Ascott]145-ascott possibly never had a heart , or it had been so stunted in its growth that it had never reached its fair development . Yet [he]145-ascott felt sorry in [his]145-ascott way for [the " young person]4071-the " young person , "[145-ascott] who looked so deadly white , yet tried so hard not to make a scene , nay , when [[her]91-hilary two assistants]2200-her two assistants came into [the one little parlor]2201-the one little parlor , deported [herself]91-hilary with steady composure ; told [them]2200-her two assistants that [she]91-hilary was obliged suddenly to go [home]3045-home , but would be back , if possible , the next morning . " How much might [your]91-hilary weekly receipts be in [a place like this]4075-a place like this ?
