[You]91-hilary 're [the head shop - woman]4077-the head shop - woman , [I]91-hilary suppose ? "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary made no answer : [she]91-hilary scarcely heard . All [her]91-hilary mind was full of but one thing : " Never see [Ascott]145-ascott any more ! "[91-hilary] There came back upon [her]91-hilary all the dreadful stories [she]91-hilary had ever heard of [lads who had committed forgery or some similar offense , and , in dread of punishment , had run away in despair , and never been heard of for years]2206-lads who had committed forgery or some similar offense , and , in dread of punishment , had run away in despair , and never been heard of for years — come to every kind of misery , perhaps even destroyed [themselves]2206-lads who had committed forgery or some similar offense , and , in dread of punishment , had run away in despair , and never been heard of for years . The impression was so horribly vivid , that when , pausing an instant in putting [her]91-hilary books in their places , [she]91-hilary heard the door bell ring [Hilary]91-hilary with difficulty repressed a scream . But it was [no messenger of dreadful tidings]2207-no messenger of dreadful tidings , it was only [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth ; and the quiet fashion in which [she]94-elizabeth entered showed [Hilary]91-hilary at once that nothing dreadful had happened at [home]3045-home . " Oh no , nothing has happened , "[307-the girl] confirmed [the girl]307-the girl . " Only [Miss Leaf]91-hilary sent [me]307-the girl to see if [you]91-hilary could come [home]3045-home to night instead of tomorrow . [She]91-hilary is quite well , that is , pretty well ; but [Mr. Leaf]97-ascott — "[307-the girl] Here , catching sight of [[Miss Hilary]91-hilary 's visitor]2210-miss hilary 's visitor , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth stopped short . [Peter Ascott]145-ascott was one of [her]94-elizabeth prejudices . [She]94-elizabeth determined in [his]145-ascott presence to let out no more of the family affairs . On [his]145-ascott part , [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott had always treated [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth as people like [him]145-ascott usually do treat [servants]1052-servants , afraid to lose an inch of [their]1052-servants dignity , lest it should be an acknowledgment of equal birth and breeding with the class from which [they]1052-servants are so terribly ashamed to have sprung . [He]145-ascott regarded [her]94-elizabeth now with a lordly air . " [Young woman]3928-young woman — [I]145-ascott believe [you]3928-young woman are [the young woman who this afternoon]4080-the young woman who this afternoon told [me]145-ascott that [Mr. Leaf]97-ascott was out . It was a fib , of course . "[145-ascott] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth turned round indignantly . " No , [Sir]3469-sir ; [I]145-ascott do n't tell fibs . [He]97-ascott was out . "[145-ascott] " Did [you]145-ascott give [him]97-ascott [my]145-ascott message when [he]97-ascott came in ? "[145-ascott] " Yes , [Sir]3469-sir . "[145-ascott] " And what did [he]97-ascott say , oh ? "[145-ascott] " Nothing . "[145-ascott] This was the literal fact ; but there was something behind which [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had not the slightest intention of communicating . In fact , [she]94-elizabeth set [herself]94-elizabeth , physically and mentally , in an attitude of dogged resistance to any pumping of [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott : for though , as [she]94-elizabeth had truly said , nothing special had happened , [she]94-elizabeth felt sure that [he]97-ascott was at the bottom of something which had gone wrong in [the household]277-the household that afternoon . It was this . When [Ascott]97-ascott returned , and [she]94-elizabeth told [him]97-ascott of [[his]97-ascott godfather]424-his godfather 's visit , [the young man]3100-the young man had suddenly turned so ghastly pale that [she]94-elizabeth had to fetch [him]97-ascott a glass of water ; and [his]97-ascott Aunt [Johanna]93-johanna — [Miss Selina]92-selina was out — had to tend [him]97-ascott and soothe [him]97-ascott for several minutes before [he]97-ascott was right again . When at last [he]97-ascott seemed returning to [his]97-ascott natural self , [he]97-ascott looked wildly up at [[his]97-ascott aunt]428-his aunt , and clung to [her]428-his aunt in such an outburst of feeling , that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had thought it best to slip out of [the room]3244-the room . It was tea time , but still [she]94-elizabeth waited outside for a half hour or longer , when [she]94-elizabeth gently knocked , and after a minute or two [Miss Leaf]92-selina came out . There seemed nothing wrong , at least not much — not more than [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had noticed many and many a time after talks between [Ascott]97-ascott and [[his]97-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts . " [I]94-elizabeth 'll take the tea in [myself]94-elizabeth , "[94-elizabeth] [she]94-elizabeth said ; " for [I]94-elizabeth want [you]97-ascott to start at once for [Kensington]40-kensington to fetch [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . Do n't frighten [her]91-hilary — mind that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . Say [I]94-elizabeth am much as usual [myself]94-elizabeth ; but that [Mr. Leaf]97-ascott is not quite well , and [I]94-elizabeth think [she]91-hilary might do [him]97-ascott good . Remember the exact words . "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth did , and would have delivered them accurately , it [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott had not been present , and addressed [her]94-elizabeth in that authoritative manner . Now , [she]94-elizabeth resolutely held [her]94-elizabeth tongue . [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott might in [his]97-ascott time have been accustomed to cringing , frightened , or [impertinent servants]2218-impertinent servants , but this was a phase of the species with which [he]97-ascott was totally unfamiliar . [The girl]307-the girl was neither sullen nor rude , yet evidently quite independent ; afraid neither of [[her]307-the girl mistress]431-her mistress , nor of [himself]97-ascott . [He]97-ascott was sharp enough to see that whatever [he]97-ascott wanted to get out of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth must be got in another way . " Come , [[my]97-ascott wench]4083-my wench , [you]4083-my wench 'd better tell ; it 'll be none the worse for [you]4083-my wench , and it sha n't harm [the young fellow]3447-the young fellow , though [I]97-ascott dare say [he]3447-the young fellow has paid [you]4083-my wench well for holding [your]4083-my wench tongue . "[97-ascott] " About what , [sir]3469-sir ? "[97-ascott] " Oh ! [you]4083-my wench know what happened when [you]4083-my wench told [him]3447-the young fellow [I]97-ascott had called , eh ? [Servants]1052-servants get to know all about [[their]1052-servants master]4087-their master 's affairs . "[97-ascott] " [Mr. Leaf]97-ascott is n't [[my]94-elizabeth master]4088-my master , and [his]3447-the young fellow affairs are nothing to [me]94-elizabeth ; [I]94-elizabeth do n't pry into ['em]4089-'em , "[94-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " If [you]3469-sir want to know any thing , [Sir]3469-sir , had n't [you]3469-sir better ask [himself]3447-the young fellow ! [He]3447-the young fellow 's at [home]3045-home to - night . [I]94-elizabeth left [him]3447-the young fellow and [[my]94-elizabeth missus]4092-my missus going to [their]4093-their tea . "[94-elizabeth] " Left [them]4093-their at [home]3045-home , and at tea ? "[94-elizabeth] " Yes , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . "[94-elizabeth] It was an inexpressible relief . For the discovery must have come . [Ascott]97-ascott must have known or guessed that [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott had found [him]97-ascott out ; [he]97-ascott must have confessed all to [[his]97-ascott Aunt]428-his aunt , or [Johanna]93-johanna would never have done two things which [[her]93-johanna sister]559-her sister knew [she]93-johanna strongly disliked — sending [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth wandering through [London]1-london at night , and fetching [Hilary]91-hilary [home]3045-home before the time . Yet [they]2224-them had been left sitting quietly at [their]2224-them tea ! Perhaps , after all , the blow had not been so dreadful . [Johanna]93-johanna saw comfort through it all . Vague hopes arose in [Hilary]91-hilary also ; visions of [the poor sinner]2225-the poor sinner sitting " clothed and in [his]2225-the poor sinner right mind , "[91-hilary] contrite and humbled ; comforted by [them]2224-them all , with the inexpressible tenderness with which [we]2226-we yearn over [one who " was dead and is alive again]4095-one who " was dead and is alive again , was lost , and is found ; "[3061-women] helped by [them]2224-them all in the way that [women]3061-women — [some women]1837-some women especially , and these were of [them]3061-women — seem formed to help [the erring and unfortunate]2229-the erring and unfortunate ; for , erring as [he]2225-the poor sinner was , [he]2225-the poor sinner had also been unfortunate . Many an excuse for [him]2225-the poor sinner suggested itself . How foolish of [them]2224-them , [ignorant women]2230-ignorant women that [they]2224-them were , to suppose that seventeen years of the most careful bringing up could , with [his]2225-the poor sinner temperament , stand against the countless dangers of [London]1-london life ; of any life where [a young man]1903-a young man is left to [himself]1903-a young man in [a great town]2232-a great town , with [his]1903-a young man temptations so many , and [his]1903-a young man power of resistance so small . And this might not , could not be a deliberate act . It must have been committed under a sudden impulse , to be repented of for the rest of [his]2225-the poor sinner days . Nay , in the strange way in which [our]2233-we sins and mistakes are made not only the whips to scourge [us]2233-we , but the sicknesses out of which [we]2233-we often come — suffering and weak indeed , but yet relieved , and fresh , and sound — who could tell but that this grave fault , this actual guilt , the climax of so many lesser errors , might not work out in the end [Ascott]97-ascott 's complete reformation ? So in the strange way in which , after a great shock , [we]2233-we begin to revive a little , to hope against hope , to see a slender ray breaking through the darkness , [Hilary]91-hilary composed [herself]91-hilary , at least so far as to enable [her]91-hilary to bid [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth go down [stairs]3048-stairs , and [she]94-elizabeth would be ready directly . " [I]91-hilary think it is the best thing [I]91-hilary can do — to go [home]3045-home at once , "[91-hilary] said [she]91-hilary . " Certainly , [[my]97-ascott dear]3016-my dear . "[97-ascott] replied [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , rather flattered by [her]91-hilary involuntary appeal , and by an inward consciousness of [his]97-ascott own exceeding generosity . " And pray do n't disturb [yourselves]3016-my dear . Tell [[your]3016-my dear sister]4063-your sister from [me]97-ascott — [[your]3016-my dear sister]4063-your sister [Selina]92-selina , [I]97-ascott mean — that [I]97-ascott overlook every thing , on condition that [you]3016-my dear keep [him]97-ascott out of [my]97-ascott sight , [that young blackguard]4100-that young blackguard ! "[97-ascott] " Do n't , do n't ! "[91-hilary] cried [Hilary]91-hilary , piteously . " Well , [I]91-hilary wo n't , though it 's [his]97-ascott right name — [a fellow who could — Look [you]3016-my dear , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , when [[his]97-ascott father]404-his father]4101-a fellow who could — look you , miss hilary , when his father sent to [me]91-hilary to beg ten pounds to bury [[his]97-ascott mother]406-his mother with . [I]91-hilary did bury [her]406-his mother , and [him]97-ascott also , a month after , very respectably too , though [he]97-ascott had no claim upon [me]91-hilary , except that [he]97-ascott came from [Stowbury]2-stowbury . And [I]91-hilary stood godfather to [the child]3274-the child , and [I]91-hilary 've done [my]91-hilary duty by [him]97-ascott . But mark [my]91-hilary words , what 's bred in the bone will come in the flesh . [He]97-ascott was born in [a prison]2099-a prison , and [he]97-ascott 'll die in [a prison]2099-a prison . "[91-hilary] " God forbid ! "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary , solemnly . And again [she]91-hilary felt the strong conviction , that whatever [[his]2235-his father]404-his father had been , or [[his]2235-his mother]406-his mother , of whom [they]2238-you had heard nothing till [she]406-his mother was dead , [Ascott]97-ascott could not have lived all these years of [his]97-ascott childhood and early boyhood with [[his]97-ascott three aunts]2239-his three aunts at [Stowbury]2-stowbury without gaining at least some good , which might counteract the hereditary evil ; as such evil can be counteracted , even as hereditary disease can be gradually removed by wholesome and careful rearing in a new generation . " Well , [I]145-ascott 'll not say any more , "[145-ascott] continued [Peter Ascott]145-ascott : " only the sooner [the young fellow]3447-the young fellow takes [himself]3447-the young fellow off the better . [He]3447-the young fellow 'll only plague [you]2238-you all . Now , can [you]2238-you send out for [a cab]3728-a cab for [me]91-hilary ? "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary mechanically rang the bell , and gave the order . " [I]91-hilary 'll take [you]2238-you to [town]3838-town with [me]91-hilary if [you]2238-you like . It 'll save [you]2238-you the expense of [the omnibus]4110-the omnibus . [I]91-hilary suppose [you]2238-you always travel by [omnibus]4111-omnibus ? "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary answered something , [she]91-hilary hardly knew what , except that it was a declining of all these benevolent attentions . At last [she]91-hilary got [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott outside [the street]1211-the street door , and returning , put [her]91-hilary hand to [her]91-hilary head with a moan . " Oh , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , do n't look like that . "[91-hilary] " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , do [you]91-hilary know what has happened ? "[91-hilary] " No . "[91-hilary] " Then [I]91-hilary do n't want [you]91-hilary to know . And [you]91-hilary must never try to find it out ; for it is a secret that ought to be kept strictly within [the family]258-the family . Are [you]91-hilary to be trusted ? "[91-hilary] " Yes , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . "[91-hilary] " Now , get [me]2241-they [my]2241-they bonnet , and let [us]2241-they make haste and go [home]3045-home . "[2241-they] [They]2241-they walked down [the gas - lit [Kensington High Street]46-kensington high street]2242-the gas - lit kensington high street , [Hilary]91-hilary taking [[her]91-hilary servant]1535-her servant 's arm ; for [she]91-hilary felt strangely weak . As [she]91-hilary sat in the dark corner of [the omnibus]4110-the omnibus [she]91-hilary tried to look things in the face , and form some definite plan ; but the noisy rumble at once dulled and confused [her]91-hilary faculties . [She]91-hilary felt capable of no consecutive thought , but found [herself]91-hilary stupidly watching the two lines of faces , wondering , absently , what sort of people [they]2241-they were ; what were [their]2241-they lives and histories ; and whether [they]2241-they all had , like [herself]91-hilary , [their]2241-they own personal burden of woe . Which was , alas ! the one fact that never need be doubted in [this world]1916-this world . It was nigh upon eleven o'clock when [Hilary]91-hilary knocked at the door of [No . 15]1304-no . 15 . [Miss Leaf]91-hilary opened it ; but for the first time in [her]91-hilary life [she]91-hilary had no welcome for [[her]91-hilary child]3364-her child . " Is it [Ascott]145-ascott ? [I]91-hilary thought it was [Ascott]145-ascott , "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary cried , peering eagerly up and down [the street]1211-the street . " [He]145-ascott is gone out , then ? When did [he]145-ascott go ? "[91-hilary] asked [Hilary]91-hilary , feeling [her]91-hilary heart turn stone - cold . " Just after [Selina]92-selina came in . [She]92-selina — [she]92-selina vexed [him]145-ascott . But [he]145-ascott can not be long ? Is not [that man]4114-that man [he]145-ascott ? "[91-hilary] And just as [she]91-hilary was , without shawl or bonnet , [Johanna]93-johanna stepped out into the cold , damp night , and strained [her]93-johanna eyes into the darkness ; but in vain . " [I]93-johanna 'll walk round [the Crescent]1223-the crescent once , and may be [I]93-johanna shall find [him]145-ascott . Only go in , [Johanna]93-johanna . "[93-johanna] And [Hilary]91-hilary was away again into the dark , walking rapidly , less with the hope of finding [Ascott]145-ascott than to get time to calm [herself]91-hilary , so as to meet , and help [[her]91-hilary sisters]302-her sisters to meet , this worst depth of [their]302-her sisters calamity . For something warned [her]91-hilary that this last desperation of a weak nature is more to be dreaded than any overt obstinacy of a strong one . [She]91-hilary had a conviction that [Ascott]145-ascott never would come [home]3045-home . After a while [they]302-her sisters gave up waiting and watching at the front door , and shut [themselves]302-her sisters up in [the parlor]313-the parlor . The first explanation past , even [Selina]92-selina ceased talking ; and [they]302-her sisters sat together , [the three women]1783-the three women , doing nothing , attempting to do nothing , only listening ; thinking every sound was a step on [the pavement]2253-the pavement or a knock at the door . Alas ! what would [they]302-her sisters not have given for the fiercest knock , the most impatient , angry footstep , if only it had been [[their]302-her sisters boy]1159-their boy 's ? About one o'clock , [Selina]92-selina had to be put to bed in strong hysterics . [She]92-selina had lashed [[her]92-selina nephew]369-her nephew with [her]92-selina bitter tongue till [he]369-her nephew had rushed out of [the house]344-the house , declaring that [none of [them]302-her sisters]1042-none of them should ever see [his]369-her nephew face again . Now [she]92-selina reproached [herself]92-selina as being the cause of all , and fell into an agony of remorse , which engrossed [[her]92-selina sisters]302-her sisters ' whole care ; until [her]92-selina violent emotion having worn itself out , [she]92-selina went to sleep , [the only one who did sleep in that miserable family]2259-the only one who did sleep in that miserable family . For [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth also , having been sent to bed hours before , was found by [Miss Hilary]91-hilary sitting on the [kitchen stairs]2260-kitchen stairs , about four in the morning . [[Her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress made no attempt at reproach , but brought [her]94-elizabeth into [the parlor]313-the parlor to share the silent watch , never broken except to make up the fire or light a fresh candle ; till candles burned up , and shutters were opened , and upon their great calamity stared the broad unwelcome day . " Missing"—"Lost"—"To—"—all[94-elizabeth] the initials of the alphabet — [we]2263-we read these sort of advertisements in the newspapers ; and unless there happens to be in them something intensely pathetic , comical , or horrible , [we]2263-we think very little about them . [Only those who have undergone all that such an advertisement implies]2264-only those who have undergone all that such an advertisement implies can understand its depth of misery : the sudden missing of [the person]2265-the person out of [the home circle]2266-the home circle , whether going away in anger or driven away by terror or disgrace ; the hour after hour and day after day of agonized suspense ; the self - reproach , real or imaginary , lest any thing might have been said or done that was not said or done — any thing prevented that was not prevented ; the gnawing remorse for some cruel , or careless , or bitter word , that could so easily have been avoided . Alas ! if [people]3210-people could only be made to feel that every word , every action carries with it the weight of an eternity ; that the merest chance may make something said or done quite unpremeditatedly , in vexation , sullenness , or spite , the last action , the last word ; which may grow into an awful remembrance , rising up between [them]3210-people and the irredeemable past , and blackening the future for years ! [Selina]92-selina was quite sure [[her]92-selina unhappy nephew]2268-her unhappy nephew had committed suicide , and that [she]92-selina had been the cause of it . This conviction [she]92-selina impressed incessantly on [[her]92-selina two sisters]336-her two sisters as [they]336-her two sisters waited upon [her]92-selina , or sat talking by [her]92-selina bedside during that long Saturday , when there was nothing else to be done . That was the misery of it . There was nothing to be done . [They]336-her two sisters had not the slightest clew to [[Ascott]145-ascott 's haunts]2270-ascott 's haunts or [associates]2271-associates . With the last fingering of honest shame , or honest respect for [[his]145-ascott aunts]3135-his aunts , [he]145-ascott had kept all these things to [himself]145-ascott . To search for [him]145-ascott in wide [London]1-london was altogether impossible . [Two courses]2273-two courses suggested [themselves]2273-two courses to [Hilary]91-hilary — one , to go and consult [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder ; the other — which came into [her]92-selina mind from some similar case [she]92-selina had heard of — to set on foot inquiries at [all police stations]2274-all police stations . But the first idea was soon rejected : only at the last extremity could [she]92-selina make patent the family misery — the family disgrace . To the second , similar and even stronger reasons applied . There was something about the cool , matter - of - fact , business - like act of setting [a detective officer]2275-a detective officer to hunt out [[their]336-her two sisters nephew]339-their nephew , from which [these poor women]2277-these poor women recoiled . Besides , impressed as [he]145-ascott was — [he]145-ascott had told [[his]145-ascott Aunt]428-his aunt [Johanna]93-johanna so — with the relentlessness of [Mr. Ascott]145-ascott , might not the chance of [his]145-ascott discovering that [he]145-ascott was hunted drive [him]145-ascott to desperation ? Hardly to suicide . [Hilary]91-hilary steadfastly disbelieved in that . When [Selina]92-selina painted horrible pictures of [his]145-ascott throwing [himself]145-ascott off [Waterloo Bridge]47-waterloo bridge : or being found hanging to a tree in one of [the parks]2279-the parks ; or locking [himself]145-ascott in [a hotel bed chamber]2280-a hotel bed chamber and blowing out [his]145-ascott brains , [[her]92-selina younger sister]1035-her younger sister only laughed — laughed as much as [she]1035-her younger sister could — if only to keep [Johanna]93-johanna quiet . Yet [she]92-selina [herself]92-selina had few fears . For [she]92-selina knew that [Ascott]145-ascott was , in a sense , too cowardly to kill [himself]145-ascott . [He]145-ascott so disliked physical pain , physical unpleasantness of all kinds . [She]92-selina felt sure [he]145-ascott would stop short , even with the razor or the pistol in [his]145-ascott hand , rather than do a thing so very disagreeable . Nevertheless , in spite of [herself]92-selina , while [she]92-selina and [[her]92-selina sisters]302-her sisters sat together , hour after hour , in a stillness almost like that when there is a death in [the house]344-the house , these morbid terrors took a double size . [Hilary]91-hilary ceased to treat them as ridiculous impossibilities , but began to argue them out rationally . The mere act of doing so made [her]92-selina recoil ; for it seemed an acknowledgment that [she]92-selina was fighting not with chimeras but realities . " It is twenty - four hours since [he]145-ascott went , "[92-selina] [she]92-selina reasoned . " If [he]145-ascott had done anything desperate [he]145-ascott would have done it at once , and [we]4116-we should have heard of it long before now ; ill news always travels fast . Besides , [his]145-ascott name was marked on all [his]145-ascott clothes in full . [I]92-selina did it [myself]92-selina . And [his]145-ascott coat pockets were always stuffed with letters ; [he]145-ascott used to cram them in as soon as [he]145-ascott got them , [you]4117-you know . "[92-selina] And at this small remembrance of one of [his]2284-his " ways , "[92-selina] even though it was an unkind way , and had caused [them]2285-them many a pain , from the want of confidence it showed , [[his]2284-his poor , fond aunts]2286-his poor , fond aunts turned aside to hide [their]2286-his poor , fond aunts starting tears . The very phrase " [he]145-ascott used to , "[2285-them] seemed such an unconscious admission that [his]2284-his life with [them]2285-them was over and done ; that [he]2284-his never would either please [them]2285-them or vex [them]2285-them any more . Yet [they]2285-them took care that during the whole day every thing should be done as if [he]2284-his were expected minute by minute ; that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth should lay the fourth knife and fork at dinner , the fourth cup and saucer at tea . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , who throughout had faithfully kept [her]94-elizabeth pledge ; who went about silently and unobservantly , and by every means in [her]94-elizabeth power put aside the curiosity of [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones as to what could be the reason that [[her]94-elizabeth lodgers]2287-her lodgers had sat up all night , and what on earth had become of [young Mr. Leaf]97-ascott . After tea , [Johanna]93-johanna , quite worn out , consented to go to bed ; and then [Hilary]91-hilary , left to [her]91-hilary own responsibility , set [herself]91-hilary to consider how long this dreadful quietness was to last , whether nothing could be done . [She]91-hilary could endure whatever was inevitable , but it was against [her]91-hilary nature as well as [her]91-hilary conscience to sit down tamely to endure any thing whatsoever till it did become inevitable . In the first place , [she]91-hilary determined on that which a certain sense of honor , as well as the fear of vexing [him]2284-his should [he]2284-his come [home]3045-home , had hitherto prevented the examining of [[Ascott]97-ascott 's room]2289-ascott 's room , drawers , clothes , and papers . It was a very dreary business — almost like doing the like to [a person who was dead , only without the sad sanctity that belongs to the dead , whose very errors are forgotten and forgiven , who can neither suffer nor make others suffer any more]2290-a person who was dead , only without the sad sanctity that belongs to the dead , whose very errors are forgotten and forgiven , who can neither suffer nor make others suffer any more . Many things [she]91-hilary found , and more [she]91-hilary guessed at — things which stabbed [her]91-hilary to the heart , things that [she]91-hilary never told , not even to [Johanna]93-johanna ; but [she]91-hilary found no clew whatever to [Ascott]97-ascott 's whereabouts , intentions , or connections . One thing , however , struck [her]91-hilary — that most of [his]97-ascott clothes , and all [his]97-ascott somewhat extensive stock of jewelry were gone ; every thing , in short , that could be convertible into money . It was evident that [his]97-ascott flight , sudden as it was , had been premeditated as at least a possibility . This so far was satisfactory . It took away the one haunting fear of [his]97-ascott committing suicide ; and made it likely that [he]97-ascott was still lingering about , hiding from justice and [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , or perhaps waiting for an opportunity to escape from [England]9-england — from the fear that [[his]97-ascott godfather]424-his godfather , even if not prosecuting [him]97-ascott , had the power and doubtless the will completely to crush [his]97-ascott future , wherever [he]97-ascott was known . Where could [he]97-ascott go ? [[His]97-ascott Aunt]428-his aunt tried to think over every word [he]97-ascott had ever let fall about [America]48-america , [Australia]49-australia , or any other place to which [the hopeless outlaws of [this country]2294-this country]2293-the hopeless outlaws of this country fly ; but [she]428-his aunt could recollect nothing to enable [her]428-his aunt to form any conclusion . One thing only [she]428-his aunt was sure of — that if once [he]97-ascott went away , [his]97-ascott own words would come true ; [they]2295-they would never see [his]97-ascott face again . The last tie , the last constraint that bound [him]97-ascott to [home]3045-home and a steady , righteous life would be broken ; [he]97-ascott would go all adrift , be tossed hither and thither on every wave of circumstance — what [he]97-ascott called circumstance — till [Heaven]104-heaven only knew what a total wreck [he]97-ascott might speedily become , or in what forlorn and far off seas [his]97-ascott ruined life might go down . [He]97-ascott , [Ascott Leaf]99-ascott , [the last of the name and family]2297-the last of the name and family . " It can not be ; it shall not be ! "[91-hilary] cried [Hilary]91-hilary . A sharp , bitter cry of resistance to the death ; and [her]91-hilary heart seemed to go out to [the wretched boy]2298-the wretched boy and [her]91-hilary hands to clutch at [him]2298-the wretched boy , as if [he]2298-the wretched boy were drowning , and [she]91-hilary were the only one to save [him]2298-the wretched boy . How could [she]91-hilary do it ? If [she]91-hilary could only get at [him]2298-the wretched boy , by word or letter ! But that seemed impossible , until , turning over scheme after scheme , [she]91-hilary suddenly thought of the one which [so many people]2299-so many people had tried in similar circumstances , and which [she]91-hilary remembered [they]2299-so many people had talked over and laughed over , [they]2299-so many people and [Ascott]99-ascott , one Sunday evening not so very long ago . This was — a Times advertisement . The difficulty how to word it , so as to catch [his]2298-the wretched boy attention and yet escape publicity , was very great , especially as [his]2298-the wretched boy initials were so common . Hundreds of " A. L. 's "[91-hilary] might be wandering away from [home]3045-home , to whom all that [she]91-hilary dared say to call [Ascott]99-ascott back would equally apply . At last a bright thought struck [her]91-hilary . " A. leaf "[91-hilary] ( will a small l ) " will be quite safe wherever found . Come . Saturday . 15 . "[91-hilary] As [she]91-hilary wrote it — this wretched double - entendre — [she]91-hilary was seized with that sudden sense of the ludicrous which sometimes intrudes in such a ghastly fashion in the very midst of great misery . [She]91-hilary burst into uncontrollable laughter , fit after fit ; so violent that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , who came in by chance , was terrified out of [her]94-elizabeth wits , and kneeling beside [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress , implored [her]94-elizabeth to be quiet . At last the paroxysm ended in complete exhaustion . The tension of the last twenty - four hours had given way , and [Hilary]91-hilary knew [her]91-hilary strength was gone . Yet the advertisement ought to be taken to [the Times office]2302-the times office that very night , in order to be inserted without fail on Monday morning . There was but [one person whom [she]91-hilary could trust]2303-one person whom she could trust — [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [She]91-hilary looked at [the girl]307-the girl , who was kneeling beside the sofa , rubbing [her]307-the girl feet , and sometimes casting a glance round , in the quiet way of one well used to nursing , who can find out how [the sufferer]2305-the sufferer is without " fussing "[91-hilary] with questions . [She]91-hilary noticed , probably because [she]91-hilary had seen little of [her]91-hilary of late , a curious change in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . It must have been gradual , but yet its result had never been so apparent before . [Her]91-hilary brusqueness had softened down , and there had come into [her]91-hilary and shone out of [her]91-hilary , spite of all [her]91-hilary natural uncomeliness of person , that beautiful , intangible something , common alike to [peasant]2306-peasant and [queen , as clear to see and as sad to miss in both — womanliness]2307-queen , as clear to see and as sad to miss in both — womanliness . Added thereto was the gentle composure of mein which almost invariably accompanied it , which instinctively makes [you]2308-you fell that in great things or small , whatever [the woman]694-the woman has to do , [she]694-the woman will do it in the womanliest , wisest , and best way . So thought [Miss Hilary]91-hilary as [she]91-hilary lay watching [[her]91-hilary servant]1535-her servant , and then explained to [her]91-hilary the errand upon which [she]91-hilary wished to send [her]91-hilary . Not much explanation , for [she]91-hilary merely gave [her]91-hilary the advertisement to read , and told [her]91-hilary what [she]91-hilary wished done with it . And [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , on [her]94-elizabeth part , asked no questions , but simply listened and obeyed . After [she]91-hilary was gone [Hilary]91-hilary lay on the sofa , passive and motionless . [Her]91-hilary strength and activity seemed to have collapsed at once into that heavy quietness which comes when [one]585-one has endured to the utmost limit of endurance when one feels as if to speak a word or to lift a finger would be as much as life was worth . " Oh , if [I]91-hilary could only go to sleep ! "[91-hilary] was all [she]91-hilary thought . By - and - by sleep did come , and [she]91-hilary was taken far away out of these miseries . By the strange peculiarity of dreams that [we]2312-we so seldom dream about any grief that oppresses [us]2312-we at the time but generally of something quite different , [she]91-hilary thought [she]91-hilary was in [some known unknown land]2313-some known unknown land , lovely and beautiful , with [blue hills rising in the distance]2314-blue hills rising in the distance , and blue seas creeping and curling on to [the shore]2315-the shore . On [this shore]2316-this shore [she]91-hilary was walking with [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , just as [he]98-robert lyon used to be , with [his]98-robert lyon true face and honest voice . [He]98-robert lyon did not talk to [her]91-hilary much ; but [she]91-hilary felt [him]98-robert lyon there , and knew [they]2317-them had but " one heart between [them]2317-them . "[98-robert lyon] A heart which had never once swerved , either from the other ; a heart whole and sound , into which [the least unfaith had never come — that had never known , or recognized even as a possibility , the one first doubt]2318-the least unfaith had never come — that had never known , or recognized even as a possibility , the one first doubt , the ominous — Is it ever so in [this world]1916-this world ? Does [God]105-god ever bring [the faithful man]2320-the faithful man to [the faithful woman]2321-the faithful woman , and make [them]2317-them love [one another]394-one another with a righteous , holy , persistent tenderness , which dare look in [His]98-robert lyon face , nor be ashamed ; which sees in this life only the beginning of the life to come ; and in the closest , most passionate human love something to be held with a loose hand , something frail as glass and brittle as straw , unless it is perfected and sanctified by the love divine ? [Hilary]91-hilary at least believed so . And when at [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's knock [she]91-hilary woke with a start , and saw — not [the sweet sea - shore]2323-the sweet sea - shore and [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , but [the dull parlor]2324-the dull parlor , and the last flicker of the fire , [she]91-hilary thanked [God]105-god that [her]91-hilary dream was not all a dream — that , sharp as [her]91-hilary misery was , it did not touch this — the love of [her]91-hilary heart : [she]91-hilary believed in [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon still . And so [she]91-hilary rose and spoke quite cheerfully , asking [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth how [she]94-elizabeth had managed , and whether the advertisement would be sure to be in on Monday morning . " Yes , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary ; it is sure to be all right . "[91-hilary] And then [the girl]307-the girl hung about [the room]3244-the room in an uneasy way , as if [she]307-the girl had something to tell , which was the fact . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had had an adventure . It was a new thing in [her]94-elizabeth monotonous life ; it brightened [her]94-elizabeth eyes , and flushed [her]94-elizabeth cheeks , and made [her]94-elizabeth old nervousness of manner return . More especially as [she]94-elizabeth was somewhat perplexed , being divided in [her]94-elizabeth mind between the wish [she]94-elizabeth had to tell [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress every thing , and the fear to trouble [her]94-elizabeth , at this troublous time , with any small matter that merely concerned [herself]94-elizabeth . The matter was this . When [she]94-elizabeth had given in [her]94-elizabeth advertisement at [the Times office]2302-the times office , and was standing behind the counter waiting for [her]94-elizabeth change and receipt , there stood beside [her]94-elizabeth [a young man]1903-a young man , also waiting . [She]94-elizabeth had hardly noticed [him]1903-a young man , till on [his]1903-a young man talking to [the clerk]2330-the clerk about some misprint in [his]1903-a young man advertisement , apparently one of the great column of " Want Places , "[1903-a young man] [her]94-elizabeth ear was caught by the unmistakable Stowbury accent . It was the first time [she]94-elizabeth had heard it since [she]94-elizabeth left [home]3045-home , and to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's tenacious nature [home]3045-home in absence had gained an additional charm , had grown to be the one place in [the world]248-the world about which [her]94-elizabeth affections clung . In [these dreary wilds of [London]1-london]2334-these dreary wilds of london , to hear a [Stowbury]2-stowbury tongue , to catch sight of [a Stowbury person]2335-a stowbury person , or even [one who might know [Stowbury]2-stowbury]2336-one who might know stowbury , made [her]94-elizabeth heart leap up with a bound of joy . [She]94-elizabeth turned suddenly , and looked intently at [the young man]3100-the young man , or rather [the lad]422-the lad , for [he]3100-the young man seemed [a mere lad , small , slight , and whiskerless]2339-a mere lad , small , slight , and whiskerless . " Well , [Miss.]4118-miss. [I]3447-the young fellow hope [you]94-elizabeth 'll know [me]3447-the young fellow again next time . "[3447-the young fellow] said [the young fellow]3447-the young fellow . At which remark [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth saw that [he]3447-the young fellow was neither so young nor so simple as [she]94-elizabeth had at first thought . [She]94-elizabeth drew back , very much ashamed , and coloring deeply . Now , if [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ever looked any thing like comely , it was when [she]94-elizabeth blushed ; for [she]94-elizabeth had the delicate skin peculiar to [the young women of [[her]94-elizabeth district]2342-her district]2341-the young women of her district ; and when the blood rushed through it , [no cheek of [lady fair]2344-lady fair]2343-no cheek of lady fair ever assumed a brighter rose . [She]94-elizabeth liked [few people]2348-few people , but those [she]94-elizabeth did like [she]94-elizabeth held very fast . How aged [we]4124-we are growing ! "[94-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , with a smile . Then [she]94-elizabeth asked after [Mrs. Cliffe]128-mrs. cliffe , but got only the brief answer , " [Mother]296-mother 's dead , "[94-elizabeth] given in a tone as if no more inquiries would be welcome . [[His]132-tom two sisters]2359-his two sisters , also , had died of typhus in one week , and [Tom]132-tom had been " on [his]132-tom own hook , "[132-tom] as [he]132-tom expressed it , for the last three years . [He]132-tom was extremely frank and confidential ; told how [he]132-tom had begun life as [a printer]2360-a printer 's " devil , "[132-tom] afterward become [a compositor]2361-a compositor , and [his]132-tom health failing , had left the trade , and gone as [servant]3356-servant to [a literary gentleman]2363-a literary gentleman . When [she]94-elizabeth looked at [him]132-tom , and listened to [him]132-tom , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth involuntarily thought of [Benjamin Franklin]188-benjamin franklin , and of [many more who had raised [themselves]2371-many more who had raised themselves from the ink - pot and the compositor 's desk from the ink - pot and [the compositor]2372-the compositor 's desk]2371-many more who had raised themselves from the ink - pot and the compositor 's desk to fame and eminence , and [she]94-elizabeth fancied that such might be the lot of " little [Tommy Cliffe]132-tom . "[94-elizabeth] Why not ? If so , how excessively proud [she]94-elizabeth should be ! For the moment [she]94-elizabeth had forgotten [her]94-elizabeth errand ; forgotten even [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . It was not till [Tom Cliffe]132-tom asked [her]94-elizabeth where [she]94-elizabeth lived , that [she]94-elizabeth suddenly recollected [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress might not like , under present circumstances , that [[their]2374-their abode]2375-their abode or any thing concerning [them]2374-their should be known to [a Stowbury person]2335-a stowbury person . It was a struggle . [She]94-elizabeth would have liked to see [the lad]422-the lad again ; have liked to talk over with [him]422-the lad [Stowbury]2-stowbury things and [Stowbury people]2378-stowbury people ; but [she]94-elizabeth felt [she]94-elizabeth ought not , and [she]94-elizabeth would not . " Tell [me]94-elizabeth where [you]132-tom live , [Tom]132-tom , and that will do just as well ; at least till [I]94-elizabeth speak to [[my]94-elizabeth mistress]4128-my mistress . [I]94-elizabeth never had [a visitor]1419-a visitor before , and [[my]94-elizabeth mistress]4128-my mistress might not like it . "[94-elizabeth] " [No followers]4131-no followers allowed , eh ? "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth laughed . The idea of [little Tommy Clifie]189-little tommy clifie as [[her]94-elizabeth " follower]4132-her " follower , "[94-elizabeth] seemed so very funny . So [she]94-elizabeth bade [him]189-little tommy clifie good - by ; having , thanks to [his]189-little tommy clifie gay frankness , been made acquainted with all about [him]189-little tommy clifie , but leaving [him]189-little tommy clifie in perfect ignorance concerning [herself]94-elizabeth and [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress . [She]94-elizabeth only smiled when [he]189-little tommy clifie declared contemptuously , and with rather a romantic emphasis , that [he]189-little tommy clifie would hunt [her]94-elizabeth out , though it were half over [London]1-london . This was all [her]94-elizabeth adventure . When [she]94-elizabeth came to tell it , it seemed very little to tell , and [Miss Hilary]91-hilary listened to it rather indifferently , trying hard to remember who [Tommy Cliffe]132-tom was , and to take an interest in [him]189-little tommy clifie because [he]189-little tommy clifie came from [Stowbury]2-stowbury . But [Stowbury]2-stowbury days were so far off now — with such a gulf or pain between . Suddenly the same fear occurred to [her]94-elizabeth that had occurred to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " [The lad]422-the lad did not see the advertisement , [I]94-elizabeth hope ? [You]94-elizabeth did not tell [him]422-the lad about [us]4134-us ? "[94-elizabeth] " [I]94-elizabeth told [him]422-the lad nothing . "[94-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . speaking softly , and looking down . " [I]94-elizabeth did not even mention [any body]3035-any body 's name . "[94-elizabeth] " That was right ; thank [you]94-elizabeth . "[94-elizabeth] But oh , the bitterness of knowing , and feeling sure [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth knew too , the thing for which [she]94-elizabeth thanked [her]94-elizabeth ; and that not to mention [Ascott]99-ascott 's name was the greatest kindness [the faithful servant]2380-the faithful servant could show toward [the family]258-the family . [Ascott Leaf]99-ascott never came [home]3045-home . Day after day appeared the advertisement , sometimes slightly altered , as hope or fear suggested ; but no word , no letter , no answer of any kind reached [the anxious women]2383-the anxious women . By - and - by , moved by [their]2383-the anxious women distress , or perhaps feeling that [the scape - grace]2384-the scape - grace would be safer got rid of if found and dispatched abroad in some decent manner , [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott [himself]97-ascott took measures for privately continuing the search . [Every outward - bound ship]2385-every outward - bound ship was examined ; [every hospital]2386-every hospital visited ; every case of suicide investigated : but in vain . [The unhappy young man]2387-the unhappy young man had disappeared , suddenly and completely , as [many another]2388-many another has disappeared , out of the home circle , and been never heard of more . It is difficult to understand how [a family]1054-a family can possibly hear such a sorrow , did [we]2390-we not know that [many]3189-many have had to bear it , and have borne it , with all its load of agonizing suspense , slowly dying hope , " The hope that keeps alive despair , "[3219-the leaf family] settling down into a permanent grief , compared to which the grief for loss by death is light and endurable . [The Leaf family]3219-the leaf family went through all this . Was it better or worse for [them]2383-the anxious women that [their]2383-the anxious women anguish had to be secret ? that there were [no friends]2393-no friends to pity , inquire , or console ? that [Johanna]93-johanna had to sit hour by hour and day by day in [the solitary parlor]1501-the solitary parlor , [Selina]92-selina having soon gone back to [her]92-selina old ways of " gadding about , "[91-hilary] and [her]92-selina marriage preparations ; and that , hardest of all , [Hilary]91-hilary had on the Monday morning to return to [Kensington]40-kensington and work , work , work , as nothing were amiss ? But it was natural that all this should tell upon [her]91-hilary ; and one day [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder said , after a long covert observation of [her]91-hilary face , " [[My]168-miss balquidder dear]3016-my dear , [you]91-hilary look ill . Is there any thing troubling [you]91-hilary ? [[My]168-miss balquidder young people]3817-my young people always tell [me]168-miss balquidder [their]3817-my young people troubles , bodily or mental . [I]168-miss balquidder doctor both . "[168-miss balquidder] " [I]91-hilary am sure of it , "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary , with a sad smile , but entered into no explanation , and [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder had the wise kindliness to inquire no further . Nevertheless , on some errand or other [she]168-miss balquidder came to [Kensington]40-kensington nearly every evening and took [Hilary]91-hilary back with [her]168-miss balquidder to sleep at [No . 15]39-no . 15 . " [[Your]91-hilary sister]4063-your sister [Selina]92-selina must wish to have [you]91-hilary with [her]92-selina as much as possible till [she]92-selina is married . "[168-miss balquidder] [she]168-miss balquidder said , as a reason for doing this . And [Hilary]91-hilary acquiesced , but silently , as [we]2395-we often do acquiesce in what ought to be a truth , but which [we]2395-we know to be the saddest , most painful falsehood . For [Selina]92-selina , it became plain to see , was one of [the family]258-the family no more . After [her]92-selina first burst of self - reproachful grief [she]92-selina took [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott 's view of [[her]92-selina nephew]369-her nephew 's loss — that it was a good riddance ; went on calmly with [her]92-selina bridal preparations , and seemed only afraid lest any thing should interfere to prevent [her]92-selina marriage . But the danger was apparently tided over . No news of [Ascott]97-ascott came . Even the daily inquiries for [him]97-ascott by [[his]97-ascott creditors]2398-his creditors had ceased . [[His]97-ascott Aunt]428-his aunt [Selina]92-selina was beginning to breathe freely , when , the morning before the wedding day , as [they]2400-they were all sitting in the midst of white finery , but as sadly and silently as if it were a funeral , [a person]2060-a person was suddenly shown in " on business . "[2060-a person] It was [a detective officer sent to find out from [[Ascott Leaf]99-ascott 's aunts]2403-ascott leaf 's aunts]2402-a detective officer sent to find out from ascott leaf 's aunts whether a certain description of [him]97-ascott , in a printed hand - bill , was correct . For [[his]97-ascott principal creditor]2404-his principal creditor , exasperated , had determined on thus advertising [him]97-ascott in the public papers as having " absconded . "[2404-his principal creditor] Had a thunder - bolt fallen in [the little parlor]520-the little parlor [the three aunts]2017-the three aunts could not have been more utterly overwhelmed . [They]2017-the three aunts made no " scene"—a[2404-his principal creditor] certain sense of pride kept [these poor gentlewomen]2407-these poor gentlewomen from betraying [their]2407-these poor gentlewomen misery to [a strange man]2408-a strange man ; though [he]2408-a strange man was [a very civil man]2409-a very civil man , and having delivered [himself]2408-a strange man of [his]2408-a strange man errand , like [an automaton]1361-an automaton , sat looking into [his]2408-a strange man hat , and taking no notice of aught around [him]2408-a strange man . [He]2408-a strange man was accustomed to this sort of thing . [Hilary]91-hilary was the first to recover [herself]91-hilary . [She]91-hilary glanced round at [[her]91-hilary sisters]302-her sisters , but [they]302-her sisters had not a word to say . In any crisis of family difficulty [they]302-her sisters always left [her]91-hilary to take the helm . Rapidly [she]91-hilary ran over in [her]91-hilary mind all the consequences that would arise from this new trouble — the public disgrace ; [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott 's anger and annoyance , not that [she]91-hilary cared much for this , except so far as it would affect [Selina]92-selina ; lastly , the death - blow it was to any possible hope of reclaiming [the poor prodigal]2412-the poor prodigal . Who [she]91-hilary did not believe was dead , but still , fondly trusted [he]97-ascott would return one day from [his]97-ascott wanderings and [his]97-ascott swine 's husks , to have the fatted calf killed for [him]97-ascott and glad tears shed over [him]97-ascott . But after being advertised as " absconded , "[91-hilary] [Ascott]97-ascott never would , never could , come [home]3045-home any [home]3045-home . Taking as cool and business - like a tone as [she]91-hilary could , [she]91-hilary returned the paper to [the detective]2415-the detective . " This is a summary proceeding . Is there no way of avoiding it ? "[91-hilary] " One , [Miss]4139-miss , "[777-the man] replied [the man]777-the man , very respectfully . " If [the family]258-the family would pay the debt . "[777-the man] " Do [you]91-hilary know how much it is ? "[91-hilary] " Eighty pounds . "[91-hilary] " Ah ! "[777-the man] That hopeless sigh of [Johanna]93-johanna 's was sufficient answer , though [no one]3371-no one spoke . But in desperate cases [some women]1837-some women acquire a desperate courage , or rather it is less courage than faith — the faith which is said to " remove mountains"—the[91-hilary] belief that to the very last there must be something to be done , and , if it can be done , [they]1837-some women will have strength to do it . True , [the mountain]2419-the mountain may not be removed , but the mere act of faith , or courage sometimes teaches how to climb over it . " Very well . Take this paper back to [[your]91-hilary employer]4141-your employer . [He]4141-your employer must be aware that [his]4141-your employer only chance of payment is by suppressing it . If [he]4141-your employer will do that , in two days [he]4141-your employer shall hear from [us]4142-us , and [we]4142-us will make arrangements about paying the debt . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary said this , to [[her]91-hilary sisters]302-her sisters ' utter astonishment ; so utter that [they]302-her sisters let [her]91-hilary say it , and let [the detective]2415-the detective go away with a civil " Good morning , "[91-hilary] before [they]302-her sisters could interfere or contradict by a word . " Paying the debt ! [Hilary]91-hilary , what have [you]91-hilary promised ? It is an impossibility . "[91-hilary] " Like [the Frenchman]4143-the frenchman 's answer to [his]4143-the frenchman mistress—'Madame , if it had been possible it would have been done already ; if it is impossible , it shall be done . ' It shall , [I]92-selina say . "[92-selina] " [I]92-selina wonder [you]91-hilary can jest about [our]4142-us misfortunes , "[92-selina] said [Selina]92-selina , in [her]92-selina most querulous voice . " [I]92-selina 'm not jesting . But where is the use of sitting down to moan ! [I]92-selina mean what [I]92-selina say . The thing must be done . "[92-selina] [Her]92-selina eyes glittered — [her]92-selina small , red lips were set tightly together . " If it is not done , [sisters]3046-sisters — if [his]4143-the frenchman public disgrace is not prevented , do n't [you]3046-sisters see the result ? Not as regards [your]3046-sisters marriage , [Selina]92-selina — [the man]777-the man must be [a coward who would refuse to marry [a woman [he]4143-the frenchman cared for]4147-a woman he cared for , even though [[her]4147-a woman he cared for nearest kinsman]4148-her nearest kinsman had been hanged at [the Old Bailey]51-the old bailey]4146-a coward who would refuse to marry a woman he cared for , even though her nearest kinsman had been hanged at the old bailey — but Ascott [himself]4143-the frenchman . [The boy]375-the boy is not [a bad boy]4150-a bad boy , though [he]375-the boy has done wickedly ; but there is a difference between a wicked act and a wicked nature . [I]92-selina mean to save [him]4143-the frenchman if [I]92-selina can . "[92-selina] " How ? "[91-hilary] " By saving [his]4143-the frenchman good name ; by paying the debt . "[91-hilary] " And where on earth shall [you]91-hilary get the money ? "[91-hilary] " [I]91-hilary will go to [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder and — "[91-hilary] " Borrow it ? "[91-hilary] " No , never ! [I]91-hilary would as soon think of stealing it . "[91-hilary] Then controlling [herself]2422-herself , [Hilary]91-hilary explained that [she]91-hilary meant to ask [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder to arrange for [her]91-hilary with [the creditor]2423-the creditor to pay the eighty pounds by certain weekly or monthly installments , to be deducted from [her]91-hilary salary at [Kensington]40-kensington . " It is not a very great favor to ask of [her]91-hilary : merely that [she]91-hilary should say , ' [This young woman]1076-this young woman is employed by [me]91-hilary : [I]91-hilary believe [her]91-hilary to be honest , respectable , and so forth ; also , that when [she]91-hilary makes a promise to pay , [she]91-hilary will to the best of [her]91-hilary power perform it . ' A character which is at present rather a novelty in [the Leaf family]3219-the leaf family . "[91-hilary] " [Hilary]91-hilary ! "[91-hilary] " [I]91-hilary am growing bitter , [Johanna]93-johanna ; [I]91-hilary know [I]91-hilary am . Why should [we]4153-we suffer so much ! Why should [we]4153-we be always dragged down — down — in this way ? Why should [we]4153-we never have had any one to cherish and take care of [us]4153-we , like [other women]3764-other women ! Why — "[91-hilary] [Miss Leaf]91-hilary laid [her]91-hilary finger on [[her]91-hilary child]3364-her child 's lips — " Because it is the will of [God]105-god . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary flung [herself]91-hilary on [[her]91-hilary dear old sister]2425-her dear old sister 's neck and burst into tears . [Selina]92-selina too cried a little , and said that [she]92-selina should like to help in paying the debt , if [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott had no objection . And then [she]91-hilary turned back to [her]91-hilary white splendors , and became absorbed in the annoyance of there being far too much clematis and far too little orange blossom in the bridal bonnet — which it was now too late to change . A little , also , [she]91-hilary vexed [herself]91-hilary about the risk of confiding in [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder , lest by any chance the story might get round to [Russell Square]3-russell square ; and was urgent that at least nothing should be said or done until after to - morrow . [She]91-hilary was determined to be married , and dreaded any slip between the cup and lip . But [Hilary]91-hilary was resolute . " [I]91-hilary said that in two days the matter should be arranged , and so it must be , or [the man]777-the man will think [we]4156-we too break [our]4156-we promises . "[91-hilary] " [You]91-hilary can assure [him]777-the man to the contrary , "[92-selina] said [Selina]92-selina , with dignity . " In fact , why ca n't [you]91-hilary arrange with [him]777-the man without going at all to [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder ? "[92-selina] Again the fierce , bitter expression returned to [Hilary]91-hilary 's face . " [You]91-hilary forget , [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's honest name is [his]777-the man only guarantee against the dishonesty of [ours]4156-we . "[91-hilary] " [Hilary]91-hilary , [you]91-hilary disgrace [us]4156-we — disgrace [me]91-hilary — speaking in such a way . Are [we]4156-we not [gentle women]4157-gentle women ? "[91-hilary] " [I]92-selina do n't know , [Selina]92-selina . [I]92-selina do n't seem to know or to feel any thing , except that [I]92-selina would live on bread and water in order to live peaceably and honestly . Oh , will it ever , ever be ? "[92-selina] [She]92-selina walked up and down [the parlor]313-the parlor , disarranging the white draperies which lay about , feeling unutterable contempt for [them]2427-them and for [[her]92-selina sister]559-her sister . Angry and miserable , with every nerve quivering , [she]92-selina was at war with [the whole world]361-the whole world . This feeling lasted even when , after some discussion , [she]92-selina gained [her]92-selina point and was on [her]92-selina way to call on [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder . [She]92-selina went round and round [the Square]3596-the square many times , trying to fix in [her]92-selina mind word for word what [she]92-selina meant to say ; revealing no more of the family history than was absolutely necessary , and stating [her]92-selina business in the briefest , hardest , most matter - of - fact way — putting it as a transaction between [employer]2431-employer and employed , in which there was no more favor asked or bestowed than could possibly be avoided . And as the sharp east wind blew across [her]92-selina at every corner , minute by minute [she]92-selina felt [herself]92-selina growing more fierce , and hard , and cold . " This will never do . [I]92-selina shall be wicked by - and - by . [I]92-selina must go in and get it over . "[92-selina] Perhaps it was as well . Well for [her]92-selina , morally as physically , that there should have been that sudden change from the blighting weather outside to [the warm , well - lighted room where [the good rich woman]2433-the good rich woman sat at [her]2433-the good rich woman early and solitary tea]2432-the warm , well - lighted room where the good rich woman sat at her early and solitary tea . Very solitary it looked — the little table in [the centre of [that large handsome parlor]2435-that large handsome parlor]2434-the centre of that large handsome parlor , with the one cup and saucer , the one easy - chair . And as [Hilary]91-hilary entered [she]91-hilary noticed , amidst all this comfort and luxury , the still , grave , almost sad expression which [solitary people]2436-solitary people always get to wear . But the next minute [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder had turned round , and risen , smiling . " [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , how very kind of [you]91-hilary to come and see [me]168-miss balquidder ! Just the day before the wedding , too , when [you]91-hilary must be so busy ! Sit down and tell [me]168-miss balquidder all about it . But first , [[my]168-miss balquidder dear]3016-my dear , how wet [your]91-hilary boots are ! Let [me]168-miss balquidder take them off at once . "[168-miss balquidder] Which [she]168-miss balquidder did , sending for [her]168-miss balquidder own big slippers , and putting them on the tiny feet with [her]168-miss balquidder own hands . [Hilary]91-hilary submitted — in truth [she]91-hilary was too much surprised to resist . [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder had , like [most folk]2437-most folk , [her]168-miss balquidder opinions or " crotchets"—as[168-miss balquidder] they might be — and one of them was , to keep [her]168-miss balquidder business and friendly relations entirely distinct and apart . Whenever [she]168-miss balquidder went to [Kensington]40-kensington or [[her]168-miss balquidder other establishments]2438-her other establishments [she]168-miss balquidder was always emphatically " [the mistress"—a]4159-the mistress"—a[168-miss balquidder] kindly and even [motherly mistress]2439-motherly mistress , certainly , but still authoritative , decided . Moreover , it was [her]168-miss balquidder invariable rule to treat all [[her]168-miss balquidder employees]2440-her employees alike—"making [no step - bairns]4160-no step - bairns "[168-miss balquidder] among [them]2440-her employees . Thus for some time it had happened that [Hilary]91-hilary had been , and felt [herself]91-hilary to be , just [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , [the book keeper]2441-the book keeper , doing [her]91-hilary duty to [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder , [[her]91-hilary employer]2442-her employer , and neither expecting nor attaining any closer relation . But in [[her]91-hilary own house]2443-her own house , or it might be from the sudden apparition of that young face at [[her]91-hilary lonely fireside]2444-her lonely fireside , [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder appeared quite different . A small thing touches a heart that is sore with trouble . When [the good woman]2445-the good woman rose up — after patting the little feet , and approving loudly of the woolen stockings — [she]2445-the good woman saw that [Hilary]91-hilary 's whole face was quivering with the effort to keep back [her]91-hilary tears . There are [some woman of whom [one]585-one feels by instinct that [they]2446-some woman of whom one feels by instinct that they were were]2446-some woman of whom one feels by instinct that they were , as [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder had once jokingly said of [herself]168-miss balquidder , specially meant to be [mothers]512-mothers . And though , in its strange providence , [Heaven]104-heaven often denies the maternity , it can not and does not mean to shut up the well - spring of that maternal passion — truly a passion to [such women as these]2449-such women as these , almost as strong as the passion of love — but lets the stream , which might otherwise have blessed [one child]2450-one child or [one family]2139-one family , flow out wide and far , blessing wherever it goes . In a tone that somehow touched every fibre of [Hilary]91-hilary 's heart , [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder said , placing [her]91-hilary on a low chair beside [her]168-miss balquidder own . " [[My]168-miss balquidder dear]3016-my dear , [you]91-hilary are in trouble . [I]168-miss balquidder saw it a week or two ago , but did not like to speak . Could n't [you]91-hilary say it out , and let [me]168-miss balquidder help [you]91-hilary ? [You]91-hilary need not be afraid . [I]168-miss balquidder never tell any thing , and [every body]3430-every body tells every thing to [me]168-miss balquidder . "[168-miss balquidder] That was true . Added to [this said mother - liness of [hers]168-miss balquidder]2452-this said mother - liness of hers , [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder , possessed that faculty , which [some people]485-some people have in a remarkable degree , and [some — very good people]2454-some — very good people too — are totally deficient in , of attracting confidence . The secrets [she]168-miss balquidder had been trusted with , the romances [she]168-miss balquidder had been mixed up in , the Quixotic acts [she]168-miss balquidder had been called upon to perform during [her]168-miss balquidder long life , would have made a novel — or several novels — such as [no novelist]2455-no novelist could dare to write , for [the public]2456-the public would condemn them as impossible and unnatural . But all this experience — though happily it could never be put into a book — had given to [the woman]694-the woman [herself]694-the woman a view of human nature at once so large , lenient , and just , that [she]694-the woman was [the best person possible to hear the strange and pitiful story of [young Ascott Leaf]99-ascott]2458-the best person possible to hear the strange and pitiful story of young ascott leaf . How it came out [Hilary]91-hilary hardly knew ; [she]91-hilary seemed to have told very little , and yet [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder guessed it all . It did not appear to surprise or shock [her]91-hilary . [She]91-hilary neither began to question nor preach ; [she]91-hilary only laid [her]91-hilary hand , [her]91-hilary large , motherly , protecting hand , on the bowed head , saying . " How much [you]91-hilary must have suffered , [[my]91-hilary poor bairn]4163-my poor bairn ! "[91-hilary] The soft Scotch tone and word — the grave , quiet Scotch manner , implying more than it even expressed — was it wonderful if underlying as well as outside influences made [Hilary]91-hilary completely give way ? [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had had [a mother]3812-a mother , who died when [he]98-robert lyon was seventeen , but of whom [he]98-robert lyon kept the tenderest remembrance , often saying that of all [the ladies [he]98-robert lyon had met with in [the world]248-the world]2460-the ladies he had met with in the world there was none equal to [her]3812-a mother — [the strong , tender , womanly peasant woman]2462-the strong , tender , womanly peasant woman — refined in mind and word and ways — though to the last day of [her]3812-a mother life [she]3812-a mother spoke broad Scotch , and did the work of [[her]3812-a mother cottage]2463-her cottage with [her]3812-a mother own hands . It seems as if [that mother]2464-that mother — toward whom [Hilary]91-hilary 's fancy had clung , lovingly as [a woman]669-a woman ought to cling , above all others , to [the mother of [the man [she]3812-a mother loves]2467-the man she loves]2466-the mother of the man she loves — were speaking to [her]91-hilary now , comforting [her]91-hilary and helping [her]91-hilary — comfort and help that it would have been sweeter to receive from [her]91-hilary than from [any woman living]2468-any woman living . A mere fancy ; but in [her]91-hilary state of long uncontrolled excitement it took such possession of [her]91-hilary that [Hilary]91-hilary fell on [her]91-hilary knees and hid [her]91-hilary face in [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's lap , sobbing aloud . [The other]3271-the other was a little surprised ; it was not [her]91-hilary Scotch way to yield to emotion before [folk]2470-folk ; but [she]91-hilary was [a wise woman]2471-a wise woman [she]91-hilary asked no questions , merely held the quivering hands and smoothed the throbbing head , till composure returned . [Some people]485-some people have a magical , mesmeric power of soothing and controlling ; it was [hers]91-hilary . When [she]91-hilary took the poor face between [her]91-hilary hands , and looked straight into the eyes , with , " There , [you]91-hilary are better now , "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary returned the gaze as steadily , nay , smilingly , and rose . " Now , may [I]91-hilary tell [you]91-hilary [my]91-hilary business ? "[91-hilary] " Certainly , [[my]91-hilary dear]3016-my dear . When [[one]585-one 's friends]4166-one 's friends are in trouble , the last thing one ought to do is to sit down beside [them]4166-one 's friends and moan . Did [you]91-hilary come to ask [my]91-hilary advice , or had [you]91-hilary any definite plan of [your]91-hilary own ? "[91-hilary] " [I]91-hilary had . "[91-hilary] And [Hilary]91-hilary told it . " A very good plan , and very generous in [you]91-hilary to think of it . But [I]91-hilary see two strong objections : first , whether it can be carried out ; secondly , whether it ought . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary shrank , sensitively . " Not on [my]91-hilary account , [[my]91-hilary dear]3016-my dear , but [your]91-hilary own . [I]91-hilary often see [people]3210-people making martyrs of [themselves]3210-people for [some worthless character on whom the sacrifice is utterly wasted]4169-some worthless character on whom the sacrifice is utterly wasted . [I]91-hilary object to this , as [I]91-hilary would object to throwing [myself]91-hilary or [[my]91-hilary friend]4170-my friend into [a blazing house]4171-a blazing house , unless [I]91-hilary were morally certain there was a life to be saved . Is there in this case ? "[91-hilary] " [I]91-hilary think there is ! [I]91-hilary trust in [Heaven]104-heaven there is ! "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary , earnestly . There was both pleasure and pity expressed in [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's countenance as [she]168-miss balquidder replied , " Be it so : that is a matter on which [no one]3371-no one can judge except [yourself]91-hilary . But on the other matter [you]91-hilary ask [my]168-miss balquidder advice , and [I]168-miss balquidder must give it . To maintain [two ladies]4173-two ladies and pay a debt of eighty pounds out of one hundred a year is simply impossible . "[168-miss balquidder] " With [Johanna]93-johanna 's income and [mine]168-miss balquidder it will be a hundred and twenty pounds and some odd shillings a year . "[91-hilary] " [[You]91-hilary accurate [girl]3026-girl]4174-you accurate girl ! But even with this it can not be done , unless [you]91-hilary were to live in a manner so restricted in the commonest comforts that at [[your]91-hilary sister]4063-your sister 's age [she]4063-your sister would be sure to suffer . [You]91-hilary must look on the question from all sides , [[my]2473-my dear]3016-my dear . [You]91-hilary must be just to [others]525-others as well as to [that young man , who seems never to — But [I]2473-my will leave [him]4179-that young man , who seems never to — but i will leave him unjudged unjudged]4179-that young man , who seems never to — but i will leave him unjudged . "[2473-my] [They]2473-my were both silent for a minute , and then [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder said : " [I]168-miss balquidder feel certain there is but one rational way of accomplishing the thing if [you]91-hilary are bent upon doing it , if [your]91-hilary own judgment and conscience tell [you]91-hilary it ought to be done . Is it so ? "[168-miss balquidder] " Yes , "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary , firmly . [The old Scotswoman]2474-the old scotswoman took [her]91-hilary hand with a warm pressure . " Very well . [I]2474-the old scotswoman do n't blame [you]91-hilary . [I]2474-the old scotswoman might have done the same [myself]2474-the old scotswoman . Now to [my]2474-the old scotswoman plan . [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , have [you]91-hilary known [me]2474-the old scotswoman long enough to confer on [me]2474-the old scotswoman the benediction — one of the few that [we]4180-we [rich folk]4181-rich folk possess ' It is more blessed to give than to receive ? ' "[2474-the old scotswoman] " [I]168-miss balquidder do n't quite understand . "[168-miss balquidder] " Then allow [me]168-miss balquidder to explain . [I]168-miss balquidder happen to know [this creditor of [[your]91-hilary nephew]3526-your nephew 's]4182-this creditor of your nephew 's . [He]4182-this creditor of your nephew 's being [a tailor and outfitter]4184-a tailor and outfitter , [we]4180-we have had dealings together in former times , and [I]168-miss balquidder know [him]4182-this creditor of your nephew 's to be [a hard man]2093-a hard man , [an unprincipled man]4186-an unprincipled man , such a one as [no young woman]4187-no young woman should have to do with , even in business relations . To be in [his]4182-this creditor of your nephew 's power , as [you]91-hilary would be for some years if [your]91-hilary scheme of gradual payment were carried out , is the last thing [I]168-miss balquidder should desire for [you]91-hilary . Let [me]168-miss balquidder suggest another way . Take [me]168-miss balquidder for [[your]91-hilary creditor]4188-your creditor instead of [him]4182-this creditor of your nephew 's . Pay [him]4182-this creditor of your nephew 's at once , and [I]168-miss balquidder will write [you]91-hilary a check for the amount . "[168-miss balquidder] The thing was put so delicately , in such an ordinary manner , as if it were a mere business arrangement , that at first [Hilary]91-hilary hardly perceived all it implied . When [she]91-hilary did — when [she]91-hilary found that it was in plain terms a gift or loan of eighty pounds offered by [a person almost a stranger]2475-a person almost a stranger , [she]91-hilary was at first quite bewildered . Then ( ah ! let [us]2476-us not blame [her]91-hilary if [she]91-hilary carried to a morbid excess that noble independence which is the foundation of all true dignity in [man]3369-man or [woman]352-woman ) [she]91-hilary shrunk back into [herself]91-hilary , overcome with annoyance and shame . At last [she]91-hilary forced [herself]91-hilary to say , though the words came out rather coldly . " [You]91-hilary are very good , and [I]91-hilary am exceedingly obliged to [you]91-hilary ; but [I]91-hilary never borrowed money in [my]91-hilary life . It is quite impossible . "[91-hilary] " Very well ; [I]168-miss balquidder can understand [your]91-hilary feelings . [I]168-miss balquidder beg [your]91-hilary pardon , "[168-miss balquidder] replied [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder , also somewhat coldly . [They]2479-they sat silent and awkward , and then [the elderly lady]2480-the elderly lady took out a pencil and began to make calculations in [her]2480-the elderly lady memorandum book . " [I]2480-the elderly lady am reckoning what is the largest sum per month that [you]91-hilary could reasonably be expected to spare , and how [you]91-hilary may make the most of what remains . Are [you]91-hilary aware that [[London]1-london lodgings]1508-london lodgings are very expensive ? [I]2480-the elderly lady am thinking that if [you]91-hilary were to exchange out of [the Kensington shop]4190-the kensington shop into another [I]2480-the elderly lady have at [Richmond]27-richmond , [I]2480-the elderly lady could offer [you]91-hilary [the first floor above [it]4190-the kensington shop]4191-the first floor above it for much less rent than [you]91-hilary pay [Mrs. Jones]153-mrs. jones ; and [you]91-hilary could have [[your]91-hilary sister]4063-your sister living with [you]91-hilary . "[2480-the elderly lady] " Ah ! that would make [us]4193-us both so much happier ! How good [you]91-hilary are ! "[2480-the elderly lady] " [You]91-hilary will see [I]168-miss balquidder only wish to help [you]91-hilary to help [yourself]91-hilary ; not to put [you]91-hilary under any obligation . Though [I]168-miss balquidder can not see any thing so very terrible in [your]91-hilary being slightly indebted to [an old woman]3726-an old woman , who has [neither chick]4195-neither chick nor [child]3052-child , and is at perfect liberty to do what [she]3726-an old woman likes with [her]3726-an old woman own . "[168-miss balquidder] There was a pathos in the tone which smote [Hilary]91-hilary into quick contrition . " Forgive [me]2480-the elderly lady ! But [I]2480-the elderly lady have such a horror of borrowing money — [you]91-hilary must know why after what [I]2480-the elderly lady have told [you]91-hilary of [[our]4193-us family]3536-our family . [You]91-hilary must surely understand — "[2480-the elderly lady] " [I]2480-the elderly lady do fully ; but there are limits even to independence . [A person who , for [his]4198-a person who , for his own pleasure , is ready to take money from any body and every body , without the slightest prospect or intention of returning it , is quite different from a friend who in a case of emergency accepts help from another friend , being ready and willing to take every means of repayment , as i knew you were , and meant you to be own pleasure , is ready to take money from any body and every body , without the slightest prospect or intention of returning it , is quite different from [a friend who in a case of emergency accepts help from [another friend]4200-another friend , being ready and willing to take every means of repayment , as [I]2480-the elderly lady knew [you]91-hilary were , and meant [you]91-hilary to be]4199-a friend who in a case of emergency accepts help from another friend , being ready and willing to take every means of repayment , as i knew you were , and meant you to be]4198-a person who , for his own pleasure , is ready to take money from any body and every body , without the slightest prospect or intention of returning it , is quite different from a friend who in a case of emergency accepts help from another friend , being ready and willing to take every means of repayment , as i knew you were , and meant you to be . [I]2480-the elderly lady meant , as [you]91-hilary suggested , to stop out of [your]91-hilary salary so much per month , till [I]2480-the elderly lady had [my]2480-the elderly lady eighty pounds sate back again . "[2480-the elderly lady] " But suppose [you]91-hilary never had it back ? [I]168-miss balquidder am young and strong ; still [I]168-miss balquidder might fall ill — [I]168-miss balquidder might die , and [you]91-hilary never be repaid . "[168-miss balquidder] " Yes , [I]168-miss balquidder should , "[168-miss balquidder] said [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder , with a serious smile . " [You]91-hilary forget , [[my]168-miss balquidder dear bairn]4201-my dear bairn , ' Inasmuch as [ye]91-hilary have done it to one of [these little ones]4202-these little ones , [ye]91-hilary have done it unto [ME]168-miss balquidder . ' ' [He]4203-he that giveth to [the poor]1105-the poor lendeth to [the LORD]3119-the lord . "[168-miss balquidder] There was something at once solemn and a little sad in the way [the old lady]1551-the old lady spoke . [Hilary]91-hilary forgot [her]91-hilary own side of the subject ; [her]91-hilary pride , [her]91-hilary humiliation . " But do [you]91-hilary not think , [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder , that [one]585-one ought to work on , struggle on , to the last extremity , before [one]585-one accepts an obligation , most of all a money obligation ? "[91-hilary] " [I]91-hilary do , as a general principle . Yet money is not the greatest thing in [this world]1916-this world , that a pecuniary debt should be the worst to bear .
