[She]94-elizabeth was but [a woman]669-a woman , poor thing ! and [two tiny rooms of [her]94-elizabeth own , with [Tom]132-tom to care for and look after]4508-two tiny rooms of her own , with tom to care for and look after , seemed [a far happier home than [that great house]4510-that great house , where [she]94-elizabeth had not only [her]94-elizabeth own work to do , but the responsibility of teaching and taking charge of [that careless , stupid , pretty Esther , who had all the forwardness , untidiness , and unconscientiousness of a regular London maid - servant]4511-that careless , stupid , pretty esther , who had all the forwardness , untidiness , and unconscientiousness of a regular london maid - servant]4509-a far happier home than that great house , where she had not only her own work to do , but the responsibility of teaching and taking charge of that careless , stupid , pretty esther , who had all the forwardness , untidiness , and unconscientiousness of a regular london maid - servant , and was a sore trial to [the staid , steady Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [Tom]132-tom consoled [her]94-elizabeth , in [his]132-tom careless but affectionate way ; and another silent consolation was the "[4127-master] little bits of things , " bought out of [her]94-elizabeth additional wages , which [she]94-elizabeth began to put by in [her]94-elizabeth box — sticks and straws for the new sweet nest that was [a - building]4512-a - building : a metal teapot , two neat glass salt - cellars , and , awful extravagance!—two real second - hand silver spoons — [Tom]132-tom did so like having things nice about [him]132-tom ! These purchases , picked up at stray times , were solid , substantial and useful ; domestic rather than personal ; and all with a view to [Tom]132-tom rather than [herself]94-elizabeth . [She]94-elizabeth hid them with a magpie - like closeness , for [Esther]201-esther and [she]201-esther shared [the same room]4513-the same room ; but sometimes when [Esther]201-esther was asleep [she]94-elizabeth would peep at [them]4514-them with an anxious , lingering tenderness , as if [they]4514-them made more of an assured reality what even now seemed so very like a dream . — Except , indeed , on those Sunday nights when [Tom]132-tom and [she]94-elizabeth went to [church]396-church together and afterward took a walk , but always parted at the corner of [the square]3596-the square . [She]94-elizabeth never brought [him]132-tom in to [the house]344-the house , nor spoke of [him]132-tom to [[her]94-elizabeth fellow servants]4518-her fellow servants . How much [they]4518-her fellow servants guessed of [her]94-elizabeth engagement [she]94-elizabeth neither knew nor cared . [Mrs. Ascott]99-ascott , too , had apparently quite forgotten it . [She]94-elizabeth seemed to take as little interest in [[her]94-elizabeth servants]4519-her servants ' affairs as [they]4519-her servants in [hers]94-elizabeth . Nevertheless , ignorant as [the lower regions]4520-the lower regions were in general of what was passing in [the upper]4521-the upper , occasionally rumors began to reach [the kitchen]253-the kitchen that "[4127-master] [Master]4127-master had been a - blowing up [Missis]134-missis , rather ! " And once , after the solemn dinner , with three footmen to wait on [two people]4523-two people , was over , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , passing through [the hall]4524-the hall , caught [the said domestics]4525-the said domestics laughing together , and saying it was "[134-missis] as good as a play ; cat and dog was nothing to it . " After which "[134-missis] the rows up stairs " became a favorite joke in [[the servants]4364-the servants ' hall]4365-the servants ' hall . But still [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott went out daily after breakfast , and came [home]3045-home to dinner ; and [Mrs. Ascott]99-ascott spent the morning in [[her]99-ascott private sitting room]4529-her private sitting room , or "[4127-master] boudoir , " as [she]99-ascott called it ; lunched , and drove out in [[her]99-ascott handsome carriage]4530-her handsome carriage , with [[her]99-ascott footman]4531-her footman behind ; dressed elegantly for dinner , and presided at [her]99-ascott own table with an air of magnificent satisfaction in all things . [She]99-ascott had perfectly accommodated [herself]99-ascott to [her]99-ascott new position ; and if under [her]99-ascott satins and laces beat a solitary , dissatisfied , or aching heart , it was [nobody]357-nobody 's business but [her]99-ascott own . At least , [she]99-ascott kept up the splendid sham with a most creditable persistency . But all shams are dangerous things . Be the surface ever so smooth and green , it will crack sometimes , and a faint wreath of smoke betray the inward volcano . The like had happened once or twice , as on the day when [the men - servants]4533-the men - servants were so intensely amused . Also [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , when putting in order [[[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's bedroom]4535-her mistress 's bedroom , which was about the hour [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott left for [the city]1745-the city , had several times seen [Mrs. Ascott]99-ascott come in [there]3030-there suddenly , white and trembling . Once , so agitated was [she]99-ascott , that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had brought [her]99-ascott a glass of water ; and instead of being angry or treating [her]99-ascott with the distant dignity which [she]94-elizabeth had always kept up [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress had said , almost in the old Stowbury tone , "[4127-master] Thank [you]2603-you , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " However , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had the wisdom to take no notice , but to slip from [the room]3244-the room , and keep [her]94-elizabeth own counsel . At last one day the smouldering domestic earthquake broke out . There was "[94-elizabeth] a precious good row , " [the footman]4370-the footman suspected , at the breakfast - table ; and after breakfast , [Master]4541-master , without waiting for the usual attendance of [that functionary]4542-that functionary , with [his]4541-master hat and gloves and a Hansom cab had flung [himself]4541-master out at the hall door , slamming it after [him]4541-master with a noise that startled [the whole house]4543-the whole house . Shortly afterward ["[94-elizabeth] Missis]134-missis 's " bell had rung violently , and [she]99-ascott had been found lying on the floor of [[her]99-ascott bedroom]812-her bedroom in a dead faint , [[her]99-ascott maid]4545-her maid , [a foolish little Frenchwoman]4546-a foolish little frenchwoman , screaming over [her]99-ascott . [The frightened servants]4547-the frightened servants gathered round in a cluster , but [nobody]357-nobody attempted to touch [the poor lady]496-the poor lady , who lay rigid and helpless , hearing none of the comments that were freely made upon [her]496-the poor lady , or the conjectures as to what [Master]4127-master had done or said that produced this state of things . [Mistress]278-mistress [she]278-mistress was , and [these four or five woman]4552-these four or five woman , [[her]99-ascott servants]4519-her servants , had lived in [[her]99-ascott house]4554-her house for months , but [nobody]357-nobody loved [her]278-mistress ; [nobody]357-nobody knew any thing about [her]278-mistress ; [nobody]357-nobody thought of doing aught for [her]278-mistress , till [a kitchen - maid , probably out of former experience in some domestic emergency]4558-a kitchen - maid , probably out of former experience in some domestic emergency , suggested , "[94-elizabeth] Fetch [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " The advice was eagerly caught at , [every body being so thankful to have the responsibility shifted to some other body]4559-every body being so thankful to have the responsibility shifted to some other body 's shoulders ; so in five minutes [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had [the room]3244-the room cleared , and [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress laid upon the bed , with nobody near except [herself]94-elizabeth and [the French maid]4562-the french maid . By - and - by [Mrs. Ascott]99-ascott opened [her]99-ascott eyes . "[94-elizabeth] Who 's that ? What are [you]94-elizabeth doing to [me]0-i ? " "[94-elizabeth] Nothing , [ma'am]3015-ma'am . It 's only [me]0-i — [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " At the familiar soothing voice [the poor woman]1647-the poor woman — [a poor , wretched , forlorn woman [she]1647-the poor woman looked , lying there , in spite of all [her]1647-the poor woman grandeur]4564-a poor , wretched , forlorn woman she looked , lying there , in spite of all her grandeur — turned feebly round . "[94-elizabeth] Oh , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , [I]0-i 'm so ill ! take care of [me]0-i . " And [she]0-i fainted away once more . It was some time before [she]0-i came quite to [herself]0-i , and then the first thing [she]0-i said was to bid [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth bolt the door and keep [every body]3430-every body out . "[656-the doctor] [The doctor]656-the doctor , [ma'am]3015-ma'am if [he]656-the doctor comes ? " "[656-the doctor] [I]0-i 'll not see [him]656-the doctor . [I]0-i do n't want [him]656-the doctor . [I]0-i know what it is . [I]0-i — " [She]0-i pulled [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth closer to [her]0-i , whispered something in [her]94-elizabeth ear , and then burst into a violent fit of hysterical weeping . Amazed , shocked , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth at first did not know what to do ; then [she]94-elizabeth took [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's head on [her]94-elizabeth shoulder , and quieted [her]431-her mistress by degrees almost as [she]94-elizabeth would [a child]504-a child . The sobbing ceased , and [Mrs. Ascott]99-ascott lay still a minute , till suddenly [she]99-ascott clutched [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's arm . "[0-i] Mind [you]2607-you do n't tell . [He]656-the doctor does n't know , and [he]656-the doctor shall not ; it would please [him]656-the doctor so . It does not please [me]0-i . Sometimes [I]0-i almost think [I]0-i shall hate it because it is [[his]656-the doctor child]2608-his child . " [She]0-i spoke with a fierceness that was hardly credible either in [the dignified Mrs. Peter Ascott]202-mrs. ascott or [the languid Miss Selina]92-selina . To think of [Miss Selina]92-selina expecting [a baby]598-a baby ! The idea perfectly confounded [poor Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know very much about such matters , " said [she]0-i , deprecatingly ; "[0-i] but [I]0-i 'm sure , [ma'am]3015-ma'am , [you]3015-ma'am ought to keep [yourself]3015-ma'am quiet , and [I]0-i would n't hate [the poor little baby]2610-the poor little baby if [I]0-i were [you]3015-ma'am . It may be a very nice little thing , and turn out a great comfort to [you]3015-ma'am . " [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott lifted [her]202-mrs. ascott heavy eyes to [the kindly , sympathetic , womanly face]4569-the kindly , sympathetic , womanly face — [thorough woman]4570-thorough woman , for , as [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth went on , [her]94-elizabeth heart warmed with the strong instinct which comes almost of itself . "[3015-ma'am] Think , to have a tiny little creature lying here beside [you]3015-ma'am ; something [your]3015-ma'am very own , with its pretty face looking so innocent and sweet at [you]3015-ma'am , and its pretty fingers touching [you]3015-ma'am . " Here [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's voice quite faltered over the picture [she]94-elizabeth had drawn . "[3015-ma'am] Oh , [ma'am]3015-ma'am , [I]0-i 'm sure [you]3015-ma'am would be so fond of it . " Human nature is strong . [This cold , selfish woman]4571-this cold , selfish woman , living [her]4571-this cold , selfish woman forty years without any strong emotion , marrying without love , and reaping , not in contrition , but angry bitterness , the certain punishment of such a marriage , even [this woman]1812-this woman was not proof against the glorious mystery of maternity , which should make [every daughter of Eve]4573-every daughter of eve feel the first sure hope of [[her]4573-every daughter of eve first born child]4574-her first born child to be a sort of Divine annunciation . [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott lay listening to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . Gradually through [her]0-i shut eyelids a few quiet tears began to flow . "[3015-ma'am] Do [you]3015-ma'am mind [me]0-i talking to [you]3015-ma'am this way , [ma'am]3015-ma'am ? " "[3015-ma'am] No , no ! Say what [you]3015-ma'am like . [I]0-i 'm glad to have any body to speak to . Oh , [I]0-i am [a very miserable woman]2613-a very miserable woman ! " Strange that [Selina Ascott]203-selina ascott should come to betray , and to [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth , of [all people]1633-all people , that [she]0-i was [a "[2613-a very miserable woman] miserable woman]4576-a " miserable woman . " But circumstances bring about unforeseen confidences ; and the confidence once given is not easily recalled . Apparently [the lady]480-the lady did not wish to recall it . In the solitude of [[her]480-the lady splendid house]4578-her splendid house , in [her]480-the lady total want of all female companionship — for [she]480-the lady refused to have [[her]480-the lady sisters]302-her sisters sent for—"he[2613-a very miserable woman] would only insult [them]2614-them , and [I]0-i 'll not have [[my]0-i family]3887-my family insulted"—poor [Selina]203-selina ascott clung to [[her]203-selina ascott old servant]4580-her old servant as the only comfort [she]203-selina ascott had . During the dreary months that followed , when , during the long , close summer days , [the sick lady]4581-the sick lady scarcely stirred from [[her]4581-the sick lady bedroom]812-her bedroom , and , fretful , peevish , made the very most of what to [women in general are such patiently borne and sacred sufferings]4583-women in general are such patiently borne and sacred sufferings , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was [[her]203-selina ascott constant attendant]4584-her constant attendant . [She]94-elizabeth humored all [her]203-selina ascott whims , endured all [her]203-selina ascott ill - tempers , cheered [her]203-selina ascott in [her]203-selina ascott low spirits , and was , in fact , [[[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's sole companion and [friend]4035-friend]4586-her mistress 's sole companion and friend . This position [no one]3371-no one disputed with [her]94-elizabeth . It is not every woman who has , as [Miss Leaf]92-selina used to say of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , "[2613-a very miserable woman] [a genius for nursing]2616-a genius for nursing ; " and very [few patients]4589-few patients make nursing a labor of love . [The whole household]4590-the whole household were considerably relieved by [her]94-elizabeth taking a responsibility for which [she]94-elizabeth was so well fitted and so little envied . Even [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , who , when [his]97-ascott approaching honors could no longer be concealed from [him]97-ascott , became for the nonce [a most attentive husband]4591-a most attentive husband , and succumbed dutifully to every fancy [[his]97-ascott wife]4348-his wife entertained , openly expressed [his]97-ascott satisfaction in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , and gave [her]94-elizabeth one or two bright golden guineas in earnest of [his]97-ascott gratitude . How far [she]94-elizabeth [herself]94-elizabeth appreciated [her]94-elizabeth new and important position ; whether [her]94-elizabeth duties were done from duty , or pity , or that determined self - devotedness which [some women]1837-some women are always ready to carry out toward any helpless thing that needs [them]1837-some women , [I]2613-a very miserable woman can not say , for [she]94-elizabeth never told . Not even to [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , who at last was permitted to come and pay a formal visit ; nor to [Tom Cliffe]132-tom , whom [she]94-elizabeth now saw very rarely , for [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress , with characteristic selfishness , would hardly let [her]94-elizabeth out of [her]94-elizabeth sight for half an hour . [Tom]132-tom at first was exceedingly savage at this : by degrees [he]132-tom got more reconciled , and met [his]132-tom sweet - heart now and then for a few minutes at the area gate or wrote [her]94-elizabeth long poetical letters , which [he]132-tom confided to [some of [[her]94-elizabeth fellow - servants]4398-her fellow - servants , who thereby got acquainted with [their]4398-her fellow - servants secret]4595-some of her fellow - servants , who thereby got acquainted with their secret . But it mattered little , as [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had faithfully promised that , when [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's trial was over , and every thing smooth and happy , [she]94-elizabeth would marry [Tom]132-tom at once . So [she]94-elizabeth took [the jokes below stairs]4598-the jokes below stairs with great composure ; feeling , indeed , too proud and content to perplex [herself]94-elizabeth much about any thing . Nevertheless , [her]94-elizabeth life was not easy , for [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott was very difficult to manage . [She]202-mrs. ascott resisted angrily all the personal sacrifices entailed by impending motherhood , and its terrors and forebodings used to come over [her]202-mrs. ascott — [poor weak woman that [she]202-mrs. ascott was!—in a way that required all [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's reasonings to counteract , and all [her]202-mrs. ascott self - control to hide the presentiment of evil , not unnatural under the circumstances]4599-poor weak woman that she was!—in a way that required all elizabeth 's reasonings to counteract , and all her self - control to hide the presentiment of evil , not unnatural under the circumstances . Yet sometimes [poor Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott would take fits of pathetic happiness ; when [she]202-mrs. ascott busied [herself]202-mrs. ascott eagerly over the preparations for the new - comer ; would make [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth take out , over and over again , the little clothes , and examine them with childish delight . Sometimes [she]202-mrs. ascott would gossip for hours over the blessing that was sent to [her]202-mrs. ascott so late in life — half - regretting that it had come so late ; that [she]202-mrs. ascott should be almost [an old woman]3726-an old woman before [[her]202-mrs. ascott little son]4601-her little son or [daughter]297-daughter was grown up . "[2613-a very miserable woman] Still , [I]0-i may live to see it , [you]2617-you know : to have [a pretty girl]2618-a pretty girl to take on [my]0-i arm into [a ball - room]2619-a ball - room , or [a big fellow to send to College]2620-a big fellow to send to college : [the Leafs]3347-the leafs always went to College in old times . [He]2620-a big fellow to send to college shall be [Henry Leaf Ascott]97-ascott , that [I]0-i am determined on ; and if it 's [a girl]3542-a girl , perhaps [I]0-i may call [her]3542-a girl [Johanna]93-johanna . [[My]0-i sister]3017-my sister would like it ; would n't [she]3542-a girl ? " For more and more , in the strange softening of [her]0-i nature , did [Selina]92-selina go back to the old ties . "[3542-a girl] [I]0-i am not older than [[my]0-i mother]2624-my mother was when [Hilary]91-hilary was born . [She]2624-my mother died , but that was because of trouble . [Women]3061-women do not necessarily die in childbirth even at forty ; and in twenty years more [I]0-i shall only be sixty — not such [a very old woman]2626-a very old woman . Besides , [mothers]512-mothers never are old ; at least not to [[their]512-mothers children]2628-their children . Do n't [you]0-i think so , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? " And [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth answered as [she]94-elizabeth best could . [She]94-elizabeth too , out of sympathy or instinct , was becoming wondrous wise . But [I]0-i am aware all this will be thought very uninteresting , except by [women]3061-women and [mothers]512-mothers . Let [me]0-i hasten on . By degrees , as [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's hour approached , a curious tranquility and even gentleness came over [her]94-elizabeth . [Her]94-elizabeth fretful dislike of seeing any face about [her]94-elizabeth but [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's became less . [She]94-elizabeth even endured [[her]94-elizabeth husband]698-her husband 's company for an hour of an evening ; and at last humbled [her]94-elizabeth pride enough to beg [him]698-her husband to invite [[her]94-elizabeth sisters]302-her sisters to [Russell Square]3-russell square from Saturday to Monday , the only time when [Hilary]91-hilary could be spared . "[0-i] For [we]2629-we do n't know what may happen , " said [she]94-elizabeth to [him]698-her husband , rather seriously . And though [he]698-her husband answered , "[0-i] Oh , nonsense ! " and desired [her]94-elizabeth to get such ridiculous fancies out , of [her]94-elizabeth head , still [he]698-her husband consented , and [himself]698-her husband wrote to [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , giving the formal invitation . [The three sisters]247-the three sisters spent a happy time together , and [Hilary]91-hilary made some highly appreciated family jokes about the handsome Christmas box that [Selina]92-selina was going to be so kind as to give [them]247-the three sisters , and the small probability that [she]92-selina would have much enjoyment of the Christmas dinner to which [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , in the superabundance of [his]698-her husband good feeling , had invited [[his]698-her husband sisters - in - law]4608-his sisters - in - law . [The baby , blessed innocent]4609-the baby , blessed innocent ! seemed to have softened down all things — as [babies]4610-babies often do . Altogether , it was with great cheerfulness , affectionateness , and hope that [they]247-the three sisters took leave of [Selina]92-selina : [she]92-selina , with unwonted consideration , insisting that [the carriage]1127-the carriage should convey [them]247-the three sisters all the way to [Richmond]27-richmond . "[0-i] And , " [she]92-selina said , "[0-i] perhaps some of these days [[my]0-i son]2562-my son , if [he]2562-my son is [a son]2631-a son , may have the pleasure of escorting [[his]2562-my son aunts]3135-his aunts [home]3045-home . [I]0-i shall certainly call [him]2562-my son ' [Henry Leaf]97-ascott , ' and bring [him]2562-my son up to be in every way a credit to [[our]2634-our family]3536-our family . " When [the ladies]245-the ladies were away , and [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott had retired to bed , it was still only nine o'clock , and a bright moonlight night . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth thought [she]94-elizabeth could steal down stairs and try to get a breath of fresh air round [the square]3596-the square . [Her]94-elizabeth long confinement made [her]94-elizabeth almost sick sometimes for a sight of [the outer world]996-the outer world , a sight of — let [me]132-tom tell the entire truth — [her]94-elizabeth own faithful [Tom]132-tom . [She]94-elizabeth had not seen [him]132-tom now for fourteen days , and though [his]132-tom letters were very nice and exceedingly clever , still [she]94-elizabeth craved for a look at [his]132-tom face , a grasp of [his]132-tom hand , perhaps even a kiss , long and close and tender , such as [he]132-tom would sometimes insist upon giving [her]94-elizabeth , in spite of all policemen . [His]132-tom love for [her]94-elizabeth , demonstrative as was [his]132-tom nature , had become to [this still , quiet girl inexpressibly sweet]4615-this still , quiet girl inexpressibly sweet , far sweeter than [she]94-elizabeth knew . It was a clear winter night , and the moon went climbing over the fleecy white clouds in a way that made beauty even in [Russell Square]3-russell square . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth looked up at the sky , and thought how [Tom]132-tom would have enjoyed it , and wished [he]132-tom were beside [her]94-elizabeth , and was so glad to think [he]132-tom would soon be beside [her]94-elizabeth always , with all [his]132-tom humors and weaknesses , all [his]132-tom little cross - selfishness , and complainings ; [she]94-elizabeth could put up with all , and be happy through all , if only [she]94-elizabeth had [him]132-tom with [her]94-elizabeth and loving [her]94-elizabeth . [His]132-tom love for [her]94-elizabeth , though fitful and fanciful , was yet so warm and real that it had become a necessity of [her]94-elizabeth life . As [he]132-tom always told [her]94-elizabeth — especially after [he]132-tom had had one of [his]132-tom little quarrels with [her]94-elizabeth — [hers]94-elizabeth was to [him]132-tom . "[132-tom] [Poor Tom]132-tom , [I]0-i wonder how [he]132-tom gets on without [me]0-i ! Well , it wo n't be for long . " And [she]94-elizabeth wished [she]94-elizabeth could have let [him]132-tom know [she]94-elizabeth was out [here]389-here , that [they]4617-they might have had a chat for just ten minutes . Unconsciously [she]94-elizabeth walked toward [[their]4617-they usual trysting place]4618-their usual trysting place , [a large overhanging plane - tree on [the Keppel Street]69-the keppel street corner of [the square]3596-the square]4619-a large overhanging plane - tree on the keppel street corner of the square . Surely , surely , that could not be [Tom]132-tom ! Quite impossible , for [he]132-tom was not alone . [Two people]4523-two people , [a young man]1903-a young man and [a young woman]4623-a young woman , stood at the tryst , absorbed in conversation : evidently [sweethearts]4624-sweethearts , for [he]132-tom had one arm round [her]4623-a young woman , and [he]132-tom kissed [her]4623-a young woman unresisted several times . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth gazed , fascinated , almost doubting the evidence of [her]94-elizabeth own senses . For [the young men]4625-the young men 's figure was so excessively like [Tom]132-tom 's . At length , with the sort of feeling that makes one go steadily up to a shadow by the roadside , some ugly spectre that [we]4626-we feel sure , if [we]4626-we stare it out , will prove to be a mere imagination , [she]4623-a young woman walked deliberately up to and past [these "[97-ascott] sweethearts]4627-these " sweethearts . " [They]4625-the young men did not see [her]4623-a young woman ; [they]4625-the young men were far too much occupied with [one another]394-one another ; but [she]4623-a young woman saw [them]4625-the young men , and saw at once that it was [Tom]132-tom , [[Tom]132-tom 's own self]4629-tom 's own self , and with [him]132-tom [[her]4623-a young woman fellow - servant]4630-her fellow - servant , [Esther]201-esther . [People]3210-people may write volumes on jealousy , and volumes will still remain to be written . It is next to remorse for guilt , the sharpest , sorest , most maddening torment that human nature can endure . [We]4626-we may sit and gaze from the boxes at [our]4626-we Othellos and [Biancas]204-biancas ; [we]4626-we may laugh at the silly heart - burnings between [Cousin Kate]205-cousin kate and [Cousin Lucy]206-cousin lucy in [the ball - room]4632-the ball - room , or the squabbles of [Mary]143-mary and [Sally]197-sally in [the kitchen]253-the kitchen over [[the gardener]4634-the gardener 's lad]4635-the gardener 's lad ; but there the thing remains . [A man]628-a man can not make love to [two women]4637-two women , [a woman]669-a woman can not coquet with [two men]4639-two men , without causing in degree that horrible agony , cruel as death , which is at the root of half the tragedies , and the cause of half the crimes of [this world]1916-this world . The complaint comes in different forms : sometimes it is a case of slow poisoning or of ordeal by red - hot irons , which though not fatal , undermines the whole character , and burns ineffaceable scars into the soul . And [people]3210-people take it in various ways — some fiercely , stung by a sense of wounded self - love ; others haughtily : "[97-ascott] Pride 's a safe robe , [I]0-i 'll wear it ; but no rags . " [Others]525-others , again , [humble , self - distrustful natures , whose only pride came through love]4643-humble , self - distrustful natures , whose only pride came through love , have nothing left [them]3210-people except rags . In a moment all [their]3210-people thin robes of happiness are torn off ; [they]3210-people stand shivering , naked and helpless before the blasts of [the bitter world]4644-the bitter world . This was [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's case . After the first instant of stunned bewilderment and despair [she]94-elizabeth took it all quite naturally , as if it were a thing which [she]94-elizabeth ought all along to have known was sure to happen , and which was no more than [she]94-elizabeth expected and deserved . [She]94-elizabeth passed [the couple]4645-the couple , still unobserved by [them]4645-the couple , and then walked round the other side of [the square]3596-the square , deliberately [home]3045-home . [I]97-ascott am not going to make [a tragic heroine of [this poor servant girl]4649-this poor servant girl]4648-a tragic heroine of this poor servant girl . Perhaps , [people]3210-people may say , there is nothing tragic about the incident . Merely [a plain , quiet , old - fashioned woman , who is so foolish as to like [a handsome young swain]4652-a handsome young swain]4651-a plain , quiet , old - fashioned woman , who is so foolish as to like a handsome young swain , and to believe in [him]4652-a handsome young swain , and to be surprised when [he]4652-a handsome young swain deserts [her]4651-a plain , quiet , old - fashioned woman , who is so foolish as to like a handsome young swain for [a pretty girl of eighteen]4653-a pretty girl of eighteen . All quite after the way things go on in [the world]248-the world , especially in [the servant - world]4655-the servant - world ; and the best [she]94-elizabeth can do is to get over it , or take [another sweetheart]4656-another sweetheart as quickly as possible . A very common story after all , and more of a farce than a tragedy . But there are some farces which , if [you]4657-you look underneath the surface , have a good many of the elements of tragedy . [I]97-ascott shall neither paint [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth tearing [her]94-elizabeth own hair nor [Esther]201-esther 's , nor going raging about [the square]3596-the square in moonlight in an insane fit of jealousy . [She]94-elizabeth was not given to "[97-ascott] fits " under any circumstances , or about any thing . All [she]94-elizabeth felt went deep down into [her]94-elizabeth heart , rooted itself , and either blossomed or cankered there . On this night [she]94-elizabeth , as [I]207-the lady of peter ascott said , walked round [the square]3596-the square to [[her]94-elizabeth home]4660-her home : then quietly went up stairs to [[her]94-elizabeth garret]4661-her garret , locked the door , and sat down upon [her]94-elizabeth bed . [She]94-elizabeth might have sat [there]3030-there for an hour or more , [her]94-elizabeth bonnet and shawl still on , without stirring , without crying , altogether cold and hard like a stone , when [she]94-elizabeth fancied [she]94-elizabeth heard [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's bell ring , and mechanically rose up and went down [stairs]3048-stairs to listen . Nothing was wanted , so [she]94-elizabeth returned to [[her]94-elizabeth garret]4661-her garret and crept to bed in the dark . When soon afterward [Esther]201-esther likewise came up to bed , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth pretended to be asleep . Only once , taking a stealthy glance at [the pretty girl who stood combing [her]4666-the pretty girl who stood combing her hair at the looking - glass hair at the looking - glass]4666-the pretty girl who stood combing her hair at the looking - glass , [she]94-elizabeth was conscious of a sick sense of repulsion , a pain like a knife running thro ' [her]4666-the pretty girl who stood combing her hair at the looking - glass , at sight of the red young lips which [Tom]132-tom had just been kissing , of the light figure which [he]132-tom had clasped as [he]132-tom used to clasp [her]4666-the pretty girl who stood combing her hair at the looking - glass . But [she]4666-the pretty girl who stood combing her hair at the looking - glass never spoke , not one word . Half an hour after [she]4666-the pretty girl who stood combing her hair at the looking - glass was roused by [the nurse coming to [her]4666-the pretty girl who stood combing her hair at the looking - glass bedside]4667-the nurse coming to her bedside . [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott was very ill , and was calling for [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . Soon [the whole establishment]4668-the whole establishment was in confusion , and in the sharp struggle between birth and death [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had no time to think of any thing but [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress . Contrary to every expectation , all ended speedily and happily ; and before [he]207-the lady of peter ascott went off to [the City]1745-the city next day [the master of [the house]344-the house , who , in the midst of [his]207-the lady of peter ascott anxiety and felicity]4671-the master of the house , who , in the midst of his anxiety and felicity , had managed to secure a good night 's sleep and a good breakfast , had the pleasure of sending off [a special messenger]4673-a special messenger to [the Times office]2302-the times office with the notification , "[207-the lady of peter ascott] [The Lady of [Peter Ascott]207-the lady of peter ascott]207-the lady of peter ascott , [Esq .]319-esq . , of [a son and heir]2637-a son and heir . " A fortnight 's time rather increased than diminished the excitement incident on the event at [Russell Square]3-russell square . Never was there such [a wonderful baby]4675-a wonderful baby , and never was there such a fuss made over [it]4675-a wonderful baby . [Unprejudiced persons]4676-unprejudiced persons might have called [it]4675-a wonderful baby [an ugly , weakly little thing]4677-an ugly , weakly little thing ; indeed , at first there were such apprehensions of its dying that [it]4675-a wonderful baby had been baptized in a great hurry , "[319-esq .] [Henry Leaf Ascott]97-ascott , " according to [the mother]280-the mother 's desire , which in [her]280-the mother critical position [nobody]357-nobody dared to thwart . Even at the end of fourteen days [the "[97-ascott] son and heir "]4680-the " son and heir " was still [a puling , sickly , yellow - faced baby]4681-a puling , sickly , yellow - faced baby . But to [the mother]280-the mother it was every thing . From the moment [she]280-the mother heard [its]4675-a wonderful baby first cry [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's whole nature seemed to undergo a change . [Her]202-mrs. ascott very eyes — those cold blue eyes of [Miss Selina's]208-miss selina's — took a depth and tenderness whenever [she]202-mrs. ascott turned to look at the little bundle that lay beside [her]202-mrs. ascott . [She]202-mrs. ascott never wearied of touching the tiny hands and feet , and wondering at them , and showing — to [every one of [the household who was favored with a sight of it—"my[319-esq .] baby]4684-the household who was favored with a sight of it—"my baby]4683-every one of the household who was favored with a sight of it—"my baby , " as if it had been a miracle of the universe . [She]202-mrs. ascott was so unutterably happy and proud . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , too , seemed not a little proud of [the baby]3533-the baby . [Nurse]209-nurse , [a very grand personage]4687-a very grand personage , had been a little jealous of [her]94-elizabeth at first , but soon grew condescending , and made great use of [her]94-elizabeth in [the sick room]4688-the sick room , alleging that [such an exceedingly sensible young person , so quiet and steady]4689-such an exceedingly sensible young person , so quiet and steady , was almost as good as [a middle - aged married woman]4690-a middle - aged married woman . Indeed , [she]209-nurse once asked [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth if [she]94-elizabeth was [a widow]242-a widow , since [she]94-elizabeth looked as if [she]94-elizabeth had "[319-esq .] seen trouble : " and was very much surprised to learn [she]94-elizabeth was single and only twenty - three years old . [Nobody else]1771-nobody else took any notice of [her]94-elizabeth . " And [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had just answered , "[94-elizabeth] Yes"-no more . During the fortnight [she]94-elizabeth had seen nothing of [Tom]132-tom . "[2638-he] In the sulks , most like , though [he]2638-he did n't look it . "[0-i] Unless , " said [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott , when this proposition was made , suddenly recurring to the fact which seemed hitherto to have quite slipped from [her]202-mrs. ascott mind—"unless[94-elizabeth] [you]94-elizabeth are still willing to get married , and think [you]94-elizabeth would be happier married . If in the dim light tears fell on its puny face , God help [her]94-elizabeth , poor [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ! [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott made such an excellent recovery that in three weeks ' time [nobody]357-nobody was the least anxious about [her]202-mrs. ascott , and [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott arranged to start on a business journey to [Edinburgh]70-edinburgh ; promising , however , to be back in three days for the Christmas dinner , which was to be a grand celebration . [Miss Leaf]91-hilary and [Miss Hilary]91-hilary were to appear thereat in [their]4707-their wedding dresses ; and [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott [herself]202-mrs. ascott took the most vital interest in [Johanna]93-johanna 's having a new cap for the occasion . Nay , [she]202-mrs. ascott insisted upon ordering it from [[her]202-mrs. ascott own milliner]4708-her own milliner , and having it made of the most beautiful lace — the "[0-i] sweetest " [old lady]4709-old lady 's cap that could possibly be invented . Evidently [this wonderful baby]4710-this wonderful baby had opened all hearts , and drawn every natural tie closer . [Selina]92-selina , lying on the sofa , in [her]92-selina graceful white wrapper , and [her]92-selina neat close cap , looked so young , so pretty , and , above all , so exceedingly gentle and motherly , that [[her]92-selina sisters]302-her sisters ' hearts were full to overflowing . [They]302-her sisters acknowledged that happiness , like misery , was often brought about in a fashion totally unforeseen and incredible . Who would have thought , for instance , on that wretched night when [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott came to [Hilary]91-hilary at [Kensington]40-kensington , or on that dreary heartless wedding - day , that [they]302-her sisters should ever have been sitting in [[Selina]92-selina 's room]3241-selina 's room so merry and comfortable , admiring [the baby]3533-the baby , and on the friendliest terms with [baby 's papa]4714-baby 's papa ? "[211-papa] [Papa]211-papa " is a magical word , and let [married people]4715-married people have fallen ever so wide asunder , the thought , "[0-i] [[[my]0-i child]3717-my child 's mother]2642-my child 's mother , " "[2643-my baby 's father] [[my]0-i baby 's father]2643-my baby 's father , " must in some degree bridge the gulf between [them]302-her sisters . When [Peter Ascott]202-mrs. ascott was seen stooping , awkwardly enough , over [[his]97-ascott son]1166-his son 's cradle , poking [his]97-ascott dumpy fingers into each tiny cheek in a half - alarmed , half - investigating manner , as if [he]97-ascott wondered how it had all come about , but , on the whole , was rather pleased than otherwise — [the good angel of [the household]277-the household]4717-the good angel of the household might have stood by and smiled , trusting that [the ghastly skeleton therein]4719-the ghastly skeleton therein might in time crumble away into harmless dust , under the sacred touch of infant fingers . "[0-i] No , [Tom]132-tom , not vexed [me]0-i exactly . But [I]0-i want to ask [you]132-tom a question . " For a moment [Tom]132-tom looked altogether confounded . Then [he]132-tom tried to recover [himself]132-tom , and said crossly , "[201-esther] Well , and if it was , where 's the harm ? Ca n't [a man]628-a man be civil to [a pretty girl]2618-a pretty girl without being called over the coals in this way ? " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth made no answer , at least not immediately . At last [she]94-elizabeth said , in a very gentle , subdued voice , "[132-tom] [Tom]132-tom , are [you]132-tom fond of [Esther]201-esther ? [You]132-tom would not kiss [her]201-esther if [you]132-tom were not fond of [her]201-esther . Do [you]132-tom like [her]201-esther as — as [you]132-tom used to like [me]0-i ? " And [she]94-elizabeth looked right up into [his]132-tom eyes . [Hers]94-elizabeth had no reproach in them , only a piteous entreaty , the last clinging to a hope which [she]94-elizabeth knew to be false . "[132-tom] Like [Esther]201-esther ? Of course [I]0-i do ? [She]201-esther 's [a nice sort of girl]2661-a nice sort of girl , and [we]2662-we 're [very good friends]2663-very good friends . " "[201-esther] [Tom]132-tom , [a man]628-a man ca n't be ' [friends]893-friends , ' in that sort of way , with [a pretty girl of eighteen]4653-a pretty girl of eighteen , when [he]628-a man is going to be married to [somebody else]2667-somebody else . At least , in [my]0-i mind , [he]628-a man ought not . " [Tom]132-tom laughed in a confused manner . "[0-i] [I]0-i say , [you]0-i 're jealous , and [you]0-i 'd better get over it . " Was [she]0-i jealous ? was it all fancy , folly ? Did [Tom]132-tom stand there , true as steel , without a feeling in [his]132-tom heart that [she]0-i did not share , without a hope in which [she]0-i was not united , holding [her]0-i , and preferring [her]0-i , with that individuality and unity of love which true love ever gives and exacts , as it has a right to exact ? Not that poor [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth reasoned in this way , but [she]0-i felt the thing by instinct without reasoning . "[132-tom] [Tom]132-tom , " [she]0-i said , "[0-i] tell [me]0-i outright , just as if [I]0-i was [somebody else]2667-somebody else , and had never belonged to [you]132-tom at all , do [you]132-tom love [Esther Martin]201-esther . " [Truthful people]4732-truthful people enforce truth . [Tom]132-tom might be fickle , but [he]132-tom was not deceitful ; [he]132-tom could not look into [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's eyes and tell [her]94-elizabeth a deliberate lie ; somehow [he]132-tom dared not . "[201-esther] Well , then — since [you]0-i will have it out of [me]0-i — [I]0-i think [I]0-i do . " So [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's "[0-i] ship went down . " It might have been [a very frail vessel]4733-a very frail vessel , that [nobody in [their]4734-nobody in their right senses right senses]4734-nobody in their right senses would have trusted any treasure with , still [she]94-elizabeth did ; and it was all [she]94-elizabeth had , and it went down to the bottom like a stone . It is astonishing how soon [the sea]2152-the sea closes over this sort of wreck ; and how quietly [people]3210-people take — when [they]3210-people must take , and there is no more disbelieving it — the truth which [they]3210-people would have given [their]3210-people lives to prove was an impossible lie . For some minutes [Tom]132-tom stood facing the fire , and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth sat on [her]94-elizabeth chair opposite without speaking . Then [she]94-elizabeth took off [her]94-elizabeth brooch , the only love - token [he]132-tom had given [her]94-elizabeth , and put it into [his]132-tom hand . "[0-i] What 's this for ? " asked [he]132-tom , suddenly . "[2669-you] [You]2669-you know . [You]2669-you 'd better give it to [Esther]201-esther . It 's [Esther]201-esther , not [me]0-i , [you]2669-you must marry now . " And the thought of [Esther]201-esther , giddy , flirting , useless [Esther]201-esther , as [[Tom]132-tom 's wife]4737-tom 's wife , was almost more than [she]0-i could bear . The sting of it put even into [her]0-i crushed humility a certain honest self - assertion . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm not going to blame [you]0-i , [Tom]132-tom ; but [I]0-i think [I]0-i 'm as good as [she]201-esther . " [Tom]132-tom said , the usual excuse , that [he]132-tom "[0-i] could n't help it . " And suddenly turning round , [he]132-tom begged [her]0-i to forgive [him]132-tom , and not forsake [him]132-tom . [She]0-i forsake [Tom]132-tom ! [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth almost smiled . "[0-i] [I]0-i do forgive [you]0-i : [I]0-i 'm not a bit angry with [you]0-i . If [I]0-i ever was [I]0-i have got over it . " "[0-i] That 's right . [You]0-i 're [a dear soul]2670-a dear soul . " "[0-i] [Your]0-i kissing [me]0-i to - day , and [another girl]2671-another girl to - morrow : [your]0-i telling [me]0-i [I]0-i was every thing to [you]0-i one week , and saying exactly the same thing to [another girl]2671-another girl the next . It would be hard enough to bear if [we]2673-we were only [friends]893-friends , but as sweet - hearts , as [husband]2675-husband and [wife]1386-wife , it would be impossible . No [Tom]132-tom , [I]0-i tell [you]132-tom the truth , [I]0-i could not stand it . " [She]0-i spoke strongly , unhesitatingly , and for an instant there flowed out of [her]0-i soft eyes that wild fierce spark , latent even in these quiet humble natures , which is dangerous to meddle with . [Tom]132-tom did not attempt it . [He]132-tom felt all was over . Whether [he]132-tom had lost or gained : whether [he]132-tom was glad or sorry , [he]132-tom hardly knew . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm not going to take this back , any how , " [he]132-tom said , "[0-i] fiddling " with the brooch ; and then going up to [her]0-i , [he]132-tom attempted , with trembling hands , to refasten it in [her]0-i collar . The familiar action , [his]132-tom contrite look , were too much . People who have once loved [one another]394-one another , though the love is dead ( for love can die ) , are not able to bury it all at once , or if [they]4739-they do , its pale ghost will still come knocking at the door of [their]4739-they hearts , "[0-i] Let [me]0-i in , let [me]0-i in ! " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ought , [I]0-i know , in proper feminine dignity , to have bade [Tom]132-tom farewell without a glance or a touch . But [she]0-i did not . When [he]132-tom had fastened [her]0-i brooch [she]0-i looked up in [his]132-tom familiar face a sorrowful , wistful , hungering look , and then clung about [his]132-tom neck : "[0-i] O [Tom]132-tom , [Tom]132-tom , [I]0-i was so fond of [you]132-tom ! " And [Tom]132-tom mingled [his]132-tom tears with [hers]0-i , and kissed [her]0-i many times , and even felt [his]132-tom old affection returning , making [him]132-tom half oblivious of [Esther]201-esther ; but mercifully — for love rebuilt upon lost faith is like [a house founded upon sands]4740-a house founded upon sands — the door opened , and [Esther]201-esther [herself]201-esther came in . Laughing , smirking , [pretty [Esther]201-esther , who , thoughtless as [she]201-esther was , had yet the sense to draw back when [she]201-esther saw [them]4741-them]201-esther . "[0-i] Come here , [Esther]201-esther ! " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth called , imperatively ; and [she]0-i came . "[201-esther] [Esther]201-esther , [I]0-i 've given up [Tom]132-tom ; [you]201-esther may take [him]132-tom if [he]132-tom wants [you]201-esther . Make [him]132-tom [a good wife]2677-a good wife , and [I]0-i 'll forgive [you]201-esther . If not — " [She]201-esther could not say another word . [She]201-esther shut the door upon [them]4741-them , and crept up [stairs]3048-stairs , conscious only of one thought — if [she]201-esther only could get away from [them]4741-them , and never see either of [their]4741-them faces any more ! And in this fate was kind to [her]201-esther , though in that awful way in which fate — say rather [Providence]213-providence — often works ; cutting , with one sharp blow , some knot that [our]2678-we poor , feeble , mortal fingers have been long laboring at in vain , or making that which seemed impossible to do the most natural , easy , and only thing to be done . How strangely often in human life "[0-i] one woe doth tread upon the other 's heel ! " How continually , while one of those small private tragedies that [I]0-i have spoken of is being enacted within , [the actors]4743-the actors are called upon to meet some other tragedy from without , so that external energy counteracts inward emotion , and holy sympathy with another 's sufferings stifles all personal pain . That truth about sorrows coming "[0-i] in battalions " may have a divine meaning in it — may be one of those mysterious laws which guide [the universe]951-the universe — laws that [we]2678-we can only trace in fragments , and guess at the rest , believing , in deep humility , that one day [we]2678-we shall "[0-i] know even as [we]2678-we are known . " Therefore [I]0-i ask no pity for [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , because ere [she]94-elizabeth had time to collect [herself]94-elizabeth , and realize in [her]94-elizabeth poor confused mind that [she]94-elizabeth had indeed said good by to [Tom]132-tom , given [him]132-tom up and parted from [him]132-tom forever , [she]94-elizabeth was summoned to [[[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's room]4746-her mistress 's room , there to hold a colloquy outside the door with [the seriously - perplexed nurse]4747-the seriously - perplexed nurse . One of those sudden changes had come which sometimes , after all seems safe , strike terror into [a rejoicing household]4748-a rejoicing household , and end by carrying away , remorseless , [the young wife from [her]4749-the young wife from her scarcely tasted bliss scarcely tasted bliss]4749-the young wife from her scarcely tasted bliss , [the mother of many children from [her]4749-the young wife from her scarcely tasted bliss close circle of happy duties and yearning loves]4750-the mother of many children from her close circle of happy duties and yearning loves . [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott was ill . Either [she]202-mrs. ascott had taken cold or been too much excited , or , in the overconfidence of [her]202-mrs. ascott recovery , some slight neglect had occurred — some trifle which [nobody]357-nobody thinks of till afterward , and which yet proves the fatal cause , "[0-i] the little pin " that "[0-i] Bores through the castle wall " of mortal hope , and [King Death]214-king death enters in all [his]214-king death awful state . [Nobody]357-nobody knew it or dreaded it ; for though [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott was certainly ill , [she]202-mrs. ascott was not at first very ill ; and there being no telegraphs in those days [no one]3371-no one thought of sending for either [[her]202-mrs. ascott husband]698-her husband or [[her]202-mrs. ascott sisters]302-her sisters . But that very hour , when [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth went up to [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress , and saw the flush on [her]431-her mistress cheek and the rest - less expression of [her]431-her mistress eye , [King Death]214-king death had secretly crept in at the door of [the mansion]4757-the mansion in [Russell Square]3-russell square . [The patient]4758-the patient was carefully removed back into [her]431-her mistress bed . [She]0-i said little , except once , looking up uneasily — "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't feel quite [myself]0-i , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . " And when [[her]202-mrs. ascott servant]1535-her servant soothed [her]94-elizabeth in the long - familiar way , telling [her]94-elizabeth [she]94-elizabeth would be better in the morning , [she]0-i smiled contentedly , and turned to go to sleep . Nevertheless , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth did not go to [her]94-elizabeth bed , but sat behind the curtain , motionless , for an hour or more . Toward the middle of the night , when [[her]202-mrs. ascott baby]4760-her baby was brought to [her]202-mrs. ascott , and [the child]3274-the child instinctively refused [its]3274-the child natural food , and began screaming violently , [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's troubled look returned . "[0-i] What is the matter ? What are [you]94-elizabeth doing , [nurse]4701-nurse ? [I]0-i wo n't be parted from [[my]0-i baby]2680-my baby — [I]0-i wo n't , [I]0-i say ! " And when , to sooth [her]202-mrs. ascott , the little thing was again put into [her]202-mrs. ascott arms , and again turned from [her]202-mrs. ascott , a frightened expression came into [the mother]280-the mother 's face . "[0-i] Am [I]0-i going to be [ill?—is baby]2681-ill?—is baby — " [She]0-i stopped ; and as [nurse]4701-nurse determinately carried [it]3274-the child away , [she]0-i attempted no resistance , only followed [it]3274-the child across [the room]3244-the room with eager eyes . It was the last glimmer of reason there . From that time [her]0-i , mind began to wander , and before morning [she]0-i was slightly delirious . Still [nobody apprehended danger]4765-nobody apprehended danger . [Nobody]357-nobody really knew any thing about the matter except [nurse]4701-nurse , and [she]0-i , with a selfish fear of being blamed for carelessness , resisted sending for [the doctor]656-the doctor till [his]656-the doctor usual hour of calling . In [that large house]4769-that large house , as in [many other large houses]4770-many other large houses , [every body]3430-every body 's business was [nobody]357-nobody 's business , and [a member of [the family]258-the family]4773-a member of the family , even [the mistress]3072-the mistress , might easily be sick or dying in [some room therein]4776-some room therein , while all things else went on just as usual , and [no one]3371-no one was any the wiser . About noon even [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's ignorance was roused up to the conviction that something was very wrong with [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott , and that [nurse]4701-nurse 's skill could not counteract it . On [her]0-i own responsibility [she]0-i sent , or rather [she]0-i went to fetch [the doctor]656-the doctor . [He]656-the doctor came ; and [his]656-the doctor fiat threw [the whole household]4590-the whole household into consternation . Now [they]4590-the whole household knew that [the poor lady whose happiness had touched the very stoniest hearts in [the establishment]4390-the establishment]4781-the poor lady whose happiness had touched the very stoniest hearts in the establishment hovered upon the brink of the grave . Now [all the women - servants]4783-all the women - servants , down to [the little kitchen - maid with [her]4701-nurse dirty apron at [her]4701-nurse eyes , crept up [stairs]3048-stairs , one after the other , to the door of [what had been such a silent , mysterious room]4786-what had been such a silent , mysterious room]4784-the little kitchen - maid with her dirty apron at her eyes , crept up stairs , one after the other , to the door of what had been such a silent , mysterious room , and listened , unhindered , to the ravings that issued thence . "[134-missis] [Poor Missis]134-missis , " and [the "[134-missis] poor little baby]4787-the " poor little baby , " were spoken of softly at the kitchen dinner table , and confidentially sympathized over with [inquiring tradespeople at the area gate]4788-inquiring tradespeople at the area gate . A sense of awe and suspense stole over [the whole house]4543-the whole house , gathering thicker hour by hour of that dark December day . When [[her]0-i mistress]431-her mistress was first pronounced "[134-missis] in danger , " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , aware that there was [no one]3371-no one to act but [herself]94-elizabeth , had taken a brief opportunity to slip from [the room]3244-the room and write two letters , one to [[her]94-elizabeth master]4793-her master in [Edinburgh]70-edinburgh , and the other to [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . The first [she]94-elizabeth gave to [the footman]4370-the footman to post ; the second [she]94-elizabeth charged [him]4370-the footman to send by special messenger to [Richmond]27-richmond . But [he]4370-the footman , being lazily inclined , or else thinking that , as the order was only given by [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , it was of comparatively little moment , posted [them]4795-them both . So vainly did [the poor girl]1994-the poor girl watch and wait ; neither [Miss Leaf]91-hilary nor [Miss Hilary]91-hilary came . By night [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's delirium began to subside , but [her]2682-her strength was ebbing fast . [Two physicians — three]4797-two physicians — three — stood by [the unconscious woman]4798-the unconscious woman , and pronounced that all hope was gone , if , indeed , the case had not been hopeless from the beginning . "[134-missis] Where is [[her]2682-her husband]698-her husband ? Has [she]2682-her [no relations]1440-no relations — [no mother]2685-no mother or [sisters]3046-sisters ? " asked [the fashionable physician]4799-the fashionable physician , [Sir]3469-sir — — — — , touched by the slight or [this poor lady]4801-this poor lady dying alone , with only [a nurse]4802-a nurse and [a servant]246-a servant about [her]2682-her . "[1440-no relations] If [she]2682-her has , [they]2687-they ought to be sent for immediately . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ran down stairs , and rousing [the old butler]4804-the old butler from [his]4804-the old butler bed , prevailed on [him]4804-the old butler to start immediately in [the carriage]1127-the carriage to bring back [Miss Leaf]91-hilary and [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . It would be midnight before [he]4804-the old butler reached [Richmond]27-richmond ; still it must be done . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll do it , [[my]0-i girl]3543-my girl , " said [he]4804-the old butler , kindly ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i 'll tell [them]2687-they as gently as [I]0-i can . Never fear . " When [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth returned to [[[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's room]4746-her mistress 's room [the doctors]4808-the doctors were all gone , and [nurse]4701-nurse , standing at the foot of [[Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's bed]4810-mrs. ascott 's bed , was watching [her]94-elizabeth with the serious look which even [a hireling]4811-a hireling or [a stranger]488-a stranger wears in the presence of that sight which , however familiar , never grows less awful — a fellow creature slowly passing from this life into the life unknown . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth crept up to the other side . The change , indescribable yet unmistakable , which comes over a human face when the warrant for its dissolution has gone forth , struck [her]94-elizabeth at once . Never yet had [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth seen death . [[Her]94-elizabeth father]1162-her father 's [she]94-elizabeth did not remember , and among [[her]94-elizabeth few friends]4814-her few friends and connections none other had occurred . At twenty - three years of age [she]94-elizabeth was still ignorant of that solemn experience which [every woman]909-every woman must go through some time , often many times during [her]909-every woman life . For it is to [women that all look in [their]4816-women that all look in their extreme hour extreme hour]4816-women that all look in their extreme hour . [Very few men]4817-very few men , even [the tenderest hearted]4818-the tenderest hearted , are able to watch by the last struggle and close the eyes of the dying . For the moment , as [she]94-elizabeth glanced round [the darkened room]4819-the darkened room , and then at [the still figure on the bed]4820-the still figure on the bed , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's courage failed . Strong love might have overcome this fear — the natural recoil of youth and life from coming into contact with death and mortality ; but love was not exactly the bond between [her]94-elizabeth and [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott . It was rather duty , pity , the tenderness that would have sprung up in [her]94-elizabeth heart toward any body [she]94-elizabeth had watched and tended so long . "[0-i] If [she]2689-she should die , die in the night , before [Miss Hilary]91-hilary comes ! " thought [the poor girl]1994-the poor girl , and glanced once more around [the shadowy room]4822-the shadowy room , where [she]94-elizabeth was now left quite alone . For [nurse]4701-nurse , thinking with true worldly wisdom of the preservation of [the "[91-hilary] son and heir]4824-the " son and heir , " which was decidedly the most important question now , had stolen away , and was busy in [the next room]4825-the next room , seeing [various young women whom [the doctors]4808-the doctors had sent , one of whom was to supply to [the infant]4828-the infant the place of [the poor mother whom it would never know]4829-the poor mother whom it would never know]4826-various young women whom the doctors had sent , one of whom was to supply to the infant the place of the poor mother whom it would never know . There was [nobody]357-nobody left but [herself]94-elizabeth to watch [this dying mother]4831-this dying mother , so [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth took [her]94-elizabeth lot upon [her]94-elizabeth , smothered down [her]94-elizabeth fears , and sat by the bedside waiting for the least expression of returning reason in the sunken face , which was very quiet now . Consciousness did return at last , as [the doctors]4808-the doctors had said it would . [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott opened [her]202-mrs. ascott eyes ; they wandered from side to side , and then [she]202-mrs. ascott said , feebly , "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , where 's [[my]0-i baby]2680-my baby ? " What [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth answered [she]94-elizabeth never could remember ; perhaps nothing , or [her]94-elizabeth agitation betrayed [her]94-elizabeth , for [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott said again , "[94-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , am [I]0-i going to — to leave [[my]0-i baby]2680-my baby ? " [Some people]485-some people might have considered it best to reply with a lie — the frightened , cowardly lie that is so often told at death - beds to [the soul passing direct to its God]4834-the soul passing direct to its god . But [this girl]1644-this girl could not and dared not . Leaning over [[her]1644-this girl mistress]431-her mistress , [she]1644-this girl whispered as softly as [she]1644-this girl could , choking down the tears that might have disturbed the peace which , mercifully , seemed to have come with dying , "[105-god] Yes , [you]94-elizabeth are going very soon — to [God]105-god . [He]105-god will watch over [baby]2692-baby , and give [him]2692-baby back to [you]94-elizabeth again some day quite safe . " "[105-god] Will [He]105-god ? " The tone was submissive , half - inquiring ; like that of [a child]504-a child learning something it had never learned before — as [Selina]92-selina was now learning . Perhaps even those three short weeks of motherhood had power so to raise [her]0-i whole nature that [she]0-i now gained the composure with which even the weakest soul can sometimes meet death , and had grown not unworthy of the dignity of [a Christian]2570-a christian 's dying . Suddenly [she]0-i shivered . "[105-god] [I]0-i am afraid ; [I]0-i never thought of — this . Will [nobody]357-nobody come and speak to [me]0-i ? " Oh , how [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth longed for [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , for any body , who would have known what to say to [the dying woman]4839-the dying woman ; who perhaps , as [her]0-i look and words implied , till this hour had never thought of dying . Once it crossed [the servant]276-the servant 's mind to send for [some clergyman]4841-some clergyman ; but [she]94-elizabeth knew none , and was aware that [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott did not either . [She]94-elizabeth had no superstitious feeling that [any clergyman]4842-any clergyman would do ; just to give a sort of spiritual extreme unction to [the departing soul]4843-the departing soul . [Her]94-elizabeth own religious faith was of such an intensely personal silent kind , that [she]94-elizabeth did not believe in any good to be derived from [a strange gentleman]4844-a strange gentleman coming and praying by the bedside of [a stranger]488-a stranger , repeating set sayings with a set countenance , and going away again . And yet with that instinct which comes to almost [every human soul]4846-every human soul , fast departing , [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's white lips whispered , "[357-nobody] Pray . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had no words , except those which [Miss Leaf]91-hilary used to say night after night in [the little parlor at [Stowbury]2-stowbury]4847-the little parlor at stowbury . [She]94-elizabeth knelt down , and in a trembling voice repeated in [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress 's ear—"Our[215-father] [Father]215-father which art in heaven"—to the end . After it [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott lay very quiet . At length [she]202-mrs. ascott said , "[215-father] Please — bring — [my]0-i — [baby]2692-baby . " It had been from the first , and was to the last , "[0-i] [[my]0-i " baby]4849-my " baby . The small face was laid close to [hers]202-mrs. ascott that [she]202-mrs. ascott might kiss it . "[2692-baby] [He]2692-baby looks well ; [he]2692-baby does not miss [me]0-i much yet , [poor little fellow]2695-poor little fellow ! " And the strong natural agony came upon [her]202-mrs. ascott , conquering even the weakness of [her]202-mrs. ascott last hour . "[2692-baby] Oh , it 's hard , hard ! Will [nobody]357-nobody teach [[my]0-i baby]2680-my baby to remember [me]0-i ? " And then lifting [herself]202-mrs. ascott up on [her]202-mrs. ascott elbow [she]202-mrs. ascott caught hold of [nurse]4701-nurse . "[2692-baby] Tell [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth is to take care of [baby]2692-baby . Promise , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . [Johanna]93-johanna is old — [Hilary]91-hilary may be married ; [you]94-elizabeth will take care of [[my]0-i baby]2680-my baby ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i will — as long as [I]0-i live , " said [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth . [She]0-i took [the child]3274-the child in [her]0-i arms , and for almost another hour stood beside the bed thus , until [nurse]4701-nurse whispered , "[0-i] Carry [it]2680-my baby away ; [its mother]2700-its mother does n't know it now . " But [she]4701-nurse did ; for [she]4701-nurse feebly moved [her]4701-nurse fingers as if in search of something . [Baby]216-baby was still asleep , but [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth contrived , by kneeling down close to the bed , to put the tiny hand under those cold fingers ; they closed immediately upon it , and so remained till the last . When [Miss Leaf]91-hilary and [Miss Hilary]91-hilary came in , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth was still kneeling there , trying softly to take the little hand away ; for [the baby]3533-the baby had wakened and began its piteous wail . But it did not disturb [the mother]280-the mother now . "[2700-its mother] [Poor Selina]217-poor selina " was no more . Nothing of [her]280-the mother was left to [[her]280-the mother child]3364-her child except the name of [a mother]3812-a mother . It may have been better so . Such was the inscription which now , for six months , had met the eyes of [the inhabitants of [Stowbury]2-stowbury]4857-the inhabitants of stowbury , on a large , dazzlingly white marble monument , the first that was placed in [the Church - yard of [the New Church]4859-the new church]4858-the church - yard of the new church . What motive induced [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott to inter [[his]97-ascott wife]4348-his wife here — whether it was a natural wish to lay [her]4348-his wife , and some day lay beside [her]4348-his wife , in [[their]4861-their native earth]4862-their native earth ; or the less creditable desire of showing how rich [he]97-ascott had become , and of joining [his]97-ascott once humble name , even on a tombstone , with one of the oldest names in the annals of [Stowbury]2-stowbury — [nobody]357-nobody could find out . Probably [nobody]357-nobody cared . [The Misses Leaf]89-the misses leaf were content that [he]97-ascott should do as [he]97-ascott pleased in the matter : [he]97-ascott had shown strong but not exaggerated grief at [his]97-ascott loss ; if any remorse mingled therewith , [[Selina]217-poor selina 's sisters]4865-selina 's sisters happily did not know it . [Nobody]357-nobody ever did know the full history of things except [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , and [she]94-elizabeth kept it to [herself]94-elizabeth . So the family skeleton was buried quietly in [[Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's grave]4867-mrs. ascott 's grave . [Peter Ascott]202-mrs. ascott showed , in [his]97-ascott coarse fashion , much sympathy and consideration for [[his]97-ascott wife 's sisters]4868-his wife 's sisters . [He]97-ascott had [them]4868-his wife 's sisters staying in [the house]344-the house till a week after the funeral was over , and provided [them]4868-his wife 's sisters with the deepest and handsomest mourning . [He]97-ascott even , in a formal way took counsel with [them]4868-his wife 's sisters as to the carrying out of [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's wishes , and the retaining of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth in charge of [the son and heir]4870-the son and heir , which was accordingly settled . And then [they]4868-his wife 's sisters went back to [their]4868-his wife 's sisters old life at [Richmond]27-richmond , and [the widower]4871-the widower returned to [his]97-ascott solitary bachelor ways . [He]97-ascott looked as usual ; went to and from [the City]1745-the city as usual ; and [his]97-ascott brief married life seemed to have passed away from [him]97-ascott like a dream . Not altogether a dream . Gradually [he]97-ascott began to awake to the consciousness of [an occasional child]4873-an occasional child 's cry in [the house]344-the house — [that large , silent , dreary house , where [he]97-ascott was once more [the sole , solitary master]4876-the sole , solitary master]4875-that large , silent , dreary house , where he was once more the sole , solitary master . Sometimes , when [he]97-ascott came in from [church of Sundays]4877-church of sundays , [he]97-ascott would mount another flight of stairs , walk into [the nursery]4878-the nursery at [the top of [the house]344-the house]1321-the top of the house , and stare with distant curiosity at the little creature in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's arms , pronounce [it]2701-it [a "[2700-its mother] fine child]4881-a " fine child , and did [her]2701-it great credit ! " and then walk down again . [He]97-ascott never seemed to consider it as [[his]97-ascott child]2608-his child , [this poor old bachelor of so many years]4883-this poor old bachelor of so many years ' standing ; [he]97-ascott had outgrown apparently all sense of the affections or the duties of [a father]4884-a father . Whether [they]4885-they ever would come into [him]97-ascott ; whether , after babyhood was passed , [he]97-ascott would begin to take an interest in [the little creature who throve and blossomed into beauty]4886-the little creature who throve and blossomed into beauty — which , as if watched by [guardian angles]4887-guardian angles , [[dead mothers]4888-dead mothers ' children]4889-dead mothers ' children often seem to do — was a source of earnest speculation to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . In the mean time [he]97-ascott treated both [her]94-elizabeth and [the baby]3533-the baby with extreme consideration , allowed [her]94-elizabeth to do just as [she]94-elizabeth liked , and gave [her]94-elizabeth indefinite sums of money to expend upon [the nursery]4878-the nursery . When summer came , and [the doctor]656-the doctor ordered change of air , [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott consented to [her]94-elizabeth suggestion of taking a lodging for [herself]94-elizabeth and [[baby]2692-baby near [[baby]2692-baby 's aunts]4896-baby 's aunts at [Richmond]27-richmond]4894-baby near baby 's aunts at richmond ; only desiring that [the lodging]4897-the lodging should be as handsome as could be secured , and that every other Sunday [she]94-elizabeth should bring up [[his]97-ascott son]1166-his son to spend the day at [Russell Square]3-russell square . And so , during the long summer months , [the motherless child]4899-the motherless child , in its deep mourning — which looks so pathetic on [a very young baby]4900-a very young baby — might be seen carried about in [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's arms every where . When , after the first six weeks , [the wet nurse]4901-the wet nurse left — in fact , [two or three nurses]4902-two or three nurses successively were abolished — [she]94-elizabeth took [little Henry]97-ascott solely under [her]94-elizabeth own charge . [She]94-elizabeth had comparatively small experience , but [she]94-elizabeth had common sense , and the strong motherly instinct which comes by nature to [some women]1837-some women . Besides , [her]94-elizabeth whole soul was wrapped up in [this little child]4904-this little child . From the hour when , even with [[her]94-elizabeth mistress]431-her mistress dying before [her]94-elizabeth eyes , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had felt a strange thrill of comfort in the new duty which had come into [her]94-elizabeth blank life , [she]94-elizabeth took to this duty as [women only can whose life has become a blank]4906-women only can whose life has become a blank . [She]94-elizabeth received [the child]3274-the child as a blessing sent direct from [God]105-god ; by unconscious hands — for [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott knew nothing of what happened ; something that would heal [her]94-elizabeth wounded heart , and make [her]94-elizabeth forget [Tom]132-tom . And so it did . [Women]3061-women and [mothers]512-mothers well know how engrossing is the care of [an infant]4910-an infant ; how each minute of the day is filled up with something to be done or thought of ; so that "[2700-its mother] fretting " about extraneous things becomes quite impossible . How gradually the fresh life growing up and expanding puts the worn out or blighted life into the back ground , and all the hopes and fancies cling around the small , beautiful present , the ever developing , the ever marvelous mystery of [a young child]4911-a young child 's existence ! Why it should be so , [we]4912-we can only guess ; but that it is so , [many a wretched wife]4913-many a wretched wife , [many a widowed mother]4914-many a widowed mother , [many a broken hearted , forlorn aunt]4915-many a broken hearted , forlorn aunt , has thankfully proved . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth proved it likewise . [She]94-elizabeth did not exactly lose all memory of [her]94-elizabeth trouble , but it seemed lighter ; it was swallowed up in this second passion of adopted motherhood . And so [she]94-elizabeth sank , quietly and at once , into the condition of [a middle aged woman]4916-a middle aged woman , whose life 's story — and [[her]202-mrs. ascott sort of [women]3061-women]4917-her sort of women have but one — was a mere episode , told and ended . For [Esther]201-esther had left and been married to [Tom Cliffe]132-tom within a few week 's of [Mrs. Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's funeral . Of course , [the household]277-the household knew every thing ; but [nobody]357-nobody condoled with [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . There was a certain stand - off - ishness about [her]94-elizabeth which made [them]277-the household hold [their]277-the household tongues . [They]277-the household treated [her]94-elizabeth with much respect , as [her]94-elizabeth new position demanded . [She]94-elizabeth took this , as [she]94-elizabeth took every thing , with the grave quietness which was [her]94-elizabeth fashion from [her]94-elizabeth youth up ; assumed [her]94-elizabeth place as [a confidential upper servant]4921-a confidential upper servant ; dressed well but soberly , like [a woman of forty]4922-a woman of forty , and was called "[90-mrs. hand] [Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand . " The only trace [her]94-elizabeth "[90-mrs. hand] disappointment " left upon [her]94-elizabeth was a slightly bitter way of speaking about [men]3062-men in general , and a dislike to any chatter about love affairs and matrimony . [Her]94-elizabeth own story [she]94-elizabeth was never known to refer to in the most distant way , except once . [Miss Hilary]91-hilary — who , of course , had heard all , but delicately kept silence — one night , when [little Henry]97-ascott was not well , remained in [the lodgings on [Richmond Hill]71-richmond hill]4924-the lodgings on richmond hill , and slept in [the nursery]4878-the nursery , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth making up for [herself]94-elizabeth a bed on the floor close beside [baby and cradle]4926-baby and cradle . In the dead of night , [the two women]2010-the two women , [mistress]278-mistress and [maid]3315-maid , by some chance , said a few things to one another which never might have been said in the daylight , and which , by tacit consent , were never afterward referred to by either , any more than if [they]2010-the two women had been spoken in a dream . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth told briefly , though not without emotion , all that had happened between [herself]94-elizabeth and [Tom]132-tom , and how [he]132-tom was married to [Esther Martin]201-esther . And then [both women]4930-both women went back , in a moralizing way , to the days when [they]4930-both women had both been "[90-mrs. hand] young " at [Stowbury]2-stowbury , and how different life was from what [they]4930-both women then thought and looked forward to — [Miss Hilary]91-hilary and [[her]91-hilary "[90-mrs. hand] bower maiden]4931-her " bower maiden . " "[90-mrs. hand] Yes , " answered [the former]4932-the former with a sigh , "[90-mrs. hand] things are indeed not as [people]3210-people fancy when [they]3210-people are [girls]252-girls . [We]2704-we dream , and dream , and think [we]2704-we see very far into the future , which [nobody]357-nobody sees but [God]105-god . [I]0-i often wonder how [my]0-i life will end . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth said , after a pause , "[0-i] [I]0-i always felt sure [you]0-i would be married , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . There was [one person]2706-one person — Is [he]2706-one person alive still ? Is [he]2706-one person ever coming [home]3045-home ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am sure [he]2706-one person was very fond of [you]0-i . And [he]2706-one person looked like [a good man]417-a good man . " "[2706-one person] [He]2706-one person was [the best man [I]0-i ever knew]2709-the best man i ever knew . " This was all [Miss Hilary]91-hilary said , and [she]91-hilary said it softly and mournfully . [She]91-hilary might never have said it at all ; but it dropped from [her]91-hilary unawares in the deep feeling of the moment , when [her]91-hilary heart was tender over [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's own sad , simply told story . Also because of a sudden and great darkness which had come over [her]91-hilary own . Literally , [she]91-hilary did not now know whether [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon were alive or dead . Two months ago [his]2706-one person letters had suddenly ceased , without any explanation , [his]2706-one person last being exactly the same as the others — as frank , as warmly affectionate , as cheerful and brave . One solution to this was [his]2706-one person possible coming [home]3045-home . But [she]91-hilary did not , after careful reasoning on the subject , believe that likely . [She]91-hilary knew exactly [his]2706-one person business relations with [[his]2706-one person employers]4934-his employers ; that there was a fixed time for [his]2706-one person return to [England]9-england , which nothing except the very strongest necessity could alter . Even in the chance of [his]2706-one person health breaking , so as to incapacitate [him]2706-one person for work , [he]2706-one person should , [he]2706-one person always said , have to go to [the hills]3438-the hills , rather than take the voyage [home]3045-home prematurely . And in that case [he]2706-one person certainly would have informed [[his]2706-one person friends]1252-his friends of [his]2706-one person movements .
