There was nothing erratic , or careless , or eccentric about [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon ; [he]98-robert lyon was [a practical , business - like Scotchman]4938-a practical , business - like scotchman — far too cautious and too regular in all [his]98-robert lyon habits to be guilty of those accidental negligences by which [wanderers abroad]4939-wanderers abroad sometimes cause such cruel anxieties to [friends]893-friends at [home]3045-home . For the same reason , the other terrible possibility — [his]98-robert lyon death — was not likely to have happened without [their]1252-his friends hearing of it . [Hilary]91-hilary felt sure , with the strong confidence of love , that [he]98-robert lyon would have taken every means to leave [her]91-hilary some last word — some farewell token — which would reach hereafter [he]98-robert lyon was gone , and comfort [her]91-hilary with the assurance of what , living , [he]98-robert lyon had never plainly told . Sometimes , when a wild terror of [his]98-robert lyon death seized [her]91-hilary , this settled conviction drove it back again . [He]98-robert lyon must be living , or [she]91-hilary would have heard . There was another interpretation of the silence , which [many]3189-many would have considered the most probable of all — [he]98-robert lyon might be married . Not deliberately , but suddenly ; drawn into it by some of those impelling trains of circumstance which are the cause of so many marriages , especially with [men]3062-men ; or , impelled by one of those violent passions which occasionally seize on [an exceedingly good man]4944-an exceedingly good man , fascinating [him]98-robert lyon against [his]98-robert lyon conscience , reason , and will , until [he]98-robert lyon wakes up to find [himself]98-robert lyon fettered and ruined for life . Such things do happen , strangely , pitifully often . The like might have happened to [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . [Hilary]91-hilary did not actually believe it , but still [her]91-hilary common sense told [her]91-hilary that it was possible . [She]91-hilary was not [an inexperienced girl]4945-an inexperienced girl now ; [she]91-hilary looked on [the world]248-the world with the eyes of [a woman of thirty]4947-a woman of thirty ; and though , thank Heaven ! the romance had never gone out of [her]91-hilary — the faith , and trust , and tender love — still it had sobered down a little . [She]91-hilary knew it was quite within the bounds of possibility that [a young man]1903-a young man , separated from [her]91-hilary for seven years , thrown into all kinds of circumstances and among [all sorts of people]4949-all sorts of people , should have changed very much in [himself]1903-a young man , and , consequently , toward [her]91-hilary . That , without absolute faithlessness , [he]1903-a young man might suddenly have seen [some other woman [he]1903-a young man liked better , and have married at once]4950-some other woman he liked better , and have married at once . Or , if [he]1903-a young man came back unmarried — [she]91-hilary had taught [herself]91-hilary to look this probability also steadily in the face — [he]1903-a young man might find the reality of [her]91-hilary — [Hilary Leaf]91-hilary — different from [his]1903-a young man remembrance of [her]91-hilary ; and so , without actual falseness to the old true love , might not love [her]91-hilary any more . These fears made [her]91-hilary resolutely oppose [Johanna]93-johanna 's wish to write to [the house of business at [Liverpool]72-liverpool]4951-the house of business at liverpool , and ask what had become of [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon . It seemed like seeking after [him]98-robert lyon , trying to hold [him]98-robert lyon by the slender chain which [he]98-robert lyon had never attempted to make any stronger , and which , already , [he]98-robert lyon might have broken , or desired to break . [She]91-hilary could not do it . Something forbade [her]91-hilary ; that something in the inmost depths of [a woman]669-a woman 's nature which makes [her]91-hilary feel [her]91-hilary own value , and exact that [she]91-hilary shall be sought ; that , if [her]91-hilary love be worth having , it is worth seeking ; that , however dear [a man]628-a man may be to [her]91-hilary , [she]91-hilary refuses to drop into [his]628-a man mouth like an overripe peach from a garden wall . In [her]91-hilary sharpest agony of anxiety concerning [him]98-robert lyon , [Hilary]91-hilary felt that [she]91-hilary could not , on [her]91-hilary part , take any step that seemed to compel love — or even friendship — from [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . It was not pride , [she]91-hilary could hardly be called [a proud woman]4954-a proud woman ; it was an innate sense of the dignity of that love which , as a free gift , is precious as "[2706-one person] much fine gold . " yet becomes [the merest dross]4955-the merest dross , utterly and insulting poor — when paid as a debt of honor , or offered as a benevolent largess . And so , though oftentimes [her]91-hilary heart felt breaking , [Hilary]91-hilary labored on ; sat the long day patiently at [her]91-hilary desk ; interested [herself]91-hilary in [the young people over whom [she]91-hilary ruled]4956-the young people over whom she ruled ; became [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's right hand in all sorts of schemes which [that good woman]4957-that good woman was forever carrying out for the benefit of [her]91-hilary fellow - creatures ; and at leisure times occupied [herself]91-hilary with [Johanna]93-johanna , or with [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth and [the baby]3533-the baby , trying to think it was [a very beautiful and happy world]4959-a very beautiful and happy world , with love still in [it]4959-a very beautiful and happy world , and [a God of love]4960-a god of love ruling over [it]4959-a very beautiful and happy world — only , only — [Women]3061-women are very humble in [their]3061-women cruelest pride . Many a day [she]91-hilary felt as if [she]91-hilary could have crawled a hundred miles in the dust — like [some Catholic pilgrim]4962-some catholic pilgrim — just to get one sight of [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . Autumn came — lovely and lingering late . It was November , and yet the air felt mild as May , and the sunshine had that peculiar genial brightness which autumnal sunshine alone possesses ; even as , perhaps , late happiness has in it a holy calm and sweetness which no youthful ecstasy can ever boast . The day happened to be [Hilary]91-hilary 's birthday . [She]91-hilary had taken a holiday , which [she]91-hilary , [Johanna]93-johanna , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , and [the baby]3533-the baby , had spent in [Richmond Park]56-richmond park , watching the rabbits darting about under the brown fern , and the deer grazing contentedly hard by . [They]4964-they had sat a long time under one of the oak trees with which [the Park abounds]4965-the park abounds , listening for the sudden drop , drop of an occasional acorn among the fallen leaves ; or making merry with [the child]3274-the child , as [a healthy , innocent , playful child]4967-a healthy , innocent , playful child always can make [good women]4968-good women merry . Still , [Master Henry]97-ascott was not [a remarkable specimen of infanthood]4969-a remarkable specimen of infanthood , and had never occupied more than [his]97-ascott proper nepotal corner in [Hilary]91-hilary 's heart . [She]91-hilary left [him]97-ascott chiefly to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , and to [[his]97-ascott aunt]428-his aunt [Johanna]93-johanna , in whom the grandmotherly character had blossomed out in full perfection . And when [these two]541-these two became engrossed in [his]97-ascott infant majesty . [Hilary]91-hilary sat a little apart , unconsciously folding [her]91-hilary hands and fixing [her]91-hilary eyes on vacancy ; becoming fearfully alive to the sharp truth , that of all griefs , a strong love unreturned or unfulfilled is the grief which most blights [a woman]669-a woman 's life . Say , rather , any human life ; but it is worst to [a woman]669-a woman , because [she]669-a woman must necessarily endure passively . So enduring , it is very difficult to recognize the good hand of [God]105-god therein . Why should [He]105-god ordain longings , neither selfish nor unholy , which yet are never granted ; tenderness which expends itself in vain ; sacrifices which are wholly unheeded ; and sufferings which seem quite thrown away ? That is , if [we]4974-we dared allege of any thing in the moral or in [the material world]4975-the material world , where so much loveliness , so much love , appear continually wasted , that it is really "[2706-one person] thrown away . " [We]4974-we never know through what divine mysteries of compensation [the Great Father of [the universe]951-the universe]4976-the great father of the universe may be carrying out [his]4976-the great father of the universe sublime plan ; and those three words , "[2706-one person] God is love , " ought to contain , to [every doubting soul]4978-every doubting soul , the solution of all things . As [Hilary]91-hilary rose from under the tree there was a shadow on [her]91-hilary sweet face , a listless weariness in [her]91-hilary movements , which caught [Johanna]93-johanna 's attention . [Johanna]93-johanna had been very good to [[her]93-johanna child]3364-her child . When , do what [she]91-hilary would , [Hilary]91-hilary could not keep down fits of occasional dullness or impatience , it was touching to see how [this woman of over sixty years]4980-this woman of over sixty years slipped from [her]4980-this woman of over sixty years due pedestal of honor and dignity , to be patient with [[her]4980-this woman of over sixty years younger sister]1035-her younger sister 's unspoken bitterness and incommunicable care . [She]93-johanna now , seeing how restless [Hilary]91-hilary was , rose when [she]91-hilary rose , put [her]91-hilary arm in [hers]91-hilary , and accompanied [her]91-hilary , speaking or silent , with quick steps or slow , as [she]91-hilary chose , across [the beautiful park]4982-the beautiful park , than which , perhaps , [all England]4983-all england can not furnish a scene more thoroughly sylvan , thoroughly English . [They]4984-they rested on that high ground near [the gate of [Pembroke Lodge]74-pembroke lodge]4985-the gate of pembroke lodge , where [the valley of]4986-the valley of [the Thames]75-the thames lies spread out like a map , stretching miles and miles away in luxuriant greenery . "[2706-one person] How beautiful ! [I]0-i wonder what [a foreigner]2710-a foreigner would think of this view ? Or [any one who had been long abroad]2711-any one who had been long abroad ? How inexpressibly sweet and [home]3045-home - like it would seem to [him]2711-any one who had been long abroad ! " [Hilary]91-hilary turned sharply away , and [Johanna]93-johanna saw at once what [her]0-i words had implied . [She]93-johanna felt so sorry , so vexed with [herself]93-johanna ; but it was best to leave it alone . So [they]4984-they made [their]4984-they way homeward , speaking of something else ; and then that happened which [Johanna]93-johanna had been almost daily expecting would happen , though [she]93-johanna dared not communicate [her]93-johanna hopes to [Hilary]91-hilary , lest [they]4984-they might prove fallacious . [The two figures , both in deep mourning]4987-the two figures , both in deep mourning , might have attracted [any one]399-any one 's attention : [they]4984-they caught that of [a gentleman]3465-a gentleman , who was walking quickly and looking about [him]3465-a gentleman , as if in search of something . [He]3465-a gentleman passed [them]4984-they at a little distance , then repassed , then turned , holding out both [his]3465-a gentleman hands . "[91-hilary] [Miss Leaf]91-hilary ; [I]0-i was sure it was [you]91-hilary . " Only the voice ; every thing else about [him]3465-a gentleman was so changed that [Hilary]91-hilary [herself]91-hilary would certainly have passed [him]3465-a gentleman in [the street]1211-the street , [that brown , foreign looking , middle aged man]4991-that brown , foreign looking , middle aged man , nor recognized [him]3465-a gentleman as [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . But for all that it was [himself]3465-a gentleman ; it was [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . [Nobody]357-nobody screamed , [nobody]357-nobody fainted . [People]3210-people seldom do that in real life , even when [a friend]3907-a friend turns up suddenly from the other end of [the world]248-the world . [They]3210-people only hold out a warm hand , and look silently in [one another]394-one another 's faces , and try to believe that all is real , as these did . [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon shook hands with [both ladies]4998-both ladies , one after [the other]3271-the other , [Hilary]91-hilary last , then placed [himself]0-i between [them]4998-both ladies . "[91-hilary] [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , will [you]91-hilary take [my]0-i arm ? " The tone , the manner , were so exactly like [himself]98-robert lyon , that in a moment all these intervening years seemed crushed into an atom of time . [Hilary]91-hilary felt certain , morally and absolutely certain , that , in spite of all outward change , [he]3465-a gentleman was [the same [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon who had bade [them]4998-both ladies all good - by that Sunday night in [the parlor at [Stowbury]2-stowbury]5001-the parlor at stowbury]5000-the same robert lyon who had bade them all good - by that sunday night in the parlor at stowbury . The same , even in [his]3465-a gentleman love for [herself]91-hilary , though [he]3465-a gentleman had simply drawn [her]91-hilary little hand under [his]3465-a gentleman arm , and never spoken a single word . [Hilary Leaf]91-hilary , down , secretly , on [your]5002-your heart 's lowest knees , and thank [God]105-god ! Repent of all [your]5002-your bitterness , doubts , and pains ; be joyful , be joyful ! But , oh , remember to be so humble withal . [She]91-hilary was . As [she]91-hilary walked silently along by [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon 's side , [she]91-hilary pulled down [her]91-hilary veil to hide the sweetest , most contrite , most child - like tears . What did [she]91-hilary deserve , more than [[her]91-hilary neighbors]2074-her neighbors , that [she]91-hilary should be so very , very happy ? And when , a good distance across [the park]4023-the park , [she]91-hilary saw the dark , solitary figure of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth carrying [baby]2692-baby , [she]91-hilary quietly guided [[her]91-hilary companions]5006-her companions into a different path , so as to avoid meeting , lest the sight of [her]91-hilary happiness might in any way , hurt poor [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . "[91-hilary] [I]0-i only landed last night at [Southampton]76-southampton , " [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon explained to [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , after the fashion [people]3210-people have , at such meetings , of falling upon the most practical and uninteresting details . "[0-i] [I]0-i came by [the Overland Mail]2713-the overland mail . It was a sudden journey , [I]0-i had scarcely more than a few hours ' notice . The cause of it was some very unpleasant defalcations in [[our]2714-our firm]2715-our firm . " Under any other circumstances [Hilary]91-hilary might have smiled ; maybe [she]0-i did smile , and tease [him]98-robert lyon many a time afterward , because the first thing [he]98-robert lyon could find to talk about , after seven years ' absence , was "[0-i] defalcations in [[our]2714-our firm]2715-our firm . But now [she]0-i listened gravely , and by - and - by took [her]0-i part in the unimportant conversation which always occurs after such a meeting as this . " Were [you]91-hilary going [home]3045-home , [Miss Leaf]91-hilary ? [They]5009-they told [me]0-i at [[your]91-hilary house]5010-your house [you]91-hilary were expected to dinner . May [I]0-i come with [you]91-hilary ? for [I]0-i have only a few hours to stay . To - night [I]0-i must go on to [Liverpool]72-liverpool . "[0-i] " But [we]5011-we shall hope soon to see [you]91-hilary again ? "[0-i] " [I]2717-i hope so . And [I]2717-i trust , [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , that [I]2717-i do not intrude to - day . "[2717-i] [He]2717-i said this with [his]2717-i Scotch shyness , or pride , or whatever it was ; so like [his]2717-i old self , that it made [somebody]3240-somebody smile ! But [somebody]3240-somebody loved it . [Somebody]3240-somebody lifted up to [his]2717-i face eyes of silent welcome ; sweet , soft , brown eyes , where never , since [he]2717-i knew [them]2721-them , had [he]2717-i seen one cloud of anger darken , one shadow of unkindness rise . " This is something worth coming [home]3045-home to , "[2717-i] [he]2717-i said in a low voice , and not over lucidly . Ay , it was . " [I]2717-i am by no means disinterested in the matter of dinner , [Miss Leaf]91-hilary ; for [I]2717-i have no doubt of finding good English roast beef and plum pudding on [[your]91-hilary sister]4063-your sister 's birth day.—Happy returns of the day , [Miss Hilary]91-hilary . "[2717-i] [She]2722-she was so touched by [his]2717-i remembering this , that , to hide it , [she]2722-she put on a spice of [her]2722-she old mischievousness , and asked [him]2717-i if [he]2717-i was aware how old [she]2722-she was ? " Yes ; [you]2717-i are thirty ; [I]2722-she have known [you]2717-i for fifteen years . "[2722-she] " It is a long time , "[93-johanna] said [Johanna]93-johanna , thoughtfully . [Johanna]93-johanna would not have been human had [she]93-johanna not been a little thoughtful and silent on the way [home]3045-home , and had [she]93-johanna not many times , out of the corners of [her]93-johanna eyes , sharply investigated [Mr. Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . [He]98-robert lyon was much altered ; there was no doubt of that . Seven years of Indian life would change any body ; take the youthfulness out of any body . It was so with [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . When coming into [the parlor]313-the parlor [he]98-robert lyon removed [his]98-robert lyon hat , many a white thread was visible in [his]98-robert lyon hair , and besides the spare , dried - up look which is always noticeable in [people who have lived long in hot climates]2725-people who have lived long in hot climates , there was an " old "[98-robert lyon] expression in [his]98-robert lyon face , indicating many a worldly battle fought and won , but not without leaving scars behind . Even [Hilary]91-hilary , as [she]91-hilary sat opposite to [him]98-robert lyon , at table , could not but feel that [he]98-robert lyon was no longer [a young man either in appearance or reality]2726-a young man either in appearance or reality . [We]2727-we [ourselves]2727-we grow old , or older , without knowing it , but when [we]2727-we suddenly come upon the same fact in another it startles [us]2727-we . [Hilary]91-hilary had scarcely recognized how far [she]91-hilary [herself]91-hilary had left [her]91-hilary girlish days behind till [she]91-hilary saw [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . " [You]91-hilary think [me]98-robert lyon very much changed ? "[98-robert lyon] said [he]98-robert lyon , guessing by [his]98-robert lyon curiously swift intuition of old what [she]91-hilary was thinking of . " Yes , a good deal changed , "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary answered truthfully ; at which [he]98-robert lyon was silent . [He]98-robert lyon could not read — perhaps [no man]418-no man 's heart could — all the emotion that swelled in [hers]91-hilary as [she]91-hilary looked at [him]98-robert lyon , the love of [her]91-hilary youth , no longer young . How the ghostly likeness of the former face gleamed out under the hard worn lines of the face that now was touching [her]91-hilary with ineffable tenderness . Also , with solemn content came a sense of the entire indestructibleness of that love which through all decay or alteration traces the ideal image still , clings to it , and cherishes it with a tenacity that laughs to scorn the grim dread of " growing old . "[98-robert lyon] In [his]98-robert lyon premature and not specially comely middle age , in [his]98-robert lyon gray hairs , in the painful , anxious , half melancholy expression which occasionally flitted across [his]98-robert lyon features , as if life had gone hard with [him]98-robert lyon , [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon was a thousand times dearer to [her]91-hilary than when [the world]248-the world was all before [them]2730-them both in the early days at [Stowbury]2-stowbury . There is a great deal of a sentimental nonsense talked about [people]3210-people having been " young together . "[98-robert lyon] Not necessarily is that a bond . Many a tie formed in youth dwindles away and breaks off naturally in maturer years . [Characters]2732-characters alter , circumstances divide . [No one]3371-no one will dare to allege that there may not be loves and friendships formed in middle life as dear , as close , as firm as [any of those of youth]2734-any of those of youth ; perhaps , with some temperaments , infinitely more so . But when [the two]2735-the two go together , when the calm election of maturity confirms the early instinct , and the lives have been parallel , as it were , for many years , there can be no bond like that of those who say as [these two]541-these two did , " [We]2738-we were young together . "[98-robert lyon] [He]98-robert lyon said so when , after dinner , [he]98-robert lyon came and stood by the window where [Hilary]91-hilary was sitting sewing . [Johanna]93-johanna had just gone out of [the room]3244-the room ; whether intentionally or not , this history can not avouch . Let [us]2738-we give [her]93-johanna the benefit of the doubt ; [she]93-johanna was [a generous woman]2739-a generous woman . During the three hours that [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon had been with [her]93-johanna , [Hilary]91-hilary 's first agitation had subsided . That exceeding sense of rest which [she]93-johanna had always felt beside [him]98-robert lyon — the sure index of [people who , besides loving , are meant to guide and help and bless [one another]394-one another]2740-people who , besides loving , are meant to guide and help and bless one another — returned as strong as ever . That deep affection which should underlie all love revived and clung to [him]98-robert lyon with a chidlike confidence strengthening at every word [he]98-robert lyon said , every familiar look and way . [He]98-robert lyon was by no means so composed as [she]93-johanna was , especially now when coming up to [her]93-johanna side and watching [her]93-johanna hands moving for a minute or so , [he]98-robert lyon asked [her]93-johanna to tell [him]98-robert lyon , a little more explicitly , of what had happened to [her]93-johanna since [they]2742-they parted . " Things are rather different from what [I]98-robert lyon thought ; "[98-robert lyon] and [he]98-robert lyon glanced with a troubled air round [the neat but very humbly furnished parlor]2743-the neat but very humbly furnished parlor . " And about [the shop]1561-the shop ? "[98-robert lyon] " [Johanna]93-johanna told [you]98-robert lyon . "[98-robert lyon] " Yes ; but [her]93-johanna letters have been so few , so short — not that [I]91-hilary could expect more . Still — now , if [you]98-robert lyon will trust [me]91-hilary — tell [me]91-hilary all . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary turned to [him]98-robert lyon , [[her]91-hilary friend]2744-her friend for fifteen years . [He]98-robert lyon was that if [he]98-robert lyon was nothing more . And [he]98-robert lyon had been very true ; [he]98-robert lyon deserved to be trusted . [She]91-hilary told [him]98-robert lyon , in brief , the history of the last year or two , and then added : " But after all it is hardly worth the telling , because , [you]98-robert lyon see , [we]5015-we are very comfortable now . [Poor Ascott]218-poor ascott , [we]5015-we suppose , must be in [Australia]49-australia . [I]91-hilary earn enough to keep [Johanna]93-johanna and [myself]91-hilary , and [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder is [a good friend to [us]5015-we]5016-a good friend to us . [We]5015-we have repaid [her]93-johanna , and owe [nobody]357-nobody any thing . Still , [we]5015-we have suffered a great deal . Two years ago ; oh ! it was a dreadful time . "[91-hilary] [She]91-hilary was hardly aware of it , but [her]91-hilary candid tell - tale face betrayed more even than [her]91-hilary words . It cut [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon to the heart . " [You]98-robert lyon suffered , and [I]98-robert lyon never knew it . "[98-robert lyon] " [I]91-hilary never meant [you]98-robert lyon to know . "[91-hilary] " Why not ? "[98-robert lyon] [He]98-robert lyon walked [the room]3244-the room in great excitement . " [I]98-robert lyon ought to have been told ; it was cruel not to tell [me]98-robert lyon . Suppose [you]98-robert lyon had sunk under it ; suppose [you]98-robert lyon had died , or been driven to do what [many a woman]5018-many a woman does for the sake of mere bread and a home — what [[your]98-robert lyon poor sister]5019-your poor sister did — married . But [I]98-robert lyon beg [your]98-robert lyon pardon . "[98-robert lyon] For [Hilary]91-hilary had started up with [her]91-hilary face all aglow . " No , "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary cried ; " no poverty would have sunk [me]91-hilary as low as that . [I]91-hilary might have starved , but [I]91-hilary should never have married . "[91-hilary] [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon looked at [her]91-hilary , evidently uncomprehending , then said humbly , though rather formally , " [I]91-hilary beg [your]91-hilary pardon once more . [I]91-hilary had no right to allude to any thing of the kind . "[91-hilary] [Hilary]91-hilary replied not . It seemed as if now , close together , [they]2746-they were further apart than when [the Indian seas]2045-the indian seas rolled between [them]2746-they . [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon 's brown cheek turned paler and paler ; [he]98-robert lyon pressed [his]98-robert lyon lips hard together ; they moved once or twice , but still [he]98-robert lyon did not utter a word . At last , with a sort of desperate courage , and in a tone that [Hilary]91-hilary had never heard from [him]98-robert lyon in [her]91-hilary life before , [he]98-robert lyon said : " Yes , [I]98-robert lyon believe [I]98-robert lyon have a right , the right that [every man]1098-every man has when [his]1098-every man whole happiness depends upon it , to ask [you]91-hilary one question . [You]91-hilary know every thing concerning [me]98-robert lyon ; [you]91-hilary always have known ; [I]98-robert lyon meant that [you]91-hilary should — [I]98-robert lyon have taken the utmost care that [you]91-hilary should . There is not a bit of [my]98-robert lyon life that has not been as open to [you]91-hilary as if — as if—. But [I]98-robert lyon know nothing whatever concerning [you]91-hilary . "[98-robert lyon] " What do [you]2748-he wish to know ? "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary faltered . " Seven years is a long time . Are [you]2748-he free ? [I]98-robert lyon mean , are [you]2748-he engaged to be married ? "[98-robert lyon] " No . "[98-robert lyon] " Thank [God]105-god ! "[2748-he] [He]2748-he dropped [his]2748-he head down between [his]2748-he hands and did not speak for a long time . And then with difficulty — for it was always hard to [him]2748-he to speak out — [he]2748-he told [her]91-hilary , at least [he]2748-he somehow made [her]91-hilary understand , how [he]2748-he had loved [her]91-hilary . No light fancy of sentimental youth , captivated by every fresh face it sees , putting upon each one the coloring of [his]2748-he own imagination , and adorning not what is , but what itself creates ; no sudden , selfish , sensuous passion , caring only to attain its object , irrespective of reason , right , or conscience ; but the strong deep love of [a just man]2749-a just man , deliberately choosing [one woman]2750-one woman as [the best woman out of all [the world]248-the world]2751-the best woman out of all the world , and setting [himself]2748-he resolutely to win [her]2750-one woman . Battling for [her]91-hilary sake with all hard fortune ; keeping , for [her]91-hilary sake , [his]2748-he heart pure from all the temptations of [the world]248-the world ; never losing sight of [her]91-hilary ; watching over [her]91-hilary so far as [he]2748-he could , consistently with the sense of honor ( or masculine pride — which was it ? but [Hilary]91-hilary forgave it , any how ) which made [him]2748-he resolutely compel [himself]2748-he to silence ; holding [her]91-hilary perfectly free , while [he]2748-he held [himself]2748-he bound . Bound by a faithfulness perfect as that of [the knights of old]2754-the knights of old — asking nothing , and yet giving all . Such was [his]2748-he love — [this brave , plain spoken , single hearted Scotsman]2755-this brave , plain spoken , single hearted scotsman . Would that there were [more such men]2756-more such men and more such love in [the world]248-the world ! [Few women]2758-few women could have resisted it , certainly not [Hilary]91-hilary , especially with a little secret of [her]91-hilary own lying perdu at the bottom of [her]91-hilary heart ; that " sleeping angel "[91-hilary] whence half [her]91-hilary strength and courage had come ; the noble , faithful , generous love of [a good woman]671-a good woman for [a good man]417-a good man . But this secret [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had evidently never guessed , or deemed [himself]98-robert lyon wholly unworthy of such a possession . [He]98-robert lyon took [her]91-hilary hand at last , and held it firmly . " And now that [you]91-hilary know all , do [you]91-hilary think in time — [I'll]98-robert lyon not hurry [you]91-hilary — but in time , do [you]91-hilary think [I]98-robert lyon could make [you]91-hilary love [me]98-robert lyon ? "[98-robert lyon] [She]91-hilary looked up in [his]98-robert lyon face with [her]91-hilary honest eyes . Smiling as they were , there was pathos in them ; the sadness left by those long years of hidden suffering , now forever ended . " [I]91-hilary have loved [you]91-hilary all [my]91-hilary life , "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary . Let [us]2761-us linger a little over this chapter of happy love : so sweet , so rare a thing . Aye , most rare : though hundreds continually meet , love , or fancy [they]2762-they do , engage [themselves]2762-they , and marry ; and [hundreds more]2763-hundreds more go through the same proceeding , with the slight difference of the love omitted — [Hamlet]219-hamlet , with the part of [Hamlet]219-hamlet left out . But the real love , steady and true : tried in the balance , and not found wanting : tested by time , silence , separation ; by good and ill fortune ; by the natural and inevitable change which years make in every character — this is the rarest thing to be found on [earth]2764-earth , and the most precious . [I]0-i do not say that all love is worthless which is not exactly this sort of love . There have been [people who have succumbed instantly and permanently to some mysterious attraction , higher than all reasoning]2765-people who have succumbed instantly and permanently to some mysterious attraction , higher than all reasoning ; the same which made [Hilary]91-hilary " take an interest "[91-hilary] in [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon 's face at [church]396-church , and made [him]98-robert lyon , [he]98-robert lyon afterward confessed , the very first time [he]98-robert lyon gave [Ascott]218-poor ascott a lesson in [the parlor at [Stowbury]2-stowbury]5001-the parlor at stowbury , say to [himself]98-robert lyon , " If [I]98-robert lyon did marry , [I]98-robert lyon think [I]98-robert lyon should like such [a wife as that brown - eyed bit lassie]5021-a wife as that brown - eyed bit lassie . "[98-robert lyon] And there have been [other people , who choosing [[their]2768-other people , who choosing their partners from accidental circumstances , or from mean worldly motives , have found providence kinder to them than they deserved , and settled down into happy , affectionate husbands and wives partners]2769-their partners from accidental circumstances , or from mean worldly motives , have found [Providence]213-providence kinder to [them]2768-other people , who choosing their partners from accidental circumstances , or from mean worldly motives , have found providence kinder to them than they deserved , and settled down into happy , affectionate husbands and wives than [they]2768-other people , who choosing their partners from accidental circumstances , or from mean worldly motives , have found providence kinder to them than they deserved , and settled down into happy , affectionate husbands and wives deserved , and settled down into [happy , affectionate husbands]2770-happy , affectionate husbands and [wives]2771-wives]2768-other people , who choosing their partners from accidental circumstances , or from mean worldly motives , have found providence kinder to them than they deserved , and settled down into happy , affectionate husbands and wives . But none of these loves can possibly have the sweetness , the completeness of such a love as that between [Hilary Leaf]91-hilary and [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon . There was nothing very romantic about it . From the moment when [Johanna]93-johanna entered [the parlor]313-the parlor , found [them]2773-they standing hand - in - hand at the fireside , and [Hilary]91-hilary came forward and kissed [her]93-johanna , and after a slight hesitation [Robert]98-robert lyon did the same , the affair proceeded in most millpond fashion : " Unruffled by those cataracts and breaks , That humor interposed too often makes . ' : There were no [lovers]1392-lovers ' quarrels ; [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had chosen that best blessing next to [a good woman]671-a good woman , [a sweet tempered woman]5024-a sweet tempered woman ; and there was no reason why [they]2773-they should quarrel more as [lovers]1392-lovers than [they]2773-they had done as [friends]893-friends . And , let it be said to the eternal honor of both , now , no more than in [their]2773-they friendship days , was there any of that hungry engrossment of [each other]1168-each other 's society , which is only another form of selfishness , and by which [lovers]1392-lovers so often make [their]1392-lovers own happy courting time a season of never - to - be - forgotten bitterness to every body connected with [them]1392-lovers . [Johanna]93-johanna suffered a little : [all people]1633-all people do when the new rights clash with the old ones ; but [she]93-johanna rarely betrayed it . [She]93-johanna was exceedingly good : [she]93-johanna saw [[her]93-johanna child]3364-her child happy , and [she]93-johanna loved [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon dearly . [He]98-robert lyon was very mindful of [her]93-johanna , very tender ; and as [Hilary]91-hilary still persisted in doing [her]91-hilary daily duty in [the shop]1561-the shop , [he]98-robert lyon spent more of [his]98-robert lyon time with [the elder sister]3213-the elder sister than [he]98-robert lyon did with [the younger]1029-the younger , and sometimes declared solemnly that if [Hilary]91-hilary did not treat [him]98-robert lyon well [he]98-robert lyon intended to make an offer to [Johanna]93-johanna ! Oh , the innumerable little jokes of those happy days ! Oh , the long , quiet walks by [the river side]5034-the river side , through [the park]4023-the park , across [Ham Common]77-ham common — any where — it did not matter ; [the whole world]361-the whole world looked lovely , even on the dullest winter day ! Oh , the endless talks ; the renewed mingling of two lives , which , though divided , had never been really apart , for neither had any thing to conceal ; [neither]411-neither had ever loved [any but the other]5038-any but the other . [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon was , as [I]2774-i have said , a good deal changed , outwardly and inwardly . [He]98-robert lyon had mixed much in society , taken an excellent position therein , and this had given [him]98-robert lyon not only a more polished manner , but an air of decision and command , as of one used to be obeyed . There could not be the slightest doubt , as [Johanna]93-johanna once laughingly told [him]98-robert lyon , that [he]98-robert lyon would always be "[2774-i] master in [[his]2774-i own house]2775-his own house . " But [he]98-robert lyon was very gentle with [[his]98-robert lyon "[2774-i] little woman]5039-his " little woman " as [he]98-robert lyon called [her]5039-his " little woman . [He]98-robert lyon would sit for hours at the "[91-hilary] ingle - neuk"—how [he]98-robert lyon did luxuriate in the English fires!—with [Hilary]91-hilary on a footstool beside [him]98-robert lyon , [her]91-hilary arm resting on [his]98-robert lyon knee , or [her]91-hilary hand fast clasped in [his]98-robert lyon . And sometimes , when [Johanna]93-johanna went out of [the room]3244-the room , [he]98-robert lyon would stoop and gather [her]93-johanna close to [his]98-robert lyon heart . But [I]91-hilary shall tell no tales ; [the world]248-the world has no business with these sort of things . [Hilary]91-hilary was very shy of parading [her]91-hilary happiness ; [she]91-hilary disliked any demonstrations thereof , even before [Johanna]93-johanna . And when [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder , who had , [of course , been told of the engagement]5042-of course , been told of the engagement , came down one day expressly to see [her]168-miss balquidder "[91-hilary] [fortunate fellow countryman]2776-fortunate fellow countryman , " [this Machiavellian little woman]5043-this machiavellian little woman actually persuaded [[her]168-miss balquidder lover]1820-her lover to have an important engagement in [London]1-london ! [She]5043-this machiavellian little woman could not bear [him]1820-her lover to be "[91-hilary] looked at . " "[91-hilary] Ah , well , [you]2777-you must leave [me]0-i , and [I]0-i will miss [you]2777-you terribly , [my]0-i deal , " said [the old Scotch woman]5045-the old scotch woman . But it 's an ill wind that blows nobody good , and [I]91-hilary have [another young lady]5046-another young lady quite ready to step into [your]2777-you shoes . When shall [you]2777-you be married ? "[91-hilary] " [I]91-hilary do n't know — hush : [we]5047-we 'll talk another time , "[91-hilary] said [Hilary]91-hilary , glancing at [Johanna]93-johanna . [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder took the hint and was silent . That important question was indeed beginning to weigh heavily on [Hilary]91-hilary 's mind . [She]91-hilary was fully aware of what [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon wished , and indeed , expected ; that when , the business of [the firm]2778-the firm being settled , in six months hence [he]98-robert lyon returned to [India]11-india , [he]98-robert lyon should not return alone . When [he]98-robert lyon said this , [she]91-hilary had never dared to answer , hardly even to think . [She]91-hilary let the peaceful present float on , day by day , without recognizing such a thing as the future . But this could not be always . It came to an end one January afternoon , when [he]98-robert lyon had returned from a second absence in [Liverpool]72-liverpool . [They]2779-they were walking up [Richmond Hill]71-richmond hill . The sun had set frostily and red over the silver curve of [the Thames]75-the thames , and [Venus]220-venus , large and bright , was shining like a great eye in the western sky . [Hilary]91-hilary long remembered exactly how every thing looked , even to the very tree [they]2779-they stood under , when [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon asked [her]91-hilary to fix definitely the day that [she]91-hilary would marry [him]98-robert lyon . Would [she]91-hilary consent — there seemed no special reason to the contrary — that it should be immediately ? Or would [she]91-hilary like to remain with [Johanna]93-johanna as [she]93-johanna was , till just before [they]2779-they sailed ? [He]98-robert lyon wished to be as good as possible to [Johanna]93-johanna — still . And something in [his]98-robert lyon manner impressed [Hilary]91-hilary more than ever before with the conviction of all [she]91-hilary was to [him]98-robert lyon ; likewise , all [he]98-robert lyon was to [her]91-hilary . More , much more than even a few short weeks since . Then , intense as it was , the love had a dream like unreality ; now it was close , [home]3045-home - like , familiar . Instinctively [she]91-hilary clung to [his]98-robert lyon arm ; [she]91-hilary had become so used to being [[Robert]98-robert lyon 's darling]2781-robert 's darling now . [She]91-hilary shivered as [she]91-hilary thought of the wide seas rolling between [them]2779-they ; of the time when [she]91-hilary should look for [him]98-robert lyon at the daily meal and daily fireside , and find [him]98-robert lyon no more . " [Robert]98-robert lyon , [I]98-robert lyon want to talk to [you]98-robert lyon about [Johanna]93-johanna . "[98-robert lyon] " [I]98-robert lyon guess what it is , "[98-robert lyon] said [he]98-robert lyon , smiling ; " [you]91-hilary would like [her]93-johanna to go out to [India]11-india with [us]5048-us . Certainly , if [she]93-johanna chooses . [I]98-robert lyon hope [you]98-robert lyon did not suppose [I]98-robert lyon should object . "[98-robert lyon] " No ; but it is not that . [She]93-johanna would not live six months in a hot climate ; [the doctor]656-the doctor tells [me]98-robert lyon so . "[98-robert lyon] " [You]98-robert lyon consulted [him]656-the doctor ? "[98-robert lyon] " Yes , confidentially , without [her]93-johanna knowing it . But [I]2782-i thought it right . [I]2782-i wanted to make quite sure before — before — Oh , [Robert—.]221-robert—. "[2782-i] The grief of [her]2782-i tone caused [him]98-robert lyon to suspect what was coming , [He]98-robert lyon started . " [You]98-robert lyon do n't mean that ? Oh no , [you]98-robert lyon can not ! [[My]98-robert lyon little woman]5050-my little woman , [[my]98-robert lyon own little woman]5051-my own little woman — [she]5050-my little woman could not be so unkind . "[98-robert lyon] [Hilary]91-hilary turned sick at heart . The dim landscape , the bright sky , seemed to mingle and dance before [her]91-hilary , and [Venus]220-venus to stare at [her]91-hilary with a piercing , threatening , baleful lustre . " [Robert]98-robert lyon , let [me]220-venus sit down on the bench , and sit [you]98-robert lyon beside [me]220-venus . It is too dark for [people]3210-people to notice [us]5053-us , and [we]5053-us shall not be very cold . "[220-venus] " No , [[my]2783-his darling]5054-my darling ; "[2783-his] and [he]2783-his slipped [his]2783-his plaid round [her]91-hilary shoulders , and [his]2783-his arm with it . [She]91-hilary looked up pitifully . " Do n't be vexed with [me]91-hilary , [Robert]98-robert lyon , [dear]685-dear ; [I]91-hilary have thought it all over ; weighed it on every side ; nights and nights [I]91-hilary have been awake pondering what was right to do . And it always comes to the same thing . "[91-hilary] " What ? "[220-venus] " It 's the old story , "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary answered with a feeble smile . " ' [I]91-hilary canna leave [[my]91-hilary minnie]5056-my minnie . ' There is nobody in [the world]248-the world to take care of [Johanna]93-johanna but [me]91-hilary , not even [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , who is engrossed in [little Henry]97-ascott . If [I]91-hilary left [her]93-johanna , [I]91-hilary am sure it would kill [her]93-johanna . And [she]93-johanna can not come with [me]91-hilary . [Dear]685-dear ! "[91-hilary] ( the only fond name [she]91-hilary ever called [him]2784-him ) " for these three years — [you]685-dear say it need only be three years — [you]685-dear will have to go back to [India]11-india alone . "[91-hilary] [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon was [a very good man]2785-a very good man ; but [he]98-robert lyon was only [a man]628-a man , not an angle ; and though [he]98-robert lyon made comparatively little show of it , [he]98-robert lyon was [a man very deeply in love]2787-a man very deeply in love . With that jealous tenacity over [his]98-robert lyon treasure , hardly blamable , since the love is worth little which does not wish to have its object " all to itself , "[98-robert lyon] [he]98-robert lyon had , [I]0-i am afraid , contemplated not without pleasure the carrying off of [Hilary]91-hilary to [[his]98-robert lyon Indian home]2788-his indian home ; and it had cost [him]98-robert lyon something to propose that [Johanna]93-johanna should go too . [He]98-robert lyon was very fond of [Johanna]93-johanna ; still — If [I]0-i tell what followed will it forever lower [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon in the estimation of [all readers]2789-all readers ? [He]98-robert lyon said , coldly , " As [you]91-hilary please , [Hilary]91-hilary ; "[98-robert lyon] rose up , and never spoke another word till [they]2790-they reached [home]3045-home . It was the first dull tea table [they]2790-they had ever known ; the first time [Hilary]91-hilary had ever looked at that dear face , and seen an expression there which made [her]91-hilary look away again . [He]98-robert lyon did not sulk ; [he]98-robert lyon was too gentlemanly for that ; [he]98-robert lyon even exerted [himself]98-robert lyon to make the meal pass pleasantly as usual ; but [he]98-robert lyon was evidently deeply wounded ; nay , more , displeased . [The strong , stern man 's nature within [him]98-robert lyon]2792-the strong , stern man 's nature within him had rebelled ; the sweetness had gone out of [his]98-robert lyon face , and something had come into it which the very best of [men]3062-men have sometimes : alas for [the woman who can not understand and put up with it]2794-the woman who can not understand and put up with it ! [I]0-i am not going to preach the doctrine of [tyrants]2795-tyrants and [slaves]2796-slaves ; but when two walk together [they]2797-they must be agreed , or if by any chance [they]2797-they are not agreed , [one]585-one must yield . It may not always be the weaker , or in weakness may lie the chiefest strength ; but it must be one or other of [the two who has to be the first to give way]2799-the two who has to be the first to give way ; and , save in very exceptional cases , it is , and it ought to be , [the woman]694-the woman . [God]105-god 's law and nature 's which is also [God]105-god 's , ordains this ; instinct teaches it ; [Christianity]222-christianity enforces it . Will it inflict a death blow upon any admiration [she]694-the woman may have excited , [this brave little [Hilary]91-hilary , who fought through [the world]248-the world by [herself]694-the woman]2801-this brave little hilary , who fought through the world by herself ; who did not shrink from traversing [London]1-london streets alone at seemly and unseemly hours ; from going into [sponging houses]2803-sponging houses and [[debtor]2804-debtor 's prisons]2805-debtor 's prisons ; from earning [her]694-the woman own livelihood , even in [a shop]3782-a shop — if [I]0-i confess that [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , being angry with [her]694-the woman , justly or unjustly , and [she]694-the woman , looking upon [him]98-robert lyon as [[her]694-the woman future husband]2807-her future husband , [[her]694-the woman " lord]5059-her " lord and [master]4127-master "[694-the woman] if [you]2808-you will , whom [she]694-the woman would one day promise , and intended , literally " to obey"—she[694-the woman] thought it [her]694-the woman duty , not only [her]694-the woman pleasure but [her]694-the woman duty , to be the first to make reconciliation between [them]2809-them ? ay , and at every sacrifice , except that of principle . And [I]0-i am afraid , in spite of all that [" strong - minded "[0-i] women]5061-" strong - minded " women may preach to the contrary , that [all good women]2810-all good women will have to do this to [all men who stand in any close relation toward [them]2810-all good women]2811-all men who stand in any close relation toward them , whether [fathers]3185-fathers , [husbands]1389-husbands , [brothers]510-brothers , or [lovers]1392-lovers , if [they]2810-all good women wish to preserve peace , and love , and holy domestic influence ; and that so it must be to the end of time . [Miss Leaf]91-hilary might have discovered that something was amiss ; but [she]91-hilary was too wise to take any notice , and being more than usually feeble that day , immediately after tea [she]91-hilary went to lie down . When [Hilary]91-hilary followed [her]91-hilary , arranged [her]91-hilary pillows , and covered [her]91-hilary up , [Johanna]93-johanna drew [[her]93-johanna child]3364-her child 's face close to [her]93-johanna and whispered , " That will do , love . Do n't stay with [me]93-johanna . [I]93-johanna would not keep [you]91-hilary from [Robert]98-robert lyon on any account . "[93-johanna] [Hilary]91-hilary all but broke down ; and yet the words made [her]91-hilary stronger firmer ; set more clearly before [her]91-hilary the solemn duty which [young folks in love]2817-young folks in love are so apt to forget , that there can be no blessing on the new tie , if for any thing short of inevitable necessity [they]2817-young folks in love let go one link of the old . Yet , [Robert]98-robert lyon — It was such a new and dreadful feeling to be standing outside the door and shrink from going in to [him]98-robert lyon ; to see [him]98-robert lyon rise up formally , saying , " Perhaps [he]98-robert lyon had better leave ; "[98-robert lyon] and have to answer with equal formality , " Not unless [you]91-hilary are obliged ; "[98-robert lyon] and for [him]98-robert lyon then , with a shallow pretence of being at ease , to take up a book and offer to read aloud to [her]91-hilary while [she]91-hilary worked . [He]98-robert lyon — who used always to set [his]98-robert lyon face strongly against all sewing of evenings — because it deprived [him]98-robert lyon temporarily of the sweet eyes , and the little soft hand . Oh , it was hard , hard ! Nevertheless , [she]91-hilary sat still and tried to listen ; but the words went in at one ear and out at the other ; [she]91-hilary retained nothing . By - and - by [her]91-hilary throat began to swell , and [she]91-hilary could not see [her]91-hilary needle and thread . Yet still [he]98-robert lyon went on reading . It was only when , by some blessed chance , turning to reach a paper cutter , [he]98-robert lyon caught sight of [her]91-hilary , that [he]98-robert lyon closed the book and looked discomposed ; not softened , only discomposed . Who shall be first to speak ? Who shall catch [the passing angel]2818-the passing angel 's wing ? One minute , and it may have passed over . [I]0-i am not apologizing for [Hilary]91-hilary the least in [the world]248-the world . [I]0-i do not know even if [she]91-hilary considered whether it was [her]91-hilary place or [Robert]98-robert lyon 's to make the first advance . Indeed , [I]0-i fear [she]91-hilary did not consider it at all , but just acted upon impulse , because it was so cruel , so heart breaking , to be at variance with [him]98-robert lyon . But if [she]91-hilary had considered it [I]0-i doubt not [she]91-hilary would have done from duty exactly what [she]91-hilary did by instinct — crept up to [him]98-robert lyon as [he]98-robert lyon sat at the fireside , and laid [her]91-hilary little hand on [his]98-robert lyon . " [Robert]98-robert lyon , what makes [you]98-robert lyon so angry with [me]91-hilary still ? "[91-hilary] " Not angry ; [I]91-hilary have no right to be . "[91-hilary] " Yes , [you]98-robert lyon would have if [I]91-hilary had really done wrong . Have [I]91-hilary ? "[91-hilary] " [You]98-robert lyon must judge for [yourself]98-robert lyon . For [me]91-hilary — [I]91-hilary thought [you]98-robert lyon loved [me]91-hilary better than [I]91-hilary find [you]98-robert lyon do , and [I]91-hilary made a mistake ; that is all . "[91-hilary] Ay , [he]98-robert lyon had made a mistake , but it was not that one . It was the other mistake that [men]3062-men continually make about [women]3061-women ; [they]3062-men can not understand that love is not worth having , that it is not love at all , but merely a selfish carrying out of selfish desires , if it blinds [us]2822-us to any other duty , or blunts in [us]2822-us any other sacred tenderness . [They]3062-men can not see how [she]3061-women who is false in one relation may be false in another ; and that , true as human nature 's truth , ay , and often fulfilling itself , is [Brabantio]223-brabantio 's ominous warning to [Othello]224-othello — " Look to [her]3061-women , [Moor]225-moor ! have a good eye to see ; [She]3061-women has deceived [[her]3061-women father]1162-her father , and may [thee]225-moor . "[98-robert lyon] Perhaps as soon as [he]98-robert lyon had said the bitter word [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon was sorry , any how , the soft answer which followed it thrilled through every nerve of [the strong willed man]2823-the strong willed man — a man not easily made angry , but when [he]98-robert lyon was , very hard to move . " [Robert]98-robert lyon , will [you]98-robert lyon listen to [me]98-robert lyon for two minutes ? "[98-robert lyon] " For as long as [you]98-robert lyon like , only [you]98-robert lyon must not expect [me]98-robert lyon to agree with [you]98-robert lyon . Oh , [Robert]98-robert lyon ! "[98-robert lyon] Words are not always the wisest arguments . " Oh , [Hilary]91-hilary , how could [you]98-robert lyon wound [me]2824-me so ? "[2824-me] And in lieu of the discussion , a long silence brooded over the fireside — the silence of exceeding love . " Now , [Robert]98-robert lyon , may [I]98-robert lyon talk to [you]98-robert lyon ? "[98-robert lyon] " Yes . Preach away , [my]98-robert lyon little conscience . " [You]98-robert lyon would not like [me]2824-me to tell [you]98-robert lyon [I]2824-me did not love [Johanna]93-johanna ? "[2824-me] " Certainly not . "[98-robert lyon] There are times when a laugh is better than a reproach ; and something else , which need not be more particularly explained , is safer than either .
