"[91-hilary] " Now , [Robert]98-robert lyon put [yourself]98-robert lyon in [my]98-robert lyon place , and try to think for [me]98-robert lyon . [I]98-robert lyon have been [[Johanna]93-johanna 's child]5064-johanna 's child for thirty years ; [she]93-johanna is entirely dependent upon [me]98-robert lyon . [Her]93-johanna health is feeble ; every year of [her]93-johanna life is at least doubtful . If [she]93-johanna lost [me]98-robert lyon [I]98-robert lyon think [she]93-johanna would never live out the next three years . [You]98-robert lyon would not like that ? "[98-robert lyon] " No . "[98-robert lyon] " In all divided duties like this [somebody]3240-somebody must suffer ; the question is , which can suffer best ? [She]93-johanna is old and frail , [we]5066-we are young ; [she]93-johanna is alone , [we]5066-we are two ; [she]93-johanna never had any happiness in [her]93-johanna life , except , perhaps [me]98-robert lyon ; and [we]5066-we — oh how happy [we]5066-we are ! [I]98-robert lyon think , [Robert]98-robert lyon , it would be better for [us]5066-we to suffer than poor [Johanna]93-johanna . "[98-robert lyon] " [[You]777-the man little [Jesuit]226-jesuit]5067-you little jesuit , "[2825-you] [he]2825-you said : but the higher nature of [the man]777-the man was roused ; [he]2825-you was no longer angry . " It is only for a short time , remember — only three years . "[2825-you] " And how can [I]98-robert lyon do without [you]2825-you for three years ? "[98-robert lyon] " Yes , [Robert]98-robert lyon , [you]98-robert lyon can . "[2825-you] And [she]2827-i put [her]2827-i arms round [his]2825-you neck , and looked at [him]2825-you , eye to eye . " [You]2825-you know [I]2827-i am [your]2825-you very own , a piece of [yourself]2825-you , as it were ; that when [I]2827-i let [you]2825-you go it is like tearing [myself]2827-i from [myself]2827-i ; yet [I]2827-i can bear it , rather than do , or let [you]2825-you do , in the smallest degree , a thing which is not right . "[2827-i] [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon was not [a man of many words]2092-a man of many words ; but [he]98-robert lyon had the rare faculty of seeing a case clearly , without reference to [himself]98-robert lyon , and of putting it clearly also , when necessary . " It seems to [me]98-robert lyon , [Hilary]91-hilary , that this is hardly a matter of abstract right or wrong , or a good deal might be argued on [my]98-robert lyon side of the subject . It is more a case of personal conscience . [The two]2735-the two are not always identical , though [they]2735-the two look so at first ; but [they]2735-the two both come to the same result . "[98-robert lyon] " And that is — "[98-robert lyon] " If [[my]98-robert lyon little woman]5050-my little woman thinks it right to act as [she]5050-my little woman does , [I]98-robert lyon also think it right to let [her]5050-my little woman . And let this be the law of [our]541-these two married life , if [we]541-these two ever are married , "[98-robert lyon] and [he]98-robert lyon sighed , " that when [we]541-these two differ each should respect [the other]3271-the other 's conscience , and do right in the truest sense , by allowing [the other]3271-the other to do the same . "[98-robert lyon] " Oh , [Robert]98-robert lyon ! how good [you]98-robert lyon are . "[98-robert lyon] So [these two]541-these two , an hour after , met [Johanna]93-johanna with cheerful faces ; and [she]93-johanna never knew how much [both]1803-both had sacrificed for [her]93-johanna sake . Once only , when [she]93-johanna was for a few minutes absent from [the parlor]313-the parlor , did [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon renew the subject , to suggest a medium course . But [Hilary]91-hilary resolutely refused . Not that [she]91-hilary doubted [him]98-robert lyon — [she]91-hilary doubted [herself]91-hilary . [She]91-hilary knew quite well by the pang that darted through [her]91-hilary like a shaft of ice , as [she]91-hilary felt [his]98-robert lyon warm arm round [her]91-hilary , and thought of the time when [she]91-hilary would feel it no more , that , after [she]91-hilary had been [[Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon 's happy wife]2832-robert lyon 's happy wife for three months , to let [him]98-robert lyon go to [India]11-india without [her]91-hilary would be simply and utterly impossible . Fast fled the months ; they dwindled into weeks , and then into days . [I]0-i shall not enlarge upon this time . Now , when the ends of [the world]248-the world have been drawn together , and [every family]522-every family has [one or more relatives abroad]2835-one or more relatives abroad , a grief like [Hilary]91-hilary 's has become so common that nearly every one can , in degree , understand it . How bitter such partings are , how much [they]2836-they take out of the brief span of mortal life , and , therefore , how far they are justifiable , for any thing short of absolute necessity , Heaven knows . In this case it was an absolutely necessity . [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon 's position in " [[our]5072-our firm]2715-our firm , "[98-robert lyon] with which [he]98-robert lyon identified [himself]98-robert lyon with the natural pride of [a man who has diligently worked [his]98-robert lyon way up to fortune]2837-a man who has diligently worked his way up to fortune , was such that [he]98-robert lyon could not , without sacrificing [his]98-robert lyon future prospects , and likewise what [he]98-robert lyon felt to be a point of honor , refuse to go back to [Bombay]13-bombay until such time as [[his]98-robert lyon senior partner 's son]2838-his senior partner 's son , [the young fellow whom [he]98-robert lyon had " coached "[98-robert lyon] in [Hindostanee]12-hindostanee , and nursed through a fever years ago]2839-the young fellow whom he had " coached " in hindostanee , and nursed through a fever years ago , could conveniently take [his]98-robert lyon place [abroad]2840-abroad . " Of course , "[98-robert lyon] [he]98-robert lyon said , explaining this to [Hilary]91-hilary and [[her]91-hilary sister]559-her sister , " accidental circumstances might occur to cause [my]98-robert lyon return [home]3045-home before the three years were out , but the act must be none of [mine]98-robert lyon ; [I]98-robert lyon must do [my]98-robert lyon duty . "[98-robert lyon] " Yes , [you]98-robert lyon must , "[91-hilary] answered [Hilary]91-hilary , with a gleam lighting up [her]91-hilary eyes . [She]91-hilary loved so in [him]98-robert lyon this one great principle of [his]98-robert lyon life — the back - bone of it , as it were — duty before all things . [Johanna]93-johanna asked no questions . Once [she]93-johanna had inquired , with a tremulous , hardly concealed alarm , whether [Robert]98-robert lyon wished to take [Hilary]91-hilary back with [him]98-robert lyon , and [Hilary]91-hilary had kissed [her]91-hilary , smilingly , saying , " No , that was impossible . "[91-hilary] Afterward the subject was never revived . And so [these two lovers]2842-these two lovers , [both stern in what [they]2842-these two lovers thought [their]2842-these two lovers duty]2843-both stern in what they thought their duty , went on silently together to the last day of parting . It was almost as quiet a day as that never - to - be - forgotten Sunday at [Stowbury]2-stowbury . [They]2842-these two lovers went a long walk together , in the course of which [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon forced [her]91-hilary to agree to what hitherto [she]91-hilary had steadfastly resisted , that [she]91-hilary and [Johanna]93-johanna should accept from [him]98-robert lyon enough , in addition to [their]2842-these two lovers own fifty pounds a year , to enable [them]2842-these two lovers to live comfortably without [her]91-hilary working any more . " Are [you]98-robert lyon ashamed of [my]91-hilary working ? "[91-hilary] [she]91-hilary asked , with something between a tear and a smile . " Sometimes [I]91-hilary used to be afraid [you]98-robert lyon would think the less of [me]91-hilary because circumstances made [me]91-hilary [an independent woman]5075-an independent woman , earning [my]91-hilary own bread . Do [you]98-robert lyon ? "[91-hilary] " [[My]2844-he darling]5054-my darling , no . [I]2844-he am proud of [her]91-hilary . But [she]91-hilary must never work any more . [Johanna]93-johanna says right ; it is [[a man]628-a man 's place]5078-a man 's place , and not [a woman]669-a woman 's . [I]2844-he will not allow it . "[2844-he] When [he]2844-he spoke in that tone [Hilary]91-hilary always submitted . [He]2844-he told [her]91-hilary another thing while arranging with [her]91-hilary all the business part of [their]2845-their concerns , and to reconcile [her]91-hilary to this partial dependence upon [him]2844-he , which , [he]2844-he urged , was only forestalling [his]2844-he rights ; that before [he]2844-he first quitted [England]9-england , seven years ago , [he]2844-he had made [his]2844-he will , leaving [her]91-hilary , if still unmarried , [[his]2844-he sole heir]2846-his sole heir and [legatee]2847-legatee , indeed in exactly the position that [she]91-hilary would have been had [she]91-hilary been [[his]2844-he wife]4348-his wife . " This will exists still ; so that in any case [you]91-hilary are safe . No further poverty can ever befall [[my]2844-he [Hilary]91-hilary]5080-my hilary . "[2844-he] [His]2844-he — [his]2844-he own — [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon 's own . [Her]91-hilary sense of this was so strong that it took away the sharpness of the parting , made [her]91-hilary feel , up to the very last minute , when [she]91-hilary clung to [him]2844-he — was pressed close to [him]2844-he — heart to heart and lip to lip — for a space that seemed half a life - time of mixed anguish and joy — that [he]2844-he was not really going ; that somehow or other , next day or next week [he]2844-he would be back again , as in [his]2844-he frequent re - appearances , exactly as before . When [he]2844-he was really gone — when , as [she]91-hilary sat with [her]91-hilary tearless eyes fixed on the closed door — [Johanna]93-johanna softly touched [her]91-hilary , saying , " [[My]93-johanna child]3717-my child "[93-johanna] then [Hilary]91-hilary learned it all . The next twenty - four hours will hardly bear being written about . [Most people]875-most people know what it is to miss the face out of [the house]344-the house — the life out of the heart . To come and go , to eat and drink , to lie down and rise , and find all thing the same , and gradually to recognize that it must be the same , indefinitely , perhaps always . To be met continually by small trifles — a dropped glove , a book , a scrap of handwriting that yesterday would have been thrown into the fire , but to - day is picked up and kept as a relic ; and at times , bursting through the quietness which must be gained , or at least assumed , the cruel craving for one word more — one kiss more — for only one five minutes of the eternally ended yesterday ! All this hundreds have gone through ; so did [Hilary]91-hilary . [She]91-hilary said afterward it was good for [her]91-hilary that [she]91-hilary did ; it would make [her]91-hilary feel for [others]525-others in a way [she]91-hilary had never felt before . Also , because it taught [her]91-hilary that such a heart - break can be borne and lived through when help is sought where only real help can be found ; and where , when reason fails , and [those who , striving to do right irrespective of the consequences]2852-those who , striving to do right irrespective of the consequences , cry out against [their]2852-those who , striving to do right irrespective of the consequences torments and wonder why [they]2852-those who , striving to do right irrespective of the consequences should be made so to suffer , childlike faith comes to [their]2852-those who , striving to do right irrespective of the consequences rescue . For , let [us]2853-we have all the philosophy at [our]2853-we fingers ' ends , what are [we]2853-we but [children]308-children ? [We]2853-we know not what a day may bring forth . All wisdom resolves itself into the simple hymn which [we]2853-we learned when [we]2853-we were young : " Deep in unfathomable mines Of never - failing skill . [He]227-blind unbelief treasures up [His]227-blind unbelief vast designs , And works [His]227-blind unbelief sovereign will . "[227-blind unbelief] [Blind unbelief]227-blind unbelief is sure to err . And scan [His]227-blind unbelief work in vain : [God]105-god is [[His]227-blind unbelief own interpreter]2855-his own interpreter . And [He]227-blind unbelief will make it plain . " The night after [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon left , [Hilary]91-hilary and [Johanna]93-johanna were sitting together in [[their]2853-we parlor]5082-their parlor . [Hilary]91-hilary had been writing a long letter to [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder , explaining that [she]91-hilary would now give up in favor of [the other young lady]5083-the other young lady , or [any other of [the many to whom it would be a blessing]5085-the many to whom it would be a blessing , [her]91-hilary position in [the shop]1561-the shop]5084-any other of the many to whom it would be a blessing , her position in the shop ; but that [she]91-hilary hoped still to help [her]168-miss balquidder — [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder — in any way [she]91-hilary could point out that would be useful to [others]525-others . [She]91-hilary wished , in [her]91-hilary humble way , as a sort of thank offering from [one who had passed through the waves and been landed safe ashore]5088-one who had passed through the waves and been landed safe ashore , to help those who were still struggling , as [she]91-hilary [herself]91-hilary had struggled once . [She]91-hilary desired , as far as in [her]91-hilary lay , to be [Miss Balquidder]168-miss balquidder 's "[227-blind unbelief] right hand " till [Mr. Lyon]98-robert lyon came [home]3045-home . This letter [she]91-hilary read aloud to [Johanna]93-johanna , whose failing eye sight refused all candle light occupation , and then came and sat beside [her]93-johanna in silence . [She]93-johanna felt terribly worn and weary , but [she]93-johanna was very quiet now . "[2856-we] [We]2856-we must go to bed early , " was all [she]93-johanna said . "[2856-we] Yes , [[my]0-i child]3717-my child . " And [Johanna]93-johanna smoothed [her]93-johanna hair in the old , fond way , making no attempt to console [her]93-johanna , but only to love [her]93-johanna — always the safest consolation . And [Hilary]91-hilary was thankful that never , even in [her]91-hilary sharpest agonies of grief , had [she]91-hilary betrayed that secret which would have made [[her]91-hilary sister]559-her sister 's life miserable , have blotted out the thirty years of motherly love , and caused the other love to rise up like a cloud between [her]91-hilary and it , never to be lifted until [Johanna]93-johanna sank into [the possibly not far - off grave]5091-the possibly not far - off grave . "[3717-my child] No , no , " [she]0-i thought to [herself]0-i , as [she]0-i looked on that frail , old face , which even the secondary , grief of this last week seemed to have made frailer and older . "[3717-my child] No , it is better as it is ; [I]0-i believe [I]0-i did right . The end will show . " The end was nearer than [she]0-i thought . So , sometimes — not often , lest self - sacrifice should become a less holy thing than it is — [Providence]213-providence accepts the will for the act , and makes the latter needless . There was a sudden knock at the hall door . "[4323-the young people] It is [the young people]4323-the young people coming in to supper . " "[4323-the young people] It 's not , " said [Hilary]91-hilary , starting up—"it[4323-the young people] 's not [their]4323-the young people knock . It is — " [She]0-i never finished the sentence , for [she]0-i was sobbing in [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon 's arms . "[3717-my child] What does it all mean ? " cried the bewildered [Johanna]93-johanna , of whom , [I]2859-i must confess , for once [nobody]357-nobody took the least notice . It meant that , by one of these strange accidents , as [we]5093-we call them , which in a moment alter the whole current of things , [the senior partner]5094-the senior partner had suddenly died , and [[his]5094-the senior partner son]1166-his son , not being qualified to take [his]1166-his son place in [the Liverpool house]5096-the liverpool house , had to go out to [India]11-india instead of [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon , who would now remain permanently , as [the third senior partner]5097-the third senior partner , in [England]9-england . This news had met [him]98-robert lyon at [Southampton]76-southampton . [He]98-robert lyon had gone thence direct to [Liverpool]72-liverpool , arranged affairs so far as was possible , and returned , traveling without an hour 's intermission , to tell [his]98-robert lyon own tidings , as was best — or as [he]98-robert lyon thought it was . Perhaps at the core of [his]98-robert lyon heart lurked the desire to come suddenly back , as , it is said , if [the absent or the dead]5098-the absent or the dead should come , [they]5098-the absent or the dead would find all things changed ; the place filled up in [home]3045-home and hearth — no face of welcome — no heart leaping to heart in the ecstasy of reunion . Well , if [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon had any misgivings — and being [a man]628-a man , and in love , perhaps [he]98-robert lyon had — they were ended now . "[2859-i] Is [she]2859-i glad to see [me]0-i ? " was all [he]98-robert lyon could find to say when , [Johanna]93-johanna having considerately vanished , [he]98-robert lyon might have talked as much as [he]98-robert lyon pleased . [Hilary]91-hilary 's only answer was a little , low laugh of inexpressible content . [He]98-robert lyon lifted up between [his]98-robert lyon bands the sweet face , neither so young nor so pretty as it had been , but oh ! so sweet , with the sweetness that long outlives beauty — a face that [a man]628-a man might look on all [his]628-a man life time and never tire of — so infinitely loving , so infinitely true ! And [he]98-robert lyon knew it was [[his]98-robert lyon wife]4348-his wife 's face , to shine upon [him]98-robert lyon day by day , and year by year , till it faded into old age — beautiful and beloved even then . All the strong nature of [the man]777-the man gave way ; [he]98-robert lyon wept almost like [a child]504-a child in [his]98-robert lyon "[2860-little woman] [little woman]2860-little woman 's " arms . Let [us]5105-us leave [them]5106-them there , by that peaceful fireside — [these two , who are to sit by one fire - side as long as [they]5106-them live]5107-these two , who are to sit by one fire - side as long as they live . Of [their]5106-them further fortune [we]5105-us know nothing — nor do [they]5106-them [themselves]5106-them — except the one fact , in itself joy enough for any mortal cup to hold , that it will be shared together . Two at the hearth , two abroad ; two to labor , two to rejoice ; or , if so it must be , two to weep , and two to comfort [one another]394-one another ; [the man]777-the man to be the head of [the woman]694-the woman , and [the woman]694-the woman the heart of [the man]777-the man . This is the ordination of [God]105-god ; this is the perfect life ; none the less perfect that so many fall short of it . So let [us]5105-us bid [them]5106-them good - by : [Robert Lyon]98-robert lyon and [Hilary Leaf]91-hilary , "[2860-little woman] Good - by ; [God]105-god be with [ye]2861-ye ! " for [we]5105-us shall see [them]5106-them no more . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth stood at the nursery window , pointing out to [little Henry]97-ascott how the lilacs and laburnums were coming into flower in [the square below]5113-the square below , and speculating with [him]97-ascott whether the tribe of sparrows which [they]5106-them had fed all the winter from the mignonette boxes on the window sill would be building nests in [the tall trees of [Russell Square]3-russell square]5114-the tall trees of russell square ; for [she]94-elizabeth wished , with [her]94-elizabeth great aversion to [London]1-london , to make [her]94-elizabeth nursling as far as possible "[2862-a country child] [a country child]2862-a country child . " [Master Henry Leaf Ascott]97-ascott was by no means little now . [He]97-ascott would run about on [his]97-ascott tottering fat legs , and [he]97-ascott could say , "[2862-a country child] [Mammy Lizzie]228-mammy lizzie , " also , "[229-pa - pa] [Pa - pa]229-pa - pa , " as had been carefully taught [him]97-ascott by [[his]97-ascott conscientious nurse]5115-his conscientious nurse . At which [papa]211-papa had been at first excessively surprised , then gratified , and had at last taken kindly to the appellation as a matter of course . It inaugurated a new era in [Peter Ascott]202-mrs. ascott 's life . At first twice a week , and then every day , [he]97-ascott sent up for "[229-pa - pa] [Master Ascott]97-ascott " to keep [him]97-ascott company at dessert ; [he]97-ascott then changed [his]97-ascott dinner hour from half past six to five , because [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , with [her]94-elizabeth stern sacrifice of every thing to [the child]3274-the child 's good , had suggested to [him]97-ascott , humbly but firmly , that late hours kept little [Henry]97-ascott too long out of [his]97-ascott bed . [He]97-ascott gave up [his]97-ascott bottle of port and [his]97-ascott after - dinner sleep , and took to making water - lilies and caterpillars out of oranges and boats out of walnut shells , for [[his]97-ascott boy]5117-his boy 's special edification . Sometimes when , at half past six , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , punctual as clock - work , knocked at the [dining room]5118-dining room door , [she]94-elizabeth heard [father]3500-father and [son]3501-son laughing together in a most jovial manner , though the decanters were in their places and the wine glasses untouched . And even after [the child]3274-the child disappeared , [the butler]4366-the butler declared that [master]4127-master usually took quietly to [his]4127-master newspaper , or rang for [his]4127-master tea , or perhaps dozed harmlessly in [his]4127-master chair till bedtime . [I]97-ascott do not allege that [Peter Ascott]202-mrs. ascott was miraculously changed ; [people]3210-people do not change , especially at [his]97-ascott age ; externally [he]97-ascott was still [the same pompous , overbearing , coarse man , with whom , no doubt , [[his]97-ascott son]1166-his son would have a tolerably sore bargain in years to come]5125-the same pompous , overbearing , coarse man , with whom , no doubt , his son would have a tolerably sore bargain in years to come . But still [the child]3274-the child had touched a soft corner in [his]3274-the child heart , the one soft corner which in [his]3274-the child youth had yielded to the beauty of [Miss Selina Leaf]92-selina ; and [the old fellow]4020-the old fellow was [a better fellow]5129-a better fellow than [he]4020-the old fellow had once been . Probably , with care , [he]4020-the old fellow might be for the rest of [his]4020-the old fellow life at least manageable . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth hoped so for [[his]97-ascott boy]5117-his boy 's sake , and little as [she]94-elizabeth liked [him]4020-the old fellow , [she]94-elizabeth tried to conquer [her]94-elizabeth antipathy as much as [she]94-elizabeth could . [She]94-elizabeth always ways took care to treat [him]4020-the old fellow with extreme respect , and to bring up [little Henry]97-ascott to do the same . And , as often happens , [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott began gradually to comport [himself]4020-the old fellow in a manner deserving of respect . [He]4020-the old fellow ceased [his]4020-the old fellow oaths and [his]4020-the old fellow coarse language ; seldom flew into a passion ; and last , not least , [the butler]4366-the butler avouched that [master]4127-master hardly ever went to bed "[97-ascott] muzzy " now . Toward all [[his]4020-the old fellow domestics]5133-his domestics , and especially [[[his]4020-the old fellow son]1166-his son 's nurse]5135-his son 's nurse , [he]4020-the old fellow behaved [himself]4020-the old fellow more like [a master]5136-a master and less like [a tyrant]5137-a tyrant ; so that [the establishment at [Russell Square]3-russell square]5138-the establishment at russell square went on in a way more peaceful than had ever been known before . There was no talk of [his]4020-the old fellow giving [it]5138-the establishment at russell square [a new mistress]5139-a new mistress ; [he]4020-the old fellow seemed to have had enough of matrimony . Of [[his]4020-the old fellow late wife]5140-his late wife [he]4020-the old fellow never spoke ; whether [he]4020-the old fellow loved [her]5140-his late wife or not , whether [he]4020-the old fellow had regretted [her]5140-his late wife or not , the love and regret were now alike ended . [Poor Selina]217-poor selina ! It was [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth only , who , with a sacred sense of duty , occasionally talked to [little Henry]97-ascott about "[0-i] mamma up there"—pointing to the blank bit of blue sky over [the trees of [Russell Square]3-russell square]5141-the trees of russell square , and hoped in time to make [him]97-ascott understand something about [her]5140-his late wife , and how [she]5140-his late wife had loved [him]97-ascott , [[her]5140-his late wife "[97-ascott] baby]5142-her " baby . " This love , the only beautiful emotion [her]5140-his late wife life had known , was the one fragment that remained of it after [her]5140-his late wife death ; the one remembrance [she]5140-his late wife left to [[her]5140-his late wife child]3364-her child . [Little Henry]230-little henry was not in the least like [her]5140-his late wife , nor yet like [[his]230-little henry father]404-his father . [He]230-little henry took after some forgotten type , [some past generation of [either family]5146-either family]5145-some past generation of either family , which reappeared in this as something new . To [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth [he]230-little henry was a perfect revelation of beauty and infantile fascination . [He]230-little henry filled up every corner of [her]94-elizabeth heart . [She]94-elizabeth grew fat and flourishing , even cheerful ; so cheerful that [she]94-elizabeth bore with equanimity the parting with [[her]94-elizabeth dear]1959-her dear [Miss Hilary]91-hilary , who went away in glory and happiness as [Mrs. Robert Lyon]231-mrs. robert lyon , to live in [Liverpool]72-liverpool , and [Miss Leaf]91-hilary with [her]94-elizabeth . Thus both [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's youthful dreams ended in nothing , and it was more than probable that for the future [their]5148-their lives and [hers]94-elizabeth being so widely apart , [she]94-elizabeth would see very little of [[her]94-elizabeth beloved mistresses]5149-her beloved mistresses any more . But [they]5148-their had done [their]5148-their work in [her]94-elizabeth and for [her]94-elizabeth ; and it had borne fruit a hundred fold , and would still . "[97-ascott] [I]0-i know [you]2863-you will take care of [this child]3054-this child — [he]3054-this child is the hope of [the family]258-the family , " said [Miss Leaf]91-hilary , when [she]0-i was giving [her]0-i last kiss to [little Henry]230-little henry . "[2863-you] [I]0-i could not bear to leave [him]3054-this child , if [I]0-i were not leaving [him]3054-this child with [you]2863-you . " And [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had taken [her]94-elizabeth charge proudly in [her]94-elizabeth arms , knowing [she]94-elizabeth was trusted , and in vowing to be worthy of that trust . Another dream was likewise ended ; so completely that [she]94-elizabeth sometimes wondered if it was ever real , whether [she]94-elizabeth had ever been [a happy girl]5150-a happy girl , looking forward as [girls]252-girls do to wifehood and motherhood ; or whether [she]94-elizabeth had not been always [the staid middle aged person [she]94-elizabeth was now , whom [nobody ever suspected of any such things]5153-nobody ever suspected of any such things]5152-the staid middle aged person she was now , whom nobody ever suspected of any such things . [She]94-elizabeth had been once back to [[her]94-elizabeth old home]5154-her old home , to settle [[her]94-elizabeth mother]241-her mother comfortably upon a weekly allowance , to ' prentice [[her]94-elizabeth little brother]5156-her little brother , to see [one sister]5157-one sister married , and [the other]3271-the other sent off to [Liverpool]72-liverpool , to be servant to [Mrs. Lyon]231-mrs. robert lyon . While at [Stowbury]2-stowbury , [she]94-elizabeth had heard by chance of [Tom Cliffe]132-tom 's passing through [the town]3034-the town as [a Chartist lecturer]5160-a chartist lecturer , or something of the sort , with [[his]132-tom pretty , showy London wife]5161-his pretty , showy london wife , who , when [he]132-tom brought [her]94-elizabeth [there]3030-there , had looked down rather contemptuously upon [the street where [Tom]132-tom was born]5163-the street where tom was born . This was all [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth knew about [them]5164-them . [They]5164-them , too , had passed from [her]94-elizabeth life as phases of keen joy and keener sorrow do pass , like a dream and the shadows of a dream . It may be , life itself will seem at the end to be nothing more . But [Elizabeth Hand]94-elizabeth 's love story was not so to end . One morning , the same morning when [she]94-elizabeth had been pointing out the lilacs to [little Henry]230-little henry , and now came in from [the square]3596-the square with a branch of them in [her]94-elizabeth hand , [the postman]5166-the postman gave [her]94-elizabeth a letter ; the handwriting of which made [her]94-elizabeth start as if it had been a visitation from the dead . "[228-mammy lizzie] [Mammy Lizzie]228-mammy lizzie , [mammy Lizzie]94-elizabeth ! " cried [little Henry]230-little henry , plucking at [her]94-elizabeth gown , but for once [[his]230-little henry nurse]5167-his nurse did not notice [him]230-little henry . [She]94-elizabeth stood on the door - step , trembling violently ; at length [she]94-elizabeth put the letter into [her]94-elizabeth pocket , lifted [the child]3274-the child , and got up stairs somehow . When [she]94-elizabeth had settled [her]94-elizabeth charge to [his]3274-the child mid - day sleep , then , and not till then , did [she]94-elizabeth take out and read the few lines , which , though written on shabby paper , and with more than one blot , were so like — yet so terribly unlike — [Tom]132-tom 's calligraphy of old : "[228-mammy lizzie] DEAR [ELIZABETH,—I]232-elizabeth,—i have no right to ask any kindness of [you]232-elizabeth,—i ; but if [you]232-elizabeth,—i would like to see [an old friend]2866-an old friend alive , [I]0-i wish [you]232-elizabeth,—i would come and see [me]0-i . [I]0-i have been long of asking [you]232-elizabeth,—i , lest [you]232-elizabeth,—i might fancy [I]0-i wanted to get something out of [you]232-elizabeth,—i ; for [I]0-i 'm as poor as a rat ; and once lately [I]0-i saw [you]232-elizabeth,—i , looking so well and well - to - do . But it was the same kind old face , and [I]0-i should like to get one kind look from it before [I]0-i go where [I]0-i sha'n't want any kindness from any body . However , do just as [you]232-elizabeth,—i choose . " [Yours]232-elizabeth,—i affectionately , [T. CLIFFE]233-t. cliffe . "[232-elizabeth,—i] Underneath is [my]0-i address . " It was in [one of [those wretched nooks in [Westminster]78-westminster]5170-those wretched nooks in westminster]5169-one of those wretched nooks in westminster , now swept away by [Victoria Street]79-victoria street and other improvements . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth happened to have read about it in one of the many charitable pamphlets , reports , etc . , which were sent continually to [the wealthy Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , and which [he]97-ascott sent down stairs to light fires with . What must not [poor Tom]132-tom have sunk to before [he]132-tom had come to live [there]3030-there ? [His]132-tom letter was like a cry out of the depths , and the voice was that of [her]94-elizabeth youth , [her]94-elizabeth first love . Is [any woman]3109-any woman ever deaf to that ? The love may have died a natural death ; many first loves do : a riper , completer , happier love may have come in its place ; but there must be something unnatural about [the woman]694-the woman and [man likewise , who can ever quite forget it]5174-man likewise , who can ever quite forget it — the dew of [their]5174-man likewise , who can ever quite forget it youth — the beauty of [their]5174-man likewise , who can ever quite forget it dawn . "[232-elizabeth,—i] [Poor Tom]132-tom , poor [Tom]132-tom ! " sighed [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , "[132-tom] [my]0-i own poor [Tom]132-tom ! " [She]94-elizabeth forgot [Esther]201-esther ; either from [Tom]132-tom 's not mentioning [her]94-elizabeth , or in the strong return to old times which [his]132-tom letter produced ; forgot [her]94-elizabeth for the time being as completely as if [she]94-elizabeth had never existed . Even when the recollection came it made little difference . The sharp jealousy , the dislike and contempt had all calmed down : [she]94-elizabeth thought [she]94-elizabeth could now see [[Tom]132-tom 's wife]4737-tom 's wife as [any other woman]5176-any other woman . Especially if , as the letter indicated , [they]5174-man likewise , who can ever quite forget it were so very poor and miserable . Possibly [Esther]201-esther had suggested writing it ? Perhaps , though [Tom]132-tom did not , [Esther]201-esther did "[232-elizabeth,—i] want to get something out of [her"—Elizabeth Hand]5177-her"—elizabeth hand , who was known to have large wages , and to be altogether [a thriving person]5178-a thriving person ? Well , it mattered little . The one fact remained : [Tom]132-tom was in distress ; [Tom]132-tom needed [her]94-elizabeth ; [she]94-elizabeth must go . [Her]94-elizabeth only leisure time was of an evening , after [Henry]97-ascott was in bed . The intervening hours , especially the last one , when [the child]3274-the child was down [stairs]3048-stairs with [[his]3274-the child father]404-his father , calmed [her]94-elizabeth ; subdued the tumult of old remembrances that came surging up and beating at the long shut door of [her]94-elizabeth heart . When [[her]94-elizabeth boy]5182-her boy returned , leaping and laughing , and playing all sorts of tricks as [she]94-elizabeth put [him]5182-her boy to bed , [she]94-elizabeth could smile too . And when kneeling beside [her]94-elizabeth in [his]5182-her boy pretty white night gown , [he]5182-her boy stammered through the prayer [she]94-elizabeth had thought it right to begin to teach [him]5182-her boy , though of course [he]5182-her boy was too young to understand it — the words "[2870-mammy] [Thy]2867-thy will be done ; " "[2867-thy] Forgive [us]2868-us [our]2868-us trespasses , as [we]2868-us forgive [those who trespass against [us]2868-us]2869-those who trespass against us ; " and lastly , "[2867-thy] Lead [us]2868-us not into temptation , but deliver [us]2868-us from evil , " struck [home]3045-home to [[his]5182-her boy nurse]5167-his nurse 's in most soul . "[2870-mammy] [Mammy]2870-mammy , mammy [Lizzie]94-elizabeth 's ' tying . " Yes , [she]94-elizabeth was crying , but it did [her]94-elizabeth good . [She]94-elizabeth was able to kiss [[her]94-elizabeth little boy]5185-her little boy , who slept like a top in five minutes : then [she]94-elizabeth took off [her]94-elizabeth good silk gown , and dressed [herself]94-elizabeth ; soberly and decently , but so that [people]3210-people should not suspect , in [that low and dangerous neighborhood]5187-that low and dangerous neighborhood , the sovereigns that [she]94-elizabeth carried in an under pocket , ready to use as occasion required . Thus equipped , without a minute 's delay , [she]94-elizabeth started for [[Tom]132-tom 's lodging]5188-tom 's lodging . [It]5188-tom 's lodging was poorer than even [she]94-elizabeth expected . [One attic room]5189-one attic room , bate almost as when [it]5188-tom 's lodging was built . No chimney or grate , no furniture except a box which served as both table and chair ; and a heap of straw , with a blanket thrown over it . The only comfort about [it]5188-tom 's lodging was that [it]5188-tom 's lodging was clean ; [Tom]132-tom 's innate sense of refinement had abided with [him]132-tom to the last . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth had time to make all these observations , for [Tom]132-tom was out — gone , [the landlady]1243-the landlady said , to [[the druggist]5191-the druggist 's shop]5192-the druggist 's shop , round the corner . "[94-elizabeth] [He]2871-he 's very bad , [ma'am]3015-ma'am , " added [the woman]694-the woman , civilly , probably led thereto by [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's respectable appearance , and the cab in which [she]94-elizabeth had come — lest [she]94-elizabeth should lose a minute 's time . "[2871-he] Ca n't last long , and [Lord]2873-lord knows who 's to bury [him]2871-he . " With that sentence knelling in [her]94-elizabeth ears , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth waited till [she]94-elizabeth heard the short cough and the hard breathing of [some one toiling heavily up the stair]5194-some one toiling heavily up the stair . [Tom]132-tom , [Tom]132-tom [himself]132-tom . But oh , so altered ! with every bit of youth gone out of [him]132-tom ; with death written on every line of [his]132-tom haggard face , the death [he]132-tom had once prognosticated with a sentimental pleasure , but which now had come upon [him]132-tom in all its ghastly reality . [He]132-tom was in the last stage of consumption . The disease was latent in [[his]132-tom family]3692-his family , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth knew : [she]94-elizabeth had known it when [she]94-elizabeth belonged to [him]132-tom , and fondly thought that , as [[his]132-tom wife]4348-his wife , [her]94-elizabeth incessant care might save [him]132-tom from it ; but nothing could save [him]132-tom now . "[2873-lord] Who 's that ? " said [he]132-tom , in [his]132-tom own sharp , fretful voice . "[0-i] [Me]0-i , [Tom]132-tom . But do n't speak . Sit down till [your]132-tom cough 's over . " [Tom]132-tom grasped [her]94-elizabeth hand as [she]94-elizabeth stood by [him]132-tom , but [he]132-tom made no further demonstration , nor used any expression of gratitude . [He]132-tom seemed far too ill . [Sick people]5197-sick people are always absorbed in the sad present ; [they]5197-sick people seldom trouble [themselves]5197-sick people much about the past . Only there was something in the way [Tom]132-tom clung to [her]94-elizabeth hand , helplessly , imploringly , that moved the inmost heart of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm very bad , [you]2874-you see . This cough ; oh , it shakes [me]0-i dreadfully ; especially of nights . " "[2878-the druggist 's shopman] Have [you]132-tom [any doctor]2875-any doctor ? " "[2876-the druggist close by] [The druggist close by]2876-the druggist close by , or rather , [[the druggist]5191-the druggist 's shopman]2878-the druggist 's shopman . [He]2878-the druggist 's shopman 's [a very kind young fellow , from [[our]2880-our county]2881-our county]2879-a very kind young fellow , from our county , [I]0-i fancy , for [he]2878-the druggist 's shopman asked [me]0-i once if [I]0-i was n't [a Stowbury man]2882-a stowbury man ; and ever since [he]2878-the druggist 's shopman has doctored [me]0-i for nothing , and given [me]0-i a shilling too , now and then , when [I]0-i 've been [a'most clemmed to death in the winter]2883-a'most clemmed to death in the winter . " "[2883-a'most clemmed to death in the winter] Oh , [Tom]132-tom , why did n't [you]132-tom write to [me]0-i before . Have [you]132-tom actually wanted food ? " "[132-tom] Yes , many a time . [I]0-i 've been out of work this twelvemonth . " "[0-i] But [Esther]201-esther ? " "[201-esther] Who ? " screamed [Tom]132-tom . "[201-esther] [[Your]132-tom wife]3938-your wife ? " "[201-esther] [[My]0-i wife]2885-my wife ? [I]0-i 've got none ? [She]2885-my wife spent every thing till [I]0-i fell ill , and then [she]2885-my wife met [a fellow with lots of money]2886-a fellow with lots of money . Curse [her]2885-my wife ! " The fury with which [he]132-tom spoke shook [him]132-tom all over , and sent [him]132-tom into another violent fit of coughing , out of which [he]132-tom revived by degrees , but in a state of such complete exhaustion that [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth hazarded no more questions . [He]132-tom must evidently be dealt with exactly like [a child]504-a child . [She]0-i made up [her]0-i mind in [her]0-i own silent way , as indeed [she]0-i had done ever since [she]0-i came into [the room]3244-the room . "[2885-my wife] Lie down , [Tom]132-tom , and keep [yourself]132-tom quiet for a little . [I]0-i 'll be back as soon as [I]0-i can — back with something to do [you]132-tom good . [You]132-tom wo n't object . " "[132-tom] No , no ; [you]132-tom can do any thing [you]132-tom like with [me]0-i . [You]132-tom always could . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth groped [her]0-i way down [stairs]3048-stairs strangely calm and self - possessed . There was need . [Tom]132-tom , dying , had come to [her]94-elizabeth as [his]132-tom sole support and consolation — throwing [himself]132-tom helplessly upon [her]94-elizabeth , never doubting either [her]94-elizabeth will or [her]94-elizabeth power to help [him]132-tom . Neither must fail . [The inexplicable woman]5201-the inexplicable woman 's strength , sometimes found in the very gentlest , quietest , and apparently the weakest character , nerved [her]94-elizabeth now . [She]94-elizabeth went up and down , street after [street]5202-street , looking for [lodgings]1187-lodgings , till the evening darkened , and [the Abbey towers]5204-the abbey towers rose grimly against the summer sky . Then [she]94-elizabeth crossed over [Westminster Bridge]80-westminster bridge , and in [a little street]5205-a little street on the [Surrey]81-surrey side [she]94-elizabeth found what [she]94-elizabeth wanted — [a decent room]5206-a decent room , half sitting , half [bedroom]5207-bedroom , with what looked like [a decent landlady]5208-a decent landlady . There was no time to make many inquiries ; any thing was better than to leave [Tom]132-tom an other night where [he]132-tom was . [She]94-elizabeth paid a week 's rent in advance ; bought firing and provisions ; every thing [she]94-elizabeth could think of to make [him]132-tom comfortable ; and then [she]94-elizabeth went to fetch [him]132-tom in [a cab]3728-a cab . [The sick man]5210-the sick man offered no resistance ; indeed , [he]132-tom hardly seemed to know what [she]94-elizabeth was doing with [him]132-tom . [She]94-elizabeth discovered the cause of this half insensibility when , in making a bundle of [his]132-tom few clothes , [she]94-elizabeth found a package labeled "[132-tom] opium . " "[132-tom] Do n't take it from [me]0-i , " [he]132-tom said pitifully , "[132-tom] it 's the only comfort [I]0-i have . " But when [he]132-tom found [himself]132-tom in [the cheerful room]5211-the cheerful room , with the fire blazing and the tea laid out , [he]132-tom woke up like [a person]2060-a person out of a bad dream . "[132-tom] Oh , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , [I]0-i 'm so comfortable ! " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth could have wept . Whether the wholesome food and drink revived [him]132-tom , or whether it was one of the sudden flashes of life that often occur in [consumptive patients]5213-consumptive patients , but [he]132-tom seemed really better , and began to talk , telling [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth about [his]132-tom long illness , and saying over again how very kind [[the druggist]5191-the druggist 's young man]5215-the druggist 's young man had been to [him]132-tom . "[94-elizabeth] [I]0-i 'm sure [he]2887-he 's [a gentleman]3465-a gentleman , though [he]2887-he has come down in [the world]248-the world ; for , as [he]2887-he says , ' misery makes [a man]628-a man acquainted with [strange bedfellows]2891-strange bedfellows , and takes the nonsense out of [him]628-a man . ' [I]0-i think so too , and if ever [I]0-i get better , [I]0-i do n't mean to go about [the country]942-the country speaking against [born gentlefolks]2893-born gentlefolks any more . [They]2893-born gentlefolks 're much of a muchness with [ourselves]2894-ourselves — bad and good ; a little of all sorts ; the same flesh and blood as [we]2894-ourselves are . Are n't [they]2893-born gentlefolks , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? " "[94-elizabeth] [I]0-i suppose so . " "[94-elizabeth] And there 's another thing [I]0-i mean to do . [I]0-i mean to try and be good like [you]94-elizabeth . Many a night , when [I]0-i 've lain on that straw , and thought [I]0-i was dying , [I]0-i 've remembered [you]94-elizabeth and all the things [you]94-elizabeth used to say to [me]0-i . [You]94-elizabeth are [a good woman]671-a good woman ; there never was a better . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth smiled , a faint rather sad smile . For , as [she]94-elizabeth was washing up the tea things , [she]94-elizabeth had noticed [Tom]132-tom 's voice grow feebler , and [his]132-tom features sharper and more wan . "[94-elizabeth] [I]0-i 'm very tired , " [he]132-tom said . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm afraid to go to bed , [I]0-i get such wretched nights ; but [I]0-i think , if [I]0-i lay down in [my]0-i clothes , [I]0-i could go to sleep . " [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth helped [him]132-tom to the small pallet , shook [his]132-tom pillow , and covered [him]132-tom up as if [he]132-tom had been [a child]504-a child . "[2896-you] [You]2896-you 're very good to [me]0-i , " [he]132-tom said , and looked up at [her]94-elizabeth — [Tom]132-tom 's bright , fond look of years ago . But it passed away in a moment , and [he]132-tom closed [his]132-tom eyes , saying [he]132-tom was so terribly tired . "[2896-you] Then [I]0-i 'll bid [you]2896-you good - by , for [I]0-i ought to have been at [home]3045-home by now . [You]2896-you 'll take care of [yourself]2896-you , [Tom]132-tom , and [I]0-i 'll come and see [you]132-tom again the very first hour [I]0-i can be spared . And if [you]2896-you want [me]0-i [you]2896-you 'll send to [me]0-i at once ? [You]2896-you know where ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i will , " said [Tom]132-tom . "[0-i] Its [the same house]3296-the same house , is n't [it]3296-the same house , in [Russell Square]3-russell square ? " "[2896-you] Yes . " And [they]5217-they were both silent . After a minute , [Tom]132-tom asked , in a troubled voice . "[2896-you] Have [you]2896-you forgiven [me]0-i ? " "[2896-you] Yes , [Tom]132-tom , quite . " "[132-tom] Wo n't [you]2896-you give [me]0-i one kiss , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ? " [She]94-elizabeth turned away . [She]94-elizabeth did not mean to be hard , but somehow [she]94-elizabeth could not kiss [[Esther]201-esther 's husband]5218-esther 's husband . "[2896-you] Ah , well ; it 's all the same ! good - by ! " "[132-tom] Good - by , [Tom]132-tom . " But as [she]94-elizabeth stood at the door , and looked back at [him]132-tom lying with [his]132-tom eyes shut , and as white as if [he]132-tom were dead , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's heart melted . [He]132-tom was [[her]94-elizabeth Tom]5219-her tom , [[her]94-elizabeth own Tom , of whom [she]94-elizabeth had been so fond , so proud ; whose future [she]94-elizabeth had joyfully anticipated long before [she]94-elizabeth thought of [herself]94-elizabeth as mixed up with it]132-tom ; and [he]132-tom was dying , dying at four - and - twenty ; passing away to [the other world]5220-the other world , where , perhaps , [she]94-elizabeth might meet [him]132-tom yet , with no cruel Esther between . "[132-tom] [Tom]132-tom , " [she]94-elizabeth said , and knelt beside [him]132-tom , "[132-tom] [Tom]132-tom , [I]0-i did n't mean to vex [you]132-tom . [I]0-i 'll try to be as good as [a sister]2493-a sister to [you]132-tom . [I]0-i 'll never forsake [you]132-tom as long as [you]132-tom live . " "[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]132-tom never will . " "[0-i] Good - by , then for to - night . " And [she]94-elizabeth did kiss [him]132-tom , mouth to mouth , quietly and tenderly . [She]94-elizabeth was so glad of it afterward . It was late enough when [she]94-elizabeth reached [Russell Square]3-russell square ; but [nobody]357-nobody ever questioned the proceedings of [Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand , who was [a privileged person]5222-a privileged person . [She]94-elizabeth crept in beside [[her]94-elizabeth little [Henry]97-ascott]5223-her little henry , and as [the child]3274-the child turned in [his]3274-the child sleep and put [his]3274-the child arms about [her]94-elizabeth neck , [she]94-elizabeth clasped [him]132-tom tight , and thought there was still something to live for in [this weary world]5225-this weary world . All night [she]94-elizabeth thought over what best could be done for [Tom]132-tom . Though [she]94-elizabeth never deceived [herself]94-elizabeth for a moment as to [his]132-tom state , still [she]94-elizabeth thought , with care and proper nursing , [he]132-tom might live a few months . Especially if [she]94-elizabeth could get [him]132-tom into [the Consumption Hospital]5226-the consumption hospital , newly started in [Chelsea]82-chelsea , of which [she]94-elizabeth was aware [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott — who dearly loved to see [his]132-tom name in a charity list — was [one of [the governors]5228-the governors]5227-one of the governors . There was no time to be lost ; [she]94-elizabeth determined to speak to [[her]94-elizabeth master]4793-her master at once . The time [she]94-elizabeth chose was when [she]94-elizabeth brought down [little Henry]97-ascott , who was now always expected to appear , and say , "[0-i] Dood morning , [papa]2900-papa , " before [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott went into [the city]1745-the city . As [they]5231-they stood , [the boy]375-the boy laughing in [[his]375-the boy father]404-his father 's face , and [the father]5234-the father beaming all over with delight , the bitter , almost fierce thought , smote [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , Why should [Peter Ascott]202-mrs. ascott be standing there fat and flourishing , and poor [Tom]132-tom dying ? It made [her]94-elizabeth bold to ask the only favor [she]94-elizabeth ever had asked of [the master whom [she]94-elizabeth did not care for]5235-the master whom she did not care for , and to whom [she]94-elizabeth had done [her]94-elizabeth duty simply as duty , without , until lately , one fragment of respect . "[2900-papa] [Sir]3469-sir , if [you]3469-sir please , might [I]0-i speak with [you]3469-sir a minute before [you]3469-sir go out ? " "[90-mrs. hand] Certainly , [Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand . Any thing about [Master Henry]97-ascott ? Or perhaps [yourself]3469-sir ? [You]3469-sir want more wages ? Very well . [I]0-i shall be glad , in any reasonable way , to show [my]0-i satisfaction at the manner in which [you]3469-sir bring up [[my]0-i son]2562-my son . " "[3469-sir] Thank [you]3469-sir , [Sir]3469-sir , " said [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , curtseying . "[3469-sir] But it is not that . " And in the briefest language [she]94-elizabeth could find [she]94-elizabeth explained what it was . [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott knitted [his]97-ascott brows and looked important . [He]97-ascott never scattered [his]97-ascott benefits with a silent hand , and [he]97-ascott dearly liked to create difficulties , if only to show how [he]97-ascott could smooth them down . "[3469-sir] To get [a patient]2904-a patient admitted at [the Consumption Hospital]5226-the consumption hospital , is , [you]3469-sir should be aware , no easy matter , until [the building at [Queen 's Elm]83-queen 's elm]2906-the building at queen 's elm is complete . But [I]0-i flatter [myself]0-i [I]0-i have influence . [I]0-i have subscribed a deal of money . Possibly [the person]2265-the person may be got in in time . Who did [you]3469-sir say [he]2265-the person was ? " "[3469-sir] [Thomas Cliffe]132-tom . [He]2265-the person married one of [the servants]4364-the servants [here]389-here , [Esther]201-esther — " "[201-esther] Oh , do n't trouble [yourself]3469-sir about the name ; [I]0-i should n't recollect it . [The housekeeper]4386-the housekeeper might . Why did n't [[his]2265-the person wife]4348-his wife apply to [the housekeeper]4386-the housekeeper ? " The careless question seemed hardly to expect an answer , and [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth gave none . [She]94-elizabeth could not bear to make public [Tom]132-tom 's misery and [Esther]201-esther 's shame . "[4348-his wife] And [you]3469-sir say [he]2265-the person is [a Stowbury man]2882-a stowbury man ? That is certainly a claim . [I]0-i always feel bound , somewhat as [a member of Parliament]2914-a member of parliament might be , to do [my]0-i best for [any one belonging to [[my]0-i [native town]2917-native town]2916-my native town]2915-any one belonging to my native town . So be satisfied , [Mrs. Hand]90-mrs. hand ; consider the thing settled . " And [he]2265-the person was going away ; but time being of such great moment , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth ventured to detain [him]2265-the person till [he]2265-the person had written the letter of recommendation , and found out what days the application for admission could be received . [He]2265-the person did it very patiently , and even took out [his]2265-the person purse and laid a sovereign on the top of the letter . "[90-mrs. hand] [I]0-i suppose [the man]777-the man is poor ; [you]3469-sir can use this for [his]777-the man benefit . " "[90-mrs. hand] There is no need , thank [you]777-the man , [Sir]3469-sir , " said [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , putting it gently aside . [She]94-elizabeth could not bear that [Tom]132-tom should accept [any body]3035-any body 's money but [her]94-elizabeth own . At [her]94-elizabeth first spare moment [she]94-elizabeth wrote [him]2265-the person a long letter explaining what [she]94-elizabeth had done , and appointing the next day but one , the earliest possible , for taking [him]2265-the person out to [Chelsea]82-chelsea [herself]94-elizabeth . If [he]2265-the person objected to the plan , [he]2265-the person was to write and say so ; but [she]94-elizabeth urged [him]2265-the person as strongly as [she]94-elizabeth could not to let slip this opportunity of obtaining good nursing and first rate medical care . Many times during the day the thought of [Tom]132-tom alone in [[his]132-tom one room]5237-his one room — comfortable though it was , and though [she]94-elizabeth had begged [the landlady]1243-the landlady to see that [he]132-tom wanted nothing — came across [her]94-elizabeth with a sudden pang . [His]132-tom face , feebly lifted up from the pillow , with its last affectionate smile , the sound of [his]132-tom cough as [she]94-elizabeth stood listening outside on the stair head , haunted [her]94-elizabeth all through that sunshiny June day ; and , mingled with it , came ghostly visions of that other day in June — [her]94-elizabeth happy Whitsun holiday — [her]94-elizabeth first and [her]94-elizabeth last . No letter coming from [Tom]132-tom on the appointed morning , [she]94-elizabeth left [Master Henry]97-ascott in the charge of [the house - maid]5239-the house - maid , who was very fond of [him]2265-the person — as indeed [he]2265-the person bade fair to be spoiled by [the whole establishment at [Russell Square]3-russell square]5240-the whole establishment at russell square — and went down to [Westminster]78-westminster . There was a long day before [her]94-elizabeth , so [she]94-elizabeth took a minute 's breathing space on [Westminster Bridge]80-westminster bridge , and watched the great current of [London]1-london life ebbing and flowing — life on [the river]4330-the river and life on [the shore]2315-the shore ; [every body so busy and active and bright]5243-every body so busy and active and bright . "[777-the man] [Poor Tom]132-tom , poor [Tom]132-tom ! " [she]94-elizabeth sighed , and wondered whether [his]132-tom ruined life would ever come to any happy ending , except death . [She]94-elizabeth hurried on , and soon found [the street where [she]94-elizabeth had taken [his]132-tom lodging]5244-the street where she had taken his lodging . At the corner of [it]5244-the street where she had taken his lodging was , as is too usual in [[London]1-london streets]5245-london streets , [a public house]5246-a public house , about which more than the usual number of [disreputable idlers]5247-disreputable idlers were hanging . There were also [one or two policemen]5248-one or two policemen , who were ordering [the little crowd]5249-the little crowd to give way to [a group of [twelve men]5251-twelve men]5250-a group of twelve men , coming out . "[132-tom] What is that ? " asked [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . "[2920-coroner] [Coroner]2920-coroner 's inquest ; jury proceeding to view the body . " [Elizabeth , who had never come into contact with any thing of the sort]5252-elizabeth , who had never come into contact with any thing of the sort , stood aside with a sense of awe , to let [the little procession]5253-the little procession pass , and then followed up [the street]1211-the street . [It]5255-it stopped ; oh no ! not at that door ! But it was ; there was no mistaking the number , nor the drawn - down blind in [the upper room]5256-the upper room — [[Tom]132-tom 's room]5257-tom 's room . "[2920-coroner] Who is dead ? " [she]94-elizabeth asked , in a whisper that made [the policeman]4369-the policeman stare . "[357-nobody] Oh ! [nobody]357-nobody particular ; [a young man]1903-a young man , found dead in [his]1903-a young man bed ; supposed to be a case of consumption ; verdict will probably be , ' Died by the visitation of [God]105-god ! ' " [Ay]184-ay , that familiar phrase , [our]5259-our English law 's solemn recognition of [our]5259-our national religious feeling , was true . [God]105-god had "[105-god] visited " poor [Tom]132-tom ; [he]132-tom suffered no more . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth leaned against the door - way , and saw [the twelve jurymen]5260-the twelve jurymen go up [stairs]3048-stairs with a clatter of feet , and come down again , one after the other , less noisily , and some of [them]5260-the twelve jurymen looking grave . [Nobody]357-nobody took any notice of [her]94-elizabeth , until [the lodging house]5263-the lodging house mistress appeared . "[2923-she] Oh , here [she]2923-she is , [gentlemen]515-gentlemen . [She]2923-she 'll tell [you]515-gentlemen [I]0-i 'm not a bit to blame . " And pulling [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth after [her]94-elizabeth , [the landlady]1243-the landlady burst into a torrent of explanation ; how [she]94-elizabeth had done [her]94-elizabeth very best for [the poor fellow]5265-the poor fellow ; how [she]94-elizabeth listened at [his]5265-the poor fellow door several times during the first day , and heard [him]5265-the poor fellow cough , that is , [she]94-elizabeth thought [she]94-elizabeth had , but toward night all was so very quiet ; and there having come a letter by post , [she]94-elizabeth thought [she]94-elizabeth would take it up to [him]5265-the poor fellow . "[2923-she] And [I]0-i went in , [gentlemen]515-gentlemen , and [I]0-i declare , upon [my]0-i oath , [I]0-i found [him]2927-him lying just as [he]2927-him is now , and as cold as a stone . " "[0-i] Let [me]0-i pass ; [I]0-i 'm [a doctor]376-a doctor , " said [somebody behind]5266-somebody behind ; [a young man , very shabbily dressed , with a large beard]5267-a young man , very shabbily dressed , with a large beard . " [he]5265-the poor fellow called out ; and [his]5265-the poor fellow authoritative manner impressed [the jurymen]5270-the jurymen , who gathered around [him]5265-the poor fellow , ready and eager to hear any thing [he]5265-the poor fellow could say . [He]5265-the poor fellow gave [his]5265-the poor fellow name as [John Smith]125-john smith , [[druggist]5271-druggist 's assistant]5272-druggist 's assistant ; said that [the young man who lodged up stairs]5273-the young man who lodged up stairs , whose death [he]5265-the poor fellow had only just heard of , had been [[his]5265-the poor fellow patient]5274-his patient for some months , and was in the last stage of consumption . [He]5265-the poor fellow had no doubt the death had ensued from perfectly natural causes , as [he]5265-the poor fellow explained in such technical language as completely to overpower [the jury]5275-the jury , and satisfy [them]5275-the jury accordingly . [They]5270-the jurymen quitted [the parlor]313-the parlor , and proceeded to [the public house]5277-the public house , where , after a brief consultation , [they]5270-the jurymen delivered [their]5270-the jurymen verdict , as [the astute policeman]5278-the astute policeman had foretold , "[0-i] Died by the visitation of [God]105-god ; " took pipes and brandy all round at the bar , and then adjourned to [[their]5270-the jurymen several homes]5279-their several homes , gratified at having done [their]5270-the jurymen duty to [[their]5270-the jurymen country]5280-their country . Meantime , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth crept up stairs . [Nobody]357-nobody hindered or followed [her]94-elizabeth ; [nobody]357-nobody cared any thing for [the solitary dead]5283-the solitary dead . There [he]5283-the solitary dead lay — poor [Tom]132-tom ! almost as [she]94-elizabeth had left [him]5283-the solitary dead ; the counterpane was hardly disturbed , the candle [she]94-elizabeth had placed on the chair had burned down to a bit of wick , which still lay in the socket . [Nobody]357-nobody had touched [him]5283-the solitary dead , or any thing about [him]5283-the solitary dead , as , in all cases of "[105-god] Found dead , " English law exacts . Whether [he]5283-the solitary dead had died soon after [she]94-elizabeth quitted [him]5283-the solitary dead that night , or whether [he]5283-the solitary dead had lingered through the long hours of darkness , or of day - light following , alive and conscious perhaps , yet too weak to call [any one]399-any one , even had there been any one [he]5283-the solitary dead cared to call — when , or how , the spirit had passed away unto [Him]5283-the solitary dead who gave it , were mysteries that could never be known . But it was all over now ; [he]5283-the solitary dead lay at rest with the death smile on [his]5283-the solitary dead face . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , as [she]94-elizabeth stood and looked at [him]5283-the solitary dead , could not , dared not weep . "[105-god] [[My]0-i poor [Tom]132-tom]2930-my poor tom , [my]0-i own dear [Tom]132-tom , " was all [she]94-elizabeth thought , and knew that [he]5283-the solitary dead was all [her]94-elizabeth own now ; that [she]94-elizabeth had loved [him]5283-the solitary dead through every thing , and loved [him]5283-the solitary dead to the end . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth spent the greatest part of [her]94-elizabeth holiday in [that house]5286-that house , in [that room]5287-that room . [Nobody]357-nobody contested with [her]94-elizabeth the possession of the few things that had belonged to [him]132-tom , which were scarcely more than the clothes [he]132-tom had on when [he]132-tom died ; so [she]94-elizabeth made them up into a parcel and took them away with [her]94-elizabeth . In [his]132-tom waistcoat pocket [she]94-elizabeth found one book , a little Testament , which [she]94-elizabeth had given [him]132-tom [herself]94-elizabeth . It looked as if it had been a good deal read . If all [his]132-tom studies , all [his]132-tom worship of "[132-tom] pure intellect , " as the one supreme good , had ended in that , it was a blessed ending . When [she]94-elizabeth reached [home]3045-home [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth went at once to [[her]94-elizabeth master]4793-her master , returned [him]132-tom [his]132-tom letter of recommendation , and explained to [him]132-tom that [his]132-tom kindness was not needed now . [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott seemed a good deal shocked , inquired from [her]94-elizabeth a few particulars , and again took out [his]132-tom purse , [his]132-tom one panacea for all mortal woes . [The clergyman]5309-the clergyman appeared , read the service , and went away again . A few minutes ended it all . [She]94-elizabeth was very quiet , and [none but a closely observant person]5314-none but a closely observant person watching [her]94-elizabeth face could have penetrated into the truth of what [[your]5315-your impulsive characters]5316-your impulsive characters , always in the extremes of mirth or misery , never understand about [quiet people]5317-quiet people , that "[132-tom] still waters run deep . [He]97-ascott sat down beside [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , and then , with eyes often averted , and with many breaks between , which [she]94-elizabeth had to fill up as best as [she]94-elizabeth could , [he]97-ascott told [her]94-elizabeth all [his]97-ascott story , even to the sad secret of all , which had caused [him]97-ascott to run away from [home]3045-home , and hide [himself]97-ascott in the last place where [they]2935-your aunts would have thought [he]97-ascott was , [the safe wilderness of [London]1-london]5334-the safe wilderness of london . There , carefully disguised , [he]97-ascott had lived decently while [his]97-ascott money lasted , and then , driven step by step to the brink of destitution , [he]97-ascott had offered [himself]97-ascott for employment in the lowest grade of [his]97-ascott own profession , and been taken as assistant by [the not over scrupulous chemist and druggist]5335-the not over scrupulous chemist and druggist in [that not too respectable neighborhood of [Westminster]78-westminster]5336-that not too respectable neighborhood of westminster , with a salary of twenty pounds a year . "[0-i] And [I]0-i actually live upon it ! " added [he]97-ascott , with a bitter smile . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't run into debt ; for who would trust [me]0-i ? And [I]0-i dress in rags almost , as [you]2953-you see . And [I]0-i get [my]0-i meals how and where [I]0-i can ; and [I]0-i sleep under [the shop counter]2954-the shop counter . A pretty life for [Mr. Ascott Leaf]2955-mr. ascott leaf , is n't it now ? What would [[my]0-i aunts]3640-my aunts say if [they]3640-my aunts knew it ? " "[3640-my aunts] [They]3640-my aunts would say that it was an honest life , and that [they]3640-my aunts were not a bit ashamed of [you]0-i . " [Ascott]97-ascott drew [himself]97-ascott up a little , and [his]97-ascott chest heaved visibly under the close buttoned , thread bare coat . "[3640-my aunts] Well , at least , it is a life that makes [nobody else]1771-nobody else miserable . " Ay , [that wonderful teacher , Adversity]5337-that wonderful teacher , adversity , "[3640-my aunts] Which , like the toad , ugly and venomous , Wears yet a precious jewel in its head , " had left behind this jewel in [the young man]3100-the young man 's heart . [A disguised , beggared outcast]5339-a disguised , beggared outcast , [he]3100-the young man had found out the value of an honest name ; forsaken , unfriended , [he]3100-the young man had learned the preciousness of [home]3045-home and love ; made [a servant of , tyrannized over]5341-a servant of , tyrannized over , and held in low esteem , [he]3100-the young man had been taught by hard experience the secret of true humility and charity — the esteeming of [others]525-others better than [himself]3100-the young man . Not with all natures does misfortune so work , but it did with [his]3100-the young man . [He]3100-the young man had sinned ; [he]3100-the young man had paid the cost of [his]3100-the young man sin in bitter suffering ; but the result was cheaply bought , and [he]3100-the young man already began to feel that it was so . "[3640-my aunts] Yes , " said [he]3100-the young man , in answer to a question of [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's , "[3640-my aunts] [I]0-i really am , for some things , happier than [I]0-i used to be . " [She]94-elizabeth thought the question over in [her]94-elizabeth clear head ; clear still , even at this hour , when [she]94-elizabeth had to think for [others]525-others , though all personal feeling and interest were buried in that grave over which [the sexton]5344-the sexton was now laying the turf that would soon grow smoothly green . "[3469-sir] If [I]0-i might advise , [Mr. Leaf]97-ascott , [I]0-i should say , save up all [your]3469-sir money , and then go , just as [you]3469-sir are , with an honest , bold front , right into [[[my]0-i master]4088-my master 's house]2974-my master 's house , with the fifty pounds in [your]3469-sir hand — " "[3469-sir] By [Jove]235-jove , [you]3469-sir 've hit it ! [You]94-elizabeth 're [a remarkable woman]2976-a remarkable woman . " [She]0-i smiled — a very sad smile — but still [she]0-i felt glad . Long after [the young man , whose mercurial temperament no trouble could repress]5348-the young man , whose mercurial temperament no trouble could repress , had gone away in excellent spirits , leaving [her]0-i an address where [she]0-i could always find [him]5348-the young man , whose mercurial temperament no trouble could repress , and give [him]5348-the young man , whose mercurial temperament no trouble could repress regular news of [[his]5348-the young man , whose mercurial temperament no trouble could repress aunts]3135-his aunts , though [he]5348-the young man , whose mercurial temperament no trouble could repress made [her]0-i promise to give [them]3135-his aunts , as yet , no tidings in return , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth sat still , watching the sun decline and the shadows lengthen over [the field of graves]5350-the field of graves . In the calmness and beauty of [this solitary place]5351-this solitary place an equal calm seemed to come over [her]94-elizabeth ; a sense of how wonderfully events had linked [themselves]5352-themselves together and worked themselves out ; how even [poor Tom]132-tom 's mournful death had brought about this meeting , which might end in restoring to [[her]94-elizabeth beloved mistresses]5149-her beloved mistresses [[their]5149-her beloved mistresses lost sheep]5354-their lost sheep , [[their]5149-her beloved mistresses outcast , miserable boy]5355-their outcast , miserable boy . [She]94-elizabeth did not reason the matter out , but [she]94-elizabeth felt it , and felt that in making [her]94-elizabeth in some degree [His]5348-the young man , whose mercurial temperament no trouble could repress instrument [God]105-god had been very good to [her]94-elizabeth in the midst of [her]94-elizabeth desolation . It seemed [[Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's lot]5356-elizabeth 's lot always to have to put aside [her]94-elizabeth own troubles for the trouble of [somebody else]2667-somebody else . Almost immediately after [Tom Cliffe]132-tom 's death [her]94-elizabeth little [Henry]97-ascott fell ill with scarlatina and remained for many months in a state of health so fragile as to engross all [her]94-elizabeth thought and care . It was with difficulty that [she]94-elizabeth contrived a few times to go for [Henry]97-ascott 's medicines to [the shop where "[125-john smith] [John Smith]125-john smith " served]5358-the shop where " john smith " served . [She]94-elizabeth noticed that every time [he]97-ascott looked healthier , brighter , freer from that aspect of broken - down respectability which had touched [her]94-elizabeth so much . [He]97-ascott did not dress any better , but still "[5359-the gentleman " in him] [the gentleman " in [him]97-ascott]5359-the gentleman " in him could never be hidden or lost , and [he]97-ascott said [[his]97-ascott master]4243-his master treated [him]97-ascott "[3465-a gentleman] like [a gentleman]3465-a gentleman , " which was apparently a pleasant novelty . There are more ways than one of turning an honest penny , when [a young fellow]3558-a young fellow really sets about it . [She]94-elizabeth ought to have retired , and yet [she]94-elizabeth could not . [She]94-elizabeth hid [herself]94-elizabeth partly behind the door , afraid of passing [Ascott]97-ascott ; dreading alike to wound [him]97-ascott by recognition or non - recognition . But [he]97-ascott took no notice . [He]97-ascott seemed excessively agitated . " Come a - begging , [young man]3998-young man , [I]97-ascott suppose ? Wants a situation , as [hundreds]5369-hundreds do , and think that [I]97-ascott have [half the clerkships in [the city]1745-the city]5370-half the clerkships in the city at [my]97-ascott disposal , and that [I]97-ascott am made of money besides . "[97-ascott] And [the little boy]2986-the little boy , in [his]2986-the little boy pretty purple velvet frock and [his]2986-the little boy prettier face , trotted across [the room]3244-the room and put the money into poor [Ascott]97-ascott 's hand . " [Young man]3998-young man , [young fellow]5378-young fellow — "[2986-the little boy] " [I]97-ascott see [you]97-ascott do n't know [me]97-ascott , [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , and it 's not surprising . " [Ascott Leaf]99-ascott , is that [you]99-ascott ? [I]202-mrs. ascott thought [you]99-ascott were in [Australia]49-australia , or dead , or something . "[97-ascott] [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott made no reply . "[97-ascott] An hour after , when [little Henry]97-ascott had long been sound asleep , and [she]2990-her was sitting at [her]2990-her usual evening sewing in [[her]2990-her solitary nursery]2991-her solitary nursery , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth learned that [the " shabby young man]5380-the " shabby young man "[97-ascott] was still in [the dining - room]2992-the dining - room with [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , [who had rung for tea , and some cold meat with it]2993-who had rung for tea , and some cold meat with it . And [the footman]4370-the footman stated , with undisguised amazement , that [the shabby young man]2995-the shabby young man was actually sitting at the same table with [master]4127-master ! [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth smiled to [herself]94-elizabeth and held [her]94-elizabeth tongue . Now , as ever , [she]94-elizabeth always kept the secrets of [the family]258-the family . About ten o'clock [she]94-elizabeth was summoned to [the dining - room]2992-the dining - room . There stood [Peter Ascott]202-mrs. ascott , pompous as ever , but with a certain kindly good - humor lightening up [his]97-ascott heavy face , looking condescendingly around [him]97-ascott , and occasionally rubbing [his]97-ascott hands slowly together , as if [he]97-ascott were exceedingly well pleased with [himself]97-ascott . There stood [Ascott Leaf]99-ascott , looking bright and handsome , in spite of [his]97-ascott shabbiness , and quite at [his]97-ascott ease — which small peculiarity was never likely to be knocked out of [him]97-ascott under the most depressing circumstances . [He]97-ascott shook hands with [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth warmly . " [I]97-ascott wanted to ask [you]94-elizabeth if [you]94-elizabeth have any message for [Liverpool]72-liverpool . [I]97-ascott go there to - morrow on business for [Mr. Ascott]97-ascott , and afterward [I]97-ascott shall probably go and see [[my]97-ascott aunts]3640-my aunts . "[97-ascott] [He]97-ascott faltered a moment , but quickly shook the emotion off . " Of course , [I]97-ascott shall tell [them]3640-my aunts all about [you]94-elizabeth , [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth . Any special message , eh ? "[97-ascott] " Only [my]94-elizabeth duty , [Sir]3469-sir , and [Master Henry]97-ascott is quite well again , "[94-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth , formally , and dropping [her]94-elizabeth old - fashioned courtesy ; after which , as quickly as [she]94-elizabeth could , [she]94-elizabeth slipped out of [the dining - room]2992-the dining - room . But , long , long after , when all [the house]344-the house was gone to bed , [she]94-elizabeth stood at the nurser window , looking down upon the trees of [the square]3596-the square , that stretched [their]3002-their motionless arms up into the moonlight sky — just such a moonlight as it was once , more than three years ago , the night [little Henry]97-ascott was born . And [she]94-elizabeth recalled all the past , from the day when [Miss Hilary]91-hilary hung up [her]91-hilary bonnet for [her]94-elizabeth in [the house - place at [Stowbury]2-stowbury]3003-the house - place at stowbury ; the dreary life at [No . 15]1304-no . 15 ; the Sunday nights when [she]94-elizabeth and [Tom Cliffe]132-tom used to go wandering round and round [the square]3596-the square . " [Poor Tom]132-tom , "[94-elizabeth] said [she]94-elizabeth to [herself]94-elizabeth , thinking of [Ascott Leaf]99-ascott , and how happy [he]132-tom had looked , and how happy [[his]132-tom aunts]3135-his aunts would be to - morrow . " Well , [Tom]132-tom would be glad too , if [he]132-tom knew all . "[3135-his aunts] But , happy as [every body]3430-every body was , there was nothing so close to [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth 's heart as the one grave over which the snow was now lying , white and peaceful , out at [Kensal Green]85-kensal green . [Elizabeth]94-elizabeth is still living — which is a great blessing , for [nobody]357-nobody could well do without [her]94-elizabeth . [She]94-elizabeth will probably attain a good old age ; being healthy and strong , very equable in temper now , and very cheerful too , in [her]94-elizabeth quiet way . Doubtless , [she]94-elizabeth will yet have [[Master Henry]97-ascott 's children]3009-master henry 's children climbing [her]94-elizabeth knees , and calling [her]94-elizabeth " [Mammy Lizzie]228-mammy lizzie . "[94-elizabeth] But [she]94-elizabeth will never marry — [She]94-elizabeth never loved any body but [Tom]132-tom .
